column35: The Receptionist Appared To Be Laughing At Me From Before I Even Reached The Desk.  She Persisted In Telling Me That You Do Not Accept Debit Cards Even After I Had Said Twice That I Was Using A Credit Card.  She Asked If I Had Stayed Before And Then Gave An Almost Sarcastic 'Welcome To Sopwell House' When I Said I Had Not Stayed Before.  I Had A Warmer  Nicer And More Helpful Welcome When Staying At A Premier Inn Recently.
column39: Room 154 Had A Slightly Grubby Feel To It.  It Was Very Small.  There Were No Bathrobes Or Slippers.  The Furniture Had A Cheap Feel About It.  For Example  The Mirror Hanging On The Side Of The Wardrobe Was Not Fully Fixed On And The Bed Was Small.
column48: I Had To Keep The Tray In My Room After I Had Finished As The Corridor Was So Small It Could Not Be Put Outside.  I Ordered Decaf Coffee With My Breakfast  When It Arrived It Was A Pot Of Hot Water And A Nescafe Sachet Of Decaf.  I Could Have Had That From The Sachets Provided In-Room.  There Was Nothing On The Room Service Menu Card That Indicated Choosing Decaf Meant You Would Get Instant Coffee Instead Of Ground Coffee. It Was Very Disappointing And Not The Standard I Would Expect From This Price Of Hotel. Also  My Husband Had A Full English Breakfast Delivered  The Poached Egg Was Tasteless  The Sausage Burnt And The Bacon So Salty It Was Inedible.
column64: Had Breakfast In The Brasserie  There Was An Excellent Choice Of Food.  I Did Have To Get Someone To Toast A Bagel For Me Though  It Would Have Been Good To Have A Toaster To Be Able To Do It Myself As I Waited A While And The Bagel Was Cold By The Time I Got It Back.
column84: We Had A Lady Serving In The Bar Of The Function Room For The Wedding Reception Who Was Kept Very Busy All Night But Still Mainatined A Sense Of Humour.  I Regret That I Did Not Get Her Name. She Was Petite With Glasses And Long Fair Hair.
column89: On Monday The Staff Were Much Friendlier Than On Saturday Or Sunday.  They Said Good Morning  They Held Open Doors And They Smiled.  Saturday And Sunday Was Not Welcoming At All.
column90: I Hope My Experiences Were A One-Off And Not The Norm.  I Appreciate That Room Sizes Are Not Something You Can Change  But I Did Feel The Standard Was Below That Of Similar Hotels I Have Stayed In.  I Was Forced To Stay In A Premier Inn Recently And The Room Was Larger  Cleaner  Brighter And Had Better Furnishings Than My Room At Sopwell House - At Half The Price.

column35: I Was Spoken To In A Very Patronizing And Condescending Way As I Arrived At Reception  And As A Young Adult I Felt Very Embarrassed And Unwelcome At The Hotel  Due To A Card Not Being Present  As A Decision Needed To Be Made Otherwise We Weren't Able To Check In  Another Card Had To Be Presented In Which The Manager At The Time Was Able To Help. There Was No Pre-Arrival Contact From The Hotel Itself  No Email To Confirm The Booking Etc. However  The Spa Rang Me In Order To Book My Treatments For My Trip Which Was Very Efficient And They Were Very Friendly To Talk To.
column64: In The Cocktail Bar  More Enjoyable Experience Due To Staff Friendliness  Smiley And Bubbly. In The Brasserie  Experience Was Enjoyable Once Restaurant Manager Was Able To Speak To Us And Offer A Good Service.
column77: The Reception Of The Spa Was Friendly And Helpful  The Lockers And Changing Area Was Well Kept  And Finally The Treatments Were Enjoyable Because Of The Bubbly Members Of Staff Who Were Able To Talk To You And Converse With You  In Order To Let You Relax And Feel At Ease.
column83: Only With Hotel Staff  Spa Staff Were Very Attentive.  On Arrival My Friend And I Experienced Service Issues By Reception  Whose Staff Were Not Attentive And Did Not Have A Friendly Way Of Speaking To Guests.  We Arrived And Were Checking In When They Asked For Me To Present The Card I Had Made The Booking With  However I Was Not The Card Holder And Did Not Have The Card On Me  As It Was My Dad's. I Was Told By The Receptionist To Speak To The Other Receptionist (Phyll) As She Was New Which I Fully Understood. As I Began Speaking To The Other Receptionist About The Problem  Her Tone Was Extremely Patronizing  Not Noticed Only By Myself But Also By My Friend  Her Way Of Speaking To Me Was Very Condescending And I Felt Very Unwelcome And Felt Like I Was Being Treated Like A Child When I Am A Young Adult. I Was Then Told That We Could Not Check In Unless We Had A Card  Were As I Responded This Was Not Told To Me In Any Way Otherwise I Would Have Happily Obliged  As I Could Have Brought My Dad With Me To Help Us Check In  However  I Explained Very Calmly That This Was Not Reiterated To Me (In Email Or Over The Phone) And Therefore I Was Not Aware Of It  And It Was Responded With 'Its Just Common Sense' Which I Was Taken Aback By  As I Feel This Was Not Necessary To Say As I Had Already Explained That If I Knew This Was The Case  I Would Have Brought The Card Holder In Order To Verify The Card. As This Proceeded  I Was Concerned With Time As I Had Booked Spa Treatments For My Friend And I  As It Was Her 18Th Birthday At 4Pm  And It Was Now 3.30Pm  However The Receptionist Was Reluctant To Allow Us To Check In Without A Card And Suggested Taking My Friends Card In Order To Debt The Total Amount From. However  I Was Not Wanting To Do This As It Was For My Friends Birthday And I Was Paying For It. I Spoke To The Other Receptionist And Said That  Wouldn't The Full Amount Only Be Taken At The End Of The Stay And She Was Agreeing With Me That  That Should Be The Case  However The Other Receptionist Was Beginning To Be Rude And Simply Saying We Cannot Check You In Unless We Have The Card And Debt The Whole Amount Now. I Asked Several Times Why Would The Card Have To Be Debited The Full Amount Now  But An Answer Was Not Clearly Given Until I Had Asked Several Times  Because It Was A Debit Card  The Amount Had To Be Taken Immediately. I Simply Said Ok  But My Mum Was Currently On The Phone To The Manager  Who Came Out To Speak To Me  She Was Much More Attentive About The Situation And Simply Said That Because Of The Policy They Needed A Card To Be Able To Check Guests In  And I Said I Fully Understand But It Was Not Reiterated To Me Otherwise I Would Have Happily Brought The Card Holder Along. She Then Said That She Would Be Able To Debit My Friends Card Only Â£50 Instead  Therefore Allowing Us To Check In  As The Card Holder (My Dad) Had Agreed To Come Down To The Spa To Verify The Card Within A Few Hours. This Experience Was Not Pleasant  And Was Embarrassing For My Friend And I. As It Was Her Birthday I Wanted To Give Her A Stress Free Trip To The Spa And Experience The Treatments  However  I Feel The Moment We Stepped Into The Hotel  We Did Not Receive A Warm Welcome At All.   The Spa Staff Were Much More Friendly And I Would Definitely Return To The Spa But Unfortunately I Would Not Like The Experience Of Staying At The Hotel Again.
column84: I Felt That Some Members Of Staff Need To Be Acknowledged And Thanked For Their Hospitality During Our Stay.  We Arrived On The 27Th Of May Around 3Pm And Was Greeted With A Smile By The Man On The Door  However I Did Not Catch His Name.  The Manager On That Day  However  I Unsure How To Spell Her Name Prima/Prema  Was The Only Person At The Hotel Reception Who Was Able To Solve Our Problem And Allow Us To Check In With The Least Amount Of Hassle. However  The Other Receptionist Phyll  Was Very Patronizing And Condescending When Speaking To Me.  The Spa Staff Were Lovely  On Reception They Greeted You With A Smile And Were Happy To Answer Any Questions.  I Had Booked Spa Treatments And The Two Women Who Were Providing The Treatments Were Very Smiley And Bubbly And Made You Feel At Ease  I Am Unsure Of The Name Of The Woman Providing My Friend Jess With Her Treatment. My Person's Name Was Jodie And She Was A Lovely Person And Was Able To Create An Enjoyable And Relaxing Experience.  In The Brassiere  The Manager Was The Most Attentive Staff Member  Being Able To Answer My Questions Efficiently And Offer Any Help During The Meal.  In The Cocktail Bar  Around 10Pm  The Man Behind The Bar Was Very Smiley And Attentive And Helped Us With Answering Questions And Was A Friendly Staff Member.
column89: The Experience With The Hotel Fell Below My Expectations Due To The Complex Check In  Which Put A Dampener Over The Ability To Enjoy The Facilities. However  The Spa Definitely Met My Expectations And The Treatments And Staff In The Spa Exceeded My Expectations.

column35: None.
column39: None
column53: We Arrived At The Desk To Be Told That They Had No Tables Ready But That They Would Seat Us Anyway Which Seemed Strange. We Sat At Our Table For 10 Minutes Without Having It Made Up Despite Asking Several Staff Walking Past. They Then Proceeded To Make Up All Of The Other Vacant Tables Around Us But Not Ours. Eventually When It Was Set  We Were Left Missing Several Items Of Cutlery And No Milk Which We Had To Go And Get Ourselves In The End. Went To Make Tea And The Pot Had Run Out Of Hot Water  When I Asked A Member Of Staff If They Could Top It Up They Looked At Me Blankly. They Didn't Top It Up Until We Were Leaving And So Neither Of Us Had A Hot Drink. The Food Was Lovely But The Service Really Let The Experience Down  It Was A Complete Shambles!
column83: Apart From The Breakfast  Mentioned Earlier  We Requested Late Check Out The Night Before Departure. The Receptionist Told Us She Would Request It. We Never Heard Back Until We Called Again The Next Morning At 10Am And There Was No Record Of Our Request. We Were Told That No We Could Not Have Late Check Out And That They Had To Insist We Were Out By 11Am. We Went To Check Out And The Queue Was Snaking Around The Whole Reception  It Took 25 Minutes To Check Out. I Understand That Late Check Out Is Not Always Available But If I Ask For It I Don't Want To Have To Chase For The Answer The Next Morning With An Hour To Go.

column39: 261. A/C Did Not Work  Called Reception Someone Friendly Came To Help But Made No Difference Therefore Room Was Hot And Uncomfortable To Sleep In Even With Window Open. Furniture Appeared Old And Worn.
column64: The Dining Experience Was Very Disappointing. Other Guest Members Informed Us About Their Previous Experiences Being Much Better And How Disappointed They Were. According To Them They Were Offered A Menu Not Just Buffet. The Buffet Was Cold And No Choice In Food. Bread Was Served To Others And Not Our Table.
column77: Excellent - Made Our Stay

column35: Very Good And Couldn't Do Enough
column39: Shower Was Terrible  Bath Took Ages To Fill  Bath Taps Weren't Properly Fitted And Towel Rail Lose.
column48: We Ordered Some Extra Tea For The Room  Which Never Arrived. Service In The Restaurant Was Mixed. Some Waiters Were Very Attentive Whilst Others Were Slow To Serve  One Waiter Only Asked One Member Of The Party For A Drink Then Left And Some Courses Were Very Rushed. We Have Starters And Main With Around 30Second Gap Between Courses And Waited Around 40Minute For The Sweet And Then Noone Seemed Interested In Clearing Our Plates When More Than One Member Of Staff Had Noticed We Had Finished.
column77: Great Staff  Maybe Other Staff Members From Around The Hotel Could Learn A Few Things From The Wonderful Spa Staff.
column84: All The Spa Staff Were A Credit To The Hotel.

column53: It Was Lovely

column90: If You Book Rooms Together Then Ideally Having Them Near Each Other Would Be Better Than The Large Distance We Were Given.

My Friend And I Had An Absolutely Wonderful Time. The Location Was Beautiful  The Facilities Were Excellent And All The Friendly Staff Made Such An Effort To Make Our Stay Enjoyable. We Will Definitely Be Back.

column35: Lovely To Have A Doorman!!!
column39: Pillows Too Soft Would Have Appreciated Firmer Ones Either In Cupboard Or Instead
column53: Didn't Get Tea Or Toast Until Half Way Through Eating Cooked Breakfast. Would Be Good To Have Sauces Out Rather Than Having To Ask And Wait. Waiter Did Not Smile Once. Lady At The Front Was Very Polite.
column77: Treatments Extremely Expensive. May Be Because Of Location However In Norfolk They Are Almost Half Your Prices In Extremely Lovely Spas.
column83: Breakfast-Drinks And Toast
column84: Lovely Doorman Very Polite And Welcoming Lovely Smile

column35: Check In States 3Pm But We Did Not Get A Room Till 3.45Pm Which Left Us Waiting Around After Being Told To Come Back From Lunch At 3 To Collect Keys To Find Out Our Room Wasn't Ready And Lunch Was Rushed For No Reason
column39: We Were Originally Given 160 Triple Room = Awful   Wooden Panel By Bath Was Damp And Falling Apart It Looked Unsightly And Was Not On When Paying Â£402. Reception Was Notified And The Only Room Available For Us Was Apartment 12 Although Stated This Was An Upgrade It Was Still Unacceptable Due To Us Being With My Elderly Nan Who Wanted To Remain In The Main Building Close To All The Amenities   When We Arrived At The Room My Nan Was Met By A Number Of Steep Stairs Not Suitable For Her  Reception Stated That This Was The Only Other Room Available For A Party Of 3 So We Had To Choose Between 160 Wood Rotting Room Or Apartment 12 With Steep Stairs And A Very Uncomfortable Pull Out Sofa Bed  Neither Rooms Were Acceptable  But Due To Apartment 12 Actually Being Clean We Chose That   Nothing Else Was Done To Accomodate Us And This Let The Trip Down  Downside To All Rooms Is That There Is No Fridge
column53: Breakfast Is Lovely Lots Of Choice
column64: Although The Food Is Nice There Needs To Be More Options Available For Main Courses As It Is Very Limited
column89: See Previous Comments On Room And Food
column90: Although We Were Offered Another Room We Felt More Could Have Been Done As We Were Just Displaced To Another Room Which Was Still Inaccurate And Upon Request Of A Room Over The Phone Requested Main Building So My Nan Could Be Close To Facilities   On Visiting Previously We Had A Lovely Stat But Thus Trip Has Really Let Us Down And Consideration Will Be Taken To Whether We Visit Again

column39: No - The Room Was Perfect  Especially Like The Black Tiled Design Of The Bathroom

column53: Our Breakfast Was Included With The Price Of Our Room.
column64: Again Our Dinner Was Included With The Price For Our Room. The Food Was Excellent  We Were A Little Dubious As My Girlfriend Is A Vegetarian And Often The Choices And Food Are Not Very Good. However She Was Very Surprised And Said It Was Delicious.
column77: The Leisure Facilities Were Fantastic  It Was By Far The Nicest Facilities That We Have Used Anywhere In The Country. The Spa Treatments Were Very Relaxing And The Staff Were Very Polite And Helpful.
column84: Unfortunately We Did Not Get The Names Of Any Of The Members Of Staff But Everyone Was Extremely Helpful And The Spa Team Were Very Good.

column90: Found It Very Expensive. However Staff All Lovely And Breakfast Fabulous. The Breakfast Staff And Reception Staff Were Very Very Helpful. Wedding Food Lovely As Were Service Staff. Bar Staff At Wedding (James) Was Not Very Nice. Felt We Were An Imposition.

column35: Room Was Not Ready For Forty Minutes However The Staff Were Very Friendly And Suggested Taking A Walk On The Grounds Which Was Pleasant Yet Did Not Make Up For The Fact The Delay Was Unprofessional.
column39: Air Conditioning Unit Or Pipes Were Loud Throughout The Duration Of The Stay And Made Being In The Room Very Difficult  Which Did Lead To Arguments With My Significant Other As To Why We Didn't Ask To Be Upgraded As A Token Of Good Faith. And Despite Explaining The Hotel Was Fully Booked And No Rooms Were Available I Am Sad To Say We Had To Leave.
column84: Lady At The Check In Desk That Handled My Check In Unfortunately I Did Not Catch Her Name But She Was A Mature Lady And Was Very Helpful And Extremely Pleasant To Talk To And Would Like To Recognise Her Efforts At Trying To Have Me In My Room As Soon As Possible.
column89: Have Someone Check Into The Noise That Is Emanates From Air Conditioning Unit It May Need Repairs Or Attention.
column90: Would Like To Say That Despite The Early Departure As A Result Of The Noise And Subsequent Dispute Between My Partner And Me As A Result Of Said Noise... I Found The Hotel Charming And Would Love To Stay Again If Their Is To Be No Further Issue Arising Again.

column35: The Set Menu In The Spa Package Was Very Good.  Sometimes In Other Places You Find The Set Menu To Be Limited Because It's Included In A Package But We Had A Good Range To Choose From And It Was Delicious!
column84: Peter  Our Waiter In The Brasserie Was Very Polite And Efficient Without Being Over The Top And Hassling Us.

column35: Our Room Was Not Ready When We Arrived At 3Pm  However Michelle On Reception Was Really Lovely And Kept Us Informed And We Were Given A Complimentarty Wine. We Did Feel That This Half An Hour Delay Meant That We Missed Some Time  And Had To Rush To Use The Facilities Before Our Treatments (At 4.30)
column39: Would Have Liked A Fridge/Mini Bar
column53: Dinner Was A Buffet I Would Have Prefered To Be Able To Order From A Menu.  Although There Was Plenty Of Food Some Of The Mains Seemed To Lack Flavour.
column64: As Previously-Some Food Lacked Taste
column83: Our Room Was Not Ready On Arrival-Reception Staff Were Very Polite About It
column84: Michelle On Reception-Very Welcoming And Friendly.

column35: Pre-Arrival Contact Was Somewhat Confused As We Were Asking Questions About The Spa - Which Were It Turns Out Answered Incorrectly.
column39: We Moved From An Executive Room As Our Smelled Strongly Of Stale Smoke - I Am 37 Weeks Pregnant And Have A Strong Aversion To Smells Especially Cigarette Smoke. The Staff We Very Kind And Moved Us To An Apartment As There Were No Executive Rooms Ready At That Time.
column48: What We Ordered From The Room Service Menu Was Not What We Were Given - The Vegetarian Club Was Listed On The Menu To Include Egg Mayonnaise - It Did Not. We Ordered A Large Bottle Of Still And A Large Bottle Of Sparkling Mineral Water - We Received A Large Of Still And A Small Of Sparkling. The Man Who Delivered Our Tray In The Evening Was Not The Most Cheerful. When Ordering I Had Asked Questions Regarding The Pudding  It Was Very Difficult To Get The Person To Find Out What The Puddings Were I Kept Being Told They Would Be Whatever Was Served At Lunch... After Asking A Few Times He Said He Could Find Out - I Did Mention That I Didn;T Want To Order Something I Didn't Like.  When Ordering Breakfast We Double Checked At Reception That It Was Ok To Ask For Extra Toast As All My Husband Wanted From The Cooked Breakfast Section Was Eggs (He's Vegetarian) - We Were Reassured That Yes That Would Be Absolute Fine. We Received No Extra Toast And Even Though We Both Checked Pastries (The Top Option) And Not Pain Au Chocolat We Received The Top Pastries And Pain Au Chocolat. Maybe Someone Thought That Was Good But We Actually Wanted The Brown Toast. The Guy Who Brought The Breakfast Was At Least More Cheerful.  Basically Lovely Idea But Rather A Lot More Effort Than You'd Hope.
column53: When Ordering Breakfast We Double Checked At Reception That It Was Ok To Ask For Extra Toast As All My Husband Wanted From The Cooked Breakfast Section Was Eggs (He's Vegetarian) - We Were Reassured That Yes That Would Be Absolute Fine. We Received No Extra Toast And Even Though We Both Checked Pastries (The Top Option) And Not Pain Au Chocolat We Received The Top Pastries And Pain Au Chocolat. Maybe Someone Thought That Was Good But We Actually Wanted The Brown Toast. We Also Both Sellected The Fruit Platter - What We Got Was The Fruit Salad - Which Left Us Questioning Why Both Were Listed On The Menu.  The Man Who Delivered The Breakfast Was At Least More Cheerful Than The Man Who Had Brought Our Dinner The Night Before.
column64: We Had Really Wanted To Be Able To Have A Cream Tea And Some Sandwiches Outside - On Asking We Were Told We Could Only Have It In The Brasserie Or In The Cocktail Bar. We Reluctantly Had It In The Cocktail Bar And Then Discovered When We Went To Have A Drink On The Terrace That People Were Having Cream Teas There.  To Say We Were Annoyed And Rather Confused Is An Understatement As This Was My Present To My Husband For Our Wedding Anniversary - Such A Shame To Be Inside On Such A Lovely Sunny Day  Especially As We Don't Get Many!  The Next Day When Ordering Lunch We Double Checked To See Of The Vegetarian Club Sandwich Did In Fact Have Egg Mayonnaise In (Due To It Not Having Any When We'd Ordered It At Dinner)  And We Were Told Yes It Did. We Ordered Two - They Came With No Egg Mayonnaise. We Did Raise This With Someone Who Then Brought Out Some Egg Mayonnaise For Us To Put Into Our Sandwiches  They Said The Menu Was Changing. Can I Suggest You Don't Change The Menu Until You've Actually Changed Your Menu's And Also Informed Your Staff?
column77: We Had Tried To Book A Treatment For Me On The Bank Holiday Sunday 26Th  And Were Told By Three Separate People That It Was Closed. It Was Our Wedding Anniversary On The 26Th And This Was My Present From My Husband. I Realised It Was Not Much Notice When We Booked But Thought It Very Strange That The Spa Should Be Closed On What Would Only Be A Very Busy Day.  When Having My Treatment I Discovered That It Wasn't Closed At All But It May Have Been Booked Up - It Would Have Been Fine To Know If I Was Fully Booked But Due To The Rest Of Our Experience It Does Leave Me Wondering If Maybe It Hadn't Been When We Booked And It Was Just Due To Staff Not Really Being Bothered.  My Treatment Was Fantastic And Made The Stay For Me - Thank You Adele - I Would Have Left Very Disappointed Otherwise.  There Were Only Three Other Members Of Staff Who Seemed To Care What They Were Doing - The Lady We Originally Checked In With  The Manager Of The Cocktail Bar On Sunday And The Man On The On The Bar On Sunday Evening.  Service Makes A Place - It Would Seem Training Staff Is Not Good.
column83: Please See My Previous Comments It Has Taken Far Too Long To Write This Down Already.
column84: The Lady We Checked In With - She Was Very Good Even Though She Gave Us Misinformation About Breakfast - However  This Should Be A Standard  She Only Stood Out As Other People Were Not. I Mention Two Others Previously Too.
column89: Train Your Staff Better & Ensure Your Menu's Are Up To Date.
column90: If I Had Not Had A Great Spa Treatment From Adele I Would Have Left Feeling Robbed.

column35: Only Issue Was That I Had Paid For Two Extra Items And One Of Them Was Not In The Room. I Went To Reception And Informed Them But Nothing Was Done About It. On Checking Out Though The Lady Refunded Me For The Error.
column64: It Too Ka Bit Of A While To Get A Staff Members Attention To Place Drinks Orders
column83: Pointed Out That Something Was Missing That I Had Paid Extra For But Nothing Was Done About It Until I Left And A Refund Given Upon Check Out
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: I Tried To Ring The Day Before Arrival 3 Times To Ask A Question But No One Answered.
column39: 135. The Bed Was Huge And Very Comfortable. It Was Very Quiet And I Slept Brilliantly  As Did My Other Half!
column53: Plenty Of Choice. Staff Chatted With Us About The Wedding We Attended And Were Very Friendly.
column89: No  We Don't Often Get The Opportunity To Stay In Such Nice Hotels And It Was Everything And More That We Expected It To Be. The Biggest Shame Was That We Didn't Have Time To Stay Longer And Use The Spa.
column90: The Wedding We Went To Was Excellent And Well Organised  Reception Room Was Set Out Lovely. Overall Experience Visiting You Was Brilliant.

column84: On Saturday We Had Some Champagne In The Bar  Our Barman Was Fantastic And Gave Us Some Fruit To Enjoy With Our Drinks. What A Lovely Touch Which Made Us Decide To Stay For Another Bottle!
column89: No
column90: We Had Our Wedding Reception With You Nearly 10 Years Ago On 6Th Sept 2003. We Had A Fabulous Time Then And Although We No Longer Live In Hertfordshire We Continue To Stay With You When Attending Functions Locally

column89: We Were There For A Family Wedding  Which Obviously Meant That There Were A Few Children Under 10.  I Feel That The Hotel Is Not Very Family Friendly  The Bar Had No Children's Drinks Like Other Bars Normally Do I.E Fruit Shoots  Or Even Orange Squash When Asked. I Appreciate That You Are An Upmarket Hotel And Spa And Couldn't Fault The Hotel At All Apart From This.  I Just Think If You Have Weddings At A Venue Then Everyone Including Children Should Be Catered For.

column39: 150 The Room Was Smaller Than Expected (Not As Picture) There Was Dust In The Top Of Wardrobe And The Bath Looked Dirty With Lots Of Limescale .
column64: I Stayed With You For The Weekend On The First Evening The Service Was Brilliant  The Saturday Night It Was Slow And I Had To Go To The Bar Twice To Get Drinks As We Were Not Offered One Then The Waitress Huffed Because I Asked If We Could Order Dessert After Waiting Around 30 Minutes  But Breakfast And Lunch The Staff Were Very Efficient.
column84: Tony In The Brasserie Was Brilliant And Funny And Always Went Out Of His Way To Make Sure We Were Happy .
column89: The Drinks Were A Bit Pricey.

column39: Room 241 - Towels  Shower Gel  Shampoo Never Replaced Bedding Not Washed Or Changed No Water In The Rooms   Air Conditioning In Mothers Room (256) Was Not Working So It Was Too Hot The Room Service Never Answered The Phone  Had To Go Through Switchboard And The Food/Drink Would Take A Long Time To Arrive There Was No Fruit/Biscuits On Arrival The Glasses/Cups  When Dirty  Were Never Replaced.
column48: They Never Answered The Phone  Had To Go Through Reception And It Took Forever To Arrive. The Food Wasnt Good Quality Always  And We Once Had To Send Back
column53: The Service Wasnt Quick  Or With A Friendly Smile.
column64: The Service Was Slow And Poor  The Restaurant Manager Had A Poor Attitude. Only One Member Of The Service Staff Was Friendly  Polite Or Helpful. The Food Was On The Whole Good  But The Choice Was Limited.
column83: As Discussed  The Room Service Was Poor  The Housekeeping Was Terrible (Please See Earlier In Survey)  The Service In The Brasserie Was Slow And Only Two Members Of Staff Impressed Us On Our Entire Stay (Of 4 Nights) - Two Bell Boys (Both Tall  Black Hair And Glasses).
column84: Two Bell Boys (Both Tall  Black Hair And Glasses) - They Were Courteous  Friendly  Hard Working And Exceptionally Positive To Me And My Family
column89: Need To Improve The Service From Staff
column90: One Of The Directors Chatted To My Mum And I Before We Left And Gave A Small Discount On The Holiday. He Explained How Much Money And Effort Had Gone Into The New Furnishings And Equipment... It's Terribly Sad That All The Effort Has Gone Into That  Rather Than The Level Of Service As The Level Of Service Has Meant That I'm Not Sure I'll Be Staying At Sopwell Again  It Was Such A Poor Experience.

column35: At 15:00 There Was A Considerable Queue At Reception  With Only 3 Check In Assistants. I Would Suggest A Meet And Greet Person For The Queue At This Time.
column39: There Were A Few Areas Missed When Cleanes  In Particular At The Bed Side Cabinets On The Floor.
column53: I Found The Waiters And Managers Did Not Have Designated Areas To Cover And Were All Over The Restaurant Serving. This Slowed Their Efficiency To Deal With Requests.
column83: I Found The Staff In The Cocktail Bar Very Slow To Attend To Us. We Waited A Good 5 Minutes In The Library For Service Until I Went To The Bar And Ordered And Even Then We Waited Another 10 Mins For The Drink To Arrive (1 X Mojito). As Mentioned Earlier  The Brasserie Waiters Were All Over The Place Serving Everyone!
column84: Diego Was Very Attentive And Spent Time Chatting To Us.

column39: Bathroom Was Disappointing For The Price We Paid  Definitely Of A Lower Standard Than Comparable Hotels We Have Stayed In.
column48: Better Vegetarian Choices Are Needed. Bigger Choice For 24 Hour Room Service Would Be An Improvement.
column53: Again Need More Vegetarian Choice - Such As Omelettes  Vegetarian Sausages. Cooked Breakfast Is Disappointing For A Vegetarian Although What Is There Is Tasty.  Unsure The Arrangements For Tea And Toast  We Were Served One Cup And One Slice Of Toast Each To The Table But Never Offered Again. Could Not See Any Self Service Tea  Coffee And Toast.  The Pastry Selection And The Fresh Fruit Was Wonderful And Delicious!
column89: Only What Has Already Be Said.
column90: Sopwell House Is A Beautiful Hotel And We Visit Frequently. Perhaps Some Sort Of Special Treatment For Guests That Return A Number Of Times A Year.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: Unfortunately The Bathroom Towels Had Stains On Them And Although They Were Clean This WasnâT Very Nice To See.  The Outside Of The Bath Had A Crack/Hole In The Wood. Lastly The Hairdryer Was So Old And Slow  It Barely Worked As It Kept Cutting Out.  Eventually We Decided To Dry Our Hair In The Spa Changing Rooms. I Did Hear That Some Of The Rooms Have Been Updated  It Will Be Interesting To See What They Are Like After The Renovation.
column64: Unfortunately Our Dining Experience Did Not Match Up To The Rest Of The Service We Received Whilst We Staying At Sopwell House.  As It Was A Sunday There Was A Themed Buffet On Offer But My Friend And I Decided That We Would Prefer To Go With The 3 Course Set Menu When Expressing This To Our Waitress She Looked Less Than Impressed  She Was Actually Quite Rude And This Continued Throughout The Night.  When Our Main Course Arrived The Chicken Was Piping Hot And The Chips Were Stone Cold So We Asked The Maitre D' To Ask The Chef To Heat Up The Chips (Not A Massive Request Considering).  When He Went Over To The Chef To Deal With Our Complaint We Could See The Chef Arguing With Him And Then Stomping Around The Kitchen In A Very Unprofessional Manner.  However Our Evening Was Thankfully Saved By The Cocktail Bar Man (He Was Italian) Who Was Extremely Pleasant And Friendly And Made The Most Amazing Strawberry DaiquiriâS.
column77: Lovely Spaâ¦The Pool And Changing Room Renovation Is Fantastic.  Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Treatments.
column83: I Have Already Mentioned The Issues We Experienced During Our Evening Dinner.  Apart From That The Service Was Brilliant  Everyone Was Really Friendly And Helpful During Our Stay.  Also Can I Just Mention That Although We Were Unhappy With Our Dinner On The Sunday Evening The Food At Breakfast And Lunch Was Lovely.
column84: The Italian Cocktail Bar Man...He Was So Friendly And Polite.  As Mentioned Before He Made The Most Amazing Strawberry DaiquiriâS!
column90: We Had A Terrific Stay At Sopwell House And Would Definitely Return In The Future  It Would Be Really Nice To Check Out The New Renovated Bedrooms.  The Only Disappointment And Complaint Was Some Of The Staff Out Our Evening Mealâ¦No One Wants To See The Chef Arguing Over Cold Chips.

column39: Duvets Too Thick For Summer!! Pillows Need Replacing. Room This Year A Lot Smaller Than Last Year And Payed More This Year!

column64: I Wasnt Keen On The Calamari And Chorizo At All

column39: The Room And Bed Was Quite Small For 2 People. (Our Bed At Home Is Bigger!)
column64: Our Order Was Messed Up And We Were Then Questioned In An Inappropriate Manner (Suggesting We Gave The Order Wrong) By The Waiter Who Took It.  My Burger Came 10 Minutes Later As Ordered But It Was Cold And Not Very Tasty.  My Husbands Starter Came With Anchovies When He Asked For It Without.  Disappointing Meal Unfortunately.
column83: Only With The Waiter In The Restaurant At Dinner Which Was Such A Shame And A Disappointing Start To Our Stress-Relieving Break. Otherwise A Lovely Stay And Would Like To Come Back- Maybe Not For Dinner Though.
column89: Better Room- The Bed Was Very Small For 2 And Extremely Hot. Better Dinner Experience.

column53: Breakfast Was A Similar Experience To Our Meal That Evening In The Brasserie. I Think There Is A Clear Issue With Staffs Attentiveness And Service Level. This Is A Concern Of Ours As We Are Due To Have Our Wedding With You In June Next Year  And Feel That Staff Just Didn't Look Like They Wanted To Be There. I Will Continue To Write More With Our Evening Dining Experience.
column64: I Think There Is A Clear Issue With Staffs Attentiveness And Service Level. This Is A Big Concern Of Ours As We Are Due To Have Our Wedding With You In June Next Year  And Feel That Staff Just Didn't Look Like They Wanted To Be There. I Dine In Restaurants At Least Twice A Week And I Must Say That The Servie In Your Brasserie Is One Of The Worst. Staff Didn't Attend The Table As You Would Expect  We Had A Bottle Of Champagne And I Had To Pour This Myself  We Had To Ask For Someone To Take Our Order  We Then Had To Prompt Someone To Clear The Plates And Then To Top It Off After Waiting And Waiting For The Bill To Arrive It Was Wrong. We Had Been Charged For Somebody Else's Set Menu Orders - As We Had Food From The A La'carte Menu. This Was Corrected. All In All It Was A Pretty Bad Experience And The Reason For Our Visit Was To Mark 1 Year Until We Host Our Wedding With You. I Must Say  It Hasn't Left Me Full Of Confidence With The Level Of Service We Will Receive On Our Wedding Day. I Will Also Pass My Concerns Onto Our Wedding Co-Ordinator.
column83: I Think There Is A Clear Issue With Staffs Attentiveness And Service Level. This Is A Big Concern Of Ours As We Are Due To Have Our Wedding With You In June Next Year  And Feel That Staff Just Didn't Look Like They Wanted To Be There. I Dine In Restaurants At Least Twice A Week And I Must Say That The Servie In Your Brasserie Is One Of The Worst. Staff Didn't Attend The Table As You Would Expect  We Had A Bottle Of Champagne And I Had To Pour This Myself  We Had To Ask For Someone To Take Our Order  We Then Had To Prompt Someone To Clear The Plates And Then To Top It Off After Waiting And Waiting For The Bill To Arrive It Was Wrong. We Had Been Charged For Somebody Else's Set Menu Orders - As We Had Food From The A La'carte Menu. This Was Corrected. All In All It Was A Pretty Bad Experience And The Reason For Our Visit Was To Mark 1 Year Until We Host Our Wedding With You. I Must Say  It Hasn't Left Me Full Of Confidence With The Level Of Service We Will Receive On Our Wedding Day. I Will Also Pass My Concerns Onto Our Wedding Co-Ordinator.

column53: Although Breakfast Was A Buffet  We Expected A Member Of Staff To Show Us To A Table And Explain To Us How It All Worked.  We Were Told To Pick Where To Sit Ourselves And Then Had No Contact With Staff After That - We Just Noticed Everyone Else Getting Up And Getting Drinks Etc And So Followed Suit.
column64: We Received Poor Service In The Brasserie - There Were Plenty Of Members Of Staff Present But All Seemed To Be Avoiding Eye Contact With Customers And It Was Very Hard To Get Their Attention.  Our Waiter Was Very Brisk In Taking Our Orders (He Marched Up To The Table And Just Said 'To Order?' Without Saying Hello Or Asking Us If We Were Ready Or Wanted Drinks First). The Food Was Ok But Not Something I Would Particularly Recommend To Other People.  We Ordered A Bottle Of House White With Our Meal.  At The End Of The Meal  We Waited For A Long Time To Ask If We Needed To Sign Anything (We Were Staying On The Spa Package And So Meals Were Included) And So Left Without Getting Anyone's Attention.  Staff Had Taken Our Room Numbers When We Arrived And So We Thought That Would Be Sufficient.  At 11Pm That Night  One Of Our Rooms Got A Call From Reception From A Member Of Staff Seemingly Accusing Us Of Deliberately Leaving Without Paying For The Wine.  We Explained That We Hadn't Paid For Anything During Our Stay Yet (We Assumed We Would Settle It All At Check Out As Per Our Conversation Upon Booking)  That The Staff In The Brasserie Took Our Room Numbers So Assumed The Wine Would Be Added To Our Room Bill.  The Member Of Staff Didn't Seem Happy With The Explanation And Was Quite Rude In Her Accusation.  The Room They Called Late At Night To Raise This Issue Had Two Heavily Pregnant Women Asleep In It - Given We Were Staying At The Hotel (And So Had Not Left The Premises)  Had Given Our Room Numbers To The Brasserie And Had Left Credit Card Details With Reception On Check In  I Think The Late Night Phone Call About An 'Unpaid' Bottle Of Wine Was Very Unprofessional And Unacceptable.  We Complained To The Manager Upon Check Out Who Was Very Apologetic And Agreed That This Is Not How The Situation Should Have Been Handled At All.  The Hotel Is Beautiful But We Feel That The Inexperienced Staff And Their Attitude In The Dining Areas Let It Down.
column77: The Staff And Facilities In The Spa Are Excellent And I Would Recommend The Hotel To Other People Based On This.  It Is A Shame That The Waiting Staff In The Dining Areas Of The Hotel Are Not Of The Same Quality.
column83: Please See Note Regarding Dining Experience. In General  Waiting Staff Seemed Inexperienced And Totally Lacking In Knowledge Of The Menu  Kitchen And Everything To Do With The Brasserie.
column84: Jodie The Therapist In The Spa Was Excellent.

column35: Only A Slight Niggle That There Was No Lift And Had Carry Our Suitcase Up Two Flights Of Stairs
column39: Room Was Lovely But Was Very Hot. We Asked Someone To Come And Put The Air Conditioning On. After Two Failed Attempts He Did Bring Us A Fan But Didn't Really Make Much Difference. We Stayed In Room 264 As It Will Need Fixing.
column53: Excellent Service  Empty Plates Etc Taken Away Promptly. Freshly Cooked Food And Excellent Choice
column64: I Have Stated I Believe The Value For Money To Be Poor But This Does Not Apply To The Food  The Food Was Outstanding  However Was Rather Taken Back At Prices For The Drinks  Very Expensive And There Was No Option For Sweet Wine Only Dry  Was Disappointed That We Ended Up Having To Leave The Premises To Have Evening Drinks Somewhere More Affordable As Had There Been Cheaper Options We Would Have Quite Happily Stayed There All Night
column77: Excellent
column84: Yes  Tony Served Us At Dinner  Breakfast And Lunch He Was Very Attentive And He Made The Experience Much More Enjoyable We Really Felt Spoiled  Lovely Man Thanks Tony We Will Definitely Be Returning
column89: I Feel Bad To Moan As Overall The Whole Experience Was Excellent  I Have Visited Champneys And Bannantyne Spa's And Sopwell House Is In A Different League It's Exceptional But As I Said Before Would Have Been Nice If Our Bags Were Carried For Us As There Was No Lifts Available.
column90: Will Definitely Return We All Had A Fantastic Time And Met Some Lovely People
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Arrival Was Lovely  Impressive Setting And There Was A Very Talented Pianist Playing As We Were Checking Which Created A Nice Atmosphere - Nice Touch!
column39: Room 267 - The Triple Room; Although The Bed Was Very Comfortable I Had Got Any Sleep As The Room Was Very Warm And We Ended Up Leaving The Air Con On All Which Isn't Very Energy Efficient But The Room Would Get Too Stuffy Otherwise. Unfortunately  This Did Not Help With My Lack If Sleep And Although The Room Was Cooler  The Air Con Was Loud And Disturbing. It's A Real Shame The Windows Would Not Open To Allow Fresh Air But I Guess There Are Health & Safety Issues Around That
column53: I Thought The Breakfast Was Lovely  Absolutely No Complaints About The Breakfast
column64: The Dinner Was Very Disappointing And The Worst Part Of Our Stay At Sopwell House. We Dined On Sunday Night As Part Of A Spa Break Deal And The Buffet Was Mediterranean Themed And It What Not What I Expected. The Food Was Bland Overall  The Paella Wasn't Very Well Cooked At All  The Lemon Chicken Was Dry And Most Of The Hot Foods Didn't Look Appetising. The Salads Were Nice But Real Shame About The Food And Overall Dining Experience - Very Disappointing Given The Reviews And Recommendations From My Close Friends And I Couldn't Help But Feel Let Down. (Luckily Breakfast The Next Day Made Up For It!)
column77: Great Pool And Good Amount Of Loungers
column83: Only One Minor Issue When We Asked For A Jug Of Water During Lunch In The Brasserie  I Could See That En Route Our Waiter Was Stopped By Another Member Of Kitchen Staff Who Said He Would Get Our Water And Told Our Waiter To Do Something Else  However He Clearly Forgot And/Or Got Distracted And After Waiting A While And Failing To Catch His Attention We Asked Another Waitress Who Was Very Prompt And Friendly. Most Of The Staff Encountered Were Very Pleasant  Helpful And Courteous.
column89: If The Themed Dinner Buffet Was Of The Same Standard As The Lunch And Breakfast. Also The Room We Stayed In Was Quite Stuffy And Too Hot At Night
column90: The Themed Buffet Was Very Poor And The Most Disappointing Part Of Our Stay. The Spa And Grounds However Were Beautiful  I Would Like To Come Back Again But I Would Probably Look A Day Spa Breaks As The Room Was Too Hot At Night And The Dinner Was Awful

column39: We Stayed In A Mews Apartment (12). The Hairdryer Was Plugged Into The Wall Via A Hole In The Back Of A Drawer  Meaning The Cord Was Incredibly Short And It Was Very Difficult To Dry Your Hair
column64: Personally If You Advetise A Fine Dining Experience Then I Don't Think You Should Be Entertaining Noisy Birthday Parties Or Screaming Children In This Restaurant  These Should Be In The Brasserie. This Did Spoil The Evening For Us  As It Was Noisy And Did Not Feel Like 'Fine' Dining. However I Would Say That The Food Was Beautiful And Very High Quality.
column77: If You Advertise A Hotel Spa Then This Should Clearly State That Children Are Allowed In The Facilities. A Standard Relaxing Spa Experience Would Normally Be Adults Only. Our Relaxing Afternoon By The Pool Was Ruined By A Large Family Of 8 Taking Over The Entire Pool With A Screaming Child  Making It Impossible To Relax  And Impossible To Use The Pool As There Was No Room Where They Were Playing Games. This Is Not Clear On The Website  Where The Spa Looks Like A Peaceful Tranquil Area. The Actual Spa Therapists And Reception Team Were Fantastic  Nothing Was Too Much Trouble  And They Were Very Professional.
column89: We Had Additional Charges On Our Bill From The Bar That Were Nothing To Do With Us  And We Had Not Been Made Aware Of. No-One In Reception Knew What These Were  So We Were Kept Waiting For 15 Minutes Whilst These Were Analysed. We Never Did Find Out What They Were  And Refused To Pay For Them. No-One Offered To Help With Our Bags.
column90: Overall We Had A Really Lovely Stay And The Hotel And Its Grounds Are Gorgeous. However It Is Advertised As A Luxury Retreat / Country House  And So I Do Think The Advertising Is False  As Our Experience Was More That It Was A Family Hotel With Lots Of Large Parties And Children. If That Is The Target Market Then This Should Be Clearly Identified In The Marketing  As This Was False Advertising. Alternatively Children Should Not Be Allowed To Use The Pool Area  And The Restaurants Should Be Arranged More Appropriately To Deal With Parties And Families Without Disturbing Other Guests

column39: When First Arrived At Our Room It Was Lovely Although It Did Over Look The Car Park. A Quick Call To Reception And We Were Moved To One Over Looking The Pond It Was Lovely. It Might Be A Good Idea To Allocate All Guest To Rooms With Better Views First If These Are Available .
column64: The Restaurant Was A Little Dark Where We Was Sitting.
column84: We Didn't Catch The Porters Name He Was Working On The 17Th June  He Was Very Helpful. There Was Also A Gardener Who Had Just Started He Was Very Friendly And Polite.

column77: The Lady That Did My Massage And Nails  Was One Of The Best I Have Ever Had. Amazing Girl - Please Pass This On Lucy Cleary 5.30 Slot On Friday 14Th June
column84: The Lady This Did The Massge (Sorry No Name And Also The Nmake Waiter That Served Us For The Evening Meal 8.30 14/06
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Had To Wait For Our Room To Be Ready And Very Busy On Repception
column39: Room Was Very Hot And Air Conditioning Did Not Seem To Work.  There Was A Background Humming Noise All Night.

column35: The Venue And Experience Was Poor And Did Not Live Up To The Expectations. We Booked An Executive Room And Were Surprised By The Fact That The Room Was Incredibly Average. The Heating Did Not Work Properly In Our Room  So Room 112 Was Cold. We Spoke To Somebody About This Twice  On The First Occasion It Was With The Maintenance Man And On The Second Occasion It Was With A Receptionist. However The Issue Was Not Rectified.
column39: Room 112. - The Room Was Overpriced And Remarkably Ordinary. In Fact It Was Very Similar To The Premier Inn  That Also Happens To Be Significantly Cheaper.
column90: As A Gesture Of Goodwill I Would Be Happy If I Received A Refund For The Poor Experience.

column35: When We First Tried To Book We Left A Message On The Answer Phone With Reservations  Leaving Name And Phone Number Etc. Which Was Never Returned.
column39: The Bed In The Room Was A Temporary Pull Down Bed Which Had A Large Wooden Section Under Head Section Of The Bed Which As Someone Who Sleeps With Their Hands And Arms Underneath The Pillow I Found Very Uncomfortable.  Around The Base Of The Bed On The Floor Was The Rest Of The Wooden Frame Of The Bed.  I Hit My Foot On This Several Times When Approaching The Bed  Which Was Very Painful.  The Curtains In The Room Did Not Fit The Windows  There Were Gaps At Both Side Edges And In The Middle  This Obviously Let In Light In The Morning But Also Let In The Light From The Orange Security Lights Outside During The Night.  We Had Our Young Baby Staying With Us And It Was Very Difficult Juggling The Curtains At 7Pm And 4Am Trying To Stop Various Sorts Of Light From Falling On Her And Waking Her Up.
column90: Unfortunately We Did Not Complain About The Room At The Time Of Arrival.  This Is Because We Aren't Really The Type To Cause A Fuss And We Had A Baby That Was Crying With Hunger And Needed Feeding When We Got To The Room.  Once We Had Fed Our Baby We Felt That We Should Re-Join The Wedding Party As We Didn't Want To Seem Rude To Our Friends And We Also Were Not Sure About The Timing Of The Meal And So On.  We Did Bring Up Our Issues When We Checked Out And Were Told That The Hotel Is Undergoing Refurbishment And We Were Obviously Unlucky To Have Got A Bad Room But As We Didn't Complain At The Time There Was Nothing To Be Done.  I Must Say That We Have Stayed At Hotels Which Cost Half The Price Which We Payed To Stay At Sopwell House (Which Included A Discount For The Wedding) Which Have Been Significantly More Comfortable And Better Furnished. We Found The 4 Star Rating Of The Hotel Surprising Considering Our Experience.

column39: Had To Change Rooms As The First Room We Were Checked Into Was In Such A Poor State. Carpet Rippled  Bath Had Loads Of Sealant Round The Plug Hole  Wasn't Clean And Generally The Bathroom Was In Disrepair. Carpet Also Had Black Marks All Over It. Room We Were Transferred To However Was Much Better.  Also Would Have Been Nice To Have A Mini Bar.
column53: Pots Of Tea Would Have Been Better Than Cups!
column77: Had To Ask For Slippers And Dressing Gown.
column89: Areas Needed Refurbished - Our Room & Leaking Roof In The Terrace Bar For Example.
column90: Grounds Were Nice.
Thank You To All The Staff At Sopwell House That Made Mine And My Husbands Wedding Day Special  Stress Free And Enjoyable.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: The Kettle Didn't Work  The Television Didn't Work And Required Two Visits By A Technician To Resolve The Issue And The Room Was Awful. Each Time Somebody Walked Past Our Room They Sounded Like A Herd Of Elephants. So Disappointing

column89: The Staff In The Brasserie Seemed A Little Under Pressure As It Was Very Busy So Maybe Some More Staff Needed At Busier Times

column39: The Taps Were Dirty/Stained And The Hair Dryer Hardly Gave Any Output
column64: We Had To Keep Asking For Things  The Waiter Never Came Over Instinctively

column39: Room 139: The Room Itself Was Well Decorated And Furnished  Although I Was Surprised At The Lack Of Fridge/ Minibar. Unfortunately The Mattress On The Bed Was Very Uncomfortable- I Could Feel The Springs On The Mattress Which Means It Was Not Pleasant To Sleep On. The Pillows Were Uncomfortable So I Had To Use One Of The Small Cushions. However  The Major Problem With The Room Was It's Location  Directly Next To The Air Conditioning Unit. This Made My Stay Unbearable  I Was Awake Until 2Am Due To The Noise And Then Was Woken Continuously Through The Night. Since I Had Booked The Stay For A Relaxing Break  This Was Very Disappointing As I Woke Up Exhausted And Just Wanted To Go Home To Get A Proper Sleep.
column53: I Had The Buffet Which I Thought Was Plentiful And Of Good Quality. However  Toast Was Not Offered Which Was Surprising. Once I Had Got My Food I Requested Some Toast With Brown Bread. Ten Minutes Later My Food Was Going Cold And Toast Not Appeared. I Requested It Again And It Came Five Minutes Later  But With No Butter. Requested Butter. Five Minutes Later It Turned Up  Hard As Rock! Toast Was Now Cold (Like The Butter)  Had To Request New Toast  New Butter And Get More Breakfast Items As The Ones I'd Got Were Now Stone Cold. Toast (With Spreadable Butter) Turned Up Five Minutes Later....On White Bread. I Gave Up At This Point. It Was A Little Bewildering As There Were Plenty Of Staff And It Was Very Quiet In The Brasserie  So Service Really Should Have Been Better. Staff Were Very Friendly And Polite Though.
column64: Service At Dinner Was Very Good. At Lunch However I Was Not Offered Water  Bread Or Butter  Despite This Being Clearly Available To Other Tables. A Plus Point However Is That My Dessert Of Choice Was Not Available On The Buffet Table And Upon Request The Waitress Found Me Some More  Which Was Nice Of Her.
column77: Really Enjoyed My Treatments  I Had The Two Natalies And They Were Very Good And Professional. However One Of My Treatments Finished Slightly Early And As They Are Not Cheap It Is Important That Guests Are Offered The Full Amount Of Time. The Pool Was Lovely And Relaxing On My First Day But On The Morning Of Check-Out I Thought I Would Have A Final Swim And Was Dismayed To Find An Aqua Aerobics Class Taking Place In The Pool. Not Only Were All The Swimmers Forced To Squeeze Into A Tiny Section Of The Pool  But Everywhere Else You Went (Sauna  Steam Room Etc) You Couldn't Escape The Loud Pop Music- Not Very Relaxing! I Think If These Classes Are To Be Offered They Should Be After Check-Out Time As People On A 1-Night Stay Miss Out On Having A Relaxing Swim On The Day Of Their Departure.
column83: All Mentioned On Previous Pages. All Staff Were Lovely And Polite  But Staff In Brasserie Not As Efficient As They Could Be. This Is A Real Shame As It Left Me Feeling A Bit Frustrated With My Overall Stay.    Due To The Unbearable Noise Where My Room Was Located  I Asked To Switch Rooms At Around Midnight And The Staff Were Very Accommodating And Helpful- Unfortunately The Room I Was Moved To Was Equally As Noisy So I Had To Move Back  But This Was Not Their Fault.
column89: It Is Unfair To Market Your Hotel As A Relaxing Break  And Then Give People Rooms Where  Unless They Are Heavy Sleepers  They Will Be Unable To Get A Good Night's Sleep. I Wish I Had Read The Reviews On The Internet Which Make Similar Comments  So I Would Have Known To Specifically Request A Room Away From The Air-Conditioning Unit.  Also  As Check-Out Is At 11Am  I Would Advise Having More Than One Member Of Staff On Reception At This Time As There Was A Queue To Check Out.

column39: 1. Mould All Over Shower Ceiling 2. Two Single Beds Pushed Together To Form A Double When Asked For A Double Room 3. Air Conditioning Having Little/No Effect In Room Even When Set At Maximum Speed To 17Deg C. 4. Unable To Open Windows (Seemed Sealed Shut)
column89: A Decent Room.
column90: Room Was Extremely Poor With What I Expected To Find; Nice At First Glance But Many Problems With It.

column39: We Were In A Fantastic Room. Basically A Suite Which Was Unexpected And Very Much Appreciated.
column53: Was Part Of Te Wedding Deal So I Can't Comment On The Prices.
column77: Spa Facilities Was Part Of The Wedding Deal So Can't Comment On Prices And I Didn't Use Any Treatments. Gym Was Well Equipped For Its Size.

column64: When I'd Booked I Had Said It Was To Celebrate My Sisters Birthday. I Was Very Impressed That The Staff In The Brasserie Had Managed To Work Out Which Of My Sisters Was Having Her Birthday And Brought Out Dessert With A Candle.
column90: The Initial Booking Via Telephone Was Very Good. The People I Spoke To Were Very Helpful. We Were Accommodated In Our Request To Have The Lunch Included In The Package On Our Day Of Arrival Which Suited Our Needs Much Better.

column39: Front Desk Staff Need To Have Better People Skills And Be More Inviting  Not Very Polite.
column64: Staff Again Seem To Not Be Polite Or Inviting.
column84: Front Desk Staff Are Key To The Experience And They Were Not Inviting Or Helpful.

column39: We Could Of Done With A Fridge In Our Room As The Room Was Very Hot And Needed Cold Drinks.

column64: Our Server For Our Evening Meal Was Extremely Rude An Unhelpful. We Were Halfway Through Starters Before All Our Drinks Arrived. He Was Annoyed That We Told Him Our Wine Was Warm And When We Asked For Ice He Bought Over A Plate Of Ice With A Spoon?? Very Unfriendly. All Other Staff However Were Great.
column77: We Found A Plaster In The Pool Amongst Other Pieces Of Dirt Etc.
column89: To Be Honest The Dinner Was Extremely Uncomfortable Due To Our Server However All Other Aspects Were Great.

column39: No Fridge Was Disappointing As It Was An Apartment Room. Apt 7 News Room. Didn't Look As Nice On Website  Not A Luxurious And Stain On Carpet.
column64: Italian Buffet On Sunday Was Nicer Than Menu On Saturday Night In Brasserie
column89: Little Touches In Room  Like Some Complimentary Water

column39: Very Noisy And Air On Was Not Working Properly....Very Bad Nights Sleep
column64: Very Noisy When The Bar Was Open Next Door Resulting In Us Feeling Like We Were In A Market Square Rather Than A Find Dining Restaurant. Once The People Left The Bar The Atmosphere Of Restaurant Was Lovely
column77: Far Too Busy. There Was Nowhere For Us To Sit/Lounge Yet Lots Of Towels On Beds.
column84: The Beauty Therapist Was Absolutely Amazing. Best Facial Ever!! She Get The Balance Spot On Between Small Talk And Being Quiet.

column39: Room 266 The Triple Room Was Very Poor Fir 4 Star Hotel! The Bathroom Could Have Been Cleaned Better And The Sink Taps Were Leaking On The Side. The Room Didn't Really Have Any Decoration Nor Feel Like We Should Have Paid The Amount We Did.
column77: There Were No Bath Robes
column90: Very Disappointed With My Room

column89: Poor Meal

column35: As I Booked The Standard Room The Lady I Spoke To Said She Will See If Possible Nearer The Time. When We Arrived We Were So Happy And Overwhelmed That This Was Done  Such A Wonderful Touch To An Amazing Day.
column39: The Sopwell Mews Really Are Home From Home And I Would Love To Stay Here Again When We Celebrate Our First Anniversary. The Only Issue We Found With The Room Was An Ants Nest Which We Found In The Door Frame Of The Bathroom And Other Side Of The Bedroom  We Found This Late On Saturday Night So Did Not Bother To Report It Till We Left On Sunday. The Ants Came Out Lots When They Were Disturbed So We Left It Alone!
column48: The Breakfast Menu Was Not In The Room The Following Day For Us To Order Room Service  Which Wasn't A Problem As Reception Brand One Up Very Quickly. Staff Always Polite And Had A Smile Which Makes A Lot Of Difference.
column53: The Breakfast On Saturday Was Amazing And Still Very Hot. The Breakfast On The Sunday Didn't Seem To Have The Same Quality And Things Like Butter And Additional Milk Were Missing. Nothing Something That Bothered Either Of Us  The Food Was Still Lovely And Great Choice.
column64: Amazing Staff On The Terrance Bar - So Polite And Helpful.
column77: Cannot Wait To Return  By Far Best Leisure Facilities In 5* Hotel
column84: All Staff Were So Polite  Really Is Refreshing To See Smiles On All Staff! Thank You To Them All For Making Our Stay Amazing.
column89: None! Excellent All Round.
column90: Just That We Can Not Wait To Return For Our First Year Anniversary And Hope We Have The Same Amazing Time! I Am Currently Arranging A Weekend Break With Friends For The Spa Break As I Had Such A Great Time! Thanks To All The Staff As They Were All So Helpful! Sopwell House Is By Far The Best Hotel I Have Stayed In And Have Already Recommended To Several Friends And Family.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Our Room Should Have Been Ready At 3Pm According To Our Email So We Were Asked To Wait In The Bar Where We Were Obviously Forgotten About As An Hour Later My Husband Had To Remind Reception We Were Still Waiting. Not A Good Start! We Were Also Not Informed Of Our Dining Information And I Took Me A Further 45 Mins Of Ringing Reception  Restaurant Etc Etc And Finally A Trip Back Down To Reception To Find Out We Had Been Booked In At 8.30 Without Any Consultation.
column48: Our Breakfast Came With Numerous Items Missing Eg Milk For Cereal And Butter For Toast. By The Time My Milk Arrived My Cooked Breakfast Was Cold. However I Was Pleased To See There Was Gluten Free Bread Available .
column53: See Previous Comment
column64: The Restaurant And Its Staff Were Excellent And This Was The Only Positive Part Of Our Experience At Sopwell House.
column83: See Previous Comments
column84: The Staff In The Restaurant Especially Our Waiter Who's Name Unfortunately Escapes Me.
column89: Yes Lots - See Previous Comments
column90: No Other Than We Felt Very Disappointed With Our Visit To Sopwell House As The Service Was So Poor.

column35: Cleaner Vacuuming Reception On Arrival Wasn't Ideal
column39: Too Hot Air Con Didn't Work
column53: Gluten Free Bread

column64: Very Friendly And Helpful Waiting Staff  It Was A Real Treat To Dine In The Brasserie Restaurant.  Thank You.

column39: Shower Was Awful And Hair Dryer Did Not Work
column64: Food Was Awful
column77: Really Nice Had A Fantastic Time In The Spa
column83: Told Reception About The Shower Not Working To Which We Got The Response 'We Can't Be Expected To Check Every Shower' Which I Found Quite Shocking And Rude
column84: Alison In The Brasserie Was Efficient Polite And A Pleasure To Have Met...She Is A Credit To Your Team And You Should Be Extremely Proud Of Her

column39: Vanity Products E.G. Cotton Buds  Balls Were Not Available In The Room And Would Have Been Useful. Bottled Water Should Have Also Been Available In The Room.
column64: Dining Options On A Sunday Evening Are Very Limited. It Would Have Been Nice To Have A Little More Choice In The A La Carte Menu Rather Than Pure Focus On The Buffet.

column39: The Rooms Were A Little Tired.  The First Room We Were Given Was Very Small And Noisey.
column83: We Wanted A Drink At The Bar  After Waiting 10 Minutes To Be Served We Were Told We Were At The Wrong Bar And Wouldnt Be Served!
column89: Better Room To Begin With- First Was Well Below The Expected Standard.

column35: Received Phone Call From The Spa To Book In Our Treatments Prior To Our Stay And Also Received A Courtesy Call A Few Days Before To Ensure This Was All Still Correct. Great Communication From Those Girls!
column64: Loved The Creme Brulee!!!
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: Only A Small Thing But The Bed Was Too Soft For Us.
I Thnk That Gown Should Be Left Upstairs In Yuor Room When You Arrive And Not Hae You Go To The Spa To Collect Them
column53: The Clearing Of Plates And Waiting Time For Desert Order Was Very Long
column77: There Are Not Enough Longers Around The Pool

column39: Dear Sirs      To Whom It May Concern I Would Firstly Like To Thank You And Your Staff For Your Hospitality  It Was Mine And My Friends First Visit To Sopwell House And We Found All Your Staff Very Polite  Friendly And Accommodating.     I Booked Our Stay 21St 22Nd July As A 30Th Birthday Treat For A Good Friend Of Mine And Was Mostly Happy With Our Stay  However When I Phoned In To Book Our Stay I Spoke To A Very Friendly Lady Who Managed To Up Sell Me To An Executive Room Describing It As A Modern  Newly Decorated Room With Views Overlooking The Grounds Located At The Front Of The Building It Sounded Lovely And Worth The Extra Money.      The Room We Were Allocated Was 219 And Was Located At The Rear Of The Building Overlooking The Car Park  I Was Going To Query This With Reception When We Arrived But My Friend DidnâT Want To Cause A Fuss And Said The Room Was Fine.          IâM Not One To Usually Complain But This Experience Did Leave Me A Little Disappointed.     Thank You Again To You And Your Staff For A Lovely Stay.              Regards  Graham Dedman   Sales Manager   Westons Car & Commercials Ltd     T: (01462) 459681  F: (01462) 421595  E: Grahamdedman@Wcac.Co.Uk
column77: Me Nd My Friend Thought The Pool Had Too Much Chlorine In It And Made Our Eyes Sting
column89: The Only Reason My Expectations Were Not Met Was The Room Upgrade/Views That Were Sold To Me.

column35: Arrival Was Smooth  Receptionist Asked If We'd Stayed Before  We Hadn't Explained Breakfast  Lunch  Dinner  Spa  Pool And Treatments  Asked If We'd Been To St Albans Before  Handed Us A Map And Gave Us General Information  Very Friendly - Shame I Can't Remember Her Name  But I Told Her I Was Expecting And She Was Very Friendly  Congratulated Me & When I Bumped Into Her Later She Asked If Our Room And Meal Etc Was Nice And If There Was Anything She Could Do For Me.  Very Warm Staff. Directions To Lift/ Room V. Clear.
column39: 123 - Room Well Maintained  Clean & Spacious  Not Too Corporate Like Some Executive Rooms In Other Hotels.  Bathroom Good Size.  Room Cleaned/ Serviced Everyday  Good Range Of Teas And Coffees & Herbal Teas  Not One Ounce Of Dirt.
column48: Although Room Service Was Very  Very Good And We Thoroughly Enjoyed It  We Did Ask For Our Change Back Three Times And Only Received It Back Once  It Was Only A Small Amount But Still.  Once We Asked For Our Tray To Be Taken Back  Which The Chap Arrived Promptly But As He Had A Few Other Things To Carry Left The Tray Outside Someone Else's Room All Night And I Swear Someone Tripped Over It In The Night - Unless He Had Remembered And Was Noisily Collecting It!!!
column53: Massive Choice  Food Looked Fresh And Appealing  We Could Have Easily Pigged Out Ever Day
column64: Quite Pricey But Not Too Bad Considering Quality Of Food
column90: Amazing Stay At Sopwell House Haven't Stopped Gushing About Since We've Been Back Home.  Want To Come Back Asap- Perhaps Once Baby's Born!! Have Recommended It To Everyone We Know And More  Have Also Given A You A Massive Rave Review On Trip Advisor  Well Done Sopwell House  Couldn't Have Asked For A Better Holiday.

column39: Was Disappointed That The Executive Room Didn't Have A Fridge. Or Dressing Gowns
Moved Room Due To Dissatisfaction Of First Room

column53: We Ordered Breakfast On Our Room And It Was Cold And Very Disappointing.
column64: The Staff Were Poorly Trained
column90: The Hotel Is Wonderful But I Think The Staff Were Not Great. We Tried To Order A Drink At The Bar But We We Asked To Sit Down And Then The Waitress Took A Long Time To Come Over And Then To Bring Our Drinks. The Same Happened Again Later. The Staff In The Restaurant Were Not Very Clever.

column35: Check In Was Laboured In Terms Of Conversing With Reception Staff And From Observing Others It Was A Similar Experience For Others.
column39: Small Compared To Others In Relation To Being The Same Price - Our Room Was The Same Price Yet Half The Size Of Other Members Of Our Group.
column53: Service In Terms Of Clearing And Setting Tables Was Slow.
column64: We Had Been Presented With Our Bill - Which We Duly Paid And Then An Hour Or So Later Had Been Presented With Another Bill For The Same Items  Also For Other Members Of Our Group They Had To Wait A Long Time For Their Meal To Be Brought To Them.
column77: None
column83: Few Problems At Reception And With Waiter Staff In Terms Of Accent And Language Barrier.
column84: The Main Member Of Staff Who Worked On The Terrace On The Friday 26Th July He Was Extremely Helpful And Attentive  Explained Any Mistakes By Other Staff And Was Courteous.
column89: No
column90: No

column39: We Stayed An A Delux Room And Thought A Fridge Would Be Available
column77: Spa And Meals Were Part Of Package That I Thought Overall Were Very Good Value For Money. I Can't Comment On Usual Individual Prices As I'm Not Aware What They Are.
column83: Our Dessert Order Was Forgotten But As Soon As The Service Team Were Made Aware Of The Error A Complimentary Drink Was Offered To Apologise

column64: For Both Dinner And Lunch We Were Not Asked If We Would Like A Drink. On Both Occasions When We Left All The Waitress Said Was Do You Need To Pay For Any Drinks! I Was Outraged! It Would Have Been Nice If We Were Offered A Drink In The Forst Place! Very Poor Service And Dissapointing.
column83: Please Refer To My Comment Regarding Drinks At Lunch/Dinner
column90: Your Drinks Prices Are Way Over The Top! Nearly Â£8 For Two Pots Of Tea! And Â£11 For Two Glasses Of The Chespest Wine! Considering I Paid Â£270 For The Night I Didnt Expect To Spend A Fortune On Drinks!

column48: Not Enough Vegetarian Options  Overly Expensive Especially Soft Drinks
column53: Breakfast Very Chaotic  Not Enough Staff.  Not Enough Cooked Vegetarian Options - Addition Of Vegetarian Sausages For Example Would Be Great. Also Options For Hot Sweet Breakfast Would Improve It Even More Such As Pancakes
column89: More Staff At Reception At Check Out Time
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column64: Our Meal Took Quite A Long Time To Come Out  But The Duty Manager Apologised Several Times  As Well As Recognising Us At Breakfast The Next Day  So We Did Not Feel Upset About This.
column84: Duty Manager On Friday 2Nd.
column90: Very Nice And Relaxing Stay

column39: Bath A Bit Dated. Chest Of Drawers A Bit Worn And Scratched.
column64: We Waited A While To Be Asked If We Wanted To Order A Drink. Once My Friend Got Up And Went Over To A Member Of Staff The Service Was Then Excellent
column89: Water Bottles To Be Able To Buy Or Given In Spa If You Are Not Having A Treatment Would Be Nice.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: We Were Moved From Room 254 Because Of The Noise To Room 270 But The Bed In 254 Was Much Softer ..
column48: We Ordered Only A Bottle Of Water. The Price Was High.
column84: The Staff All Over The Hotel Was The Best I Have Ever Met!
column90: We Enjoyed Our Stay Beyond All Expectations

column39: 139 The Only Thing I Would Change Is The Hairdryer
column83: Someone Entered In Our Room Twice While I Was In The Room Without Knocking On The Door. It Wasn't A Great Deal And One Of The Two Times The Lady Was Very Apologetic (The Second Time They Just Realised There Was Someone In The Room And Closed The Door Immediately) But I Think That You Should Always Make Sure Before Entering A Room.
column84: Natalie At The Spa Was Really Good. Very Professional During The Treatments. Really Helpful With Advices And Friendly.

column20: It's Where The Wedding Was Being Held
column35: I Was Not Comfortable Giving My Credit Card Details Over The Phone  I Wish There Was An Online Way To Do So (I Had To Call As We Claimed Special Rates Applicable To Wedding Guests). The Original Rate That Was Proposed To Us Did Not Reflect The Special Wedding Rate  Although We Quoted The Reference  We Had To Sort That Out Later On.
column39: It Was A Queen Size Bed  Which We Found Narrow And Short For Our Needs. There Was No Minibar.
column64: The Food Was Ok  But Nothing Special.
column84: Prima At Reception Was Very Nice And Welcoming And Sorted All Our Issues In A Timely And Professional Manner. The Rest Of The Staff Was Polite And Serviceable  But I Would Not Say They Went The Extra Mile.
column89: Offer Smoking Rooms. Offer An Outdoor Smoking Area Which Is Slightly Larger Than The 3-4 Tables Y The Brasserie.
column90: Despite What Might Seem Like A Rather Negative Review  We Had A Very Nice Stay. We Wouldn't Recommend It Because It Is Very Much Out Of Our Price Range (And That Of Our Friends)  And We Wouldn't Come Back Again Because We Have No Business In The Area. Thank You Very Much.

column83: A Member Of Staff On Reception At The Spa Was Clearly Chatting To A Friend And Made It Clear We Had Interrupted Her As She Continued Her Conversation While Serving Us
column90: The Hotel Is Priced And Advertised As High Quality But The Service And Rooms Seem Merely Adequate. I Was Happy With Our Stay But It Was What I Would've Expected From A Far Lower Quality Hotel/Spa So Feel Let Down To Have Paid Top Quality Pricing For It.

column35: I Had A Lovely Stay But Had A Single Room (Which I Knew About Before Arrival).  However I Thought The Room Was A Little Dated For Such A Lovely Hotel It Didnt Really Fit With The Decor In The Other Areas.  Also  I Could Not See Any Options For Ordering Room Service.  Other Than That I Really Enjoyed My Stay  The Staff Were Very Courtious And I Will Certainly Stay Again.  Thank You
column39: I Was Really Not That Keen On My Room (As Mentioned In Previous Comment)

column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column20: Friend's Wedding Was At Sopwell House Therefore We Stayed At Sopwell House
column35: When We Arrived  We Explained That We Were Here (As Bridesmaids) For A Wedding The Same Day As Our Reservation  And The Receptionist Prioritised Our Room For Cleaning After 11Am Check-Out To Ensure We Could Access Our Room As Early As Possible. Very Helpful And Efficient Service.

We Were Disappointed As I Booked The Same Package In The Same Way For The Same Price  But For 2 Rooms Instead Of The Previous 3. On Arrival We Were Told The Rooms Weren't Next To Or Really Near By Each Other And When We Got To The Rooms They Were Not They Same Standard/Size As Before (4Months Previous) When I Questioned This The Lady Said I Had Previously Booked Different Rooms But Couldnt Explain Why It Was The Same Price. We Ended Up Having To Pay An Upgrade To Get 2 Rooms Next To Each Other.
column39: Most Comfy Bed Ever
column53: The Table We Had Been Given Wasn't Fully Laid With Butter  Forks  Milk Etc. Service Was A Little Slow.

column39: I Had Booked 2 Rooms On The Same Spa Break Package. The First 2 Rooms Given To Us  Even Though On Your System Are Standards Doubles  One Was Significantly Bigger Than The Other. When We Bought This To The Managers Attention We Were Given An Alternative Second Larger Room Which Was Very Nice.
column64: Only Comment Would Be As We Were There For 2 Nights Would Have Been Nice To Have Had A Different Set Menu For Each Night.
column77: While It Is Good To See Staff Tidying Up Around The Pool  It Would Have Been Nice To Have My Wet Towel Left Laid Out To Dry While Swimming Rather Than Coming Back From A Swim & Still Have A Wet Towel!
column83: After The Issue With The Size Of One Of The Rooms  We Then Discovered The Air Conditioning Wasn't Working In One Of Them. We Were Offered An Alternative Double (However This Was A Smaller One) Or A Larger One But This Was Above Where A Party Was Below So Would Have Been Noisy. We Had No Choice But To Have To Pay For An Upgrade So As To Continue With The Comfort We Had Begun The Break With. This Was Very Disappointing As I Had Recommended Your Hotel To Our Friends  As I Have Stayed There Many Times Before  Yet They Still Had To Pay For The Upgrade.
column90: Despite The Issues  We Had A Very Enjoyable Stay & Look Forward To Returning To You In The Future.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: A Lovely And Warm Welcome From The Concierge  Who Was Already Taking Our Cases Up To Our Room Before We Had Even Checked In! All Pre-Arrival Contact Was Smooth (Organising Flowers  Afternoon Tea And Spa Treatments).
column39: Room 263 - We Have The Same Room Every Year We Turn Up (163 Or 263). Last Year  Unfortunately  A Pair Of Underwear From Some Previous Occupants Was Left In The Room And We Had To Ask Three Times To Have It Removed! This Year  The Housekeeping Service Was Much Better  Although We Were Not Given Fresh Supplies Of Some Hot Drinks  Toilet Roll And Soap. There Was Also A Dental Floss Stick That Had Been Left In The Room By Previous Occupants And Was Never Removed During Our 2 Night Stay. We Beleive That The Room Could Also Benefit From A Fridge  Allowing Guests To Store Bottled Water In A Chilled Environment.
column53: We Can't Really Comment On Value For Money - We Don't Know How Much The Room Would Have Been Without Breakfast! Being Vegetarian  The Only Possible Addition To The Cooked Counter Would Be Some Form Of Vegetarian Sausage. We Noticed That Rather Than Being Given Toast Directly To The Table (As Per Previous Years)  It Was Sitting On The Buffet And Therefore Not As Fresh When We Had It.
column64: The Quality Of Service Was Second To None And Possibly One Of The Best We Have Experienced In Any Uk Hotel. The Staff Were Attentive  Yet Not Disruptive And Everything Was Done With A Minimum Of Fuss. The Food Quality Was Fantastic  Especially In The Restaurant And The Atmosphere In The Restaurant On Saturday Night Was Topped Off By The Beautiful Background Sounds Of The Pianist. We Always Feel That You Can't Come To Sopwell House And Not Eat In The Restaurant!
column77: I Had The Pleasure Of My First Ever Facial During Our Stay And It Was One Of The Most Pleasant And Relaxing Experiences I Have Ever Had. I Will Certainly Be Coming Back For Another One! You Always Felt The Swimming Pool Was Clean  Especially With Cleaning Staff Constantly Walking Around To Check And Tidy The Areas.
column83: On The Sunday Night  A Notice Was Placed On The Door Of The Cocktail Bar  Stating That It Would Be Closed For Refurbishment. We Were Quite Upset As We Nothing More Than Relaxing On A Sofa With One Of Your Excellent Cocktails  Something We Would Not Be Able To Do On Monday. However  It Was The Attitude Of The Bar Manager That Was More Upsetting. He Said The Bar Would Close Early At 11.30 And So We Ensured We Arrived Just In Time For Last Orders. It Did However Seem Like More Of An Inconvenience That We Were There And He Couldn't Close Up Quick Enough After Our Order Was Complete.
column84: Tanzin (Terrace Bar) - Both This And Last Year  He Was Extremely Attentive  Pleasant And Friendly To Us  Always Ensuring We Had Everything We Wanted And That All Problems Were Easily And Efficiently Resolved.
column89: Nothing Apart From The Content Of Previous Comments.
column90: Many Thanks For Another Wonderful Year At Sopwell House  We Look Forward To Seeing You Soon.

column35: Previously Discussed Via Telephone Before Booking And On My Online Reservation - Stated That We Follow A Vegan Diet And I Was Told You Can Cater For This.  When I Checked In And Asked About Breakfast And Meals And What We Will Be Having.  The Lady Phones Through To The Kitchen  They Made No Effort And Said We Can Fruit And Croissants.  Unless The Croissant Were Diary Free We Could Not Have Them.  I Expected Extra Effort  And We Would Have Less Options Than Meat Eaters Without Any Help From The Kitchen Staff. When We Called Front Desk  The Phone Either Was Not Answered Or It Took Along Time To Be Answered.
column39: Room 107 - The Pillows Were Too Soft  Would Be Good To Have A Pillow Menu.  When We Arrived The Room Was Cleaned To A High Standard.  But On Sunday Am  There Were Two Trays In The Room  But Only One Tray Was Removed.  We Was Left With A Dirty Tray In The Room.  The Room Had Butter Biscuits And Diary Milk Which Could Not Be Eaten Or Drunk By Vegan.  If The Room Was Allocated On Booked And I Stated We Were Vegans  This Should Have Been Removed. We Forgot To Put The 'Do Not Disturb' Sign Out  But In The Morning The Cleaner Did Not Knock And Say Room Service.  This Normally Happens In Other Hotels I Have Stayed At  Announce They Are Entering A Room
column48: Room Service Took Too Long To Answer The Phone  The Service Was Poor.  In The Morning I Had To Go Down To The Restaurant As No One Answered The Phone.  In The Evening  The Phone Also Took Ages To Answer  On Some Occasions We Called Housekeeping And Asked To Be Transferred Or For Room Service To Call Us Back.   There Was No Selection For Us  The Staff Made Us Feel Like We Were Being Difficult.  We Had Reservations For The Brasserie But Decided To Have Room Service.   We Had A Choice Of Roasted Vegetable Panini And Fries Or Pasta With Vegetables.  This Was Disappointing And The Prices Were Totally Made Up And More Than Some Of The Meals On The Menu.  They Asked Us What We Wanted  But I Don't Understand Why They Did That As All Our Suggestions They Could Cater To. One Evening We Asked For Orange Juice  This Was Not Sent Up.  When We Asked The Delivery Staff Where It Was.  We Was Told They Would Sort This Out.  But The Orange Juice Was Not Sent Up.  We Did Not Bother To Phone Back As The Phone Was Never Answered.  We Asked For Soya Milk For Tea  The Milk Was Not Soya As The Next Day Milk Had Curdled  Thickened Separated.  This Does Not Happen With Soya Milk.  For Breakfast On Monday Morning  The Jam Was Not Brought To Our Room.  We Had To Phone To Get This Sent Up And We Got Warm Milk  Even Though We Asked For Cold Soya Milk. Honestly The Whole Experience With Room Service Was Poor And The Selection Was The Worst I Have Had In A Hotel Of This Status.  We Spent A Total Of Â£76.51 Including Room Service On Food At Sopwell.  Totally Over Priced For What We Had.  Thankfully We Were Able To Go To Woody's Vegetarian Cafe For Lunch On Both Days.  The Service Charge On Saturday Night Was Â£7.25 Night Porter And Â£3.51 Service Charge.  For The Service We Received  This Was Over Priced. I Would Not Want To Stay Again And Have To Go Through This And Struggle With Food  And Drive 20 Minutes To Have Eat A Decent Meal.
column77: The Spa Was Fully Booked So Did Not Have Any Treatments.  Also The Dressing Gown I Had Was Stained With Was Looked Like Tanning Lotion Or Something.
column83: Poor Service With Answering The Phone And General Experience With Out 2 Night Stay Was Disappointing  Frustrating And Upsetting
column84: Tanya Lavin - Assistant Front Of House Manager.  We Spoke To Her When We Checked Out And She Was Very Sympathetic And Wished She Had Known About The Issues Sooner So She Could Have Helped Up.
column89: General Overall Stay - Service  Food Choice  Room Service  Spa Treatment Availability
column90: Tanya Offered Us 50% Off Our Next Stay And Said She Will Ensure We Have A Selection Of Vegan Good.  But After Having Time To Think About It  I Don't Think I Will Come Back And Stay.  This Is Our 4Th Time Staying At Sopwell Over The Years And The Worst Yet.  Even With 50% Off The Accommodation  I Really Don't Think Its Worth It Especially Having Spent Â£400 For This Stay. I Would Appreciate It  If You Could Contact Me Directly To Discuss As I Was Going To Write You A Letter And Put My Feedback On Trip Advisor.  I Did Ask To Speak To You  But You Were Not Available.  Tammy Thomas 07930473957
