column35: We Were At The Checking Desk For A While As Our Names Could Not Be Found

column39: 216 - Bath/Shower Is Wonderful!
column48: I Will Be Staying At Sopwell House For A Period Of Weeks - The 3 Dinner Optoins For Room Service Are Very Limiting. I Am Trying To Avoid Carbs In My Diet  Which Only Leaves Me With One Option. I Would Like A Few Salads To Choose From.
column53: Excellent Staff
column64: Sparkling Water Is Very Pricey!
column89: I Would Have Expected More Bath Products (Being A Spa Hotel) - Eg Bubble Bath  Hand Cream  Moituriser
column90: A Lovely Stay.

column39: The Room Was Very Nice  Although Pillows Way Too Soft But Mattress Comfy  No Fridge/Mini Bar Which Was A Shame.
column53: There Was No Off Buffet Menu Which Was A Shame As I Have Stayed At Other Spas And This Has Always Been Offered In Addition To The Buffet. Food Was Nice Though  In Particular The Food. Not Much Choice Re. Breads. Service Fairly Irrelevant And Were Not Offered Toast And Top-Up Drinks.
column64: The Hostess Was Stiff  Although The Waitress Was Lovely. We Had The Set Menu And The Variety Was Fairly Limited  I Tend To Avoid Gluten But It Wasn't Encouraged Or Easy To Order Off-Menu. There Wasn't A 'Healthy' Option  Such A Salad. We Ordered The Cheese Plate And Both Crackers And Chutney Felt Fairly Cheap  However  The Mains We Had Were Tasty. Wine Selection Was Expensive.
column83: Very Slow Service Both Waiting For Waiters/Waitresses To Take Order And Once Ordered Very Slow In Providing Drinks. The Glasshouse Room Was Very Cold In The Evening So We Sat In The Only Other Room Available Which Was A Tea Room And There Were Old Half Eaten Teas Still Sitting Out At 10:00Pm  This Was Pretty Horrible When We Also Additionally Noted That Teas Were Last Served At 17:30!!! Was Not Asked How Experience Was At Check Out. Also Drinks Were Very Expensive  Â£3.75 For A Basic Americano Coffee Is Extortionate!!!
column89: All Noted In Previous Info - Cheaper Drinks And Wider Variety  As Well As Better Service Would Have Helped! Also There Was A Funeral Wake Taking Place On Same Day As We Were There...Bit Odd And Felt A Bit Inappropriate.

column35: It Would Be Nice To Be Told About The Classes Available To You Ie Zumba  Yoga When You First Check In

column39: I Was Very Disappointed With The Size Of The Room And The Rooms Were Not Refilled With Tea Or Cups Had To Ask For Them.
column53: Very Happy With Breakfast
column64: I Did Not Think The Menu Was Great The Food Was Just Ok. The Staff Were Lovely
column83: I Was Not Happy To Be Told We Had To Pay Â£15 To Use The Leisure Facilities We Paid Enough For The Stay It Was A Disgrace.
column84: Yes Safron Hair Saloon Was Amazing Very Friendly And My Hair Was Fab She Was Very Fast Also I Would Recommend Her.
column89: The Wedding Dinner Was Not Up To Irish Standards There Was Not Enough On The Plates. There Should Been Tea And Coffee In The Evening For The Older People. The Staff Was Nice.

column35: Our Room Should Have Been Ready For 1.30. We Arrived At 2.45 Ready In Time To Unpack Our Bags And Get Changed Ready For Our Treatment At 3.30. We Did Not Get Our Room Card Until 3.25 Which Made Us Late.
column77: Although Our Treatment Was The Wrong One. I Did Not Realise Until The Spa Manager Informed Me. He Explained That They Should Have Used Hot Stones On My Full Body Massage Which I Thought They Had. He Kindly Arranged For Me And My Mother In Law To Receive A Neck And Back Stone Massage The Following Day Before We Had Our Facial. Excellent Customer Service.
column84: I Unfortunately Cannot  The Name Of The Lady That Did My Facial But I Think It Was Alania. The Spa Manager Also Did A Great Job. He Worked On The 10Th August And My Facial Was On 11Th August At 2Pm.
column89: No
column90: Fantastic Service And Staff Only Problem Was Not Being Able To Get In To Our Room Before Out Treatments. We Had Spent The Morning Shopping In St Albans And Was Looking Forward To Getting Our Room And Getting Organised And Relaxed Before Our Treatment.

column39: ?253 The Bathroom Seemed Like It Needed Updating  There Was A Loose Panel Under The Basin  The Shower Did Not Seem Particularly Clean And The Bath Was Slippery.
column89: We Thought The Bar Prices Were Very Expensive
column90: We Did Enjoy Our Stay And The Wedding  Thankyou.

column39: The Tv Didnt Work Properly But Was Resolved Quickly When I Called Reception
column77: Manicure Polish Wasnt As Good A Stamdard As Other Treatments
column83: Check Out Was A Tad Tiresome. The Bill Didnt Appear Correctly So We Spent 20Mins Or So At Reception To Establish How It Was Made Up

column35: Reception Staff Were Charming And Friendly
column64: After A Fantastic Day At The Spa  We Were Hugely Disappointed With Our Meal At The Brasserie. The Food Was Of Poor Quality  And Not Freshly Cooked. The Waiting Staff Were Not Knowledgeable About The Menu  And Provided Fairly Poor Service  For Example  On Pouring Wine After Removing It From The Ice Bucket  Our Waitress Dripped Ice Water All Over My Lap.  We Asked To Speak To The Manager To Provide Feedback On Our Experience. The Manager Who We Spoke To Was Extremely Rude To Us And Unprofessional. He Offered To Give Us Other Customers' Room Numbers So That We Could Go To Their Rooms And Ask Them If They Too Had Been Dissatisfied. On Giving Us Our Bill  He Stood Over Us Waiting For Us To Sign. On Being Told That We Could Deal With The Bill Ourselves He Said  'I See You Have Two Hands So I Imagine You Can' And Walked Off.  This Experience Really Tainted Our View Of The Spa  Which Is A Real Shame As The Rest Of The Day Had Been Faultless.
column83: My Only Issues Were With The Brasserie  As Detailed Previously. May I Say That All Other Staff We Encountered Could Not Have Been More Pleasant Or Professional.
column84: Foh Manager  Tanja  Was Extremely Helpful And Kind. Brasserie Mangaer Provided Some Of The Worst Service I Have Ever Experienced.

column64: The Varitiy Was Poor. If I Had Known The Evening Meal In The Brasserie Would Be So Poor. I Would Of Opted Out! Breakfast And Lunch Were However Of Exceptional Quality.
column77: No Music In The Gym.
column89: Just Evening Meal In Brasserie. Wish I Was Informed Of The Difference So I Could Of Booked The Restaurant

column39: Room 8 Could Have A Minibar And Dressing Gowns/Slippers Already Provided.
column64: Small Menu. Change Daily

column39: Upgraded My Room  Which Was A Huge Disappointment. The Bathroom Wasn't Clean With All Green Around The Taps And Sink  The Wood Was Flaking Off The Bath. The Overall Room Had A Very Strong Musky  Damp Odour. There Was No Bathrobes Available When We Arrived In Which We Had To Wait 1 Hour For!!! Huge Disappointment!!!! Eventually Got Our Room Changed Over After 1 1/2 Hours Of Arriving. So Wasted My Time That We Could Of Been Using The Spa Facilities.
column53: Breakfast Was Ok............
column64: The Brasserie Didn't Have Much Of A Selection Of Food And We Ordered Food That We Wasn't Particularly Fond Of  But Nether-The-Less Still Ordered Something. I Asked To Dine In The Restaurant And Pay Extra To Get More Of A Variety From The Menu But Unfortunately They Was Only One Menu On That Evening Regardless Of Were You Ate!!!! Strange That You Have Two Restaurants But Do Not Have Two Varieties Of Menus. Another Huge Disappointment Within Our Stay!!!!!!!
column77: The Spa/Swimming Pool Area Was Very Busy With A Lot Of Children During The Day. Unfortunately This Maybe Relaxing For Some  But Not For Me!!!!! I Resorted In Staying In My Room For The Rest Of The Day. This Experience Was Not At All Relaxing............
column83: Lots Of Issues On The Day Which I Was Happy To Inform The Duty Manager About  This Experience Was Just Overall Very Disappointing And I Will Not Be Recommending You To Any Of My Friends And Family. I Was More So Disappointed As I Had Been Recommended To Visit You As My Friends And Family Knew That I Love To Visit Spas Every 4/5 Months!
column84: The Lady That I Had My Spa Treatments With Was Very Lovely  Unsure Of Her Name Though.
column89: Upgraded Rooms Should Feel Like An Upgrade Not A Downgrade (Smelly  Musky  Dirty). Bathrobes And Slippers Should Be In Each Of The Rooms When You Arrive. If You Have 2 Dining Restaurants Then Make Use Of Them And Not Offer The Same Menu. Spa/Swimming Pool Area Should Be For Adults. Lifts Should Go To All Floors (As A Guest That Came With Us Had Crutches And Found It Very Difficult And Time Consuming To Get To Her Room).
column90: I Think I Have Covered Everything  Hope To Have Some Response Back!!!

column35: Receptionist Kasia Was A Great Help. Very Welcoming And Very Professional.
column84: I Would Like To Acknowledge Receptionist Kasia  Kasia Was A Great Help And Very Helpful During My Stay.

column53: Service Was Slow  We Weren't Asked If We Wanted Toast For At Least 10 Mins  Then Had To Ask For It
column64: Service Very Slow  It Was 45 Mins Before Our Order Was Taken
column83: Service Slow For All Meals And Drinks  It Was A Busy Weekend But We Felt There Should Have Been More Staff To Cope With The Extra Demand

column35: There Was A Very Rude Man Demanding Us To Move Cars After Another Person (We Suspect A Member Of Staff) Hit One Of Our Cars. The Hotel Couldn't Find Him
column39: 215 We Loved It It Was Great  Thanks
column53: Great Breakfast
column77: Only Used The Pool And Sauna / Steam Room  It Was Very Crowded And The Steam Room Smelt
column83: As Previously Stated About The Man As We Arrived
column84: Banqueting Staff Were Amazing!
column89: Ask Your Staff Not To Be Rude To Us  Limit People In The Spa?
column90: I Had High Expectations For Staying At Spowell As I Had Heard Such Great Things About It  I Would Consider Staying Again But Would Have Reservations  Would Not Recommend It To People  Would Encourage Them To Look Around. The Banqueting Staff Were So Helpful And Bent Over Backwards For Us!

column39: Room 120: The Room Was Beautiful And Very Comfortable.
column53: The Staff Were Very Accommodating Of My Gluten-Free Requirements And All Of The Hospitality Team Were Extremely Helpful And Friendly
column84: The Hospitality Manger In The Brasserie Was Very Friendly And Helpful
column89: More Vegan Options On The Menu
column90: Thank You For A Wonderful Stay!

column35: At Times It Took Some Time To Get Threw To Reception When Calling
column39: I Have Expected Room To Be Larger . There Was No Mini Bar
column83: We Had Amassing Time All The Time We Stayed With You  - However When At Check Out It Was Hard To Understand What We Were Charged For For Extra Items And When Asked To Explain Certain Expenses We Felt Uncomfortable As We Were Questioned Weather We Understand Something What The Supervisor Did Not Apair Not To Understand Herself . Only About Spending About 15 Min We Were Refunded The Overcharge Which Supervisor Was Confused About Herself . We Felt That Disappointed Us And We Left Thinking That At Times When You Spend Â£800 For 2 Nights   Should Not Be Questioned For 15 Min About Â£30 Pounds - Which Was Hotel Mistake In The First Place.  At Times It Should Be About The Principal It Self And Customer Crevice Rather The Money .
column84: The Bar Manager ( Wearing Glasses Was Very Reassuring - We Got Stuck In The Lift For 10 Min And Ä® Was Very Upset As I Struggle With Enclosed Spaces - He Reassured Us And Offered A Glass Of Sparkling Wine At Dinner)
column89: Everything Was Lovely  Apart Of Departure

column35: We Arrived At 2:30Pm To Which One Of Our 4 Rooms Was A Triple. We We Told That All Rooms Were On The Same Floor And All Close To Each Other However The Triple Room Was On The Other Side Of The Building And Could Not Be Accessed By The Rest Of The Party Unless They Went Back Down The Stairs From Reception And Then Back Up The Other Side. No Lift Was In Use And One Of The Guests Staying In The Triple Room (The Hen) Has Severe Arthritis Which Did Not Help. We Were Also Told That Our Rooms Would Be Ready At 3:00Pm But The Triple Was Not Until 3:45Pm Which Then Made Us Late And Rushed To Our Spa Reservation At 4:00Pm
column77: The Spa Staff Went Around And Tidied Robes And Towels On The Beds Whilst We Were Enjoying The Sauna  However A Cleaner Came Along And Removed Our Items From The Loungers Which Held Our Personal Possessions Eg Phones And Room Keys  Needless To Say That Lockers Were Provided We Chose To Keep Some Items Out. We Had Not Been In The Sauna Long When We Had To Leave Very Quickly And Reclaim Our Stuff
column84: Natalie Spa Therapist Was Fantastic And So Were All Of The Staff Especially Rose In The Brasserie
column89: Make Sure Rooms Are Ready On Time And Not Just Keep Saying It Will Be 10-15 Minutes And Leave Us Loitering In The Lobby

column39: Room - Not Sound Insulated. Were On The 2Nd Floor But Could Not Sleep Very Late Into The Night Due To A Wedding Reception. It Was Like Sleeping Above A Red Lion Kareokee Bar.
column48: Room Service - We Are Counting As Both Our Food Ordering  And The Request To Change The Down Pillows And Duvet Due To Allergies. The Turn Down Service Was Not Delivered Very Well  And Was Not Efficient  And Certainly Not With A Smile.
column53: Thank You For Accommodating Our Birthday Request On Delivery.
column77: Too Many Children
column83: The Turn Down Service Due To Down Duvet And Pillows Was Far From Professional And Less Than Polite. The Night Manager Was Unable To Resolve The Issue With Noise Due To The Wedding  That Went On Far To Long For A Hotel (But Understandably For A Wedding) And Wondering If We Would Stay A Second Night In A Row  Decided Not To For The Reason Of Another Wedding In The Hotel That Night Also.
column89: Improve On The Points Of Weakness We Have Detailed Earlier In This Survey
column90: The Piano Playing Was Excellent  And The Pianist Was Very Polite  Friendly And Made Our Evening Very Pleasurable. Please Maintain This Aspect Of The Hotel.

column8: Staying Whilst Having Work Done On Our House
column35: We Stayed With You Twice For Multiple Days During July And August. We Experienced Difficulties With Our Booking On Both Occasions. The First Time Our Problem Was Put Right After One Night  But During Our Second Stay I Had To Provide An Inflatable Bed For My 3 Year Old.
column39: Apartment 14 Was Well Laid Out For A Family With Young Children  However The Carpets Were Quite Dirty And It Could Have Done With Some Redecoration. Apartment 2 Was Not So Good For Families With Young Children And I Had To Use My Daughter's Inflatable Bed As The Sofa Bed Did Not Fit Into The Bedroom. It Smelt A Bit Mouldy And Could Also Have Done With Some Redecoration.
column48: Need To Have More Choice For Children
column64: The Children's Menu Is Quite Limited As Is The Brasserie Menu
column83: The Duty Manager Was Initially Quite Unhelpful And Rude When Our Initial Booking Was Erroneous  However She Did Help Us On The Following Day. During Our Second Booking We Had Requested A Specific Suite Which Was Promised To Us  But Was Unavailable When We Arrived. No Attempt Was Made To Help Rectify Our Issues.
column84: The Breakfast Staff Were Kind  Polite And Went The Extra Mile To Make Us Feel Welcome And Special Throughout Our Entire Stay
column89: See Previous Issues

column39: The Room Is Dated And Tired . Not Luxury At All As They Like To Sell Themselves. A Good Summary Would Be A Glorified Premier Inn Standard Room If Not Worse. Bath Panel Was Rotten And Tiles Loose And Grouting Dirty. Very Very Disappointed Room 165 Spoke To Denver Before Leaving Who Offered Us Another Stay But Not Sure If We Will Come Back And Returned This Time Due To Dirty Bathroom. Loosing A Bit Of Faith
column53: Excellent Staff 7*. Food Alright.
column77: Pool Too Cold For Kids And I Don't Think Sopwell House Is A Child Friendly Hotel.
column83: Ask Denver I Have Also Attached Pics Of Issues In Room 165
column84: All Staff In Brasserie
column90: Will Send You Email And Pics. Even Though We Complained We Were Offered Another Stay Not Cost Free But 'We Will Look After You' Which Was What Was Said The First Time And This Is The Second Time. Having Told Denver This No Refund Or Anything Was Offered So You Tell Me Why I Would Come Back?

column35: The Receptionist Gave Us No Information About Dinner Times Etc And We Left There Not Knowing Much And Had To Phone Reception Later For Information.  Nobody Helped Us With Our Luggage Either.
column48: I Resented Paying Around Â£14 For A Large Glass Of Wine To Be Honest!
column53: There Was A Leak Of Sorts From The Air Con Unit Which Had Left A Puddle On The Floor By The Cooked Buffet. I Alerted A Male Member Of Staff Who Did Nothing To Clear It.  Pretty Bad Especially As The Lady I Came With Was Pregnant And Easily Could Have Slipped.
column77: Not Enough Loungers.  Nowhere Near.
column84: I Didn't Get Her Name But A Lady Waitress In The Brassiere.  Very Very Professional.  She Was Also At Breakfast And Was Excellent.

column35: Just Some Additional Signs To Find The Hotel On The Main Road.
column64: Best Lamb I Have Ever Eaten!
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: The Lady I Arrange My Stay With Was Friendly And Very Helpful.
column83: Sadly There Seemed To Be A Delay In Drinks Orders On The Terrace And The Cocktail Bar  Though Neither Were Busy  We Did Wait A While For Our Order To Be Taken And Drinks To Then Arrive
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column20: Attended Wedding At Venue So From Invite
column35: Check In Was Very Chaotic With A Big Queue And It Seemed To Take The People In Front Of Us A Long Time To Check In For No Apparent Reason (They Were People We Knew And They Commented On How There Was No Reason Why It Should Have Taken So Long)
column39: The Room Was Fine  But The Sound Proofing Wasn't Great As I Was Disturbed By People Walking Down The Corridor Outside.
column77: The Swimming Pool Area Was Lovely
column89: See Further Comments Below.
column90: The Hotel Itself Was Perfectly Pleasant But To Be Charged Over Â£4 For A Lime And Soda Which I Normally Pay 80P For Is Totally Unacceptable As Far As I Am Concerned. I Was So Shocked I Actually Thought The Bartender Had Accidentally Added Vodka Until He Told Me He Had Not. There Is Also No Reason Why A 10% Service Charge Should Be Added For Drinks Purchased At A Bar With No Table Service. I Stay In Hotels Regularly For Both Work And Leisure And I Think These Are The Most Outrageous Prices I Have Seen. Its Such A Shame Because I Had A Lovely Time At The Wedding I Attended And The Place Itself Was Nice  But Because This Gives The Impression Of A Hotel Setting Out To Rip People Off It Left An Overall Negative Impression And I Would Not Return Or Recommend It To Others.

column35: There Was A Wedding And I Managed To Find One Parking Space That Was Tight Because Of People Being Allowed To Park Badly. When I Left The Following Day I Found 2 Scratches On Either Side Of My Car. However All Staff Were Pleasent Throughout My Booking And Changing Spa Appointments
column39: Room 109- Amazing Experience!
column77: They Run Out Of Robes So Delivered Two To Our Room However These Robes Were Damp And Smelt Of Clourine!
column83: I Wanted To Buy A Spa Product And Charge It To My Room However The Lady I Spoke With Said This Was Not Possible. When I Came Back The Next Day (As I Was Departing)With My Card She Asked If Id Like To Put It On My Room. She Did Not Recall  Telling Me Otherwise
column89: Controlled The Parking Of The Wedding Guests. I Would Like To State Again My Car Had 2 Scratches Which I Could Tell Were Done Out Of Malice Because I Parked Too Close.
column90: This Was My 3Rd Visit...Each Time The Experience Is Better Than The Last Other Than A Few Hiccups. I Will Of Course Be Back In A Few Months.

column39: The Plug In Our Bathroom Was Broken And This Created A Problem As It Left A Bath Full Of Cold Water When Someone Wanted To Take A Shower Before Dinner. We Had To Make Two Calls For Someone To Come And Fix The Plug. The Person Was Helpful And Resolved The Issue.   I Cannot Remember The Room Number.
column77: We Did Not Have Any Spa Treatments. The Pool/Relaxation Are Was Very Nice  Although It Was Very Busy. The Gym (Weights Room) Is A Bit Dated. Bit Of A Pain Having To Go Outside The Spa To Get Drinks To Sit By The Pool Area.
column83: The Plug In The Bath As Mentioned Previosuly.
column84: The Man That Came To Fix The Plug - Very Helpful. Must Have Arranged For Us To Have Complimentary Drinks In The Brasserie Which We Were Very Pleased With. Unfortunately  I Cannot Remember His Name.

column64: Very Slow Service. We Were Left For Ages With No Drinks Etc

column35: Seeing As We Arrived At 07:00 And Managed To Check In To A Room Straight Away  I Was Very Impressed. However For The Receptionist To Inform Us That We Had Not Been Allocated A Room Made Us A Little Worried As We Work In The Industry And Know What This Can Mean - Especially When There Are 3 Weddings Taking Place In The Hotel And The Hotel Is Full.
column39: Room 154 - The Fan In The Bathroom Did Not Work  And There Was A Cracked Tile In The Bathroom. The Shower Screen Was Not Very Long And Therefore While Having A Shower The Water Went All Over The Floor
column53: The Breakfast Room Was Extremely Light And Airy Which Was Wonderful  The Staff Were Very Friendly And Efficient And The Food Was Exceptional
column84: Miriam (The Spanish Girl On Front Desk) Was A Delight To Deal With And Was Very Knowledgable Of The Area And Directed Us Very Nicely To St. Albans Town

column35: Fantastic Staff; They Really Made Us Feel Very Welcome.
column84: Spanish Girl On Reception. Truly A Delightful Person.

column53: Perfect

column39: Our Room Was In The Arch Directly Above The Cocktail Bar. The Mugs In The Room Were Dirty And Had Chips On The Rim  The Wardrobe Had Fingerprint Marks On The Front And The Shelves Were Broken Inside It. There Was Too Much Furniture In The Room And The Wardrobe Was Too Small. Stains On Curtains And Bed Throw.The View Was Great And The Bed Comfortable.
column53: The Butter Was Still Too Cold And Difficult To Spread.
column64: The Food Was Well Cooked And Service Prompt.
column77: The Pool Area Was Modern Well Kept And Spotlessly Clean. The Decor Was Lovely  Really Lovely Spa Rooms And Waiting Areas. Beauty Therapists Gave Excellent Treatments  Especially Adele. Felt Relaxed And Pampered. Spa Reception Team Need Some Education On What Treatments Pregnant Ladies Can And Cant Have As My Treatment Was Cancelled On The Day As No On Had Told Me A Body Scrub Was Not Suitable For Me Which Was A Little Disappointing.
column83: As Explained I Pre Booked A Spa Treatment Told Them I Was Pregnant And When I Arrived For My Treatment Was Told I Never Should Have Been Allowed To Book It In The First Place.All Staff Should Agree On What Is Not Allowed For Pregnant Guests So Theres No Confusion.
column84: I Had A Wonderful Facial From Adele. She Made Me Feel So Relaxed And Was Really Knowledgeable And Nice. The Best Facial Ive Ever Had Without A Doubt.
column90: As We Were Directly Above The Cocktail Bar We Had Some Issues With Noise On The Thursday Night But We Rang Reception And It Seemed To Be Dealt With Swiftly. Also We Were Nearly Charged For Someone Elses Drinks In The Brasserie On The First Night As Someone Had Said We Were Spotted Drinking Lots In The Terrace Bar During The Day.As Im Pregnant And My Boyfriend Hardly Drinks This Was A Bit Annoying And We Had To Explain This To The Staff Before The Long List Of Beers And Spirits Drinks Were Removed From  The Bill.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column83: The Only Minor Issue That We Had Was That During The Wedding Reception On 6Th Sep 2013  There Seemed To Be A Limited Number Of Bar Staff And The Service Was A Little Slow  So People Often Ended Up Waiting For Long Periods To Be Served At The Bar. I Would Suggest Increasing The Bar Staff Number For Such Events.

column64: On The Night We Dined In  There Were Quite A Few Flies In The Brasserie.
column77: Swimming Pool Was Nice  Only Negative; Unfortunately My Friends And I Were Exposed To In The Jacuzzi. This Incident Was Reported To The Manager.

column64: I Arrived During Waiter Shift Change.  The Person Who Took My Order Left As Her Shift Was Over And Forgot To Put In My Order To The Kitchen.  I Waited Over 50 Min For My Food Before I Spoke To A Different Waiter To Ask About My Order.  He Checked In The Kitchen And The Order Was Never Placed.  I Asked Him To Again Place My Order  Let Him Know What I Wanted  And It Came Relatively Quickly After.  He Did Not Charge Me For The Meal.
column70: I Did Not Attend A Meeting Or Event At Sopwell House.
column83: I Was Not Feeling Well From Traveling Internationally And The Staff Stated They Would Not/Could Not Provide Me With Any Medicine.  I Did Not Have A Car So I Had To Take A Taxi To Go Get Medicine Which Was Very Inconvenient.  If The Staff Can Not Provide Medicine  There Should Be An Area Of The Hotel Where We Can Purchase Medicine.
column89: During Check Out I Had To Wait About 10-15 Min. Because There Was One Person Ahead Of Me That Was Making Difficult Requests During Check In.  However  There Were Two Front Staff Helping Him.  I Felt That One Of Them Should Have Continued To Help Him And The Other Could Have Checked Me Out As My Check Out Was Fast And I Had A Taxi Waiting.

column77: There Was Bits Of Paper Floating Around In The Pool.    Also There Wasn't Enough Beds For People To Sit On To Relax And Many People Were Left To Stand Around Which Isnt What You Want To Relax

column39: I Think We Stayed In 117 Which Was A Disabled Room And No One Informed Of Us This Beforehand. Although We Didn't Mind Per Se  I Would Have Normally Expected To Receive That Information At Check In. Also  The Alarm Went Off Very Easily And We Had 4 People Coming To Our Room Not Knowing How To Turn It Off. This Was Also Quite Late In The Evening So I Expect That Some Other Guests Were Disturbed.   Room Was Definitely Nice Overall!
column53: It's A Lovely Breakfast Area - But The Good Presentation Could Be Brought Up A Notch.
