column35: We Were Able To Check In Earlier Than Planned Which Was Great.
column39: Room 225 - The Only Thing That Let The Room Down Was When I Went To Run A Bath The Part You Turn To Get The Plug To Go Down Kept Spinning Round And Fell Off In My Hand So I Had To Try And Fix It And Put It Back On.

column35: A Special Mention To Jenny In Phone Bookings Was Very Helpful And Very Friendly - A Great Impression From The Start.
column39: Executive Room - Room 119 Lovely Room. For The Price We Paid  I Would Expect A Travel Cot To Be Included For Free. We Bought Our Own In The End To Avoid The Â£15 Charge. Was Impressed With The Sound Proffing. Lovely Shower But A Bath For Our Baby Would Have Helped Too!  Loved The Tv And The Range Of Channels. Bed Was Wonderful! Loved The Toiletries Provided - Great To Have Hair Conditioner.
column53: Good Range. We Went Early Which Was A Good Idea  Before The Rush!
column64: Salad Starter Over Priced At Â£9.75!!! Rest Of Menu Fine.  Food Good And Buzzy Atmosphere.
column84: Jenny In Bookings! Was Also Impressed That On Check Out When We Asked For Directions To Nearest Supermarket  We Were Handed Printed Directions! Thank You!
column89: Pricey But Enjoyed Stay   Worth It For Special Treat.

column39: The Shower And Bath Plates Had Been Attached Wrong So When You Turned It For Cold Water It Got Hotter!  Room 104
column77: The Massage Given By Holly Was One Of The Best I Have Ever Had.
column83: I Did Ask For Fresh Ice For The Wine Bucket But None Was Delivered To The Room

column39: Suite 107... Im Pregnant And Was A Special Occasion For Us  Sadly There Was A Wedding And Was Very Noisy For Us  Couldn't Sleep Till After Midnight.
The Is No Toilet Brush. Not Sure Why But It Is A Basic Item For A Bathroom. It Seriously Dampens The Stay When You Have To Get Toilet Paper And Scrub The Toilet Yourself.

column35: No
column39: Room 244'S Position Was Situated In A Very Noisy Area In Terms Of People That Were Walking Past... You Could Hear The Floor Boards Every Time People Walked Past  You Could Hear Them Talking/Shouting. It Was A Wedding Weekend But We Woke Up So So Tired Because Of This. But The Bed And Shower Were Excellent
column53: Breakfast Was Gorgeous And The Staff Were Just So So Nice And Friendly
column84: Unfortunately I Do Not Remember Their Names  But There Was A Young Man Who Served Our Drinks And Dinner Who Was Extra Attentive And Very Pleasant. There Was Another Young Man Who Made Us Toast In The Morning Who Was So Lovely As Well And Nothing Was Too Much Trouble (Both I Would Say Were Asian/Indian Descent Another Was A Lovely Lady Philipina I Believe Who Served Us Tea At Breakfast.. Very Lovely Staff To Have Representing The Hotel And Who Are So Pleasant That I Never Felt Uncomfortable To Ask For Anything.
column89: It Was Brilliant
column90: Just The Noisy Floor Boards That We Heard Every Single Person That Walked Past Regardless Of Whether They Were Talking Or Not... We Woke Up So Tired Its Unbelievable

column39: Was Noisey As There Was A Private Function Below The Room.

column20: Our Stay Was A Present From Someone Who Had Previously Visited.
column35: Arrival Was Great. When Trying To Book I Had A Few Problems As Staff Were Not Available For Bookings  Then Tried To Charge Extra When I Had A Gift Voucher Even Though The Advertised Price Was Cheaper Than The Gift Voucher. Eventually Spoke To Jenny Who Was Excellent.
column39: Very Sorry  Cannot Remember Room Number. Found Nail Clippings And Dust On Bathroom Floor. Didn't Want To Say Anything As It Was A Special Break For My Husband And I (A Rare Treat Without Our Young Daughter). Room Overall Was Ok But The Presentation Seemed Very Lacking Compared To How Beautiful The Public Areas  Restaurants And Bar Are.
column53: Very Tasty  Good Choice.
column64: Food Was Fantastic  Chocolate Plate Pudding Was Outstanding. The Gentleman Who Looked After Us In The Restaurant Was Superb (Smaller Guy Out Of The 2 Who Were In There On Thursday 26Th September)  Great Service And Made Us Feel Very Welcome And Looked After.
column84: Gentleman Who Waited On Us In The Restaurant Thursday 26 September. Lovely And Welcoming  Fantastic Service  Prompt And Helpful.
column89: All Areas Downstairs Looked Amazing However The Bedroom Almost Felt Like It Wasn't The Same Hotel. It Was A Little Drab And Tired Looking  Paint Chipped  Stains On Wall  Bathroom Not Clean. Felt Like It Needed Some Tlc.
column90: Reiterate Comments About Our Waiter  He Was Superb And Made Our Night Feel Special. Food Also That Night Was Amazing  Thank You.

column39: Balcony Suite (303 I Think?) - Could Have Done With A Little Fridge
column84: Becci Farmery In The Reservations Department Was Brilliant. I Emailed Her Quite Frequently With Regard To My Booking For Myself And My Wedding Party  Trying To Get All Our Rooms Sorted Out And She Was Great And Very Helpful With Each Reply.
column90: Just Wanted To Say A Big Thank You  - All My Guests Had A Wonderful Stay At Sopwell House As Did I For The Two Nights Over My Wedding Weekend. The Little Touches Were Gratefully Receieved - The Wine  Prosecco And Complimentary Second Night. All Staff I Came Across Were Lovely And Helpful.

column39: There Were Three Of Us In The Room And We Had To Visit Reception For More Sugar And Tea. More Could Have Been Provided In The Room.
column90: I Lost My Mulberry Travel Holder Whilst At The Hotel And I Am Sure That It Was Within Your Spa Facilities Yet No One Handed It In. This Ruined The Stay For Me.

column35: When Making The Booking Becci Was Very Helpful.
column39: The Room Was Very Cosy. We Stayed In The Exexutive Room But Was Under The Impression That It Would Be A Four Poster Bed. And It Was Two Beds Stuck Together Which Was Not That Comfortable
column53: It Would Have Been Nice To Have More Hot Vegetarian Options
column64: Both Friday And Sat The Dinner Menu Was The Same. Would Have Been Nice To Have Something Different The Second Night. But Annika Was Very Helpful  I Had Told Her Beforehand That I Was Pregnant And Me And Mu Husband Only Have Halal Food And No Alcohol  She Had A Prehighl
column77: It Would Be Nice To Have Certain Designated Time Slots For Swimming. I.E Having Just Ladies Swimming Sessions Etc. Louise Gave Me An Amazing Facial  The Head And Neck Massage Was Very Relaxing!

column39: Would Be Good To Have A Mini Bar In Room
column64: Rated Cost As Good As I Paid A Large Single Supplement For The Package And To Have A Double Bed
column77: Therapist Was Excellent!!
column84: Therapist - I Think Her Name Was Kirsty?
column90: The Noise Level In The Room Was Disappointing. I Had A Course The Following Day But Was Kept Awake By The Next Rooms Antics! I Realise This Is Not Your Fault.

column39: There Was No Fridge.
column53: Could Have Had A Few More Options And The Eggs Tasted Like They Were Cooked In A Microwave.... Not Good!
column64: The Food Was Very Bad  I Had A Lamb Stew And It Was Very Tasteless And Had Lots Of Chunck Of Fat And Not Good Piece Of Lamb  Very Dry And Tasteless Mash Potatoes  Not Smooth And Just Really Disappointing Experience.
column77: I Was Booked For A Massage At 5:30 And The Lady Arrived 15 Minutes Late And Only Gave Me An Extra 5 Minutes Which Basically Means I Got A Shorter Massage That I Paid For Because She Was Late!. The Water In The Jacuzzi Was Far From Being Hot Enough And The Steam Room Is Also Not Hot Enough. I Visit A Lot Of Spa And Recommends Lots Of Spa In Europe And While The Facility Was Clean And Nice Looking Those Important Details Made My Experience Less Enjoyable.
column83: Spa Service Was Late And Did Not Compensate The Time They Made Me Wait For.

column39: Room 212 A Fridge Would Be A Nice Addition
column53: Extremely Helpful Staff
column64: The Staff Were Not So Efficient. We Were Expecting Better Food Quality And Presentation.
column77: The Treatment Staff Were Nice And Helful. Expected A Bit Better Treatment Quality.
column83: We Were Overcharged Twice In The Cocktail Lounge. The First Time We Were Told That The Prices Had Just Changed But We Did Not Pay The Extra Charge. The Second Time We Were Told That When You Have Your Coffee In The Lounge There Is An Extra Charge. That Was Not Clearly Written Somewhere  We Were Not Informed Of That Before Ordering And Also Being In A Hotel  We Did Not Expect This Kind Of Extra Charge;A Lounge Is For Having A Drink/Coffee  Why Should There Be An Extra Charge For Sitting? We Would Not Have Been Able To Take The Coffee Anywhere Else Anyway.
column84: The Ladies In The Reception Were Extremely Helpful And Pleasant.
column89: Earlier Check-In Time. Jucuzzi Water Was Cold.

column64: Myself And My Friend Were Questioned At Lunch About Why We Asked For A Jug Of Water When We Had Two Glasses On Our Table By A Male Waiter Possibly Superviser. We Were Both Outraged By This Because There Were Plenty Of Other Tables Who All Had Water Jugs Including Another Table Of Two. We Were The Only Two Black Guests At The Time So We Felt It Was Due To That. For This Reason We Were Very Dissatisfied. Theale Was A White Male With Dark Hair And Very Red Cheeks  Possibly Irish. At The Time We Were Going To Make A Complaint But Decided We Would Not Let One Member Of Staff Spoil Our Otherwise Enjoyable Stay.
column83: See Comments Re Lunch On Previous Page.

column8: Meal With My Staff And Friends
column35: This Was My First Time Going To The Hotel Reception As I Come Almost Everyday To Eat And Spa. I Found The Hotel Reception Staff Cold And Emtionless. Staff At Sopwell Know Me And I Hope To Come Across As A Nice Guest But Flip The Recrption Staff Just To Much Like Hard Work To Even Cover A Basic Conversation.
column39: I Am Very Sorry I Dont Have These Details. All I Remember Was The Aircon Waking Me And Dust On The Bed Side Lamps. The Bath Had Yellow Stains But Other Than That Being A Careing Obsevation Loved The Room I Love Sopwell
column53: Fab!
column64: Just Cannot Get Over How Helpful The Staff Were. I Am Proud Of Sll Of Them No One Let Me Down In Front Of My Guests Which For Me Is Most Important As I Talk So Much About Sopwell!
column77: As A Member I Do Find It Odd When The Cleaner Is Cleaning Around Us At 945Pm In The Changing Room. At Times I Worry Where The Henry Hover Hose End Up Next! I Have Experienced Alot Of Spas Here In The Uk And By Far I Am Impressed With The Way Paul Manages And How Clean The Pool Is. Outstanding.
column84: Well As Im Writing This And George Bringing Me My Third Coffee After Another Meal! And I Know The Staff Will Read This! The Lack Of Hugs And Kisses Just Shocks Me And You Should All Be Disapointed! I Cannot Wait For Christmas Holidays I Intend To Live At Sopwell Cannot Wait To Enjoy Company Sopwell Staff Over Festive Season.
column89: If Anyone Can Remember How I Got To My Room From Cocktail Bar Be Most Thankful!
column90: I Am Enjoying Watching This Place Get Better And Better. Will Say Though My Mother Was Unable To Read Christmas Menue I Took Home As Her Eyesight Not At Her Best But The Print Really Small. The Website Does Not Offer Larger Text Either And Find It Not Very Phone Friendly. My Company Having A New Website Done And Its Been Costly To Ensure The Site Is Pc And Phone Friendly Big Task But Worth  It. Please Can You Send A Pdf Of The Christmas Menue So My Mum Can Read It. Thanks

column35: My Stay At Sopwell House With My Fiancã© Was The Most Unwelcoming Stay I Have Ever Encountered.We Arrived At The Hotel Being Served My Martin Firstly Saying That My Reservation Was Not On The System  After Having Sorted That Out Another Customer Interrupted Us And Martin Began To Focus On Them In The Middle Of Us Checking In.. Very Poor Customer Service. Our Room Was Not Ready Until 3:20Pm When I Went To Ask If The Room Was Ready  Martin Had Offered Other Customers Whose Rooms Were Not Ready A Complimentary Drink  Where As Myself And My Partner Were Not Offered Anything..We Found That Very Rude And Unprofessional As It Came To Evening I Tried To Call Reservations From My Room There Was No Answer For Over Half An Hour  Myself And My Partner Then Went Downstairs To Ask Whether We Were Able To Order Food To The Hotel. We Got To The Front Desk And We Were Served My Maxine  Firstly She Questioned Whether We Were Staying At The Hotel  Which We Found Very Rude  I Asked If There Was Anything Wrong With The Phones As I Had Been Trying To Call  She Plainly Said No  With No Apology. After Asking If We Were Able To Order Food To The Hotel She Had Told Us It's Not Advisable As There Is A Restaurant  The Restaurant Does Not Cater For Vegans So We Had To Order Out.  Overall I Will Never Stay At Sopwell House Again  We Booked One Of The Most Expensive Rooms  And To Be Treated In That Manner  The Service Was Appalling. Very Disappointed As Our Room Was Lovely.  A Response Back Would Be Greatly Appreciated.
column83: My Stay At Sopwell House With My Fiancã© Was The Most Unwelcoming Stay I Have Ever Encountered.We Arrived At The Hotel Being Served My Martin Firstly Saying That My Reservation Was Not On The System  After Having Sorted That Out Another Customer Interrupted Us And Martin Began To Focus On Them In The Middle Of Us Checking In.. Very Poor Customer Service. Our Room Was Not Ready Until 3:20Pm When I Went To Ask If The Room Was Ready  Martin Had Offered Other Customers Whose Rooms Were Not Ready A Complimentary Drink  Where As Myself And My Partner Were Not Offered Anything..We Found That Very Rude And Unprofessional As It Came To Evening I Tried To Call Reservations From My Room There Was No Answer For Over Half An Hour  Myself And My Partner Then Went Downstairs To Ask Whether We Were Able To Order Food To The Hotel. We Got To The Front Desk And We Were Served My Maxine  Firstly She Questioned Whether We Were Staying At The Hotel  Which We Found Very Rude  I Asked If There Was Anything Wrong With The Phones As I Had Been Trying To Call  She Plainly Said No  With No Apology. After Asking If We Were Able To Order Food To The Hotel She Had Told Us It's Not Advisable As There Is A Restaurant  The Restaurant Does Not Cater For Vegans So We Had To Order Out.  Overall I Will Never Stay At Sopwell House Again  We Booked One Of The Most Expensive Rooms  And To Be Treated In That Manner  The Service Was Appalling. Very Disappointed As Our Room Was Lovely.

column8: I Stayed Here The Night Before My Wedding At Another Venue.
column20: I Teach At Oaklands College And We Use Sopwell For Our Work Experience Beauty.
column35: The Booking Was Taken Over The Phone  The Staff Member Didn't Make Me Feel Welcome  I Had To Ask A Lot Of Questions To Get The Information I Required. There Was No Special Treatment Considering I Made It Very Clear I Was A Bride Making A Bridal Party Booking.
column39: Mews Suite 3  I Booked The Room And Asked Advice From Staff Which Room Would Be Best For A Bridal Party To Get Ready An Informed Staff On Booking It Would Be A Bridal Booking. The Room Was Just Big Enough But There Was No Special Treatment (On The Happiest Occasion Of Your Life)  There Was Only 2 Cups  No Where Met Enough Tea  Coffee And Condiments For The Bridal Party  Make Up Artist And Hairdresser All Arrived In The Morning.
column48: Two Cheeseburgers  A Very Small Portion Of Chips Each And Two Diet Cokes Â£40!!!! Disgustingingly Expensive
column83: My Husband Purchased Two Bottles Of Champagne That Were Meant To Be Delivered At 9.15Am They Arrived At 1.40  I Was Getting Married At 2Pm  Previously To My Booking I Visited And Asked To See The Rooms  I Was Taken Through Staff Entrances And Rushed Around.
column89: Huge Amount.  Actually Listened To The Booking Requests  Cared About Me.  Cared That Is Was A Special Occasion.  Prepared The Room To Suit The Booking.   Contacted Us Asap When We Left Items In The Room Instead Of One Of My Wedding Guests Having To Leave The Wedding To Find Items (Which You Lost)

column35: The Staff Were So Helpful  Both Over The Telephone During Booking  And On Our Arrival.
column39: 263 - We Were Relocated To This Beautiful Suite After Some Noise Issues With A Wedding Party Below. I Can Not Thank Both The Night Staff & The Receptionist In The Morning Who Not Only Went Out Of Their Way To Move Us  But Were So Pleasant & Helpful In The Way It Was Done. This Is Honestly The Best Customer Service I Have Come Across & It Was Greatly Appreciated By Both Of Us As We Had Planned A Relaxing Weekend Stay.
column53: Again - Fantastic
column64: It Was My Partner's Birthday - The Staff Bought Out A Desert With A Candle & Sang Happy Birthday - How Thoughtful  And Gave A Lovely Personal Touch To The Meal.
column84: As Previously Mentioned  The Night Staff & Receptionist Were So Helpful. Also The Dining Staff Were Fantastic.
column89: Absolutely Not
column90: I Would Like To Thank The Staff For Such A Wonderful Experience At The Hotel. They Really Made Our Visit And I Can Not Praise Them Enough For Their A* Customer Service. The Hotel It's Self Was Beautiful And We Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay - Thank You
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: 244 A Fridge Would Be Good
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: The Cold Tap Did Not Work At The Sink And Only 1 Out Of 4 Ceiling Spotlights Worked.
column77: Steam Room Could Have Been Cleaner Plasters Etc
column83: Tap And Lights As Explained Earlier
column84: There Was A Lady On Duty Late Friday Night In The Spa Who Was Very Helpful And Chatty
column89: Room Was Below Expectation For A Superior.
column90: Would Possibly Go Back For Spa But Not To Stay The Night

column64: Drink Prices Very Expensive And Off Putting.
column89: Have Much Cheaper Drink Menu.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: It Took Me Several Times To Get Through To The Hotel To Book The Room.  I Left Several Messages For A Call Back. Check In Was Slow And Confusing.
column39: 252.  The Room Was Very Basic More Travel Lodge Than Luxury Spa Hotel.  Bathroom Very Dated.  Basic Furniture.
column53: Service At Times Was Slow.  Orders Got Mixed Up.  Chips Were Chewy As If They Had Been Precooked Then Warmed Through.
column83: There Was An Insisdent Outside Our Room.  Guests On The Same Corridor Were Very Loud Around Midnight Which We Ignored  But At Around 3Am An Aggressive Argument Broke Out  Outside Our Door.  I Called Reception To Ask For The Incedent To Be Defused Or Moved Out Of The Corridor.  At 4Am I Had To Call Again As The Situation Had Got Worse  The People Were Not Removed Until 4.10.  In The Morning When I Raised With Reception I Was Asked To Wait To Speak To The Manager  After 10 Minutes He Had Not Arrived And I Needed To Get Ready For The Wedding My Husband And I Were Attending.  I Would Have Expected Some Form Of Communication In Anticipation Of My Concerns.  Whilst The Arguement Is Not The Hotels Fault  I Feel It Was The Hotels Responsibility To Deffuse The Situation And Remove From Outside The Bedrooms. We Specifically Travelled Down On The Friday To Have A Relax Ahead Of Our Friends Wedding And Instead Had A Very Distrurbed And Upsetting Night.

column84: I Think Her Name Was Natalie K. This Was My First Massage And Found It Really Relaxing  I Am Know Looking To Have Them More Often As She Was Really Nice And Made Me Feel Comfortable.

column35: I Had Booked Several Rooms As I Was Part Of A Wedding Party (The Bride). Check Into My Room Was Fine. However I Had Booked 2 Rooms  One For Mr And Mrs Wijesuriya (Groom's Parents) And One For Sophie Wijesuriya. I Received Email Confirmation Of This Booking. When They Came To Check In Evening Of The Wedding (12Th October)  They Were Told That One Room Had Water Damage And So Only 1 Room Was Available And Could They All Share. We Had Not Been Notified Of This Earlier Which Was Totally Unacceptable. Sophie Is An Adult (27 Years Old) And Should Not Have Been Assumed That They Could All Just Share. It Was Too Late For Them To Find An Alternative Hotel. Apparently As The Hotel Was Fully Booked There Were No Spare Rooms. We Still Had To Pay Full Price For The One Room.
column64: The Service In The Brasserie And Cocktail Lounge Was Extremely Slow. My Mother Dined Alone In The Brasserie Thursday 10Th October And She Was Very Disappointed With The Service  Felt That She Was Just Left. She Actually Complained About This At The Time. However When I Arrived 11Th October  I Felt That The Staff Were Friendly  Food Good  Just Slow Service.
column77: Good Experience At Spa (Received A Manicure)
column84: Ani Asofiei  Very Helpful  Gave Excellent Service. Thank You.
column89: Overall  Would Have Been A Good Experience  However Let Down By The Problem With The Rooms As Previously Discussed. We Were Not Informed Earlier Regarding A Problem With The Wijesuriya's Rooms. No Discount Or Other Room Was Offered.

column53: The Coffee Is Far Too Strong - Almost Like Syrup.

column39: 224- Carpet Was Covered In Stains And Bath Didn't Drain Properly Probably Due To Not Having Hair Etc Removed For A While
column77: Not Enough Beds And People Left Their Towels There All Day When They Weren't Using Them So We Didn't Get A Bed At All On The First Day

column39: 222 No Fridge Nor Glasses. Iron Was Terrible Didn't Make A Difference To My Shirt. The Bed Was Soft- Fair Enough- But On One Side It Was So Soft You Could Easily Fall Off! The Window Didn't Fully Shut. Sky Tv Functionality Was Great Though
column53: Not Much Choice And Nothing Looked Appetizing. The Decor Was Shabby With Cobwebs On The Blinds. This Was A Common Theme Throughout. The Hotel Felt Tired And Needed A Good Spring Clean
column77: No Smile When We Walked In. Other Than That The Leisure Facilities Were Great!
column84: No Service Stood Out
column89: For The Price It Wasn't Worth It And Disappointed Us
column90: Won't Be Returning

column35: Original Deluxe Room Not Ready So Was Offered 'Upgrade' To Apartment. Did Not Feel This Had The Deluxe Touch To It That Had Been Advertised With The Other Room So Asked To Go Back Which Was Done And Offered Complimentary Drink. Handled Well And No Complaint About Service Received.
column39: Room 161 (I Think) For Â£149 Per Night  I Expected A Lot More From This Room Which Is A Real Shame As We Were Really Looking Forward To Our Stay. It Was Very Basic Indeed  With Water Damage On The Wood In The Bathroom. Bath Also Did Not Drain Properly And Had To Turn Shower Off Halfway Through To Allow It To Drain. Bed Extremely Uncomfortable And We Were Both Awake From 4Am  Giving Up And Getting Up At 6:30. If I'd Have Paid Â£70 - Â£80  I Wouldn't Have Minded So Much But For The Room Was  To Be Honest  A Real Let Down.
column48: We Ordered Breakfast To Our Room. Not Much Choice On The Cooked Breakfast Menu (No Beans  Hash Browns Etc). Food Quality Good But Was Actually Cold On Arrival. Did Not Send Back As After Waiting Since 6:30 When We Had To Get Up (Ordered Breakfast To Arrive At 9:45)  We Just Wanted To Leave.
column53: See Previous Comments Re. Room Service As We Ordered This To Our Room.
column64: Ordered Burger And Chicken Bhuna. Chicken Bhuna Was Actually A Korma And Did Not Arrive With All That Was On The Menu - Had To Ask For The Papadum As Was Forgotten. Asked For Tomato Sauce With Burger But Waiter Forgot And Had To Be Reminded After 5 Minutes Of Waiting. It Is A Very Nice Brasserie Though And Food Was Tasty. Just Again  Expected A Bit More For The Price - Â£50 For Two Mains And A Bottle Of Wine  On Top Of Â£149 For The Room.
column83: Do Not Agree At All With Service Charge Being Added To A Drinks Charge When I Have Gone To The Bar Myself  Taking Back My Own Glass. If I Had Been Made Aware Of This And / Or Table Service Had Been Provided Whilst In The Lounge  I Wouldn't Object But There Was No Extra Mile Put In To Deserve This Hidden Charge.
column84: Receptionist Very Friendly And Happy To Accommodate On Changing Rooms Etc. From Memory  Her Name Was Jenny.
column90: I Hate To Give These Comments After Our Stay But We Were Unfortunately Never Asked. I See From Your Website And From Feedback On Tripadvisor That Other Guests Have Commented On The Same Issues And That You Are Undergoing Refurbishment - There Are Often Comments In Reply From Staff Indicating That There Are Nicer Rooms Available That Have Been Done Up. Perhaps You Should Not Charge Â£149 For A Room That Is Not To The Same Standard Of The Other Rooms. It's A Shame We Were Not Put In One Of These As Perhaps Our Stay Would Have Been More Enjoyable. We Were Aware Of The Prices Etc But Chose To Stay With Sopwell House For The Extra Luxury Offered But Unfortunately This Just Wasn't Delivered. I Do Hope Your Refurbishment Continues And That These Issues Are Resolved With That. Your Spa Facilities Looked Lovely And To A Good Quality And I Hope This Makes It Into The Rest Of Your Hotel.

column39: 156 - Room Booked For 3 Sharing  But Only Two Towels. We Phoned Reception And Asked For Third Set Of Towels But They Never Arrived! Room Was Very Hot With No Way Of Controlling The Temperature Except Opening Window  But This Let The Rain In!
column53: Melon Tasted Pickled And Had To Ask Waiting Staff To Check It After Adding It To My Bowl. We Had To Ask For Tea  Coffee And Toast. Otherwise Good Choice And Good Quality Generally?
column64: Despite The Restaurant Being Half Empty Our Waiter Was Very Pushy And Courses Served Too Fast. We Were Initially Asked To Order Desert At The Same Time As Starter And Main! Then Main Was Served Less Than 5 Mins After Starter. We Were Asked For Desert Orders 4 Times And Had To Ask Waiter To Give Us Time To Digest Main. All In All It Was Good Food  But Pushy And Unrelaxing Service.
column77: Lack Of Loungers!
column83: No Towels For 3Rd Person Despite Asking. Pushy Service In Restaurant.

column77: This Was The One Negative Of Our Experience. The Pool And The Steam/Sauna Was Uncomfortably Full. Too Many People In ( I Presume After Spa Treatments) And It All Felt Clostraphobic. Dont Understand The Rule About Children Not Being Allowed To Swim In The Afternoon.We Went At 4 Both Days And It Was Just The Jacuzzi And Steam Room Packed To The Rafters. Peiople Didnt Actually Want To Swim....Why Not Put A Limit On When People Having Treatments Can Go In Pool As Surely The Guests Of The Hotel Should Have Priority. The Hotel Is Happy To Charge 20.00 A Night For A 1Year Old But Ban Her From The Pool At Certain Times! Reception Area Completely Full Of Hen Parties And Groups Of Women ...Is There Not A Better Way To Ensure There Is Less People Waiting Around
column89: All In All We Love This Hotel And It Is Special To Us As We Got Marries Here. A Bit Let Down By The Experience At The Swimming Pool Where I Was Unable To Use The Jacuzzi And Steam For Queues Of Women On Hen Parties Using It. Hardly Anyone Actually Swimming In Pool So The Ban On Kid As Between 1-4 Makes Little Sense Especially As They Are Paying Guests. Confused - Is This A Hotel Or Spa As A Hotel Guest We Felt Second Class!!!!

column35: Amazing Food In The Restaurant And Facilities. It Was A Stay For My Husbands Birthday And We Had An Amazing Time. We Want To Come Back At Christmas. The Spa And Facilities Were First Class. My Therapist Holly Was Outstanding And Very Informative. I Would Highly Recommend This To Family And Friends And We Will Be Back Asap. Best Wishes  Josanne Cobham.
column39: Room 154 (I Think) We Stayed 23Rd & 24Th October. From Check In To Departure We Felt That We Were In A 5 Star Establishment. Check In Process Was Long Due To The Massive Party Of Women Who Arrived A Couple Minutes Before Us  But The Porters Told Us To Sit And Relax  Stored Our Bags Till We Were Called. They Were Twin Guys  Very Charming And Helpful Throughout Our Stay. Key Cards Didn't Work Twice  And We Had To Go Back To Reception But That Was Resolved Albeit Annoying To Come Back Down. You Should Check The Magnetic Strip On The Door Itself For Future Reference. The Spa Was First Class  Loved The Espa Range And The Therapist Holly Was One Of The Best I've Ever Had. Spa Facilities Were Great On 2Nd Day  First Day Was Bombarded By This Massive Group. Afternoon Tea Was Fabulous And So Tasty And Relaxing In The Lush Environment. Waiter Was So Accommodating As I Couldn't Eat The Fish Options Of Sandwiches And Provided Me Alternatives. We Dined In The Brasserie For My Partners Birthday Meal The First Night And The Set Menu Met Expectations And More. We Had Breakfast And Lunch The Following Day And Both Had Such A Wide Selection Of Good And Healthy Food. The Room Was Good With A Great View. My Partner Loved That You Had Sky Sports Available  We Have Stayed In Hotels Around The World  Even The Shangri-La Chain And They Didn't Have This  So He Was Impressed. Also The Football Hall Of Fame Was A Nice Touch. Beautiful Grounds  Parking Was Fine. We Hope To Come Back After Xmas And Before New Years. We Had One Of The Best Spa Breaks We've Been To In The Uk. Thank You Very Much. Josanne Cobham.
column53: You Should Do Vegetarian Sausages And Bacon. My Partner Doesn't Eat Pork And It's A Shame An Alternative Wasn't Offered On That Front.
column84: Holly Is The Spa Was Outstanding And The Most Attentive Therapist Ever  So Knowledgeable With Product And Regime Advice. The Twin Porters In Reception Were So Attentive And Helpful On Arrival And Departure.
column89: Advise On The Spa Capacity In Terms Of If Its Going To Be A Busy Time Before We Book.
column90: Congratulations On A First Class Establishment.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: 264 (I Think This Was The Number) The Bed Was Very Hard And Uncomfortable And The Wood In The Bathroom Was In A Poor State.
column64: There Was A Problem With My Husbands Meal  There Was What Appeared To Be A Metal Fragment In His Burger  This Was Dealt With Professionally And The Meal Was Not Charged For.
column77: The Water Was On The Cold Side In The Pool.
column84: All Staff Members Were Very Good.

column35: I Had To Make A Lot Of Changes To My Booking And These Were Dealt With Promptly And Very Professionally As If Nothing Were An Issue.
column83: The Bar Service For Getting Drinks Be It Alcoholic Or Not Was Consistently Poor And We Waited Long Periods Of Time For Our Drinks Thoughout Our Stay To The Point Were It Became A Running Joke
column90: The Service Charges Added To The Bill For Our Drinks Was Extreme For The Length Of Time We Had To Wait. I Was Also Incorrectly Charged Â£178+!Which Included The Previous Occupants Drinks I.E Two Bottles Of Champagne - This Was Taken From The Bill But I Was Very Close To Signing On Trust
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: 135 The Room Was Great But We Were Unable To Lock The Window Properly (We Didn't Notice That It Was Unlocked Until We Went To Open It). Because The Room Overlooks A Flat Roof  This Could Be A Security Issue As It Would Be Easy For Someone To Access The Room Through The Window.
column64: Lots Of Choice. Very Friendly And Efficient Service. Staff Knowledgeable About Gluten Free Options. Good Gluten Free Bread - Thank You!
column77: Excellent Facilities. It Got Rather Crowded At Times Around The Pool Area But It Was A Busy Half Term Weekend So Probably To Be Expected!
column90: A Friend And I Had A Two Day Spa Break. The Value For Money Of The Overall Package Was Excellent And I Have Already Recommended This To A Number Of Friends. In Particular We Enjoyed Being Able To Use The Spa Facilities After Checking Out And Lunch On The Day Of Departure Was Also An Added Bonus That Enhanced The Overall Enjoyment Of The Weekend.

column39: Appartment 8- Lovely Room But The Shower Is Showing Signs Of Age And Looks Dirty/Grubby  Even Though I Know It Isn't.
column48: Most Of The Spa  Waiting And Bar Staff Were Very Attentive And A Credit To The Hotel.
column53: Staff Were Less Cheerful In The Morning Than At Lunch/Dinner Time

column35: I Did Not Receive Any Booking Confirmation Even Though I Rang And Requested Twice
column39: Very Hot Even When Air Con On  Think It Was The Mattress Though. Would Have Liked A Mini Fridge. Room Lovely  Bathroom Great  Excellent Sized Bath Towels.
column83: The Staff Did Have Some Problems Trying To Find Our Room  They Were New Though So We Found It Quite Funny Traipsing Back And Forth To Reception
column84: I Cannot Think Of Any Names But The Staff In The Cocktail Bar Were Great!!!
column89: Better Milk In The Rooms
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: We Were Told Prior To Our Stay That Every Effort Would Be Made To Upgrade Our Room As We Were Staying For A Special Occasion  However  We Do Not Believe We Received This. Upon Check-In We Asked About This But The Person Checking Us In Did Not Seem To Understand This And Merely Proceeded To Check Us In - This Was A Disappointing Start To Our Stay.
column39: We Were On The 2Nd Floor  Cant Remember The Room Number  The Bed Was Extremely Soft Resulting In A Bad Back The Next Day Which Is A Great Shame Having Spent Money And Time With A Massage Earlier In The Day
column53: The Service Was Lacking After Being Shown Your Table  No One Came To Ask If We Wanted Any More Hot Drinks So Were Only Able To Have 1 Cup Of Tea. It Took A Long Time For Anyone To Clear Our Plates In Between Having The Hot Food And Fruit/Cakes. It Was Disappointing To See That No Effort Had Been Made To Offer Gluten Free Food Especially As This Request Had Been Made On Booking Our Reservation. No One Even Asked Us If We Had Any Dietary Requirements.
column64: We Ordered Soup To Start With But Unfortunately The Soup Was Served Cold And We Had To Ask For This To Be Re-Served - Soup Should Be Piping Hot!!
column89: Overall The Experience Was Enjoyable  However  It Was Not Anything Really Special For The Amount Paid And No Real Effort Was Made To Make A Special Celebration Really Memorable.

column35: Upon Arrival At 4Pm  Our Room Was Not Ready For Check-In. There Was Also A Mix Up With Regards To The Cost. We Were Made To Stand For 30 Minutes  Whilst This Was Unresolved At This Point. We Were Not Given Instructions About Use Of The Spa And Told We Could Go To Our Room  Which Now Was Ready As We Had Had To Wait For This Period  And We Would Be Called Once It Was Sorted. We Stayed In The Room For 45Minutes But Thought As We Had Booked A Spa Package We Would Like To Use The Spa So Went Back To Reception To See If The Issue Was Sorted. After Waiting Again We Were Told It Had. We Paid For The Booking In Cash And Gave A Credit Card For Any Extras. We Then Had To Ask About The Spa Details As They Were Not Offered Up. We Had Drinks In The Cocktail Bar Which We Were Able To Sign For On The Room  However At Dinner We Were Told That We Had To Pay For The Bottle Of Wine As We Had No Credit On The Room. Yet Again We Had To Return To Reception To Resolve This Issue  Which Was Again  Through No Fault Of Our Own. Having Wasted So Much Time I Was Glad To Have Booked A 2-Night Stay As This Would Have Otherwise Ruined The Whole Experience.
column83: Please See Details Of Check-In. However  There Was Very Little Apology Or Acknowledgement Of The Issues Which Were Entirely The Fault Of Sopwell House.
column89: Acknowledgement Of The Wasted Time On The Day Of Check-In.
column90: A Response Would Be Appreciated.

column35: I Phoned Before To See If We Could Check In Before 3 Having Travelled A Long Way For The Wedding. Was Told This Wasn't Possible And That 3Pm Would Be Check In. Arrived At 2.55 And Queued Until 3.10Pm To Be Seen. Then Told Our Room Was Not Ready. I Am Heavily Pregnant And Was Unhappy. I Had To Complain And Then Wait Another Fifteen Minutes (Now Missing Reception Drinks And Canopies) Finally Got Given A Room.
column39: We Had No Tea And Coffee Facilities And Were Told There Would Be.
column84: No. However When I Arrived With Bags And Loaded Down And Dressed Up I Had To Ask 3 Members Of Staff How To Get To Reception. The First Two Didn't Know!
column89: Check In On Time And Have Rooms Ready. Don't Allow Others To Check In Early When Some Have Been Told You Can't!
column90: It Is A Shame I've Left With Quite A Negative Perception Of The Hotel. The Wedding Itself Was Wonderful. Experience Of The Hotel And Staff Was Quite Poor.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: The Car Park Was Very Full And We Had To Look For A While To Find A Space.
column48: Some One From The Room Service Team Accidentally Woke Us At 2.45Am When He Mistakenly Knocked Twice On Our Door. We Ordered Breakfast In The Room The Following Morning And The Eggs And Bacon Were Not Hot Enough  By The Time We Got To Eat Them They Were Barely Warm.
column53: It Was Cold By The Time It Came To Our Room.
column83: Being Woken In The Night By Room Service We Did Not Order

column35: Took 4 Phone Calls To Try And Book A Table In The Brasserie  Left Numerous Messages But No-One Called Me Back
column39: Originally Put In Room 111 Which Was Very Nice But At Night Was Extremely Noisy From The Wedding Disco. Was Moved To Mews Room 16 Which Was Very Disappointing - Cold  Noisy And Very Dated And Old Fashioned
column64: Very Good As Mentioned Before  But Booking A Table Was A Nightmare!
column77: Tried To Book Treatments But No Availability So Cannot Comment In These. Spa Was Very Busy  Facilities Were Nice But Unfortunatley Not Very Relaxing Due To The Overcrowding

column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column84: The Bar Manager Was Extremely Hard Working And Friendly. I Also Thought The Doorman Was Very Helpful And Went Out Of His Way To Help With Luggage Etc.
column90: We Saved For A While So We Could Spend A Night In Sopwell And Enjoy A Nice Meal Etc. The Experience We Had Did Not Let Us Down. We Had One Of The Best Weekends And Almost Every Detail Was Perfect.

column77: There Was Not Enough Beds By The Pool To Cater For All The Guests.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column48: Room Service Was Ordered For My Room On The Day Of My Wedding For 07:00. At 07:25 It Had Still Not Been Delivered. I Had To Then Phone Downstairs And Order Again. This Was Annoying And Frustrating. Especially As I Was Time Limited.
column83: The Room Service
column84: Zak Welch Did An Amazing Job Along With His Colleagues In Organising My Wedding On The 19Th. Everyone Who Attended The Wedding Were Extremely Happy.
column89: Room Service Should Be On Time And Delivered Without Having To Make So Many Calls. When Ordering A Bell Boy It Should Also Be Within 10 Minutes. My Friend From New York Had To Wait 15 Mins And Then Gave Up.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: I Found The Spa Extremely Busy And Not Very Relaxing Due To The Number Of People Using The Facilities At The Same Time.
column77: As Mentioned Previously

column35: We Had A Wonderful Stay At Sopwell House. The Only Negatives Were During The Check-In And Check-Out. They Service Was 'Satisfactory'  One Of The Three Rooms Booked Was Not Ready And We Did Not Feel Suitably Satisfied With The Resolution  The Welcome Wasn't Particularly Warm And The Wait Was Quite Long  As The Staff Did Not Seem Suitably Smooth And Efficient. That Aside All Other Staff Provide Exceptional Service To The Bar Staff Providing Ice Buckets To The Room With Charm  A Young Italian Gentleman Who Took Us Personally Through The Maze From Our Room 102 To The Spa  Trying To Show Us The Way While Opening Each Door For Us To Go Through First  Excellent Service In The Brasserie For Breakfast  Fabulous Food For Dinner (And Breakfast) And The Staff Serving Late On Saturday Night....It Was Such A Pleasure To Stay. I Have Stayed Several Times In The Last Few Years But Noticed An Exceptional Improvement In The Service And Experience We Had This Time. We'll Definitely Be Back Soon.
column39: It Would Have Been Nice To Have A Hair Dryer.
column77: There Were It Enough Sun Beds For The Guests In The Spa/Swimming Pool. It Would Be Nice During Busy Periods That People Do Not Reserve A Bed When They Are Using The Facilities And Not Using It  Allowing Others To Rest Sometimes.
column83: As Per Previous Comments Regarding Check In
column84: The Young  Tall Dark Italian Gentleman Who Took Us Through The Hotel To The Spa  The Brasserie Manager Who Was Very Hospitable  And The Waitress Serving Us At Dinner On Saturday. She Was A 30Ish Year Old  Whose First Language Was Not English. She Was Not Particularly Smooth In Her Approach As She Seemed New To The Role  But She Was Trying To Please And Working Very Hard To Make Sure Everyone Was Happy.

column35: Pre-Arrival. Booked On Phone And Got Wedding Rate. We Could Have Stayed At Other Cheaper Nearby Hotels But We Decided To Say With You Because1. Wedding Reception There So Convenient On Day And For Kids To Go To Bed Earlier( We Hired An Au Pair To Sit In Room While We Partied Downstairs) And To Be At Hub Of Wedding With Other Guests;And 2 Cos Of Nice Spar And Pool For Us All To Use.  Then Got Email Saying We Had To Pay Extra For Pool Use As We Are On Wedding Rate. I Strongly Considered Cancelling The Booking - Losing You Â£840 For 2 Rooms For 3 Nights.  I Know Other Wedding Guests Were Upset By This.  Bride Intervened And Got Us Limited Use Of Pool For Free. Wedding Rate Is In Recognition Of The Number Of Guests Using The Hotel Due To Wedding Being Held There Not A Cut Rate For Cut Down Amenities.  When I Arrived I Was Determined Therefore Not To Like The Hotel Due To Booking Experience But In Fact It Was Lovely.
column39: Slightly Tired But I Think You Are Under Going Program Of Renovation Cos Other Rooms Were Better
column77: See Above
column89: Booking As Above. Some Decoration Work To Be Done In Corridors (Very Dark ) And Outside Windows!
column90: Thank You

column39: My Son Did Say His Fold Out Bed Was Rather Uncomfortable He Could Feel All The Springs Through It.
column83: At Breakfast We Had To Ask For Milk On Table And Spoons Had To Wait For Bowls When Needed For Fruit At Buffet  But The Waiters Were Very Pleasent.   The Impression At Breakfast Was That Seemed To Be Under Staffed And Staff Were Pushed To Get Everything Done.
column89: There Was Only One Bar Man In Hotel Bar Making Drinks On The Friday Night And We Could See He Was Under Alot Of Pressure .And We Were Kept Waiting Along Time For Our Drinks To Be Made  There Was A Girl Behind Bar But Did Not Seem To Be Making Any Drinks ?
column90: We Enjoyed Our Stay And Wedding  But Would Of Preferred To Of Stayed As A Couple And Enjoyed The Facilities On Offer We Had Another Appointment The Following Morning So Did Not See Spa Facilities On Offer.We Do Go Away As A Couple Now And Again And Stay In Hotels So Maybe In Future We May Return.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: A Small Fridge Would Be Nice. Water Pressure Very Low.  Floorboards Were Very Squeeky. Stayed In Room 149.
column77: I Booked A Package. Would Have Nice To Use The 2 Treatment S Together To Have 1 Long Treatment Without Having To Pay Extra

column35: 2 Wedding Parties So A Little Hectic Which Was Understandable.
column39: The In-Room Prepacked Coffee Granules Could Be Of A Better Quality  As Everything Else Was Excellent
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: 259 Mattress Was Hard  No Mini Bar And Taps In Bathroom Covered In Tarnish And Blue Ring Around Bottom. A Place To Hang A Hand Towel Would Be Useful Near The Sink.

We Were In Room 217. The Bulbs In The Wardrobe Had Been Removed And As There Is No Other Lighting In This End Of The Room  Finding Anything In The Wardrobe  Especially The Shelves Or The Safe Was A Challenge!
column53: Breakfast Was A Bit Chaotic Some Mornings  And It Was Not Always Easy To Get Tea Or Coffee. On One Of The Mornings We Had Breakfast At The Restaurant Rather Than The Brasserie And Were Seated At A Table With A Very Dirty Tablecloth From Previous Diners.
column64: A Small Niggle  But I Really Object To Being Told That I Cannot Be Served Tap Water In The Restaurant And Subsequently Being Charged Â£4 For A Bottle Of Still Water. This Is A Very Outdated Concept  Even 3 Michelin Starred Restaurants Are Happy To Provide A Jug Of Iced Tap Water. The Following Evening Our Booking In The Brasserie Was Moved To The Restaurant As The Hotel Was So Busy....We Were Happily Served Tap Water In There That Night  Which Made The Refusal Of The Night Before Even More Absurd. On A Positive Not We Really Enjoyed The Newly Renovated Cocktail Bar  One Barman In Particular (I Believe He Told Us He Was From Italy) Was Extremely Friendly And Mixed Wonderful Cocktails. Please Get Some Decent Glasses In The Cocktail Bar. You Have Nice Glasses In The Restaurant But When Served Wine Anywhere Else Including In Your Room  Awful Pub Wine Glasses Are All That Seems To Be On Offer.
column83: We Left Some Champagne And Wine Downstairs To Be Chilled During The Day On A Couple Of Occasions  Which The Reception Staff Were Very Happy To Do And Helpful With Our Request. However  Retrieving It In The Evening Was A Bit Difficult Both Times  No One Seemed To Know Where It Was
column84: As Previously Mentioned  Your Barman In The Cocktail Bar Was Wonderful And Very Friendly  I Believe He Was From Italy But I Did Not Get His Name.

column39: I Specifically Booked The Room As It Had A 'Garden Terrace' And Spoke To Someone On The Afternoon About Booking This. I Was Told There Was One Left And Booked This In The Evening Online At Â£214. On Arrival I Was Allocated And Upstairs Room With No Terrace. A Little Disappointed As I Could Have Booked Anywhere For A Lot Less. The Only Reason I Stayed Was For The Availability Of 'Outer Space'. The Hotel Was Superb But I Did Feel A Little Aggrieved That At Â£214 For One Night The Room Was Not What I Booked Or Requested. On Booking I Added A Note For The Terrace Room. No-One Came Back To Me To Say This Wasn't Available. I Tried To Change Rooms On Checking In But Was Told No Other Rooms Were Available.
column90: See Comments Re Room.

column35: Our Room Keys Did Not Work So We Had To Return To Reception To Get Them Checked
column39: Felt That A Mini Fridge Would Have Made The Stay Even Better
column48: Our Breakfast On The First Morning Arrived Without Any Cutlery And By The Time We Had The Cutlery Our Food Was Cold  We Did Receive A New One But The Person We Had To Complain To Did Not Apologies.
column64: The Waiting Staff Were A Little Quick To Remove Our Plates Between Courses.
column83: I Have Already Outlined These In Earlier Questions
column84: The Head Waiter On Lunch Service Was Extremely Efficient And Courteous  As Were The Staff In The Spa.
Yes  I Can't Remember His Name But He Was Very Very Helpful And Kind And Chatty  He Has Black Wavy Short Hair  Knows Gianfranco Zola Very Well And Is  Of Medium Build  Very Nice Man!
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column64: We Felt Very Rushed By Serving Staff And Also Most Of The Staff In The Brasserie And Terrace Lounge Couldn't Understand Us As They Had Limited English. Forgot Our Bread Basket Twice And Got Out Dessert Order Wrong.
column83: Only Whilst Dining As Mentioned On Previous Page

column35: All Staff Were Extremely Friendly And Helpful.

As It Was My Partner's 50Th  I Was Told Upon Booking That They Would Try And Upgrade Us Or Do Something Special. This Did Not Happen  The Receptionist Told Me To Check My Room First (The View Was Not Very Good) And To Call For An Upgrade The Desk For An Upgrade  But Upon Calling 5 Minutes Later  She Then Changed Her Tune And Said There Was Not A Room Available.
column53: We Had To Ask For Toast  For Butter  For Plates  Not What I Would Have Expected For The Price Paid.

column35: Was Not Told In Advance That I Wouldn't Be Allowed To Use The Spa Facilities Until 3Pm.  I Go To Sopwell House Every Year And Have Previously Arrived At Midday And Used The Facilities Until My Room Was Ready.  No Where On The Internet Or Confirmation Booking Did It Say This Has Changed.
column39: No Earl Grey Tea In The Room.
column53: The Service At Breakfast  In The Overflow On Sunday Morning  Was Terrible.  We Had To Search For A Table Ourselves  Walking Past 2 Waiters Who Ignored Us. All The Tables Were Covered In Previous Diners Mess And Had Not Been Cleared.  The Food Was Not Being Restocked  Had To Ask For Juice  Eggs And Milk. No One Offered Me Toast  I Had To Get Up  Find A Waiter And Ask For Some. When It Arrived There Was Hardly Any  It Was Brown Toast When I Had Wanted White  And It Was Cold.  This All Happened At 9.30Am On A Sunday So It's Not Like We Got There When They Were Clearing Up And No Longer Meant To Be Serving. I Was Very Very Disappointed.
column64: Much Better Than The Staff In The Overflow Breakfast.
column77: The Pool Water Felt Greasy/Oily. There Were Not Enough Sunbeds And People Would Reserve Sunbeds For Hours At A Time When They Were Off Having Treatments. This Was Supposed To Be Against The Rules But No One Was Enforcing The Rule.
column83: Yes As Stated About The Breakfast Overflow Room  Terrible Service.
column89: Too Much Noise From The Disco/Party Downstairs  Kept Me Awake Till 12.45Am

column64: The Brasserie Was Not Up To The Standard We Expected Of A Hotel Restaurant. Even In A Good Pub You Can Get Freshly Made Food Of A Better Standard. It Was Too Mass Produced And Reminded Us Of A Canteen Which We Wouldn't Expect In A Higher End Hotel. It Was The Only Disappointing Part Of Our Stay.
column84: Spa Staff And Receptionists Were Very Friendly And Helpful

column8: A Birthday Treat For My Wife
column53: Breakfast Selection And Quality Was Very Good
column90: We Are Looking Forward To Returning In The Future

column53: The Bacon Was Not The Best Quality  We Chose Not To Eat It.
column77: There Were Too Many People Who Were On Day Spas Not Staying In Th Hotel. This Made The Pool Area Very Crowded And As Residents Paying Â£400 To Be There For The Weekend We Were Unable To Get A Pool Lounger Because Of People On Day Spas Paying Circa Â£65 For The Day. We Would Not Come Back To The Hotel Until There Is Some Preferential Treatment For Hotel Residents.
column89: Limit The Number Of Day Spa Entrants. It Spoils The Experience For Hotel Residents.
column90: The Hotel Interior In General Is In Very Good Condition And Very Clean. What Lets The Hotel Down Is The Condition Of The Hallways. The Paintwork Is Shabby.

column64: My Friend And I Were Up Upgraded To A Meal At The Restaurant Because Of An Complaint Which We Had Previously Made. The Food At The The Restaurant Was Brilliant!!
column83: The Issue With A Particular Member Of Staff Has Been Dealt With.
column84: Denver Is An Asset To 'Sopwell House'. Professional In His Approach To Staff And Clientele.. Brilliant

column39: Room Fantastic No Complaints Apart From Very Loud Music Till 12Pm We Was In Room 103 And Could Not Sleep. We Was On A Quite Pamper Night.
column89: Fantastic Place. I Do Think The Drinks/ Cocktails Are Way Over Priced.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc
special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: My Only Comment Is That The Tea Making Facilities Are Not Close To A Plug - The Kettle Had To Be Moved To Boil.
column53: We Had To Ask For Tea/Coffee On Both Mornings - & Also For Toast On The First

column39: Bathroom Not Enough Light
column64: Disappointed With  Missed Breakfast  As We Were Both Ill  Really Enjoyed Lunch
column89: Wish There The 7 Day Cancellation Notice Could Be Better. We Could Of Moved The Weekend To When We And Our Children Felt Better !  :-(
column90: Really Disappointed With Dinner. Wish We Felt Better To Enjoy More Of The Facilities .

column64: The Staff In The Brasserie Were Fantastic - So Welcoming And Friendly A Lovely Change From Most Hotels - The Staff Were Interested In The Guests And Seemed To Enjoy Their Roles
column84: Staff In Brasserie

column35: I Booked Through Jenny And She Was Fantastic  Gave Me A Good Deal And Covered All My Requirements.  Lovely Lady.
column39: My Daughter Slept On The Sofa Bed And Found It Exceptionally Uncomfortable  Infact Could Not Sleep At All On The First Night  However  The Reception Team Did Put Another Bed Into Appartment 13 The Next Night Which Was Much Better.
column83: The Shower Door In Apartment 13 Was Broken And Held On By A Screw-None Of Us Felt Comfortable Using This Incase It Fell Off So Had To Have Showers For Our Whole Stay In The Pool/Leisure Area-I Did Mention This To A Young Girl On Reception On Day 1.
column84: Jenny As She Was Exceptionally Warm And Friendly When I Was Booking Our Stay.

column64: Booked Prior To Arrival But Had To Wait An Hour For Our Table Was Told To Go To Bar And Wait Then Waited An Hour For Our Dinner
column77: Thought The Treatments Were Expensive
column84: Lady On The Door To Dining Room Very Unhelpful  Lady On Front Reception Very Friendly
column89: Only The Dining Experience Which Was Sorted By The Manager
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: Far Too Far Away From Stairs. We Were Allocated The Last Room At The End Of The Second Corridor And Had To Go Up Two Flights Of Stairs - Very Very Disappointing As We Booked 3Months In Advance. Even Though I Was Told Only When I Arrived Rooms Are Allocated The Night Before - I Still Think Its Very Bad Especially As I Had Not Been Advised Of The Room Being In That Location.
column48: Room Service Didn't Arrive After We Called It Took At Least 20-30Mins To Receive Hot Water With Lemon.
column83: Waited Over 20Minutes For My Treatment As The Customer Before Me Was Running Late I Was Told.
column89: Given Us A Room In A Better Location Especially As I Had Explained It Was A Booking For My Cousins Birthday So Was A Special Occasion But The Fact We Had To Walk Up Two Flights Of Stairs And The Room Was Two Corridors Away Definitely Spoilt The Experience A Bit.
column90: The Menu That Was Originally Offered For The Spa Break Was A Simple Menu With Little Choice And Was A Great Dissapointment. Luckily The Manager Agreed To Allow Us To Order From The Main Menu At No Extra Charge.

column83: If I Had To Find A Criticism  The Service In The Brasserie Of An Evening Was Very  Very Slow. As A Guest On Her Own I Was Happy To Get In And Get Out Rather Than Have To Wait 45 Minutes For My Meal To Arive.

column35: No. Everything Was Quick And Easy.
column64: Had A Set Menu For A Spa Day Which Was Very Limited
column77: Really Enjoyed The Spa And Treatments. Have Booked To Come Back To See The Same Therapist As She Really Understood My Skin Problems And Will Probably Have A Facial Per Month With Her.
column83: Service Very Slow At Dinner  Felt Ignored
column90: Was Also Concerned About The Amount Of Police Activity Around The Building Overnight And Also A Police Car Was Still At Location In The Morning. Being 2 Women On Our Own We Felt A Little Unnerved And Was Offered No Reassurance. Only Answer Was 'Cant Discuss As Confidential'.....

column35: We Were Early And Waited In The Cocktail Bar After Being Told We Would Be Called When The Room Was Ready . We Weren't And Had To Go Back To Reception An Enquire. It Was Ready .
column39: Room 124  Was Not As Described It Was Very Small And Very Hot . The Air Conditioning Did Not Appear To Be Working . Large Stain On The Carpet By The Door And Anywhere Else I've Stayed At Least One Bottle Of Drinking Water Has Been Supplied Along With The Coffee An Tea Facilities .
column53: The Selection Was Good But The Fruit Was Under Ripe And The Staff Seemed Harassed .
column64: We Booked A Table In The Brasserie Upon High Recommendation From People I Know . The Website Seems Deceiving As It Shows Both An A La Carte Menu And Fixed Menu . It Was The A La Carte Menu We Wanted And When We Arrived Only To Fixed ( Limited ) Menu Was Available . We Were Not Informed At Point Of Booking As Had We Known We Would Have Chosen The Restaurant Instead . The Service Was Rushed And Very Noisy   He Staff As At Breakfast Seemed Harassed . My Potatoes ( Sea Bream On A Niscoise Salad ) Were Undercooked And The Potatoes With The Duck Were Cold . No Butter With The Bread   Ordered Garlic Bread And Got Garlic Bread With Cheese( Not Advised ) And A Very Dirty Glass!!! Over All Very Disappointed .
column77: Cannot Fault The Spa At All   Very Relaxing And Polite And Efficient .
column83: Waited Over 20 Minutes For Drinks In The Cocktail Bar And Had To Rush Hem In Order To Make Our Dinner Reservation .
column89: Our Experience Just Lacked That ' Special ' Experience We Expected .
column90: I'm Glad I Received This Survey As I Was Going To Write In And Actually Still May Do As Although We Enjoyed The Break Alway We Left Feeling Disappointed . It Was Not As We Had Expected .

column20: My Own Research On Spa Hotel In A 100Mile Radius
column53: Excellent Choice And Fresh Foods Such The Fruit Was Lovely
column84: All Staff Excellent Had Strong Customer Service Skils And Assisted Myself And My Sister Without Needing To Ask  They All Are A Credit To The Hotel
column89: No It Was An Excellent Stay And I Will Back

column35: When There Was A Big Queue For Check In  There Was Only One Receptionist. When The Queue Cleared - There Were Three!
column39: 234 - Tea Making Facilities Would Have Been Appreciated.
column53: The Waiter Was Very Helpful And Explained The Set Up  Organised An Omlette And Drinks  Very Attentive.
column64: The Waiter Was A Little Abrupt And Did Not Ask Us If We Wanted To Order Drinks. Staff Were Also Quick To Take Your Plate While Still Eating!
column77: Unfortunately People Left Towels On Their Beds While Having Treatments  So At One Point Every Bed Was Taken But Only A Couple Of People Were Actually There! It Would Work Better If People Gave Up Their Beds When Having Treatments As There Were Plenty. Door On Steam Room Hard To Close Properly. Also Very Hot By The Swimming Pool.
column90: Maybe A Discount Voucher For A Return Visit Would Be Good.

column39: Unfortunately We Had  Very Bad Nights Sleep As The Room Was Very Very Hot.  Even With The Air Conditioning Up Full!!
It Would Have Enhanced The Facilities In Room If There Was A Docking Station For Ipod

column35: No
column53: Great Selection  Spoiled For Choice!
column64: A Little Bit Slow On Bringing Desert  And They Should Ask You If You Want Toast As Soon As You Are Seated To Save Time. We Had To Catch Someone's Attention And It Took A While!
column77: Water Should Be Provided Near The Sauna! We Had To Walk Out From Poolside To Back Out To Near Reception Just To Get Water! Not Good!
column83: I Asked (The Manager I Think) In The Spa For Some Slippers  She Told Me She Had Not Offered Them As I Was Wearing Flip Flops! This Was Neither Here Nor There And She Should Only Have Replied Of Course Madam. I Thought This To Be A Bit Cheeky As I Was A Paying Customer And Wanted The Full Experience Like Anybody Else!
column84: Natalie Provided An Excellent Treatment And Was Extremely Friendly And Professional.
column89: Complimentary Teas And Coffees Dotted Around Would Have Been A Nice Touch!
column90: Loved It  Can't Wait To Come Back And Hope To Receive A Free Upgrade As A Returning Customer!

column84: They All Were Fantastic

column39: Unfortunately We Asked To Be Moved As Our Room Was Extremely Below What We Would Regard As A 4* Room. The Bathroom Wasn't Clean  The Bath Panel Was All Chipped Off. The Room Was Not Hoovered Properly And The Walls & Skirting Were Damaged & Marked.  Once We Were Moved Into Another Room  Although Much Cleaner  Unfortunately The Toilet Flush Did Not Work Properly And Once You Had A Shower It Took Some 20Mins Before The Water Drained Away.  We Brought This To The Attention Of The Manager Whom Was Very Apologetic And Offered Us A Â£42.00 Discount & Explained That This Side Of The Hotel Was Awaiting Refurbishment  Although We Do Feel The Rooms Should At Least Be Clean. We Did Book Far In Advance For A Suprise For Our Friends 40Th Birthday So It Was A Little Disappointing To Start The Weekend Like This.
column53: Fantastic Service By All Staff Members And A Great Choice Of Food On Offer.
column64: Superb !
column89: Apart From The Issue We Had With The Rooms  None.
column90: We Had A The Most Relaxing Time  Staff  Food  Spa Was Exceptional. As I Said Earlier  Sadly The Issue With The Rooms Was The Only Down Side.  We Are Planning On Returning Later In The Year But Will Be Requesting That Until These Rooms Are Updated We Would Request Something On The Other Side.

column35: We Had To Wait 45 Minutes To Check In And The Service We Received Was Awful. We Had Confirmation Of Two Rooms Booked 6 Months Ago (At Least) At Â£120 Per Night And The Receptionist Was Questioning It Despite Us Having Already Waited 45 Minutes To Check In And Trying To Get To A Wedding Reception.
column39: Our Shower Fixture Was Broken And We Had No Toilet Roll In The Room.  As We Were At A Wedding Reception And Already Running Late Due To The Late Check In We Didn't Check The Room Thoroughly Before Going Down To The Wedding Breakfast - As I Was A Bridesmaid!   I Have Stayed At Sopwell Before And The Room We Had For The Wedding Evening Was Certainly Not The Level I Expected.
column53: We Were Not Offered A Menu And We Had To Ask Three Times For Toast And Eventually Got It After Our Self Serve Breakfast!
column83: At Check In And Breakfast  - I Have Already Mentioned Check In But Breakfast We Were Barely Acknowledged And We Had To Ask For Our Toast Three Times And The Gentleman Even Then Didnt Apologise Or Smile!
column89: More Customer Focused Service  Sufficient Room With Working Utilities And Speedier Check In.

column35: We Were Early So We Decided To Have A Drink In The Cocktail Bar And The Receptionist Said She Would Call Us Whn The Room Was Ready . She Did Not   We Had To Go Back And Enquire And It Was Ready.
column39: Room 124. I Expected More For The Price And It Was Smaller Than Described . The Air Conditioning Didn't Work   There Was A Large Stain On The Carpet By The Door And No Bottle Of Water In The Room   Anywhere I've Stayed This Has Standard Along With The Coffee Facilities .
column53: The Staff Were Always Pleasant But Clearly Rushed Off Their Feet . For The Cost Of Breakfast ( Ours Was Included In Room Cost ) I Don't Think The Standard Nor Choice Was Worth Nearly Â£20 . The Fruit Was Under Ripe An He Smoked Salmon Rubbery .
column64: We Had Booked A Table In The Brassiere On Recommendation And Also The Menu Advertised On Your Website . Mis Leading As It Implies A Choice Of Either He Fixed Menu Or The A La Carte ?! On The Day Only The Fixed Menu Was Available . We Were Not Advised Of This At Booking And Frankly Would Have Chosen To Eat In The Restaurant Instead If We'd Known . Also It Was Very Noisy   Rushed Service   Cold And Undercooked Potatoes And Over All A Let Down .
column77: We Could Not Fault The Spa At All   Professional And Very Relaxing   Exactly What We Wanted.
column83: Over 20 Minutes To Wait For Our Drinks In The Cocktail Bar !!! Very Poor   We Had Wanted To Enjoy A Drink Before Dinner But Ended Up Taking Them With Us !!!! It Wasn't Busy Either ??
column89: Our Stay Just Lacked That ' Special ' Feeling . More Attentive Staff ( Not Aimed At The Spa Staff ) And Attention To Detail .
column90: I'm Glad You Sent This Survey As I Was Going To Write To You Anyway And Still May Regarding Our Stay . Thank You

column39: Would Expect Mini Bar/Snacks In Room Or Vending Machines Available
column64: Brasserie Was Very Busy  We Had A Table For 3 Which Was A Table For 2 With An Extra Chair  Not A Lot Of Room Once Meals And Drinks Were Ordered. There Was A Large Hen Party Having A Meal Who Were Very Noisy  Staff Did Ask Them To Be Quiet But Not Until They Had Been Very Loud For Well Over An Hour. The Whole Area Doesn't Seem To Cope Well With The Background Noise Of Chatter - It Had A Very Canteen Sound To The Whole Place. When I Booked Dinner On The Saturday Night I Was Expecting It To Be More Refined After Reading The Website And Looking At The Photos Of The Brasserie. I Purposely Didn't Book The Restaurant As I Thought It Looked Too Formal  But With Hindsight Might Have Been A Better Option.
column77: Pool Area At The Weekend Had Lots Of Children In It  Very Noisy. Wasn't Expecting It To Be Open To Children  Was Glad I Hadn't Booked For A Spa Weekend  Would Have Been Very Disappointed If I Was Hoping To Relax For The Day. Children Were Jumping In And Out Of The Jacuzzi Pools.
column84: Bar Staff In The Cocktail Bar On The Saturday Night Were Excellent  Very Knowledgeable  Able To Give Recommendations And Made Some Lovely Cocktails. Reception Staff Who Booked Us In Very Friendly And Efficient. Housekeeping Staff Very Courteous  Always Said Hello/Good Morning When Passing In Corridors Which I Always Find Nice.

column35: Check In Was Good But Dinner And Lunch Reservations Had Already Been Made For Us And We Were Not Told What Time As We Assumed It Was Buffet!
column39: The Was No Fridge For Milk And One If The Power Sockets Was Faulty  It Came On And Off. Tray Had No English Breakfast Tea  Just Herbal.
column53: A Great Relaxing Experience And All The Staff Were Excellent. Thank You
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: I Would Have Liked A Mini Fridge In The Room And There Were Not Enough Tea Bags. When My Friend Asked At Reception For More  She Got A Bit Of A Frosty Reception Even Though It Said In The Room Handbook That You Could Request More Teabags If Necessary.
column64: Both My Friend And I Agreed That The Food Was Out Of This World. Truly Impressive.

column35: More Information Needed Regarding The Room Required. Didn't Know Where Robe & Slippers Were Or Even How To Work The Air Con!
column39: The Condition Of The Room Has Put Me Off Having Another Overnight Stay. The Tv Had No Signal (Had To Call A Member Of Staff To Fix It). The Air Con Didn't Work. There Was Dried Up Chewing Gum Stuck On The Carpet Outside The Bathroom. The Complimentary Robe & Slippers Aren't Provided In The Room. We Only Found The Tea Making Facilities In A Drawer When We Were Checking Out.
column53: The Breakfast Was Lovely With An Extensive Choice. The Staff ( One Lady In Particular) Were Brilliant.
column64: Staff Were Attentive  Nice Atmosphere  Food Quality Was A Bit Of A Let Down Though (Served Warm Not Hot And A Bit Bland).
column77: Lots Of Flies In The Changing Room! Spa Itself Was Lovely. Only Criticism Of Staff Is That They Constantly Move Your Towels Of You're Not Sat On The Sun Lounger When They Walk Round (We Were Having A Dip In The Pool)
column84: The Lady At Breakfast Was So Friendly To My Daughter And Vey Attentive. Unfortunately I Don't Know Her Name!
column89: The Staff Work Very Hard Znd Do A Good Job But The Actual Room And Cleanliness Of It And The Changing Rooms Really Let Your Hotel Down. There Are Other Better Options For An Overnight Spa Break. The Spa Itself Is Lovely Though.

column84: Spanish Girl At Reception Was Exceptionally Helpful And Serviceminded

column35: We Cycled So Did Not Notice The Parking.
column39: Husband Found Bed Too Soft. I Was So Tired That I Did Not  Although I Could See In The Morning That It Was Not As Firm As I Would Like.
column53: My Breakfast Consisted Of Simply Toast And Tea. I Was Unimpressed By The Thin  Plastic Quality Of The Bread. As You Had Superior Bread At The Buffet  I Would Have Much Preferred To Be Allowed To Toast This  But There Was No Facility For This. I Accept That Had I Partaken Of The More From The Buffet Or Menu I May Have Been Impressed!
column64: We Attempted To Have A Cocktail Before Dinner At The Bar. After More Than 15 Minutes My Husband Walked In To Say We Had Dinner Reservations. The Staff Had Not Even Begun This Order. I Understand That There Was A Large Table Which Took Up Their Time But We Considered This Unacceptable  And At The Least  Should Have Been Informed Of The Wait. We Cancelled The Order. However  As I Have Evaluated Above  The Meal In The Restaurant Truly Surpassed Our Expectations. All Waiting Staff Were Superb  As Was The Food.
column83: Only In The Cocktail Bar  Which I Detailed In The Previous Comment.
column84: The Doorman Was Very Friendly And Chatty. He Was Very Pleasant To Talk With. We Had Cycled  And We Spoke Of The Local Area.
column89: More Staff In The Cocktail Bar On Busy Nights - And The Surliness Of One Of The Girls There Let The Side Down. That Apart  We Had A Lovely Stay And Would Come Again.

column35: Amazing As Always
column84: Brassier Manager  Maya  Louise In Spa

column35: For Some Reason The Staff Were Convinced The Apartment Was Not Big Enough For 2 Adults And 2 Very Small Children (3 And 5Yrs) And Kept Pushing Us To Stay In The Family Room. They Wouldnt Stop Until I Said Id Look At The Room  Baring In Mind My Brother In Laws Wedding Was About To Start Any Second. We Looked At The Room And It Wasnt Bigger It Just Had Two Sofa Beds Instead Of One  But It Was All One Room.  I Said Yes To It Just To Get The Staff Off My Back And I Was Hassled About Needing To Settle Before The Wedding.   However  The Staff Werent Right In Their Decision Because My Son Kept Us Up Until 3.30Am Because If They Were Parents They Would Realise You Absolutely Cannot Share A Room With Your Children  You Will Not Sleep.  So While They Were Convinced The Sofa Bed Wasnt Big Enough For 2  It Was. I Know My Children And I Know We All Would Have Had A Much Better Night Sleep Had They Have Just Left Us Alone In The Apartment  Where We Would Have Had A Bedroom For Us And The Boys Very Easily Could Have Shared The Sofa Bed.  Next Time  Dont Do This With Other Parents  You Dont Know Best.

column53: The Wait Staff Needed To Be Asked Many Times For Tea  Coffee  Toast. Some Was Brought Some Wasnt. They Seemed To Serve The Top Of Our Table Out Of Ease And Kept Giving Everything To Them  It Was Very Frustrating. I Didnt Realise There Was A Menu  We Werent Informed Of One.
column83: Regarding The Room.
column89: Lack Of A Concirege Or Valet Parking Is Ridiculous.  I Got To The Check In Desk And Was Met By A New Member Of Staff Who Couldnt Do A Thing And Was Too Quiet To Ask One Of The Other Two Staff Members For Help  So I Had To Wait While Other People Bothered Them  Even Though I Needed To Sort Out The Mess With The Room And Get To My Brother In Laws Wedding. It Was Very Frustrating.
column90: Im Really Disappointed. I Think The Hotel Needs A Facelift Generally As Everywhere Looks Very Tired. The Ballroom Where The Wedding Was Apparently Was Alll New  But You'd Never Know. The Entire Place Looks Old Fashioned  Nothing Seems Clean  The Lift Is Rickety And The Bride Got Trapped In There On The Way To The Reception.

column39: The Room Was Very Chilly And It Took Ages To Hear Up  Decided To Have A Bath To Warm Up But Both The Bath And Shower Provided Only Tepid Warer-Most Unpleasant
column53: The Service Was V Chaotic And We Ordered Toast At Least Twice And It Never Came  Gave Up In The End
column64: On My Booking Confirmation It Confirmed That We'd Be Dining In The Restaurant For Our Dinner (Incl In The Deal) However We Were Booked In To The Brasserie. Food Was Mediocre And Both My Boyfriend And I Suffered From Sickness The Following Day. Only Thing That We'd Eaten The Same We're The Burgers From Your Brasserie
column83: We Tried To Get Room Service On The Sunday Morning But The Line Just Rang Out  We Tried For Over Half An Hour But To No Avail -V Frustrating

column39: Biscuits With The Tea/Coffe Making Facilities Would Be Nice For A Hotel Of This Stature.
column48: I Never Understand Why Such Basic Choices Are Offered For Room Service. When There Is A Full Menu In The Brasserie And Restaurant. I Travel For Business A Lot And You All Offer The Same Boring Room Service Menu. As A Lady Travelling Alone  I Prefer To Dine In My Room And Am Always Disappointed With The Choices.
column89: A Large Queue And One Lady Coping On Her Own  Who I Must Say Was Very Pleasant And Was Trying To Work As Quickly As Possible. Another Lady Walked Out Of The Back Office Area And Although Saw The Large Queue  Did Not Assist And Left Her Colleague To Do It Alone. This Lady Just Walked Away To Another Part Of The Hotel...I Am Sure It Was Not Her Role To Do Reception At That Time But Great Customer Service Would Have Been To Stay And Help Or Get Someone Else From The Back Room To Help. This Made Me Late For My Meeting In The Morning. The Lady On Reception Did Apologise To Me For My Wait Which Was Appreciated.
column90: A Lovely Hotel And I Do Prefer To Work At Our Office In St Albans Rather Than In London When I Travel South   As I Always Feel I Have Had A Great Rest When I Stay.

column8: Did Not Stay - Despite Booking And Paying In Advance  You Sold Our Rooms.
column20: Company; An Post/Air Business Frequent Users Or Should I Say Were!
column83: Prepaid Room Sold!

column35: A Few Technical Hitchs With The Printer And A Small Accent Problem At Reception But It Happens !
column53: I Had The Buffet But Agree With All The Above

column90: Was In Room 233 Which Was Noisy As Could Hear Wedding Dj Underneath And People Outside Our Room Arguing/Smoking So Had To Ring Reception At 11Pm. Was On Spabreak So Would Have Preferred Earlier Check In Or Later Check Out As Was A Bit Rushed. Also Have Been Coming To Hotel Last 18 Years And Was Promised Upgrade At Time Of Booking But When We Booked In Received Nothing. I Also Think They Should Have Taken Money Off Our Bill On Check Out As We Did Not Get A Goodnight Sleep Which Is The Whole Point Of Relaxing Spa Break
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column83: There Was A Mix Up With Treatment Times Which Inconvenienced  The Rest Of Our Stay.

column53: The Servers Took My Plate Away Before I Was Ready Multiple Times. I Liked The Quieter Room For The Breakfast Buffet (The More Formal Dining Room) Because The Brassiere Was Too Loud.
column64: Again  The Service Was A Little Strange - I Wasn't Sure The Waiter Understood My Order  And He Missed Another Person At The Table. Fortunately The Food Came Out Correctly And It Was Very Good.
column77: The Woman At The Front Desk Of The Spa/Pool Area Was Very Friendly An Helpful.
column83: Once When I Arrived Back At The Hotel  A Staff Member Blocked My Way And Asked If I Needed Help In A Very Rude Way. I Was Carrying A Bag And Wanted To Get Upstairs And Had To Explain That I Was Staying In The Hotel In Order To Get Past Her.
column84: The Housekeeping Was Very Efficient And Effective And The Woman At The Pool/Spa Desk Was Very Helpful.
The Spa Team Were Especially Good
column89: The Only Issue We Had Was Beyond The Control Of The Hotel - Very Noisy Wedding Guests Wandering About The Corridors And Having Chats And Arguments - This Woke Us Up At 2Am And Carried On For At Least Half An Hour.
column90: We Will Definitely Be Rebooking For Next Year. The Sunday Lunch Was Also Very Enjoyable.

column35: We Asked For An Early Check In  However Our Room Was Not Available On Arrival. The Spa Staff Were Excellent  However The Service We Received Everywhere Else In The Hotel Was Appalling Considering The Premium We Paid To Stay With You. We Waited For 45 Minutes On The Terrace Area Before A Waiter Even Took Our Order.  It Then Took 20 Minutes To Serve Us 2 Drinks. Later That Evening Our Friends Came To Pick Us Up To Go To A Function And We Decided To Have Some Drinks On The Terrace Before We Left.  Again It Took Around 20 Minutes For Someone To Take Our Order.  The Waiter Who Took Our Order Clearly Could Not Understand Us And 3 Of The 4 Drinks Ordered Were Wrong.  We Were Then Presented With Another Table's Bill For Â£107. On Both Occasions The Terrace Was Barely Half Full.  There Were Simply Not Enough Staff There And Those That Were There Appeared Incompetent. The Next Morning Was No Better  The Breakfast Buffet Was Empty And Not Being Refilled  There Again Seemed To Be Very Few Staff On Duty And We Waited An Eternity To Eat. Our Final Ordeal Was Checking Out.  Stood In A Queue At Reception For 30 Minutes.  I Explained My Dissatisfaction To The Girl On The Desk.  She Referred Me To A Lady Who Was Introduced As The Duty Manager.  She Felt The Best Way To Deal With My Complaint Was To Make A Joke About It And Tell My Wife To Cheer Up!  She Was Trying To Be Friendly  However Massively Misjudged The Situation And Compounded The Incredibly Poor Service We Had Already Received. She Went Off To Find The Manager  But He Was Off Duty.  She Promised That The Manger Would Call Me Later That Day And I Gave Her My Mobile Number.  It Is Now 3 Days Later And Unsurprisingly I Have Not Received A Call. It Is A Rare Treat For Myself And My Wife To Have A Child Free Night Away And We Had Travelled 180 Miles From Our Home In North Wales.  Including Spa Treatments And My Wife's Visit To The Hair Salon  We Spent Â£400 On Our One Nights Stay With You And Our Lasting Impression Of Sopwell House Is The Appalling Level Of Service We Received.
column39: Very Nice Room  But Very Small For An 'Executive Double'
column83: See Previous Comments.
column84: Holly From The Spa Was Excellent  Very Friendly And Professional

column39: Booking Was For 3 People But One Bed Was A Sofa Bed Which Was Lopsided And Uncomfortable.
column64: Tony Who Looked After Us Was Exceptional And So Friendly And Knowledgeable.
column84: Tony -As Stated Before. Helpful  Friendly  Funny  Attentive. Brilliant Service Above And Beyond Expectations.

column39: The Room Itself Was Fine  Very Clean And All You Would Need. Only Minor Issue Was That There Wasn't Any View Which Was A Shame. Our Fourth Visit So A Little Disappointing  But Not Really A Problem.
column84: Quite A Few Members Of Staff Waiting In The Brasserie For Each Meal Of Our Stay Were Very Helpful And Attentive.  Sarah  Who Did My Facial Treatment In The Spa Was Lovely  Very Professional.

column39: Room 158 - Bath Panel Was In Poor State.
column64: Vegetarian Options Need Expanding  Although Staff Did Say That The Cooks Could Russle Up Something For The Main. Veggie Starter Option Was Poor.
column83: After Eating At The Brasserie In The Evening  I Told The Staff Member That My Card Details Were Taken At Reception And That The Incidentals Could Be Charged To It.  When I Reached My Room  I Had A Phone Call To Say That My Card Details Were Not Given To Reception.  I Insisted I Had  Confirming My Amex Was Handed Over At The Time.  The Staff Member Then Said She Would Contact The Desk Again To Confirm. As I Didn't Get A Phone Call Back To Say That Everything Was In Order (Which I Guessed It Was By The Absence Of The Call)  I Also Did Not Get An Apology For The Misunderstanding Between The Brasserie And Reception Staff. This Was The Only Thing Which Irritated Me And I Felt  Could Of Been Handled By The Staff In Question Better.
column84: Being Hindu Vegetarians  I Felt That The Asian Staff In The Brasserie Where Generally More Aware Of Our Needs And Were Better At Trying To Accommodate Us.
column89: Other Than The Confusion With The Cards Details And The Genuine Variety Of Options For Veggies  Nothing More Really.

column89: Maybe More Signs  Very Easy To Get Lost. I Had One 55Min Treatment Even I Booked Two Night  But If I Book One Night I Could Have Two 30Min Treatments  Little Bit Confusing Why Is It.
column90: It Was Very Nice Experiences  And Probably My Best Short Break  Thank You Very Much
