column48: I Had Paid My Bill On Check In  At The Hotels Insistence As I Dont Have A Credit Card. I Ordered Some Room Service  And Signed For It.  Thereafter I Was Interrupted Three Times Demanding Payment And Treating Me Like A Common Criminal. I Was Told I Had To Pay  I Said I Would Pay On Check Out  No There Is No Credit You Will Pay Cash. When I Informed Him That Was Impossible He Went Away To Think. I Was Later Told I Should Come And Pay; I Declined. I Was Then Told Someone Would Come And Collect My Card And Tae Payment Before Returning It.   It Goes Without Saying I Did Not Appreciate This. I Am A Regular Visitor To Quality Hotels And Have Never  Encountered Either This Problem Or The Proposed Manner Of Dealing With It.
column83: See Room Service Comments- The Staff Who Brought My Room Service Were Excellent- So I Dont Say Alyour Staff Are Belligerent It May Be The Policy The Hotel Employs That Is At Fault.

column20: Competition Win Through Good Spa Guide
column35: Communications Between The Spa And General Reservations Were Poor. Information Was Either Not Passed On Or Passed On Incorrectly Elongating The Booking Process  Requiring Further Emails And Calls.
column64: The Acoustics In The Brasserie Are Poor. We Had Three Meals There And All Were Unbearably Loud Simply Due To The Way Human Voices Bounce Round The Area. Primarily This Is Due To The Lack Of Soft Furnishings Which Would Absorb Some Of The Noise
column77: Whilst The Staff We Met We're Incredibly Pleasant And Friendly  The Treatments Myself And My Partner Received Were Not To The Standard Expected.   Our Mini Mani And Pedi Were Rushed  The Varnish On My Mani Untidy And Colour Left On My Fingers  Varnish Chipping In Under 24Hrs.   Back Neck And Shoulder Massage Received By My Partner Was Rushed And Of No Relaxation Benefit As It Was Too Light - A Rub Rather Than A Massage.   I Paid For An Espa Eye Treatment As Well As My Mini Facial. Aside From The Time Taken  Which Was Longer Than The Mini Facial Time  I Did Not Feel That My Eye Area Received Any More Attention Than It Would In A Regular Facial. Most Disappointing As Previous Eye Treatments At Other Salons  Including Espa Ones Have Been Lovely And I've Both Felt And Seen A Benefit. That Eye Treatment On Saturday Was Over Priced And Of Poor Quality In My Opinion.   So Disappointing. Had Our Experience Been More Favourable We Would Have Been Back To Sopwell To Stay Particularly To Use The Spa Facilities. It Is Doubtful Now Unless We Are Required In The Sea On Business.
column83: Quality Of Spa Treatments. Please See Previous Comments.

column77: Lack Of Leisure Space Around Pool. Not Enough Benches. Screaming Children Broke The Relaxing Atmosphere.
column84: The Younge Lady Working In The Terrace Bar. Long Braided Black Hair. Very Professional And Friendly! A  True Star

column90: Only Slight Negative Was Dinner At The Brasserie Which We Felt Didn't Meet The Standard Of Breakfast And Lunch The Following Day. It Was Good  But Not Excellent.

column89: I Am Pregnant And Therefore Not Drinking Alcohol. Although When Asked Staff Happily Listed A Number Of Non-Alcoholic Drinks - One Saying 'We Can Do Anything You Like' - I Would Like To Have Seen Some Non-Alcoholic Options Listed On The Menu Or Wine/Drinks List  Both In The Brasserie And The Cocktail Lounge (Didn't Visit Restaurant Or Terrace).

column39: Some Of The Towels In Room Were Not Very Clean

column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: We Had The Mews Apartment And Was Disappointed At The Lack Of Cleaning That Had Taken Place  Had Lots Of Cobwebs All Around The Bedroom  Especially Behind The Tv. Also Found Spiders In The Bath  Worst Of All Was Hairs In The Bath Where It Had Not Been Cleaned Properly.
column48: We Came For A  Relaxing Night For My Partners Birthday  Thought Having Breakfast In The Room Would Be Nicer And More Relaxing Than Having It In The Dining Area  However We Left Our Room Service Card Out And It Was Not Collected  We Then Had To Walk Over To Reception To Ensure We Could Have Breakfast In Our Room Which Defeated The Point For Us.
column53: We Came To Have A Relaxing Evening Morning Together As First Weekend In A Long Time Without Our Daughter  We Decided To Have Breakfast In The Room  We Left Our Room Service Card Out As Required  However It Was Not Collected  We Then Had To Go To Reception With Our Order To Ensure Breakfast Could Be Delivered  Defeated The Object Really
column89: We Expected A Clean Room First And Foremost  Especially For The Price For One Night  It Was Disappointing That We Was Offered A Downgraded Room Because Of The Mess  Which We Did Not Take As We Had Paid For Our Room.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column84: All Were Lovely. Staff That Tidied Our Room Did A Fab Job. Huge Thanks To Them!!!
column89: More Comfortable Bed But Then Again We're All Different And My Husband Found It Fine.
column90: Just Very Happy With The Whole Experience In St Albans And Hope To Return Again One Day!!!

column8: My Son Is On Trial With Some Local Clubs So The Hotel Is Excellenty Positioned For This Plus The Pool  Gym And Spa Offer Excellent #Rest Day# Facilities To Any Athlete.
column39: We Always Stay In The 1 Bedroom Aptments Which Are Great But I Must Admit The Bathrooms Are A Bit Tired And The Beds Can Be Uncomfortable.
column84: Front Desk Staff Were Excellent

column35: When You Pull Into The Car Park  It Isn't Immediately Clear Where The Main Reception Is (The Entrance To The Conference Centre Is Very Visible  But Not The Hotel Reception.  A Sign Near The Conference Centre Entrance Pointing The Way To Eth Hotel Reception Would Be Useful.
column39: Room 124.  The Carpet Was Very Stained In Places Which Is Offputting. A Fridge / Mini Bar Would Be Welcome.

column35: No Real Directions To Where To Book In. Also 3Pm Is A Late Check In And Was To Are Room Wasnt Ready. It Was.
column53: Wasn't As Hot As It Should Have Been  But Was Enjoyable.
column64: Staff Were Very Helpful And Added Different Vegetable As To Ones That Were On Offered  Thanks To The Chef.
column77: We Had This Brought As A Gift With Treatments Included From A Choice Of 3 Do More  Information To Be Available As We Didn't Know Where To Go  And Wasted Time Trying To Find Out.  Also Not Many Beds Around Pool  Area
column89: When We Left We Were Told The Amount That Had To Be Paid Even Thou It Was All Paid For.

column64: We Really Enjoyed The Lunch Time Buffet
column77: The Swimming Pool Sol It For Us Loved The Pool
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column83: Very Slow Drink Service Both In The Bar Pre-Dinner And When In The Brasserie  For Tea In The Morning And For Drinks Generally
column84: Very Friendly Members Of The Brasserie Team - All Very Professional And Attentive Without Being Overly So.
column89: Improved Consistency. Not Having Been Over-Charged (It Was Sorted Out  But Didn't Feel Very Nice Having To Challenge The Bill).
column90: I Have Been Several Times To Sopwell House And Was Supposed To Be Reviewing It For Ukmums.Tv  But Whilst My Stay Was Fine  My Friend Stayed On An Extra Night And Had A Terrible Time  Not Getting The Meal She Ordered And The Service Taking A Long Time And Being Very Different To What We'd Experienced With The Friendly Service Previously (They Left The Restaurant At 10Pm After Just A Starter) Having A Room Over A Noisy Wedding Party And Several Other Problems That Spoilt Their Stay. I Therefore Am Unable To Write A Fair Review As Whilst There Were Lots Of Excellent Parts To The Stay  It's All Too Inconsistent For Me To Be Able To Recommend The Hotel.

column64: Meal Was Part Of Wedding Party

column39: Although It Wasn't Clear When We Booked (Ladies Spa Break)  We Had Expected A Twin Room And We Had A Double.  However  The Reception Staff Were Incredibly Helpful And Were Able To Immediately Move Us To A Twin Room.  We Were Very Impressed With How Smoothly And Professionally This Was Handled.
column77: Unknowingly  We Arrived Early And It Was Explained That We Could Not Use The Facilities Until Check In.  This Was Bit Disappointing  But Completely Understandable.  We Felt The Leisure Staff Could Have 'Sold' The Other Areas Of The Hotel Available To Us  Whilst We Waited.  For Example  I Would Have At Least Suggested Having A Drink In The Bar Area Or Suggested Walking Around The Grounds Or Visiting The Nearby Furniture Store/Area - All Of Which We Did.
column84: Reception Staff - They Were Great
column89: I Had Been To Sopwell House On A Spa Break For A 40Th Birthday A Few Years Ago.  I Expected My Experience To Be At Least The Same But It Was Much Better And I Will Definitely Be Booking Another Spa Break With More Of My Friends Again Soon:)

column84: Jenny And The Reception Staff Were Very Good
column89: On Check Out My Wife Who Stayed With Me The Night Did Not Have My Business Credit Card. I Did Call To Pay But Was Told Someone Would Call Back But They Didn't.  I Understand Your Policy But It Did Leave My Wife With Our Young Child In An Awkward Position When Told She Would Have To Pay Before Leaving As They Could Not Take Payment From Me Over The Phone Although I Have Used This Card At Your Hotel On Numerous Occasions. My Wife Said Your Staff Were Very Good  A Call Back To Me To Explain This Would Have Been Good. I Like Your Hotel Very Much And Enjoy Staying There  It's Not A Big Problem But Something From A Customer I Just Water To Point Out.

column53: It Would Be Nice If You Were Offered Tea  Coffee And Toast When You Are Shown To The Table. By The Time We Got Someone's Attention To Ask For Toast Breakfast Was Nearly Finished
column64: We Stayed 3 Nights. Two In Brasserie. I Was Disappointed To Order Soup Of The Day On The Second Night. Only To Find It Was The Same Soup As The Night Before!!! We Paid Extra To Dine In The Restaurant Which Was Lovely
column77: Could Do With More Sun Loungers
column90: If We Came Back I Think We Would Avoid Weekends As Having Weddings There Makes It A Lot Busier And We Had Problems On The Friday Night With Guests In The Room Next To Us We Were In Room 115. They Woke Us Up At 1.15Am Until Gone 2.

column39: Rooms 114 And 118 - There Could Be More English Tea  And There Should Be Bottles Of Water Included In The Package.
column64: The Waiting Staff Was Very Pleasant And Welcoming.
column77: We Thoroughly Enjoyed The Steam Room  Sauna And Swimming.
column83: One Morning For Breakfast - We Were Completely Forgotten About And Had To Ask For Tea And Toast About 4 Times.
column84: There Was A Portuguese Waiter In The Dining Room - Extremely Pleasant  Warm  Professional And Proficient.
column89: There Should Be Instructions On How To Control The Temperature And To Switch On The Heater In The Bathroom.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column8: Point Of Rest For Our Relocation Towards London
column53: Honey! Could Be Italian  Which Is The Best Quality
column90: Thank You For That Day  But Definitely We Will Visit Again! Beautiful Place Paradise On Earth
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column64: We Have Dined Previously In The Brasserie And Was Very Disappointed With The Experience Particularly With One Of The Waiters Who We Believe May Be A Senior Member Of Staff. We Observed Him To Be Rather Abrupt To Another Member Of Staff On A Few Occasions.  O. Our Recent Visit  This Particular Member Of Staff Was In The Brasserie And Had Made A Mistake With One Of My Orders. I Did Not Recieve An Apology  Or Any Kind Of Reparation. What I Did Receive Was  An Explanation Of The Different Menus Which The Staff Work With And Attempted To Suggest I Had Made The Error. Once Pointed Out That He Had Made The Mistake I Still Did Not Receive An Apology And Little Responsibility Taken If Any. I Did Not Challenge This Further As I Did Not Want This To Spoil Our Stay. However  We Were Not Happy Or Comfortable With This.
column89: To Apologise For The Mistake In The Brasserie & To Offer Some Form Of Replacement Or Complimentary Alternative.

column39: Room 236 - Found Bed Too Soft And As A Double Bed  It Would Have Been Tough For 2 People To Sleep In It. Furniture Was Too Big For The Room  Therefore Reducing Space.
column48: Ordered Breakfast. There Was More Choice For Breakfast If You Went Down For Breakfast  Instead Of Ordering To The Room. Items Were Not On The Menu But Were In The Breakfast Room. Also The Way To Select The Items Was Not Great. E.G. You Could Have Toast Or Croissant But Not Both  As Only 1 Item Per Section.
column64: The Room Was Very Noisy
column90: The Piano Player Beside The Bar Is Very Loud And It Just Makes It Very Hard To Talk With People While In The Bar Area.  Also Problem With A Lift Getting Stuck. Was Described As Frequent So Didnt Use The Lift During Our Stay

column35: We Were Not Informed About The Times For Breakfast On Sunday And I Had To Ask Questions About The Spa/Pool Opening Times.  Would Be Helpful If We Were Provided With A Little More Information At Check In.
column39: There Was No Mini Bar And Two Of The Lamps In The Room Were Not Working.  We Also Had No Robes Or Slippers.  When We Called To Reception To Ask For The Lamps To Be Fixed They Said They Would Send Someone Up.  This Did Not Happen During Our Stay.  We Also Asked About Robes And Were Informed That They Had Not Come Back From The Laundry Yet.  We Didn't Check In Until Almost 5Pm Which Meant We Had To Wait For Over An Hour Before Robes Were Available And We Could Go Into The Spa.  By Which Time It Was Getting Late And We Had Very Little Time To Use The Facilities Before Our Table Reservation For Dinner.
column53: Good Selection And We Dined In The Restaurant Which Was A Very Pleasant A Room.
column77: I Was Not Able To Book Into The Spa Because They Were Fully Booked When I Called Up The Week Before To Book A Treatment.
column83: Maintenance Did Not Come Up To Fix The Lamps As We Had Requested.  I Was Also 7 Months Pregnant During Our Visit.  I Ordered A Virgin Mojito From The Cocktail Bar In The Afternoon And Was Given A Lemon  Lime And Bitters (With Some Limp Mint In) By The Barman.  Bitters Has A Small Level Of Alcohol In Which I Definitely Had Not Requested!
column89: I Mentioned These Issues To The Reception Staff On Check Out And She Made No Effort To Try And Resolve Any Of The Issues Or See If She Could Improve Our Experience In Any Way.
column90: We Booked Last Minute And Were Very Much Looking Forward To A Late Escape.  Especially Seeing As I Am Quite Heavily Pregnant And This Could Well Be Our Last Opportunity For Some Time To Get Away And Be Spontaneous.  Very Disappointing Stay Overall.  The Grounds Were Lovely & We Enjoyed Our Dinner In The Brasserie But Overall The Service & Experience Fell Way Below Our Expectations.

column35: We Arrived At 3.10 And Were Told Our Room Was Being Checked.  We Were Asked To Sit Down.  We Waited Until About 3.40 And Then Asked What Was Happening.  No-One Offered Us Tea  Coffee Or Anything.  Other People Arriving After Us Were Given Keys.  After We Complained  Someone Offered To Get Us A Drink.  When It Arrived  I Said That We Should Get A Discount As The Room Was Not Ready.  No Apologies Were Offered At All.  We Were Shown To Our Room And Then Got A Call Saying We Can Be Upgraded To Another  Better Room.  Whilst I Was Happy With This  Fundamentally The Initial Service Was Poor.  Had We Been Offered A Drink  We Would Have Been Fine.  As It Was  We Were Waiting  Getting Frustrated.  You Should Be Alive To The Fact That If A Room Is Not Ready (And This Happens  I Am Not Too Bothered About It) A Drink Should Be Offered.  It Would Make All The Difference To The Experience.
column53: Table Service For Tea/Coffee Would Be Far Better
column83: See Earlier  Room Not Ready  No Drink Offered  No Checking On Us In Reception
column89: See Earlier
column90: No

column39: The Overall Feel Of The Room Could Have Been More Cosy  It Was A Bit Stark.  The Bathroom Needs Updating  Quite A Lot Of Mould / Limescale And The Shower Was Tempermental
column64: I Had Pre Booked The Brasserie When I Made The Accommodation Booking  However There Was No Record Of Our Reservation When We Went Down To The Brasserie  But Luckily We Were Squeezed In
column83: Just A Point To Make Re The Renovations Happening At The Hotel During Our Stay  Meant There Was No Stair Free Access To Our Room.  This Should Have Been Made Aware To Us At The Time Of Booking Or A The Very Least When We Arrived

column35: We Were Greeted In The Car Park By A Member Of Staff Who Welcomed Us And Assisted Us With Our Bags. Excellent.
column39: 210 The Room Was Immaculate. Very Impressive And Had A Balcony View. Many Thanks.
column48: The Room Service To Us On Our Can Only Be Described As Horrendous. We Had To Contact Reception Several Times As Our Food Took Well Over An Hour To Arrive  Then Was Cold  Incorrect And Not At An Acceptable Standard.
column53: One Member Of Staff Was Exceptionally Helpful And Delivered Super Customer Service. Wish I Had Taken His Name To Give Feedback To His Manager!
column77: Excellent  Well Designed Facilities In A Relaxing Environment.
column83: There Was Some Complication With Our Spa Booking Which Made Us Feel Uncomfortable At The Reception. However The Manager Later Dealt With The Issue In A Very Professional Manner And Communicated With Us Very Well.
column84: The Manager At The Spa Impressed My Wife And I With His Dedication And Commitment To Put Things Right. Also His Attention To Detail To Ensure Our Stay Was Enjoyable. Thank You Very Much From Us Both.
column89: There Was A Wedding Taking Place On The Day Of Our Arrival  Parking Was An Issue And At Times Noise Levels Were Understandably Loud. I Wish We Had Been Advised Of This Prior To Booking.
column90: Thank You For Making Us Your Welcome Guests And We Hope To Visit Again Soon. Our Executive Room Was Provided To Us In Immaculate Condition And We Did Our Best To Leave It As We Found It. We Really Hope Other Visitors Enjoy The Room As Much As We Did. Thank You To All Your Staff  Neil And Nicola Joseph
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Excellent Service
column39: Mews 11 Was Just Lovely
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: 220 Considering This Was A Superior Room In A 4* Hotel  I Was Hugely Disappointed With A Water Stain In One Of The Corners Of The Ceiling. I Also Found The Quilt To Be Poor Quality And The Valance Had Stains On It Too. For A Hotel With A Great Reputation These Were Not The Standard I Was Expecting.
column53: The Staff Did Not Seem Very Attentive In The Morning And One Particular Waiter Seemed To Be On Edge. I Do Not Think That Cleaning The Floor Whilst Guests Are Still Eating Is Appropriate.
column64: I Enjoyed My Meal In The Brasserie But Could Not Believe When As Soon As I Had Finished My Starter The Main Course Was Served. I Had To Request A Break Between The Main And Dessert. It Was A Real Shame As It Did Feel That We Were Rushed For The Whole Dining Experience.
column84: There Was A Very Courteous Friendly Member Of Staff Who Took Our Bags To Our Room Unfortunately I Do Not Remember His Name.
column90: I Wish I Had Complained At The Tome In The Hotel But I Was With My Best Friend On Her 40Th Birthday Celebration And Did Not Want To Cause Any Embarassment.

column89: Would Have Been Nice To Be Able To Use The Leisure Facilities Before 3Pm As This Seems Quite Late In The Day. Especially If Dining In The Restaurant During The Evening. But Stay Was Wonderful  Thank You
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Only Reason There Was A Lack Of Parking Was Because There Was A Large Wedding There That Day
column53: Breakfast Was Part Of The Spa Package Deal  We Had It Delivered To The Room - It Wasn't Very Warm
column90: Great Stay  Will Be Returning Thanks To All The Staff.

column39: 105. Lovely Room  Well Appointed. Slightly Disappointed That On The Thursday I Requested That The Room Be Cleaned At 4.30Pm As We Were Getting Ready All Day For Our Wedding At 5Pm And I Wanted The Room To Look Nice For When We Returned To It That Night  But Only The Bed And Towels Were Done - The Plates And Dirty Glasses Were Still In The Room And The Furniture Not Arranged Back Tidily Or The Dressing Table Tidied.
column64: We Ordered 15 Lunches On The Terrace And 2 Didn't Arrive. However When We Spoke To The Staff They Did Not Charge Us For The Two Late Meals. The Service Was Excellent. On The Friday The Hotel Seemed To Be Packed (I Think There Was 2 Weddings?) And The Bars Were Understaffed - We Waited 30 Minutes For Coffees.
column83: As Mentioned Before The Room Cleaning. Slow Service On The Busy Day But That Wasn't The Fault Of The Staff  I Feel You Needed To Have More Staff On To Cope With The Higher Volume.
column84: The Therapist Who Gave Me My Massage Was Exceptional - The Reception Staff Were Extremely Helpful And The Guys Who Brought Room Service Were Very Very Nice
column89: I Just Think More Staff At Busy Times. And Also I Was Disappointed On Our Wedding Night To Come Back To A Messy Room When I Had Asked For The Room To Be Done.
column90: Sopwell House Was Lovely - I Believe We Had 12 Rooms In Total And Everyone Was Very Impressed With Our Stay And Loved The Spa. We Will Definitely Return And Thank All The Staff For Their Friendliness And Helpfulness

column39: I Didn't Think It Was Worth Upgrading For The Money It Cost Versus The Quality Of The Room.
column53: Felt A Bit Sorry For People Who Had Booked A Table For Dinner As There Was A Screechy Hen Party Which Rather Dominated The Brasserie. Difficult To Keep Everyone Happy Realistically. On One Hand You Have Those Who Have Come To Relax And Unwind For A Spa Weekend And On The Other You Have A Hen Party That Wants To Be Raucous And Have Fun Understandably.
column84: I Think He Was The Maitre'd But I Can't Remember His Name Sadly. Avuncular Mediterranean Looking Gentleman Who Made Everyone Feel Like They Were The Most Important Guests In The Brasserie Without Being Obsequious. I Remember Him From My Last Visit. Quite Often It Is The Way Staff Make You Feel In A Hotel That Leaves You Your Lasting Impression Of A Place.
column89: There Were Some Chavvy Little Shits In The Pool But That Can't Be Helped.

column35: Staff Were Extremely Efficient And Helpful
column39: 122 Very Happy
column53: Very Pleased With Breakfast
column64: Excellent
column77: The Area To Sit Around The Pool And The Outside Seating Was Excellent
column84: All Staff Were Exceptional
column89: Extremely Happy With Our Stay. Faultless! If I Had To Find Fault It Would Be The Showers In The Room Were Not Very Hot
column90: The Spa  Food  Staff And All Facilities Were Absolutely Outstanding
Hotel Is Feeling A Bit Tired To Be Honest

column39: Loved The 4 Poster Bed! Great To Have Sky Tv!
column53: Once We Were Taken To Our Table  We Were Not Advised Of What Service Would Be Given. We Were Not Sure If It Was Self Service Or Table Service So Had To Watch Other Guests First. I Had To Ask One Of The Kitchen Staff For Tea And Was Then Told A Waitress Would Come Round. We Were Not Asked If We Had Any Dietary Requirements. I'm Vegetarian And Would Have Liked Vegetarian Sausages But Didn't Get The Opportunity To Request These So Had To Choose From What Was Available. In Future  It Would Be Beneficial To Be Advised Of The Breakfast Offering And Service Whilst Being Greeted.
column77: Lovely Selection Of Leisure Items Eg Jacuzzi  Sauna Etc. The Warm Wall Was Extremely Nice

column39: 14 Mews Apartment As We Had Our Daughter With Us We Used The Sofa Bed And I Do Think That These Should Be Updated As They Are Really Quite Uncomfortable.
column64: I Wish That The Menu Had A Little More Choice  However What We Selected Was Very Good.
column90: The Only Comment I Would Make Is That Whilst Having A Drink In The Bar After Dinner With My Husband And Daughter A Member Of Staff Was Overheard Telling Another Member Of Staff Off And Some Inappropriate Language Was Used Bearing In Mind They Were In A Public Place. It Was Around 9Pm In The Evening And Our Daughter Is 9 Years Old And Is Not Used To Hearing Strong Language. Other Than This Incident We Had A Very Pleasant Stay And This Is The Fourth Occasion We Have Stayed At Sopwell House.

column35: Concierge Experience Delightful
column64: Beautiful Surroundings

column20: It Was A Friend's Wedding Venue
column35: We Had Already Booked Online And Wanted To Upgrate Our Room. I Made An Enquiry By Email And This Was All Done For Us Very Efficiently  Which Was Very Good.
column39: Room 215 (Executive Suite With Balcony): Very Nice Room; Balcony A Bit Of A Disappointment; Limited View; Bathroom A Bit Small For A Suite (In Comparison To Others That We Have Stayed In); Also  When I Book An Executive Suite I Would Normally Expect A Separate Living Room (E.G. As In The Radisson Edwardian Suites) Not Just An Area Beside The Bed. Nevertheless  It Was A Nice Room.
column53: The Breakfast (In Room) Arrived On Time On Both Days (Unusual For A Hotel!) And Was Actually Very Nice -- Not Greasy Or Cold Etc. As They Sometimes Are.
column64: Presentation Of The Food Was Better Than The Taste; And  Although It Is Nice For Food To Have A 'Fine Dining' Look  Taste Is Everything.
column84: Becci Farmery Was Very Helpful In Arranging The Booking  Upgrade And Dinner Reservation.
column90: On Checking Out We Asked For Our Bags To Be Taken Down And This Didn't Happen. We Asked Again And It Did Happen  But Only After A Delay And The Taxi Had Already Arrived. As A Result  We Were Charged A Waiting Fee By Addison Lee. This Was A Bit Disappointing  But Otherwise Checkout Was Fine.

column64: The Only Criticism I Have Is That The Dinner Was Served Very Quickly We Had Just Finished Starters And It Had Been Cleared When The Main Course Arrived We Would Have Preferred A Little Gap In Between Courses.
column90: A Very Enjoyable Stay We Will Definitely Be Back.

column39: As We Said On Departing. The Bed In Room 151 Is Diabolical  It Has An Extremely Big Hole/Dip On The Left Hand Side. Had We Have Layed On The Bed Before We Went Out  We Would Most Certainly Have Complained And Insisted On Changing Rooms  But As We Didn't Get Back Til Very Late  We Didn't Bother. Charging Â£139 For That Is Ridiculous. We Did Complain At Check Out  But Just Got A Feeble Apology. I Sincerely Hope You Take Note And Purchase A New Mattress For That Room  As We Were Really Looking Forward To Spending The Night In A Supposedly Bespoke Hotel And It Totally Ruined Our Stay And Our Impression Of Your Hotel.
Pillows Were A Bit Sunken To Lie On  Room 127.
column64: Great Selection Of Delicious And Well Cooked Food.

column84: All The Staff Were Extremely Polite And Helpful.

column35: There Was A Wedding Taking Place And People Were Running Late So These People Were Rushed Ahead To Checkin In Front Of Us. Fair Enough But It Could Have Been Explained.
column39: Can't Remember The Room Number  But We Got Moved From Our First Room As The Generator Noise Outside Was Too Loud And Had To Have The Window Open As The Air Con Wasnt Working Very Well. Eventually Got Moved After Asking Twice And There Was Still Noise And The Bed Was A Temporary Pull Down Bed From The Wall. Wasnt As Uncomfortable As It Looked Though.
column64: The Staff Are Very Nice But Poorly Trained. We Were Meant To Have A Comp Bottle Of Wine  But There Was No Record Of This And They Didnt Know How To Sort It Out  Also They Sometimes Were Over Attentive And Felt Rushed To Get You Out The Restaurant  Then Next You Couldnt Get Their Attention For 10 Minutes. Food Was Lovely.
column77: It Was Over Busy. It Was A Bank Holiday So Expected To Be Busy But There Were No Seats To Wait For Spa Treatments And Nowehre To Lie By The Pool And Everywhere Lots Of People So It Didnt Feel Very Relaxing.
column83: Yes  Many - See Previous Comments
column84: The Girl Who Did My Spa Treatments Was Exceptional - Very Attentive And Knowledgeable - Think Her Name Was Natasha G?
column90: The Hotel Is A Lovely Setting And Has Lots Of Nice Aspects  But A Series Of Unfortunate Mishaps And Lack Of Attention And Care To Recover Them Made Me Feel Very Disappointed. Â£370 Is A Decent Amount Of Money For A Spa Night And It Felt Like We Were Staying At A Travel Lodge Some Of The Time.

column35: We Were Told Where Our Rooms Were But Given No Other Information. I.E. Location Of Spa Restaurant. Opening Times Etc.
column39: 235 There Appeared To Be A Problem With The Drainage In Our Bath And Our Friends Who Were Staying In Another Room Had Problems With The Flush On The Toilet. The Side Of The Bath In Our Suite Was Peeling And Tatty.
column53: We Were Met By A Very Rude Person In The Brasserie Who Told Us He Was Too Busy To Serve Us And That We Needed To Go To The Restaurant. The Restaurant Had A Sign Saying That It Was Reserved For A Wedding Party  So We Were A Little Confused. We Eventually Dined In The Restaurant And The Food Was Excellent.
column64: The Service Was Shocking  We Had To Ask For Drinks And Then Ask To Order  We Then Had To Ask Again To Order More Drinks. Our Glasses Were Empty For A Large Portion Of Our Meal!
column77: Spa Staff Were Very Warm And Friendly  We All Enjoyed Our Treatments Which Were Included In Our Package Deal. There Needs To Be More Loungers Available Or A System So That People Cannot Reserve Them If They Are Not Using Them.
column83: As Previously Stated We Were Very Uphappy With Most Of The Service We Received. The Reservations Team And Spa Staff Were Great. Everyone Else We Encountered Had Terrible Manners / Service Skills. I Work In High End Retail  So Know How Important Good Service Is. One Of Your Staff (Jobee?) Was Exceptionally Rude To My Friend By Telling Her That Her 'Asking If There Are Any More Puddings Are Not Going To Make Them Arrive Any Quicker'
column84: Jenny In Reservations Was Really Helpful When I Was Booking Our Break And Gave Me All The Information That I Needed.
column89: I Really Feel That I Would Not Come Back To Your Venue Or Recommend It To My Friends After The Service That Myself And My Friends Received. We Expected A Lot More For The Money And Reputation That You Have.

column39: Quite Small And Basic

column20: I've Been Coming For Over 15 Years Now
column53: Bacon Far Too Wet But That's Personal Preference

column39: We Had No Electricity On The First Night So My Husband Had A Poor Nights Sleep As He Wears Breathing Apparatus For Sleep Apnoea.
column53: Poor Childrens Menu And One Child Served Wrong Food  So Had To Wait For Her Choice. We Had All Finished By This Stage. I Had Pre-Booked Food So They Had No Excuse To Get This Wrong.
column83: Maintenance Sat Am. Personnel Very Good

column20: Had Previously Visited The Website Also
column53: We Did Have To Specifically Ask For Some Toast From A Waiter As It Was Not Made Clear Or Obvious That There Was Toast Available To Us
column64: After Dinner We Went And Sat In The Cocktail Bar And Had Brandy  The Piano Was Being Played And It Was A Wonderful Experience  A Real Pleasure.
column83: In The Terrace Bar - We Ordered Some Drinks On Our First Day Prior To Lunch  The Order Was Taken Fairly Promptly  However  The Drinks Took A Very Long Time To Reach Us.  I Could See That There Were 2 Staff On Duty That Were Servicing Both The Terrace Bar And The Brasserie And I Honestly Believe There Should Have Been More Staff On Duty.  Also  My Husband And I Were Given Drinks Menus Which Were Both Slightly Different  I Ordered An 'Apple Mac' Cocktail As Listed In My Menu  The Waiter Came Back And Said That It Was Not Listed In The Drinks Menu And I Said That That Was Where I Had Chosen It From But He Didn't Seem To Understand.  However  He Was Very Polite And Suggested Another Cocktail Which I Did Have And Was Excellent.
column89: No It Was All Excellent.
column90: My Husband And I Have Already Discussed Coming Back A Spa Day Treatment In The Near Future.

column64: Only Down Side Was A Noisy Hen Party During Dinner
column77: I'll Be Back!

column35: Very Good Quality Service.
column39: Room 121 Hotel Suite. Very Excellent Facilities And Comfort Was Brilliant.
column84: Yes The Porter Was Very Helpful And Professional

column48: Relatively Expensive (Particualrly Drinks) And Limited Choice
column83: Would Be Good Not To Be Disturbed By Housekeeping Prior To Check Out Time. Quite A Large Queue On Check-Out
column84: Reception Staff Very Friendly

column39: 121 I Was Delighted That The Bed Was So Comfortable  And The Pillows Were Lovely- Shame My Bag Was Too Small To Pinch Them!
column53: You Are Serving Different Sausages From Previously. Not Quite So Lovely  But I'll Forgive You!
column64: I Have Learnt It Is Impossible To Remain Ladylike Whilst Eating Linguine- But I Was So Relaxed And Comfortable That It Didn't Matter!
column77: It Would Be Nice If There Was A Wider Choice Of Treatments Available As Part Of The Spa Break Package.
column84: Alessandro  Who Welcomed Me To Lunch In The Brasserie  Enquired About My Stay  Asked If I Was Comfortable And Was Genuinely Lovely.
column89: Hot Chocolate Sachets In The Room- Always Had Them Before!!!
column90: Can't Wait To Return- Love It At Sopwell.

column83: We Were Told That Tea And Coffee Were Complimentary By One Of The Staff Only To Be Told By Another Once We Had Ordered That It Wasn't And That We Needed To Pay. Was Left Embarrassed.
column84: The Staff In The Cocktail Lounge Were Brilliant. Very Friendly And Helpful.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column89: Drop Your Prices For Drink An Absolute Joke  Â£4.50 For A Bottle Of Fosters Gold You Can Get Them For 80P And A Glass Of Chablis Â£10 And A Small Glass Aswell You Can Get A Bottle For Â£7 That Is Daylight Robbery.

column39: 127 Was Booked As A Deluxe Room But Was No Larger Or Better Equipped Than Twin Rooms I've Stayed In Before. Also I Forgot To Report That The Hairdryer Wasn't Blowing Hot Air.

column35: Lovely Welcome Upon Arrival  However The Check In Process In Reception Seemed Exceptionally Slow And We Had To Wait About 25 Min To Check In.     It Was Exactly The Same When We Came To Check Out  Another 20 Minute Wait. This Surely Can Be Improved Upon.
column39: Apartment 1 Was Fantastic. A Really Nice Surprise Which I Presume We Were Upgraded To As It Was Our Wedding Anniversary. Thank-You To Who Ever Was Responsible For This.
column77: Quite Annoying That People Leave Their Towels On Sun Loungers Whilst They Go Off For An Hour Or So For Lunch Or Treatments. With A Limited Number Of Loungers Available This Behaviour Should Be Discouraged.
column89: Check In And Check Out Process Was Far To Slow

column77: Just Very Busy And Not Condusive To Relaxing. Struggled To Get A Bed By The Pool.

I Was Greeted By A Very Helpful And Friendly Girl At The Spa Desk. The Gentleman In The Gym However Never Bothered Once To Acknowledge Me Or Talk To Me. He Seems Completely Disengaged With His Job And Looked Bored. Ironically I'm The Director Of Education For One Of The Largest Fitness Orgnizations In The World.
column84: I Forgot The Young Girl Who Worked At The Desk Of The Spa - She Worked There On Sept 26Th. Super Firendly  Helpful And Easy To Approach. As Was The Young Bell Hop. Miriam At The Front Desk Was Very Friendly As Well.

column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column53: One Night Spa Break So Wouldn't Know Individual Costings
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: Could Provide More Tea  Coffee And Milk.  Had To Call Reception For More Milk  Only Enough For 2 Cups.
column77: No Spa Treatments Left  Although I Did Book Very Late.

column20: Charity Event Held There And Rooms Available
column35: No
column39: Very Thick/Warm Quilt For The Time Of The Year. Mini Bar In The Room Would Have Been Good Too.
column90: The Cost Of Drinks Took The Edge Off The Weekend. The Prices Charged Are Not Appropriate. I Also Emailed The Hairdressers To Have A Bit Of Pampering On The Saturday And Was Not Called Or Emailed Back At All - Appreciate The Hairdressers Is Independent But Again Took The Edge Off The Day.

column35: We Arrived At 3.10Pm To A Busy But Friendly Reception. We Were Dealt With Straight Away But Our Room Was Not Ready. We Were Taken To The Bar For A Complementary Drink Whilst We Waited Which Was Nice But Did Not Get Our Keys Until About 3.45Pm.
column39: Our Visit Was Discounted For This Visit Partly Because On Our Last Stay We Were Directly Over The Function Room And Had To Listen To Loud Music From Downstairs. Unfortunately We Were Again Subjected To The Same Situation.
column48: I Think Some Of The Food Is Fairly Over Priced - For Instance 3 Pieces Of Garlic Bread With Cheese For Â£8.50!
column53: Had The Nicest Breakfast In The Room We've Ever Had At Sopwell.
column89: Get The Room Ready On Time.
column90: Only A Couple Of Minor Things  One Of The Side Dishes For Room Service Was Forgotten But Was Brought Up Fairly Quickly. Also You Guys Forgot To Deliver The Paper I Had Ordered. It Was Not On The Bill So I Presume The Guys On Reception Forgot To Put It On The System.

column64: There Was A Hair In My Duck Dish  I Was Given A Complementary Dessert But That Unfortunately Does Not Detract From The Experience In The First Place.

column35: Signs To Recption From The Car Park Were Not Particularly Clear. The Welcome Was Warm Enough But The Receptionist Seemed Didn't Seem 100% Focussed On Us And Broke Off Mid-Sentence At On Point To Hand The Other Receptonist Some Papers And Desribe An Issue To Her
column39: I Can't Remember The Room Number Unfortunately But Booked An Executive Room As The Website Mentoned All Of These Had Been Refurbished. Shame That They Were All Suject To Noise From The Wedding Receptions Going On And At One Point We Had People Smoking And Laughing Below Our Window. Fortunately All Noise Did End Dead On Midnight So This Was Not A Big Problem But Was Still Disappointing
column53: Generally Very Good
column64: Food Was Excellent But The Meal Was Rather Spoilt By The Table Of 6 Girls Very Close To Us Who Were In High Spirits  Very Loud And Using Some Rather Colourful Language At Times On A Range Of Topics. Difficult For The Hotel To Control I Grant You. The Wite Wine We Were Served Seemed Very Warm. We Queried It And Were Told We Could Have Another Bottle But It Would Also Be At 11-12 Degrees (Which Still Seems High To Me). Having Declined That Our Glasses And The Rest Of The Bottle Were Taken Away And Chilled Instead So In The End The Wine Was Lovely.
column77: Total Relaxation In The Pool Area Was Only Spoiled By The Number Of Children Present. We Found Ourselves Wondering If The Hotel Might Introduce Adult Only Periods In The Pool Area?
column83: Our Only Problem Was On The Sunday Morning. Thought We'd Have A Quick Coffee In The Orangery Before Lunch. Seemed To Be Ignored By The Waiting Staff So Ordered At The Bar. No Sign Of Any Coffee After 20 Minutes So Just Left To Make Our Lunch Reservation. No Body Seemed To Notice We Were Leaving. Certainly Nobody Asked Why Or If Anything Was Wrong

column39: I Think We Were In Room 146 - Rather Warren Like Trying To Find It (But That's The Building!) - Also Air Con A Bit Fierce  We Didn't Seem To Be Able To Get The Temperature Right Between Really Hot Overnight And Icily Cold In The Morning
column53: Warm Plates Would Have Been Nice - The Hot Food Was Lukewarm By The Time We Sat Down....But It Was Very Good And The Choice Was Great
column83: Queue For Check Out Was Exceptionally Long  And Two Staff Members (Very Courteous  However) Perhaps Not Enough To Deal With It (It Was Just Before 11)
column84: Our Cocktail Waiter In The Bar Was Very Helpful  Friendly And Knowledgeable - We Didn't Get His Name But I Think He Was French.
column89: A Few More Tea Bags And Better Quality Coffee In The Room Would Have Been Nice.

column35: The Wait To Check In Was 20 Minutes.  Not A Great Start When Staff Are Dealing With Complaint After Complaint From Other  Guests Infront Of Me And My Guest.  I Also Phoned Before My Stay To Make Sure If I Arrived Early We Could Use The Spa I Was Catagorically Told This Was Fine By A Female Employee.  When I Got To The Hotel  The Receptionist Told Me This Was Not Possible And No One Would Ever Have Told Me Any Different.  In Essance Calling Me A Liar Infront Of Other Guests. Not A Great Start Being Made To Feel Unwelcome At The Start Of Our Stay.
column77: As A Hotel Guest There Was No Treatments Available To Book.
column83: Reception Staff Rude

column39: Suite 105.  This Room Was Very Expensive.  At The Time Of Booking  It Was Not Mentioned To Me That It Was Above The Conference Suite Which Had 2 Parties Going On.  It Was Therefore Very Noisy.
column53: I Feel The Quality Of The Breakfast Has Gone Down Hill.  I Am Aware There Were Large Parties On The Weekend I Stayed  But That Being Said  If You Don't Have The Room  Then There Wouldn't Be The People.  We Were Gruffly Shown To Our Table  Had To Ask For Toast  No Pot Of Tea Or Coffee (Just Poured From A Flask).
column64: It Was An Event So The Food Was Catered For In The St Alban Suite.
column90: This Is The First Time I Have Stayed At Sopwell Since The Upgrade Of Rooms And Spa.  We Didn't Get To Use The Spa Because The T&C State You Cannot Use It Until You Check In.  Check In Is At 3  Our Event Started At 6.  Therefore No Time To Use The Spa.  Check Out Is At 11.  Our Event Finished At Midnight - Therefore Most People Want Some Sleep  Then Breakfast.  Unless You Are Going To Get Up At 6 (After A Party!) And Go For A Swim Etc Before Breakfast  Then There Is No Opportunity To Use The Facilities.    Further - We Had Drinks In The Conservatory.  They Got The Bill Wrong.  We Only Had 4 Drinks.  The Table Next To Us Ordered A Hot Chocolate With No Cream.  It Came Out With Cream.  There Were Several People Working But Always With The Eyes Averted From Any Tables.

column35: No
column39: 157  The Room And Corridors Were Extremely Shabby An Aged. The Corridors Had Paint Chipped And Door Frames Dented. The Room Decor Was Very Very Dated And Tired Looking. Lime Scale On The Taps In The Bathroom Etc  Very Disappointing For A Weekend That We Had Without Our 3 Children. As A St Albans Born And Bred Girl  I Have Always Been Used To Sopwell Having A Reputation Of Prestige And Class  Sadly I Was Most Disappointed.
column53: The Spider Which Came Out If The Orange Juice Machine Into My Glass At Breakfast Really Did Nothing To Enhance My Opinion Of Sopwell At The Stage! Sadly V Dissapointing  Sorry
column89: Updated Rooms And Drinks Area In The Conservatory. Dead Flies On The Blinds And Burnt Bent Lampshades Etc

column39: Rm 230. Carpet Not Fitted Flat  Looks Like It Needs Replacing. Very Heavy Dust & Cobwebs On Curtain Rail. Bath Needs To Be Re-Enamalled. Dont Consider It A Â£124 Pn Room.
column48: Room Service Food Quality Is Nowhere Near As Good As If Ypu Eat In Restaurant/Brasserie
column53: I Have Stayed Before And Breakfast Great In Brasserie But Room Service Breakfast Pretty Bad.
column84: Denver. Wonderfully Welcoming  A Gentleman. Ensured We Were Happy.

column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: We Were Welcomed As If The Only Guests Arriving Although There Was Several Checking In At The Same Time. Our Room Was Not Ready On Our Arrival 15.00 And We Were Taken To The Lounge For A Complimentary Drink While Whilst We Waited.
column39: Room 225 Which We Did Upgrade When Booking. Nothing Special Although We Did Enjoy The Room.
column53: Loved The Fresh Fruit On Offer But Again All The Food On Display Was Excellent Plus Gluten Free Toast Was On Offer Which I Normally Take My Own. Also The Tea Was The Best We Had In Any 4-5 Star Hotel. All The Chef's Were Working In The Kitchen Were Enjoying Their Work - I Noticed! Keeep It Up Guys!
column64: The Back Ground Music Was Perfect And A Good Atmosphere All Around
column77: Totally Enjoyable And Everything Worked Well!  Steam Room And Pool Are Some Of The Best We Have Experienced And Enjoyed.  The Staff From Spa Reception Were Welcoming And Informally Friendly And The Locker Security Were Ace!  Thank You All Who Made Our Experience A Joy!
column83: From The Porters To All The Staff Were Naturally Friendly And Moreso They Knew How To Give Good Customer Services. A Credit To All Again.
column84: I Unfortunately Did Not Notice The Receptionist Manager (Apologies Not Taking Note Of Her Name) Who Looked After Us So Well (Room Not Ready On Arrival) Who Looked After Us In Every Way - Very Impressed. Thank You Very Much.
column89: No! A Joy Indeed
column90: The Lovely Spanish Porter Who Accompanied To Our Room Was Charming And Welcoming And Was Knowledgable To The Area Where We Could Take A Walk.

column48: Drinks Took Over 30 Mins To Arrive. They Forgot The Ordered Crisps And We Asked For Them To Be Sent Back Up. They Never Arrived
column84: The Lady Who Did My Spa Treatment Was Excellent.  Really Made It Special

column35: Our Room Was Not Ready When We Arrived  Car Parking Was Very Busy And We Had To Park Quite A Distance From The Entrance.
column39: Room 101 Room Was Made Up As King-Size Not Twin As Requested.  I Had To Call Reception Twice To Get This Rectified.  The Floor Was Dirty  The Space Between The Beds Had No Been Hovered.  The Bath And The Shower Both Were Dirty  The Bath Had Pubic Hair In It!  The Sheets Of One Of The Beds - After It Was Changed Were Stained.
column64: The Brasserie Was Noisy Both During Dinner And Lunch  As We Had Booked A Spa Break And All Our Meals Were Included In The Package  We Had No Alternative But To Eat There  But The Noise From Other Larger Tables Was Very Off Putting When We Were Trying To Have A Nice Quiet Relaxing Break.  Would Have Preferred A Choice In Restaurant Even If It Had Meant Paying A Supplemental Charge.
column77: The Swimming Pool Area Was Far Too Busy And Over Crowded At Times.  As We Had Booked A Spa Break We Had Assumed That We Would Be Able To Use The Spa Area At All Times However Especially Sunday Morning This Was Impossible And We Were Glad We Had Booked Additional Treatments Or We Would Have Had Nothing To Do And Nowhere To Relax Having Had To Check Out Of Our Room!  I Do Not Expect A Group Of 6 Children/Teens To Be Allowed Into The Pool Area With Only One Adult Who Was Not Swimming  But Taking Photo's Despite The Signs Saying No Photography!  Or The Fact That They Hogged The Jacuzzi Which They Shouldn't Have Been In For Health & Safety Reasons For A Good 25 Minutes.  Totally Spoilt The Only Few Hours We Had To Relax In That Area!   Therapists Need To Be Much More Aware Of The Noise When They Are Swapping Over Clients  My 1.5 Hour Massage Was Spoilt When Others Around Us Swapped Over After The First Hour Lots Of Noise And Chatting  Completely Disturbed Me Just As I Was Starting To Feel Very Relaxed And I Didn't Enjoy The Last Half Hour As Much.
column84: The Twins On Concierge Were Extremely Nice And Very Helpful
column90: There Should Be Time Reserved During The Day Just For Those Doing A Spa Break  And Most Definitely A Limit On The Times That Children Are Allowed To Use The Pool.  Was Concerned That As There Were Children In There Without Adequate Supervision There Was No Life Guard On Duty.

column35: Just Flipping Perfect
column39: 215 Was Great  Thank You And Reception Even Called To Make Sure Everything Was Right. Flipping Awesome.
column53: Just Perfect. Perfect Staff
column64: Again Perfect.
column84: All Of Them. Just Perfect. Keep Up The Good Work
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Was Asked To Pre Order Food For A Party Of 6 Which Is Ridiculous
column39: 228/226/227 One Room Had Such A Large Stain On The Valance At First I Thought It Was A Fluer De Lit Design Coffee Stain On Wall - Dust Fluff In Wardrobes Unable To Sleep Until The Early Hours Due To Function Below - Mentioned This In Both Nights - Spoilt The 2Nd Night Completely As This Had Been Our Day With Spa Treatments Do Everyone Was Very Relaxed And Ready For An Early Night (11.30)But Couldn't Sleep Due To Loud Music
column64: Being Told We Would Have To Wait 20 Minutes For Cocktails At Dinner Table
column77: Could Do With More Relaxing Areas
column84: The 2 Doorman Were Perfect Gentleman Helping Us To Our Car In The Rain And Insisting To Pack The Car For Us . As Soon As You Come Across Them It Sets The Standards Very High - Maybe Too High!
column89: Offered To Move Us On Saturday Morning To New Rooms - You Knew That A Function Going On Again  And That We Would Not Get To Sleep - Offering To Change Rooms At 11.30 At Night Is Ridiculous
column90: Weekend Spoilt By Lack Of Sleep - 6 Busy Working Mums Were Looking Forward To Celebrate A 50Th Birthday And Get Some Well Deserved Rest And Pampering- Not Being Ae To Sleep Until 1.00 -1.30 On One Night And 12.45/ 1.15 The Second Is Unacceptable . The Rooms Over The Function Rooms Hear Everything The Rooms Opposite Here All Music The Cabs Arriving And Lots Of Noise Coming From  The Entrance

column35: We Were Early So Told We Would Be Called When Room Ready. At 3.15 We Had Heard Nothing So Went To Desk And Were Sent To Our Room. It Was Still Being Cleaned As We Were Asked To Come Back In Ten Minutes.
column39: 119 No Instructions For Air Con. No Mini Bar.
column53: A Shame No Proper Coffee Options.
column64: No Consistency In Server - So Many Different People! Desserts On The Sat Evening Very Uninspiring.
column77: Very Busy Pool Area With No Seats Available To Relax. Lockers Too Complicated To Use. Lovely Spa Area Though. Staff Excellent.
column90: We Didn't Sleep Well At All Due To Slamming Doors In Our Corridor Until About 2.30Am. Very Disappointing As We Were 2 Mums Specifically Looking For A Peaceful Night Away From The Children.

column35: Overall The Stay Was Lovely The Two Young Men (Twins) Were Very Helpful And Welcoming The New Upgrades Bedroom Allocated Was Wonderful - The Only Thing I Would Say Let It Down Was The Quality Of The Food In The Fine Dining Restaurant Which I Decided To Upgrade To - The Food Quality Was Very Poor In Comparison The Brasserie Was Excellent Both In Terms Of Service And Food Quality.  The Duck Starter Was Awful Snd Food Was Not Whaf We Gas Expected Which Was A Shame
column39: Room Was Lovely
column53: Breakfast Was Great In The Brasserie Restaurant
column64: Could Not Rate Dining As The Two Main Experiences Were Very Different
column84: The Two Porters Brothers Were Exceptional Both On Arrival And Departure Very Helpful With Luggage And Helping Us To Car

column35: Unfortunately Our Room Wasn't Ready Despite Arriving An Hour Later Than Check In. This Was Dealt With In A Good Way By Helpful Staff.
column39: 136. The Room Was Very Small And Cramped. Tv Had To Be Swivelled Around To Be Able To Watch It.No Tea And Coffee Facilities. The Tap Was Broken On The Shower/Bath.
column53: Food Was Tasty But Felt It Could Have Been Warmer.
column89: The Size Of The Room And The View From The Room Was A Bit Of A Let Down.
column90: Staff Very Helpful And Friendly.

column35: It Was Lovely To Have Someone At The Door To Welcome Us And To Open The Door For Us.
column39: Apartment 11 - More Milk  Breakfast Tea And Coffee Would Be Good For 3 Adults Staying In A Room. We Had A Drink In The Evening And There Wasn't Then Enough For The Morning.
column53: We Had The Two Night Spa Package So A Breakfast Buffet Was Included. This Was Very Good.
column64: We Ate At The Brasserie As Part Of The One Night Spa Package. We Found It To Be Rather Noisy In There And Quite Difficult To Hear Each Other Speak. It Was Much Better At Lunch Time When It Wasn't So Busy.
column77: The Swimming Pool Was A Bit Cold For Just Gentle Swimming.

column83: Tv Was Not Working. One Of The Twins Helped Immediately. Thank You
column84: One Of The Twins (Sorry  Donâ´T Know His Name). See Above

column8: Business - The Hotel Location Fulfils My Needs
column20: My Colleagues At My Company Stay Here
column90: I Stay At The Hotel At Least Once A Week And Believe That There Should Be Some Sort Of Reward Scheme For Frequent Stays.

column77: Not Enough Seats Around The Pool. Last Time We Visited We Couldn't Sit Down In The Pool Area And This Time Once We Had Seats We Were Scared To Move To The Steam Room Etc Incase The Went While We Were In There.
column84: Stephanie Sinclair For Sorting Out Our Second Visit After We Had A Number Of Issues During Our First Visit In April.

column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: There *Were* Plenty Of Parking Spaces And Clear Directional Signage' - Admittedly It Was A Wedding But We Had To Park On The Kerb And A Fair Distance Away
column39: Lovely Big Room  But No Coat Hooks And Lack Of Hanging Space - Small Single Wardrobe Was Taken Up With Gowns And Ironing Board
column83: Asked For A Cocktail In The Cocktail Bar And Was Told They Were Too Busy To Make One. Unbelievable! Unfortunately The Responses Above Are Driven By That One Exception - Everyone Else Was Very Good. I Didn't Ask About The Hotel Or Local Area
column89: See Comments About Room Facilities And 'Cocktail' Bar!
column90: Thanks

column39: 137 It Was Extremely Stuffy And Got In The Room And The Air Con Didn't Work Properly. The Big Mirror Is Situated In An Awkward Position On The Wall Right Beside The Bedroom Table Therefore Making It Very Difficult To Get In Between To Dry Hair Or Even Look In The Mirror!
column64: There Was Another Table Of 2 Next To Us Who Arrived After Us   They Got Served Before Us ! Also Our Main Meal Was Cold  It Was Taken Away Once We Managed To Get A Waiters Attention  No Apology But Said 2 Mins And Another Meal Wld Be Served. We Waited 15 Mins. We Were Told By The Waitress As Our Table Was Small She Wld Come Back And Re Fill Our Water Glasses  She Never Came Back!
column77: Was Meant To Be A Relaxing Spa Package  It Was Far From That. Families With Young Children Around The Spa Area  Children Under Age In The Jacuzzi  Children Not Closing The Sauna Or Steam Room Doors- Very Very Noisy And Not Relaxing At All  Couldn't Find Any Spare Loungers Either  All Together A Complete Nightmare And Waste Of Our Spa Package
column90: We Felt The Package We Bought Would Have Been Very Good Value Money But Was Marred By The Service In The Brasserie During Dinner And The Non. Relaxation In The Spa Area. We Would Think Again Before Booking Another One.

column35: Room Wasn't Ready On Time Was Attending A Wedding So Didn't Need It Straight Away But Rooms Should Be Ready By The Stated Check In Time
column39: A Mini Bar Would Have Been A Nice Extra In A Large Room That We Had
column53: Toast Should Be Offered Without Having To Ask
column84: A Young Man Around Reception Was Particularly Attentive And Helpful
column89: It Wasn't Very Clear Where To Go For A Wedding Had To Ask For Directions

column35: Much Quicker Than On Previous Occasions.
column39: 231 - Much Nicer Room Than Given On Previous Occasions With The Same Package.  Thank You!
column64: After A Disappointing Dining Experience On A Previous Visit (The Brasserie Has Been Crowded  Noisy & Hot & Our Table Location Poor) This Time We Had A Wonderful Time.  Everything Was Perfect.
column77: Another Jacuzzi?!  We Had To Wait A Long Time For Space To Become Available.
column84: Yes - Our Waiter At Dinner Was Fantastic.  Recommended An Excellent Bottle Of Wine.  Small And Dark - Sorry  I Can't Remember His Name.
column89: Our Final Account Included Gratuities I Had Not Signed For During The Day/Evening.  Not A Huge Problem  But Still Unexpected. Less Children In The Pool Diving And Squealing - We Came To Get Away From Children!  Offer Adults Only Days/Evenings During The Holidays?
column90: Thank You And See You Again Soon.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: The Room Was Tiny For A Superior - Hate To Think What The Size Of A Standard Double Is.  We Upgraded To A Delux As A Result Which Was Fine But The Bed Was Unbelievably Uncomfortable - Mattress Sloped Into Middle Of Bed.  Expected A Rather Better Hairdryer And Bathroom To Be A Bit Less Tatty
column53: Man Pouring Tea Managed To Walk Along Pouring Tea On Floor Which Poured Onto My Foot!
column77: The Pool Was So Busy The Next Morning Due To Aqua Class That There Was Nowhere To Sit And Relax Which Was A Shame
column89: Shame About The Room And Bed - More Clarity Needed On What To Expect In Each Grade Of Room - Eg Bath Or Not  Size And Size Of Bed

column64: `Buffet Lunch Selection Was Not Amazing But Passable
column89: The Mezzanine Rooms Are Very Far Way From The Spa. I Would Have Preferred To Be Offered Something Closer

column35: I Was Told When Booking It Would Be Okay To Arrive Early With My Two Children As The Room Wasn't Booked The Night Before But When We Arrived It Wasn't Ready Even Though We Arrived At 2.30Pm. However We Went For Lunch And By The Time We'd Finished Not Only Was The Room Ready But Our Luggage Had Been Taken Over Which Was A Lovely Touch.
column39: Apt 3. I Have A 3 Year Old Son And The Stairs Concerned Me So It Might Be An Idea To Have A Stair Gate Available. Also There's A Huge Gap That Even My 8 Year Old Almost Fell Through At One Point So Perhaps A Perspex Panel Would Be Wise To Avoid Potentially Very Serious Accidents. I Found There Was No Earl Grey Tea And Housekeeping Kindly Brought Some To Me Very Quickly Which Was Fantastic. I Had Trouble Figuring Out The Heating And After Speaking To Reception I Had A Visit From Maintenance Really Promptly.
column48: All The Staff Were Lovely And Service Speedy.
column53: Asked Three Times For A High Chair But Didn't Get It. We Were Seated Around The Corner So Unable To Get Tea  Coffee Or Toast Without Seeking Out A Waiter. The Actual Breakfast Is Superb And The Reason My Daughter Keeps Asking To Stay Again! Cooked Option Nicely Done As You're Not Confronted With Huge Piles Of Food That's Sat Around For Ages  The Smaller Serving Plates Mean Food Is Fresher And Therefore Quality Is Maintained. Best Hotel Breakfast I Have Ever Had (And The Reason It Was Our Third Visit!)
column64: Lunch In The Brasserie Was Fabulous. Brilliant Service And Food  Love The Ambience Of The Conservatory. Dinner In The Main Restaurant Was Extremely Disappointing And Had Recommended The Hotel To Friends Who Decided To Stay Too. We Had To Wait Ages To Order  Deliberately Ordered Kids Food Over 20 Mins Before Our Own As They Were Hungry But Ours Still Came First. Some Of The Food Was Burnt And The Waitress Was Impolite And Unhelpful. I Spoke To The Manager As I Was Frankly Embarrassed Having Raved About The Hotel To My Friend And He Was Lovely  Very Apologetic And Keen To Make Things Right. He Very Kindly Didn't Charge Us For The Bottle Of Prosecco We Had Which Was Really Appreciated.
column83: Previously Mentioned
column84: The Restaurant Manager (As Explained Previously) And Brasserie Staff. Brasserie Staff Were Lovely With My Children  Super Speedy And Really Helpful.
column89: It Only Fell Below As It Had Been So Much Better On Previous Stays

column35: My Mother And I Have Been Staying At Sopwell For The Last 6/7 Years (Once A Year) And As With Every Other Time We Have Stayed  The Service Was Excellent.  The Staff Are Extremely Professional  Helpful And Understanding.  I Could Not Think Of A Better Place To Spend A Relaxing Break In The Uk.
column39: Again  Absolutely No Complaints  Very Comfortable Indeed!
column53: We Had Both Dinner And Breakfast At Sopwell.  The Food Was Delivered Fast And Was Piping Hot!
column84: Generally All The Staff - From Reception To The Cleaners.  All Very Helpful.
column90: No  I Plan To Come Back Next Year (Aside From The Booking I Make With My Mother Every Year) With My Husband To Celebrate Our Anniversary - I Think It Is A Great Retreat For Time With Your Mum And Hopefully Time With Your Husband  Which I Am Sure He Will Love It There.  Please Don't Change A Thing!

column48: Room Service Menu Very Limited Although I Had Option To Select From Brasserie Menu.
column53: Would Like To Have Option Of Porridge For Breakfast
column77: The Gym Equipment Is Dated And Not Up To The Standard I Would Expect.
column90: Lovely Hotel And Very Good Room (Executive Suite) Which Was Conducive To An Overnight Stay On Business.

column35: Only Because There Was An Experienced Member Of Staff On Hand To Assist The Trainee On Reception. The Trainee Spoke So Quietly You We Could Not Hear What She Was Saying. Also Could Not Work Computer As Yet And Had Dinner Reservation Times Wrong From Our Booking.
column39: 264. Lovely Big Room But Bed Very Uncomfortable. Could Not Have Slept Another Night In It.

column35: No
column53: None  Breakfast Was An Excellent Experience For Us And Our Kids.
column64: Good Food  Good Service.
column89: Yes  We Had A Spa Break Overnight Package. We Did Not Enjoy Having To Pay For Every Bill When We Had Overs Each Time  Why These Were Just Not Charged To The Room. The Package We Had Meant Breakfast  Lunch And Evening Meal Were All In The Same Resturants  Would Have Been Better If We Got To Eat In Different Places To Enjoy The Whole Ness Of Sopwell.  In Our Room  Would Have Been Nice To Have Water In The Fridge. Regarding The Payment Point On Each Sitting/ Bill  It Made My Wife Feel Everyone Just Wanted Your Money And Made You Feel Like We Were Going To Run Off And Not Pay.
column90: When I Booked The Overnight Stay  We Spoke To Both Reservations Ad Spa  Would Prefer To Talk To One Person Who Co- Ordinaries It All Together. It Feels And With The Payments Like All The Different Rooms Incl Spa And Hotel Are Separate Subsidiaries Of Sopwell.

column53: We Were A Little Late Coming Down For Breakfast Which Mean't That There Was Not A Lot Left - Our Fault But It Was A Shame!
column64: We Had To Wait A While Until Our Drinks Arrived - And Already Had Finished Out First Course When They Did Arrive

column39: Room No. 331 The Bed Was Quite Lumpy And I Did Find It A Little Uncomfortable.
column77: The Slippers Were Huge And I Was A Bit Concerned That People Could Trip And Have An Accident.  Perhaps Smaller Slippers For Women Would Be Appropriate.
column89: Would Have Liked More Coffee Sachets And Milk In The Room.

column35: We Were Met And Assisted To Our Room By Marco! What A Very Polite  Professional Man  He Helped Us Move To A Much Better Room Overlooking The Grounds... Rather Than The Car Park! column83: _____________________________________________ From: Travers Kim  Sent: 29 May 2013 14:30 To: 'Reservations@Sopwellhouse.Co.Uk' Cc: 'Trudy Travers' Subject: Our Recent Stay ...   Hello  I Thought I Would Drop You A Line Regarding To My Recent Stay At Sopwell House On One Of Your Two Day Breaks.  All In All  My Sister And I Had A Lovely Time.  The Service In The Restaurant  Overseen By Tony Most Of The Time  Was Superb And The Food Was Great At Breakfast  Lunch And Dinner.  We Have Used The Hotel In The Past And Really Noticed A Significant Improvement In Facilities All Around The Hotel And Especially The Country Club And Spa And Our Afternoon By The Pool  Massages (Holly In My Case) And Even A Haircut On Site Were All Great.  My Only However Though Was About The Room Allocation.  On Arriving We Were Shown A Room That  In My View  And Having Stayed Previously For A Hen Night And Wedding As Well As Previously ÂGirlyâ Spa Weekends  Was Most Definitely Not A ÂSuperior Twinâ As Per The Booking Made.  In Fact  It Was Still A Double And Would Required ÂTwinning.  I Questioned This At Reception And Was Told Nothing Else Was Available By The First Receptionist  Then Other Rooms Did Become Available  Once A Second Receptionist Got Involved  But I Was Informed There Would Be An Extra Charge Of Â£20 Per Night.   I Agreed To This And We Were Shown Two Other Rooms  Which I Suspect Were Targeted At Disabled Guests Â Wide Doors  Low Sink  No Bath ... However  Both A Better Standard Than The First Offering  So One Of These Suited Us Once The Double Bed Had Been Made A Twin.  Having Looked At Your Website And Deliberating Choosing A Larger  Superior Room Â Described As Sleeping Up To 3 Adults  I Was Perplexed At Where You Would Have Put A Third Adult Without Removing The Armchairs?  None Of The Rooms We Saw Had A Black Marble Bathroom Or Room For A Third Bed As Is Stated May Be Available In Some Of The Superior Rooms.   On Checkout  As Had Been Explained  We Had Been Charged Extra For The Room Which I Was Happy To Pay.  However To Add To My Room Frustration  Unfortunately  I Was Next To A Couple Checking Out As The Receptionist Congratulated Them On Achieving A Complimentary Upgrade To Their Room.  I Understand They Are Likely To Be Have Been Booked In Under A Different Deal  But Did End Up Feeling A Bit Like A Second Class Citizen.  Having Worked In Hospitality Previously  I Know How Discretionary Such Things Like Room Allocation Can Be.  It Was A Shame That The Reception / Room Allocation Experience Was So Far Removed From All The Other Experiences Of Our Stay.  You May Want To Share This With One Of Your Managers To Ensure Future Guests DonâT End Up Being Similarly Frustrated.  I Think It Is Difficult To Spot Which Of Your Guests Is Likely To Be An Experienced Hotel User  So Taking An Approach Where All Get The Best Service Possible Is Always Going To Reap Rewards In My View.  As Stated  The Overall Experience Was A Good One  Being In A Customer Facing Role Myself  I Always Welcome Feedback Whether Positive Or Negative As A Means Of Improving Our Service.  I Hope You Find This Helpful And Feel Free To Pass Onto Those Individuals We Have Named!  As Previously Mentioned  The Service Overall Was Really Top Notch!   Kind Regards Â Kim   Kim Travers | Head Of Hr Service Delivery Hr Services | Transport For London 1St Floor  14 Pier Walk  London  Se10 0Es External 0203 054 3488 | Auto 83488 | Mobile 07841 887506

column53: We Stayed For 2 Nights.  At Breakfast On The First Morning We Were Asked If We Would Like Brown Or White Toast Or A Combination Of Both.  We Asked For White Toast Only  But Were Given A Combination Of Both.  On The Second Morning Our Table Had Not Be Laid Up Properly After The Previously Guests Had Vacated It And There Were No Cups On The Table For Tea/Coffee And No Member Of The Waiting Staff Came To Ask Us If We Would Like A Drink.  In The End We Had To Ask For A Cup Of Tea.  The Managers In The Restaurant Seemed To Be Very Good  But The Actually Waiting Staff Did Not Listen And Did Not Deliver What Was Requested Of Them.  The Breakfast Food Was Brilliant  Both Is Choice  Quality And Taste  But The Service Somewhat Let It Down.
column64: Our Table For Our Evening Meal Was Not Laid Up Properly After The Previous Guests Had Vacated It And Throughout The Meal The Staff Had To Keep Going To Get Cutlery Or Glasses For Us.  After Being Seated We Waited Quite A Long Time Before Anyone Came To Take Our Order  And We Waited Even Longer For Someone To Come And Take Our Drink Order.  The Food Was Very Tasty  But Again Service From The Waiting Staff Let It Down.
column83: See Previous Comments About Breakfast Service And Meal In The Brasserie Service  Which Was Disappointing.  Also  When We Went To The Bar For A Drink  The Waitress Got The Wrong Drink On The First Night And Left Us Waiting For A Long Time On The Second Night.  Overall  Apart From The Managers  We Would Consider Most Of The Waiting Staff To Be Poor.  The One Exception Was In The Terrace Bar Where We Had Something To Eat And A Pot Of Tea On The Sunday Afternoon.  We Were Served By A Young Man With Ginger Hair And Glasses And He Was The Only Member Of Staff Who Actually Engaged With Us And Had A Conversation With Us And He Got Our Order Right First Time.
column84: Young Man In The Terrace Bar - Ginger Hair And Glasses.  He Was In The Terrace Bar On Sunday Afternoon (23/6/13) And Served Us With A Pot Of Tea For Two  A Panini And A Smoked Salmon Bagel.  Despite Him Being Very Busy Trying To Set Up For A Big Party Coming In For Afternoon Tea  He Still Took The Time To Chat To Us  He Got Our Order Correct And Was Friendly.  He Was The Only Member Of Staff Who Actually Did This.
column89: Staff Should Be Better Trained And Encouraged To Interact More With Guests.  More Importantly They Should Listen And Get Orders Correct - If They Don't Hear What We Have Said Then We Don't Mind Them Asking Again  Especially As It Is Quite Noisy In The Brasserie.  Customer Service And Making Guests Feel Welcome Is Very Important  Both To Us As Guests And To You To Encourage Future Business.
column90: Overall Our Stay Was Comfortable.  We Really Enjoyed The Food And The Room Was Nice.  However  The Room Was A Little Warm And The Bed Creaky  But We Slept Ok.  The Gardens At Your Hotel Are Lovely And Credit Should Be Given To Your Gardeners For Keeping Them Looking So Lovely.  Mostly It Was The Service From A Lot Of Your Waiting Staff That Let Your Hotel Down.  We Were Attending A Friend's Celebration In The Area  Hence Our Stay At Your Hotel  But I Am Not Sure That We Would Return To Your Hotel If We Were In The Area Again.  Also  Despite The Fact That I Booked Our Stay In My Name  Mrs Leonard  And I Was Addressed As Mrs Leonard By The Receptionist Upon Check-Up  The Email Inviting Me To Take Part In This Survey Was Simply Address 'Dear Leonard'  Which I Found Rather Rude.  If You Are Going To Email People To Ask For Their Opinions And If You Truly Value Your Clientele  Try To Address Them Correct!

column35: Confirmation Letter Was Very Detailed And Had All The Information I Needed

column8: 21St Birthday Of One Daughter And End Of A Levels For Another
column39: I Had Taken Care To Ask For An Upgraded Room As I Wanted To Ensure A Special Time With My Daughters And A Memorable 21St. I Found The Mews Apartment Drab And 'Granny'-Like. The Curtains Were Torn  The Blinds Didn't Close - We Struggled To Close Them And Despite Numerous Attempts To Call Reception And Housekeeping - The Phone Wasn't Answered. There Was No Heated Towel Rail. The Heating System Difficult To Control And The Sofa-Bed So Uncomfortable I Barely Slept A Wink. The Only Plus Was That It Was Quiet. The Decor Seemed Random And Worm. I Was Very Disappointed With The Room.
column53: We Dined In The Brasserie And Some Care Was Taken To Ensure That Vegan And Vegetarian Food Was Available. The Service Was Excellent - Warm  Helpful And Speedy.
column64: We Found The Staff Polite And Helpful And The Food Enjoyable.

column83: My Phone-Calls From The Mews Apartment Were Not Answered- Our Struggle To Close The Malfunctional Blinds Was Tiring.
column84: I Wish I Could Remember The Name Of The Wonderful Member Of Staff At The Spa That Handled The Anxiety That My Daughter Felt At Having Her First Facial With Sensitivity And Professionalism. I Was So Grateful To Her.
column89: We Really Appreciated The Lovely Staff  The Hotel And Spa Were Fine But Our Accommodation Fell Below Expectations. It Felt Like A Downgrade. The Room Was Shabby And Felt 2 Star Not 4 Star And As It Was A 21St Celebration I Wish I Had Booked A Five Star.
column90: The Hotel Experience Hit The Note Between Relaxed And Formal Perfectly. If I Could Be Sure That The Room Was To Standard Then We Would Come Again - But I Had Spoken At Length On Booking Requesting A Special Experience And An Upgraded Room - So The Mews Apartment Was A Particular Disappointment.

At The Time Of Placing The Order  I Wanted To Double-Check It  By Having It Read Back  But The Person Taking The Order Wanted To/Needed To  Hang Up. Generally  I Don't Have Great Expectations With Any Hotel's Room Service.

column35: On Arrival I Was Asked To Put A Credit Card For Security  I Told The Lady That I Didn't Want To Put Anything On The Credit Card. So I Paid For The Room   On Arrival On My Debit Card. Then They Took The Details Of My Credit Card  Again I Told Them That I Didn't Want Any Transactions On My Credit Card. When I Checked Out On Monday  The Receptionist Was In The Process Of Putting The Extras On My Credit Card  Which I Got Them To Refund And Put The Monies On My Debit Card.
column39: Would Have Been Nice To Have A Fridge

column64: On Saturday We Couldn't Get A Table In The Restaurant  We Was Offered A 6.30Pm Table In The Brasserie  Which Was Disappointing.  The Menu Was Not Very Good. We Was Sat Down In The Back. The Dining Area Was Very Hot  And Uncomfortable  I Was Told The Air Conditioning Was Working Properly  We Asked If We Could Eat Outside  We Was Told No.The Manager  Managed To Get Us A Table In The Restaurant  Then Our Evening Was Fine
column77: The Gym Instructor On Saturday Was Very Helpful To My Guest
column83: The Staff In The Outside Area Were A Bit Hit And Miss   Not Always Looking Out For Customer Needs
column84: The Managers Were Good  Ironing Out Any Problems  Shame Problems Arose

column53: Saturday Morning Was Fine  But Sunday Morning Tables Left With Dirty Plates Etc.  Not Cleared Away. Eventually When We Did Get A Table No Cutlery.  Waited About 10 Mins For 2 Spoons So In End Went And Got Our Own.  No Butter On Table. Again Took Off Another Table.  Other People Were Also Doing The Same.  Not Well Organised
column83: Unfortunately Many.  When We Arrived On Friday Evening And Went Outside At The Back Of Hotel To Get A Drink It Took About 15 Mins For 2 Gin And Tonics.  The Place Was Not Very Busy But The Service Was Very Poor  Only  1 Person Working.  Other People Were Having The Same Problem Too And We Were Talking About It To Each Other.  On The Saturday Afternoon We Arrived Back At The Hotel Around 4.30Pm.  The Sun Was Shining And We Decided To Get A Drink Again At The Back Of The Hotel.  This Time My Husband Went To The Bar And Personally Got The Drinks.  When We Went To Sit Down We Were Greeted By Dirty Tables Not Cleared  Glasses And Plates Piled Up.  Staff Were Walking Past These Tables But Not Making Any Effort To The Clear Them Up.  We Watched As Other People Arrived And Found It Very Difficult To Get Drinks.  We Watched One Lady Waiting By The Pimms Counter For Around 15 Mins For Someone To Come And Serve Her.  Again Not Enough Staff And No One In Charge.  We Did Eventally See One Gentleman Go To Make A Complaint And Within 5 Mins The Place Was Over-Run With Staff  People Got Served And The Tables Were Cleared.  Lastly  The Check Out On Sunday Morning.  This Was Very Poor  We Waited About 25 Mins To Check Out And The Queue Was Horrendous.  My Husband Noted That Quite A Few People Were Complaining About The Overall Service In The Hotel.  This Needs Rectifying Quickly As It Is Just Not Acceptable For This Kind Of Hotel To Have These Kind Of Problems.  My Husband Stays In Many Hotels And He Was Amazed That A Hotel Of This Standard Should Have These Problems With Service.
column84: On Saturday Evening Before We Went Out We Decided To Drink In The Cocktail Bar.  We Were Attended To By 2 Very Polite And Professional Bar Men.  Sorry Did Not Get Their Names  Just That They Were French.  Rest Of Hotel Needs To Be Up To This Standard.
column89: As Previously Advised.  Service  Service  Service.  We Actually Loved The Hotel And Did Not Let The Service Issues Spoil Our Stay.  We Felt That The Staff Were All Very Polite  But The Training Was Poor And There Did Not Seem To Be Anyone In Charge Making Sure Everything Was Running Smoothly.
column90: I Also Feel That The Spa Should Have Its Own Bar/Eating Area.  Got Sick Of Seeing Large Groups Of People Walking Around In Robes And Slippers.  The Spa Was Exceptionally Busy And The Clients Seem To Take Over The Hotel At Times.  I Am Glad You Send This Questionnaire As I Needed To Put These Points Across.
