column84: The French Receptionist From Grenoble - Alexandra  A Lovely Girl  Very Helpful  Kind And Friendly
column89: The Hotel Bar Was Overtaken By A Hen Party Making It Impossible To Even Approach The Bar To Order Drinks  Hence The Order Taken By Reception And Billed As Room Service. We Would Have Enjoyed A Nice Drink In A Comfortable Bar On Arrival But It Was Not To Be.
column90: Only That The Wedding Organization Was Excellent  The Banqueting Staff  Especially Ludovic (I Think) Were Very Helpful And Professional. It Was An Excellent Weekend In A Wonderful Hotel In Beautiful Surroundings. Thank You Again

column39: Was Not Happy To Ay Â£150.00 For A View Of A Roof And Air Conditioning Vents  The Room Was Also Very Small And The Noise So Bad Being Next Door To The Stairs  Hovering At 7.30 On A Sunday Morning Was Not Acceptable. Have Been To Sopwell House Many Of Times  But Will Not Be Visiting Again.
column53: Ordered A Meal Asked For New Potatoes  Was Given Fries When I Told The Waiter He Then Replied No You Ordered Fries. Waited 20 Minutes For A Drink And 40 Minutes For My Meal And Then It Was Wrong.
column64: Three Hen Nights Dining And The Noise Was So Loud. Food Very Average Long Waiting Time  Will Not Be Dining Or Recommending To Anyone.
column83: Went For A Drink On The Terrace Waited Half An Hour To Be Served  Gave Up Waiting And Went Into St Albans To Have A Drink. There Was A Party Of 18 Women On A Hen Party That Also Waited At Least 20 Minutes To Be Served  The Money That Your Company Must Be Losing Because Of Waiter Issues.

column39: Was Not Able To Use The Bath Because Of Plumbing Problems  Staff Offered To Move Us But Was Very Late And Said We Could Get A Discount Which Was Not True...
column53: Since My Last Visit ( I Have Visited In Exess Of A Dozen Times In The Last 8 Years Or So I Am Not Sure My Last Experience Was The Current Level Of Service To Expect) To Be Fair It Was Very Hot That Day And Myself And My Partner Were Really Tired And Wanted A Relaxing Evening And The Room Was Very Hot Even With Air Conditioning. I Would Be Staying This Weekend Otherwise. I Can Be Contacted On 07970 294334  Terry Page.
column83: Yes  With Bath  See Previous Comments
column89: I Was Expecting Better From Previous Visits.

column35: When We Last Stayed Robes And Slippers Were Brought To Our Room As We Were On  Spa Break-This Time-We Were Told To Get Them Ourselves.I Thought That Was Disappointing For A Hotel Of This Standard.
column39: 265- The Toilet Didn't Flush Very Well And The Shower Would Cut Out Intermittanatly
column64: Despite Asking For A Burger To Be Cooked Well-Done It Was Served Pink-We Appreciated The Apology And Free Drink But Were Disappointed When It Was Still Under- Done.It Went Uneaten
column77: More Sun Loungers Needed In Garden Area
column89: Compared To My Previous Visit-My Experience Was Below My Expectations Because Of The Matters That I Have Pointed Out
column90: More Tables And Chairs Are Needed At The Front Of The Hotel-Outside The Bar

column35: Room Not Ready Until 3.15 But That Was No Problem
column84: Lady On Reception - Cant Remember Name  Helped Us With The Aircon!

column39: Unfortunately We Needed To Change Our Room From Our Original Booking. The Room We Were Allocated (139?) Seemed To Be A Dual Use Room And As Such There Was A Large Wooden Partition At The Head Of The Bed Which Made Sleep Virtually Impossible As It Was Across Our Head And Shoulders . We Complained About The Poor Standard Of The Bed And Were Allocated A Further Room. I Have Since Written A Letter Of Thanks To Those Concerned Over The Way Our Complaint Was Dealt With. It Is However A Shame We 'Lost' A Night Due To Such An Unusually Uncomfortable Bed When 1 Night Of A 2 Night Stay Was Virtually Ruined.
column64: We Tend To Book For Two Nights Using The Breakfast And Dinner Inclusive Weekends. The Food And Service Has Always Good. The Only Criticism Is That The Dinner Choice Is Limited In That  The Same Choices Appear On The Menu For Both Nights.
column83: As Previously Mentioned There Was A Problem With Our Bed Which Left Us Unable To Sleep On Our First Night And Therefore Undid All The Unwinding We Had Achieved During Our Day In The Spa - The Situation Was Rectified For Our Second Night And The Customer Satisfaction Skills Used By The Team Were Exemplary.
column84: As I Have Said Earlier In The Questionnaire I Have Sent A Letter Of Thanks To Those Involved. However I Would Like To Mention The Work Of Stephanie Sinclair For Dealing With Our Complaint And The Satisfactory Outcome  Ani (Housekeeping) For Her Feats Of Engineering In Trying To Pad Out The Bed And The Reception Staff For Their Time And Concern.
column89: As You Will Be Aware From Reading Through This Information You Will See That I Could 'Tick' All 3 Boxes Above - Overall I Would Mark It Between Met And Exceeded.

column8: Attended Battle Proms At Hatfield House
column20: Used To Work For Ab Hotels Many Years Ago
column35: Receptionist Was Extremely Pleasant  Helpful And Professional.  Sadly  I Didn't Take Note Of Her Name To Mention Her Personally.
column39: 102 - Great To Have The Magnifying Mirror In The Bathroom.  Might Be Nice To Have The Robes And Slippers Waiting In The Executive Rooms.
column53: Unfortunately For Us Breakfast In The Brasserie On Sunday Morning Was Exceptionally Busy With Several Large  Noisy Family Groups - Not Quite The Relaxing Experience We Had Hoped For.  Staff Were Efficient And Coped Well With The Large Numbers.
column64: Have Always Enjoyed Dining In The Restaurant And Have Never Been Disappointed When Eating There.  It Was Also A Much More Stylish And Relaxed Venue Than The Brasserie.
column77: Due To The Large Family Groups Staying At The Hotel The Pool Was Very Busy And Noisy At One Point.  Your Staff Were Very Vigilant At Keeping All Areas Clean And Tidy.  Sadly  Didn't Have Time To Have Any Treatments   .
column83: The Draught Beer In The Cocktail Bar Was Warm When Served To My Husband.  However  This Was Due To Problem With The Draught System And The Bar Person Immediately Replaced It With A Pint Of Bottled Beer At No Extra Cost.
column84: As I Said Earlier The Receptionist Who Checked Us In And Out Was Extremely Pleasant And Helpful But I Did Not Take Note Of Her Name.
column89: No Not Really.
column90: It Had Been Several Years Since We Last Stayed And The Hotel Has Undergone Some Obvious Refurbishment Which Has Been Done Very Well And Stylishly.

column39: 225 Would Have Liked A Bottle Of Water
column84: All Staff Very Good
column89: Inform Me Of Future Offers

column35: Arrived For A Wedding Was Lovely To Be Able To Check Into Our Room At 11Am
column39: Bathrooms Were A Bit Dark
column89: No
column90: No
We Hosted The Wedding And The Only Comment To Make Was That The Banqueting Team Contact Didn't Have The Required Knowledge To Deal With Our Questions

column53: Could Have Had A Little More Choice From The Set Menu. Nothing Was Really Explained To Us On How The Dining Worked.
column64: As Mentioned Previously What And Where We Could Eat Wasn't Really Explained And Was A Little Confusing.
column84: All Staff Were Great Especially In The Dining Rooms. The Drinks Waiter In The Brasserie Was Great.
column89: The Only Problem We Had Was With The Lift. We Took My Mother With Us Who Is Not Very Agile So We Needed The Use Of The Lift. On A Few Occasions The Lift Wasn't Working Or Was Turned Off Which Cause Problems With Waiting About Etc For It To Start Working. However If My Mother Hasn't Been With Us Then It Wouldn't Have Been A Problem.

column35: Our Arrival Was Early And The Check In Was Efficient  Friendly And Very Helpful.  Luckily Our Room Was Available So That Helped
column53: We Had To Wait For Coffee/Tea And Had To Ask For It After Nearly 5 Minutes Of Waiting.  No Toast Was Offered - I Had To Ask For It.  Would Expect Eggs To Be Cooked Fresh  Omelette/Fried Poached.
column64: Again  We Had To Ask For Everything And On Some Occasions Two Or Three Times  For Something As Easy As Water!  We Didn't Have One Waiter Allocated And I Think Saw Four Or Five Different People None Of Which Knew What We Were Waiting For - It Was Very Disjointed  Now Flow In Service.  Quite Disappointing Considering The Write Up For The Brasserie On Your Home Page.
column77: The Duty Manager Walked Around And Checked Everything From Cleanliness To How Happy Everyone Was In The Pool Area.  Very Impressed.
column83: Our Dining Experiences Were Disappointing -  Lunch  Dinner And Breakfast In The Brasserie.  I Would Recommend For People To Stay - But I Would Not Advise Them To Eat At The Hotel From My Experience. We Waited For Nearly 10 Minutes For A Cocktail On The Terrace And When I Asked What The Sopwell House Cocktail Was -He Didn't Know!
column89: You Really Need To Train Up Your Staff In The Brasserie To An Acceptable Level.  In The End It Was Almost Funny Because We Knew What We Had Requested Would Have To Be Asked For Again  Sometimes Twice.  This Was Not Acceptable For The Standard Of Hotel We Expected.
column90: However  The Hotel Itself Was Magnificent.  I Have Not Seen Such Attention To Detail With The Ambience In The Main Rooms And Spa Areas As Yours.  The Furnishings Were To An Amazing Standard  We Walked Round Stroking The Upholstery And The Artwork Was Very Refreshing And Original.  Beds Were Very Comfortable And The Rooms Were Again To A Very High Standard.  My Friend Staying With Me Is An Interior Designer Who Works In Dubai On New And Refurbing 5*+ Hotels  She Was Indeed Impressed With This Side Of Your Hotel.  Shame The Food And Beverages Service Side Was Not Up To The Standard It Should Have Been.

column84: Rachel Who Served On The Terrace Was Helpful  Pleasant And Polite

column8: I Won A Voucher For A 2 Night Stay For 2.
column35: There Were A Few Problems With Arranging Our Dates When I Was Dealing With Francesca's Predecessor As She Was Not As Efficient As I Would Have Expected.  I Didn't Feel That The Hotel Compensated For This Sufficiently In Subsequent Contact (But Perhaps This Is Because You Didn't Know About It)
column39: 152. Our Kettle Wasn't Working (Which You Swiftly Replaced) And The Shower Is Very Temperamental. We Loved Having Sky Sports!
column53: I Have Stayed At Good Hotels Where The Decaff Coffee Is Also Filter Coffee  Rather Than Sachets (But In Most Cases It Is Not!).  No Cranberry Juice.
column64: We Understand That The Menu In A Fine Dining Restaurant Will Be Limited.  We Were Disappointed  Though  That It Was The Same Menu On The Second Night As The First.
column84: The Maitre D' And His Staff In The Restaurant Were All Very Attentive And Welcoming.
column89: The Brasserie Was Very Noisy.  Don't Know If That's Possible To Solve. In The Evening We Walked In And Then Walked Out Again Very Quickly But Ended Up In The Wonderful Calm Of The Restaurant Which Was Fine.  We Weren't Offered A Paper.  It Wasn't Clear Whether The Bottle Of Wine In The Room Was Complimentary.
column90: Thank You For A Lovely Stay.  One Of The Things We Most Liked Was The Quality And Style Of The Environments Both Inside And Outside The Hotel.  A Lot Of Thought Has Gone Into This  And We Thought The Various Spaces Were Really Lovely.

column39: Very Hot And Air Conditioning Not Very Efficient
column53: Smoked Salmon Frequently Running Out . A Bigger Selection Of Cheeses And Cold Meats Would Have Been Good. Tea And Coffee Was Often Cold By The Time It Was Poured At The Table And We Had To Specially Ask For A 'Pot Of Tea' And Even Then It Arrived As A Pot Of Hot Water And Separate Tea Bags
column64: We Had To Question The Bill As It Had Not Taken Into Account The 'Two Courses' And 'Three Courses' Offers. It Took 3 Attempts To Get The Total Correct. The Staff Were Very Apologetic About This
column83: We Asked To Be Shown Where Our Room Was And We Were Taken Up 2 Flights Of Stairs . The Member Of Staff Carried One Case But One Of Us Had To Carry The Other Heavy Case. On Asking Why We Weren't Going In The Lift We Were Told It Was A Long Way Round And That This Route Was Much More Direct. This Was Clearly Not The Case As Our Room Was A Very Short Distance Away From The Lift

column35: Confusing As Entered Via Business Centre But Staff V Helpful
column64: Very Busy So V Slow Service But Didn't Mind
column83: Slow Service In Restaurant
column89: Clearer Signs For Spa  Restaurants And Reception

column39: Mews Room 12 - Could Do With A Fridge. Water Supplied Was A Nice Touch  But Much Better If Cooled.

column84: The Blonde Lady Who Looked After Us In The Bar For Tea And Later For Drinks/Snacks Was Exceptionally Helpful And Courteous
column89: Check-Out Was Exceptionally Busy On Our Departure And Took Longer Than Ideal. Although It Did Not Greatly Bother Us  We Would Have Liked To Have Been Told In Adavnce That There Was A Wedding In The Hotel That Afternoon/Evening

column35: Everything Went Very Well
column39: The Decor Was Not As Smart As Expected.  Rather Like A Premier Inn.
column53: It Was Excellent
column64: I Was Upset That The Waiter Did Not Explain The Set Menu And That We Could Order 3 Courses As Both Myself & My Guest Had Forgotten. We Only Ordered 2 Courses And He Made No Comment That We Had Paid For 3 Courses.  I Checked With The Lady On The Desk And She Kindly Explained The Deal And Allowed Us To Have Our Glass Of Wine For Free.  She Was Excellent Whilst The Waiter Who Took Our Order Was Disappointing.
column77: I Was Disappointed That I Was Unable To Book And Pay Extra For A Special Facial At 3Pm As I Was Told My Day Ended At 3Pm.
column83: Only Those Previously Mentioned
column84: Only The Lady On The Brasserie Desk On The Evening Of The Monday 22 July.  She Certainly Went The Extra Mile.  I Only Wish I Had Taken Her Name.

column64: I Found The Room Far To Noisy And Lacked Ambiance For An Evening Meal
column83: The Terrace Staff Were Very Slow I Actually Cancelled An Order As We Waited Over 20 Minutes And Still Hasn't Arrived

column35: Misinformed Regarding Use Of Facilities
column39: Room 136 Was Very Small And Cramped
column83: The Waiters Kept On Removing Glasses From The Tables That Still Had Drink In Them While We Were On The Dance Floor
column89: Clearer Communication Between Booking Staff And Other Staff

column8: Relax...First Two Days Of Our Summer Hols  We're Teachers!
column64: There Was Only One Other Couple In The Restaurant  So Very Quiet And Little Atmosphere.
column77: We Booked Late So Were Unable To Get A Treatment.
column83: Getting A Coffee Was Soooooooo Slow....On The Up Side The Young Lad Then Never Charged Us! The Second Day We Had Coffee Again  We Were Charged This Time But Again Slow  At Least 15 Mins After Ordering.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Had To Email On Receipt Of Confirmation As Form Was Unclear And I Was Not Confident My Reservations Had Been Correctly Booked
column39: 126 - No Minibar. I Would Have Expected A Fridge And At Least Availability Of Cold Drinks In The Room
column64: We Also Had Snacks At The Cocktail Bar And On The Terrace During Our Stay Where The Service Was Very Slow
column70: Casual Meeting Room Was Not Required
column83: Following Dinner On The Friday Night We Were Told By Very Unhelpful Staff That We Were 'Not Allowed' On The Terrace As It Was Closed For A Private Function. Had We Have Been Aware Of This Previously We Would Have Gone Into St. Albans For Dinner. Also A Male Member Of Staff Walked Into My Room While I Was In My Underwear Despite The Do Not Disturb Sign Being On The Door
column89: It Is Not Appropriate To Close The Terrace To Residents  Regardless Of Extra Functions You May Have Booked. There Was Insufficient Seating Outside The Cocktail Bar For The Other Wedding And All Other Guests  The Air Conditioning Was Totally Insufficiently To Remain Inside
column90: If You Overbook Functions In The Space You Have  Quality Will Suffer And People Will Not Recommend The Venue

column64: The Air Conditioning Wasn't Very Good. Very Hot Everywhere.
column77: When Going On A Relaxing Spa Break I Didn't Expect Noisy Children In The Pool
column89: Up The Air Conditioning.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Very Good Spa Phoned To Confirm Bookings
column64: We Had A Lovely Lunch But The Diner Wasn't Quite As Nice.
column84: Porter Very Good And Lady In The Spa Was Also Very Good
column90: Enjoyed My Stay And Would Like To Return

column35: The Lady That Was Checking Me In Did Not Seem To Know About How To Do Pre-Authorisation On Cc. She Was Therefore Too Busy Talking To A More Experienced Person Re This Than Talking To Me  When I Arrived I Went Straight To The Main Part Of Reception She Just Said 'Can You Come Round Here I'm Checking In Here Leave Yr Bags There) - Was A Bit Forthright ( I Am A Sales Director And Not Sensitive!) However Think She Was New.  All Other Staff Were Very Welcoming And Friendly Particularly Bar/Restaurant Etc. Checkout Staff Were Very Good.
column39: The Room Was Nice Enough But Some Tin Gs Let It Down. (Dust Had Just Started To Come Back On The Mirror Tale Under The Tv) .  The Bin In The Bathroom Was A Foot Pedal Type But The Foot Pedal Didn't Open!  Ther Should Be A Minibar In The Room. Plus Side Safe  Wardrobe Space Good.
column53: Breakfast Was Average - Should Offer More Choice Of Eggs And Someone On Hand To Do Them. Bacon Was Smoked And Not Very Nice - Needs To Be Better Quality. Mushrooms Were Tinned!  Not Good!!!!
column64: Food Was Excellent And So Was Service. Totally Different From Breakfast
column83: Other Than The Check In As Explained
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: We Did Not Have A Hair Dryer In Our Room
column84: The Girl At Reception Was Extremely Helpful  Polite And Cheerful When We Checked In Early. She Phoned Us When Our Room Was Ready.
column90: We Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Spa Experience And Will Certainly Book Again.

column35: We Arrived Early (11Am) And Didn't Expect To Get Into Rooms Then But Rooms Were Ready And We Were Allowed Up - Nice Surprise
column39: More Tea (English Breakfast) Please!
column53: One Of Our Party Is Coeliac And Was Pleased To Have Gluten-Free Toast Made For Her - Thank You
column64: As We Stayed For Two Nights We Were A Little Disappointed To Have The Menu Duplicated The Second Night.  One Of Our Party Doesn't Eat Meat And She Had The Salmon & Prawn Pasta The First Night Which She Didn't Like At All.  The Second Night Then Her Only Choice Was A Vegetable Dahl.  Bearing In Mind How Many Non-Meat Eaters There Are Out There  You Should Offer More Choice.  Also  The Menu Was Very 'Wintry' - No Salads Or Summery Options.  The Duck & Pork Were Very Nice Though.  We Did Get Offered The Ala Carte Menu (At A Discounted Rate) But As This Didn't Add Many Options To The Meal We Didn't Think It Was Worth The Extra.
column77: Lovely To Have The Sunbeds Outside - And The Pool Area Is Much Improved Since Our Last Stay
column84: Thank You To The Restaurant Staff On Saturday Night Who Did A Little 'Celebration' Icecream For My Sister's Birthday

column77: We Wanted To Use The Swiming Pool And Were Told That Someone Would Come Around And Take Orders For Drinks . This Did Not Happen So We Were Forced To Return To The Bar For A Cup Of Tea. When We Returned There No Beds To Lie On!. This Was Frustrating So We Had To Return To Are Room. We Did Return To The Pool Much Later In The Day And Were Able To Use All The Spar Facilities Which Was Great. My Only Other Suggestion Is That There Should Be A Range Of Reading Matter Available @ The Pool Side.

column83: The Drinks In The Library Were Very Slow In Coming Forward.....Waited Sometime To Have Our Order Taken
column89: The Only Problem I Had Was That The Prices Of Your Drinks/Wine I Found Very High....Very Off Putting To Want To Stay Again When Everything Else Was Very Nice...I Believe People Would Spend More If Prices Were Lower...

column39: Tv Did Not Work Despite Repeated Attempts To Fix.. Was Eventually Fixed
column53: Only Brassiere Was Open.. Limited Menu Compared To Restaurant
column64: Limited Menu

column35: Just A Big Thank You To All That Made Our Stay Very Pleasant.
column53: Everything Was Hot And Plentiful
column84: I Think All The Staff Treated Us Very Well And Politely Nothing Was To Much Trouble
column89: Everything Was Fine
column90: Once Again Just A Thank You To All The Staff And We Hope To See You Again In The Future

column35: The Lift Was Not Working And Sent Wrong Way To Room Were Directed Via The Shut Off Area So Had To Double Back.Had To Go Up The Stairs With A Suitcase Couple Of Times.
column39: In The Bathroom Panel And Surrounding Area Requires Attention.For The Cost We Thought The Room Could Do With A Little Bit Of A Refurb A Bit Tired Looking.
column64: Staff Very Nice But Asked Us If Everything Was Okay A Little To Often.
column84: Gentleman On The Management Staff Was Very Helpfull We Spoke To Him About Our Reception Held There 23 Years Ago  As We Were Looking From Outside Into The Wedding Areas.He Showed Us In To The Hall Which Was Set Up For A Wedding  Which Was Very Nice To See Especially For My Wife Who Got A Little Emotional.So Thanks Again But Unfortunately I Don't Know His Name But I Am Sure He Will Remember.
column90: It Was Lovely To Come Back Because We Have Always Been Away On Holiday At That Time Of The Year. Everything Overall Was Very Nice We Just Thought The Room Less The Bed Would Be Nicer For The Cost.

column84: The Manageress (I Dont Know Her Name But She Was On Duty Sunday Evening 18Th Aug) She Was So Helpful And Also Kyri The Beautician Who Was Excellent At Delivering The Treatments I Had Booked And Also Both Friendly And Professional
column89: Perhaps When You Have A Spa Break There Could Be Complimentary Coffee/Herbal Teas Available  As There Was At Grayshott I Think This Could Be Covered By A Slight Increase In The Price And This Would Be Helpful For Those That Are In  Their Robes And Maybe Not Wanting To Take Their Money With Them Into The Spa
column90: Have Recommended The Hotel And Spa To Friends And Will Definitely Revisit. Would Love To See A Similar Break To The Spa One That I Could Take My Little Girl On As Its A Great Help Having All The Meals Included.

column39: I Was Surprised At How Far It Was From Reception Adn How Hard To Find;  There Is No Sign On The Door You Need To Go Through To Get Down To The Mezzanine Level
column53: No Fresh Brown Bread  Cooked Foods Didn't Taste As Though They Were Top Quality.  Smoked Salmon And Bacon Too Salty.
column64: I Couldn't Bring Myself To Eat In The Brasserie Or Restaurant Because They Were Too Dark.  Only The Conservatory Gave Me Spave To 'Breathe'.
column89: I Liked The Reception Area But Did Not Like Thebedroom Decor At All.  There Is No Consistent Theme Running Through Though I Can See That A Designer Has Been Paid To Decorate!
column90: All In All  Disappointing Surroundings  But The Conservatory Food Was Very Good (Excellent Salade Nicoise) And All The Staff Were Excellent.  For Some Reason A *Huge* Deposit Of Around Â£400 I Think Was Taken On Arrival. The Balance Was Refunded On Departure.  Unfortunately We Didn't Have Time To Use The Spa Although We Had Intended To.

column35: I Think We Should Have Been Told Where Everything Is As We Found Ourselves Constantly Asking For Directions To The Spa Etc
column39: More Coffee  Tea And Sugar Would Have Been Better
column53: Food Was Hot And Edible :-)
column64: Food Was Amazing But Didn't Know There Was A Restaurant - See Previous Comment About Knowing Where Things Are!
column77: Smaller Slippers!!! Also The Fact That Children Were Using The Pool  Would Have Preferred An Adults Only Area.
column84: Girls In The Spa Were Brilliant And Even Cut My Slippers Down (I'm Only A Size 3)
column89: More Signs Saying Where Facilities Are!
column90: No  But It Was A Lovely Stay-Thank You

column84: Callum (Concierge) Took Great Care Of Us  Whilst We Were Stuck In The Lift For 20 Minutes  He Stood Outside The Lift And Talked To Us And Kept Us All Calm Until The Maintenance Engineer Arrived To Free Us All. There Were 8 Of Us Ladies In The Lift And Half Were In Panic Mode. So Well Done And Thank You So Much To Callum For His Kindness And Patience.
column89: Was An Excellent 2 Days To Celebrate An 18Th Birthday And Getting Stuck In The Lift Didn't Take Anything Away From Our Experience.  However We Were A Little Disappointed That Because Of The Lift Incident 4 Members Of The Party Missed Out On One Of Their Two Treatments And In Way Of Compensation  We Were  Offered Clarins Samples (Which By The Way  Are Given Free Over The Counter From Any Large Department Store) And 2 Bottles Of House Wine At The Dinner Table. Paul The Manager Had Indicated That We Were To Have Free Champagne And Were To Be Looked After At Dinner. Well We Had Already Ordered And Paid For A Bottle Of Champagne At The Table And That Was The Only One We Had. When We Asked The Waitress About It She Said She Was Told To Give Us The House Wine. So Although We Had Paid For 2 Treatments Each Only 4 Of Us Had Them  The Other 4 Had One Treatment That Lasted Half An Hour.
column90: It's A Shame That These 4 Ladies Missed Out On A Treatment Due To No Fault Of Our Own And I Realise That The Spa Is Busy And Always Booked. Because We Had Such A Good Time We Didn't Want To Finish This Experience On A Negative Note With A Complaint  So We Didn't Take It Further Before We Left.  But Now You Have Asked For Feedback  I Have Taken The Opportunity To Advise Of Our Disappointment At What Was Offered In Place Of 4 Treatments  I.E.  Freebie Samples And 2 Bottles Of Wine.

column89: No
column90: Really Enjoyed My Stay But Was Very Disappointed With Cambridge.

column35: Very Helpful Member Of Staff Re Wheelchair Accessibility.  But This Followed The Person Answering The Phone Answering Questions But Not Understanding The Issues - Would Have Been Better To Just Pass Call Straight On To Someone With Information. 1St Spa Staff Phone Contact Unfriendly And Unwelcoming.  2Nd Conversation Very Helpful
column39: Room 117?- Bed By Window Dreadful.  Mattress Really Sagged In The Middle - Big Dip.  After I Requested It The Mattress Was Turned And Was A Bit Better (In Contrast!)   But Still Needed To Be Replaced.
column53: Poached Eggs Excellent! Should Make It Clear By Menu/Sign That Sliced Bread Toast Available On Request
column64: Would Be Good To Have A More Reasonable Price Option For Wine  Other Than As Part Of Set Menu.  Price Of Bottles Exorbitant

column84: The Majority Of Staff Were Very Willing To Be Helpful With Wheelchair Accessibility Issues And To Give Me A Push Up Very Steep Ramps In Hallway/Carry Chair Up/Down Stairs To Access Outside.
column89: Had A Better Bed.  Better Accessibility.  More Reasonably Priced Soft Drinks
column90: I Would Recommend Sopwell House To Able-Bodied Friends  But Not For People In Wheelchairs.  There Are Probably A Few Things That Could Be Done To Make The Hotel More Accessible  But It Really Isn't Currently.  Admittedly I Was Told It Wasn't Fully Accessible  But The Reality Was Even Worse Than I Anticipated.  I Believe The Room I Was In Was For People In Wheelchairs - But It Was As Far From The Lift As Possible!  Manual Wheelchairs On Carpets Are Very Hard Work!

column90: The Hot Buffet Lunch Was Slightly Disappointing As The Food Was Luke Warm And Quite Dry But There Were Plenty Of Cold Alternatives Which I Took Instead.

column84: All Were Very Good  Friendly  Professional
column89: Offered Newspapers To Be Delivered To Our Room In The Morning.
column90: We Found Everything To Be Excellent And Sincerely Hope To Visit Again.

column39: Room 264(?) 2Nd Floor  On Initial Telephone Enquiry I Was Told We Could Book An Apartment To Accommodate 5 People At Â£240.00  Male Receptionist. Upon Booking A Few Minutes Later Was Told No Such Accommodation Exists And Would Have To Have Two Rooms  Female Operator. Paid For Two Rooms  264 Was Drab  Smelt Dirty And Tired. The Bathroom Was Marked 4 Out Of Ten Clean And The Panel On The Side Of The Bath Was Plywood And Looked As Though It Had Been Used To Push A Wheelbarrow Up In To A Skip! I Would Not Have Let My Children Sleep There. The Children's Room Was Drab And Tired (255.) I Reported This To Your Reception And Had Asked To Have A Quick Word With The Manager. Although Your Receptionist Disappeared Three Times To Talk To The Manager Regarding This I Was Unable To Speak To Him Or Her! You Receptionist Was Very Embarrassed And Most Apologetic And Offered Me A 10% Discount........ An Insult! I Declined The Offer And Explained That I Was Not That Cheap And Did Not Need Your Money. Your Food Was Average And Some Options Were Not Available Due To Empty Serving Plates. Your Restaurants Need To Explain To Customers Properly What They Need To Do To Accommodate Sitting Down And Eating  There Was A Lack Of Communication. We Had Several Celebrated Guests Visit Us In The Evening Who Didn't Believe That The Rooms Were That Poor Until Some Insisted On An Inspection. Your General Staff Were Pleasant At All Times Particularly The Bar Manager And Bar Tender They Were Very Accommodating... I Would Employ Them Any Time. It Should Be Said That Your Main Reception Is An  Impressive Area Let Down By Some Paint Work  Doorman And Porter Were Helpful And Pleasant. The Pool Area And Gym Were Good Working Areas And Enjoyable. I Hope That You Find These Comments Both Candid And Constructive. Yours Sincerely  Collin Glinsman
column83: Only In Trying To Speak To Your Manager Which Did Not Happen And His Or Her Financial Insult.
column84: Serving Staff In The Breakfast Area  And The Bar / Lounge Manager And Barman.
column89: See Above
column90: See Above

column39: I Think It Was Room 117 A Double Executive. No Different To A Good Premier Inn   Value  For Money Poor. Overall Disappointed. Shower/ Toilet For Disability Ok.
column48: A Rustic Beef Sandwich Is Not A Slice Of Beef Between Ordinary White Sliced Bread. Very Shabby.
column53: Queues Made It An Indifferent Experience With Some Dishes Empty.Access For Those With Disability Confined To One Area Which W Full.
column83: Hotel Is Not Disabled Friendly. Our Room Couldn't Have Been Any Further From Dining Areas/Reception. Access On Ground Floor Via Steep Gradient Ramps In Narrow Corridors With Hand Rails Only On One Side. Your Whole Setup To Meet The Needs Of Disabled/Mobility Issues Needs To Be Reviewed.
column89: Not Value For Money. We Were Really Looking Forward To The Stay On The Basis Of Your Write Up But Were Very Disappointed. I Don't Ming Paying But I Do Expect Value For Money. This Was Sadly Lacking.

column35: When I Telephoned To Confirm My Restaurant Booking The Receiptionist Was Polite But Very Abrupt And This Made Me Concerned That I May Have Made A Mistake In Booking At Sopwell House.  When We Acctually Arrived This Concern Was Allayed.
column53: The Breakfast Was Very Good - But I Would Really Have Prefered To Have A Teapot On The Table Rather Than 'Dunking' A Teabag In A Cup With Water Dispensed From A Flask.  The Water In The Flask Was Hot But It Detracted From The Whole Experience Slightly.  Bring Back The Tea Pots! - I Assume You Have Them When People Book Afternoon Tea?
column64: The Food In The Restaurant Was Delicious And Well-Presented And The Service Was Attentive Without Intrusion. The Brasserie Gave A Good Choice Of Food For The Lunch Buffet And The Staff Were Very Helpful/Accomodating With A Member Of Our Party Who Couldn't Eat Any Dairy... Well Done.
column84: The Restaurant Staff On The Evening Of 30.08.13 Were Excellent.  They Just Gave Very Good Service They Could Not Have Been More Helpful.  We Did Give An Extra Tip When We Paid For Our Meal But As We Did This On A Card I Do Not Know If It Went To The Staff Or Was Absorbed In The Takings?
column90: I Was Really Very Happy With How My Last Minute Booking And Dining Turned Out Which Was Down To The Very Helpful  Professional And Curtious Staff  The Pleasant Location And The Delightful Weather!

column53: I Would Have Said That Our Stay Was Excellent And We Would Certainly Stay With You Again. However  We Felt That The Service Could Have Been Better. On The Friday Morning  We Were Greeted In The Breakfast Area By A Very Pleasant Gentleman Who Subsequently Came Over To Our Table To Ensure Everything Was Ok. My Critisism Albeit Minor  Was That We Had To Wait What Seemed Like A Long Time(But May Have Been Only 10 Minutes) To Be Offered Tea  Coffee Etc. I Had To Attract The Waitresses Attention To Ask For Tea  And Very Promptly She Brought A Mug Of Black Tea. No Offer Of Milk And I Had To Request A Teaspoon. Surely A Pot Of Tea Is The Correct Thing To Offer. I Just Feel That You Have An Exceptional Hotel And The Small Point I Am Making Is A Genuine Weakness That Should Be  Addressed. Saying That  It Was My Daughter's Wedding Reception And Without Exception  Everyone Of The Guests That I Spoke To Said What A Great Day They Had At Sopwell House.
column84: The Young Man Who Took Our Bags To The Room Was Very Helpful. And I Must Say That The Receptionists Were Very Professional And Pleasant.

Surely Housekeeping Are Aware Of These Issues And Should Report Them? Antonella? Was Very Apologetic  Pleasant And Arranged A Move To 157 Which Was Stunning In Both Size And View. Only Problem Which I Didn't Raise For 157 Was One Of The Mugs Was Clearly Not Dishwashed  But This Is A Hotel Industry Issue Which I Have Seen Before. Housekeepers Must Check All Areas Of A Room  That Said 157 Was Still Lovely.

column83: I Had A Tea For 23 People Booked For The Restaurant  And It Was All Set Up For Us As I Saw It 15 Minutes Previous To Booking Time.  But When We Sent To The Table We Had Been Moved To The Terrace  Without Consultation.  This Caused An Issue As The Tables In The Terrace Were Too Low For The Elder Members Of My Party  So It Added Stress To The Event.   We Also Had A Waiter Tell Us The Childrend Sandwiches Were Nut Free When One Of In Fact Peanut Butter And One Of The Children Had A Mild Nut Allergy  Luckily No Harm Was Done But It Was Poor When Asked A Direct Question By Myself As To The Content Of The Sandwiches  I Specifically Said Did They Contain Nuts And Was Assured Not.
column84: The Assistant Manager  Peter (I Think  He Gave Me His Card But I Misplaced It) Was Excellent And Dealt Brilliantly With The Problem Of The Tables And Gave Us A Fair Discount For The Inconvenience And Stress.  We Ended Up Having A Lovely Time  The Food Was Great And We Would Come Again  But It Was A Shame That He Needed To Fix The Issue.  Had We Been Left In The Restaurant Or Consulted About The Move It Would Not Have Happened And You Would Not Have Felt The Need To Give A Discount.
column90: My Husband Enjoyed His 50Th Birthday And We Especially Loved The Hot Stone Massages.  Thank You

column39: 141 - The Security Viewfinder In  He Door Was Missing And Therefore People Could Look Into The Room. I Had To Stuff The Hole With Tissue.
column83: At 10Pm  As I Was Sitting On My Chair Watching Tv A Male In His Mid-Twenties Let Himself Into My Room. I Was Shocked Andbefore I Had A Chance To Say Anything He Looked At Me  Said Sorry And Left. This Left Me Shaken. I Did Call Reception And 'Emergency' Key On Phone And After The Third Time Of Ringing  Explained My Situation. The Lady Taking My Call Was Sorry For What Had Happened And Said That She Would Look Inot It. I Explained That It Was Distressing And She Said That If It Was A Member Of Staff She Was Sorry. I Asked For A Reply But None Came. When I Checked Out The Next Day  The Lady On Reception Asked If I Had Had A Nice Stay. I Explained What Had Happened And She Too Was Shocked. She Took The Detilas And Said She Would Look Into It. I Have Had No Response To Date. I Travel And Stay In Hotels Each Week And My Safety Is Paramount. I Have Never Felt Vulnerable And Yet In This Instance I Didn't Sleep As I Had No Reassurance As To What Had Happened.
column89: Some Feedback On My Complaint Would Have Been Nice. I Can Understand That Mistakes Can Be Made  But The Lack Of Customer Care And Follow-Up Is Disappointing.

column64: Staff  In The Restaurant Were Brilliant; Very Pleasant  Customer Focused  Polite  Knowledgeable. Very Impressed. Chefs Are Producing Very Good Quality Food  And We Have Been Lucky Enough To Experience Some Some Michelin Star Restaurants So We Know What Is Good And Bad !!
column77: You Are Not Offering What Your Rivals Are Offering; Other 5-Star Hotels Offer Spa Treatments For Couples. We Were Highly Disappointed. If You Trumpet How Good Your Facilities Are  You Need To Ensure They Are  And They Are Not ! You Have Missed The Boat. You Have Become Complacent As You Are Obviously Fully Booked Every Weekend For All Girl Spa Sessions  However  With Second Marriages Etc Now  Us 2Nd/3Rd Timers Are More In Touch With Our Female Sides And What Our Partners Want. Thus Customers Like Us Want 'Spas For Couples'

column39: 159 The Pullout Sofa Bed Was Unsleepable-Our Daughter  Who Was With Us The Third Night  Would Have Been More Comfortable On The Floor.  Even As A Sofa It Was Not Comfortable
column53: There Should Be A Toaster For Guests To Use.  On One Occasion We Asked For Toast As We Were Helping Ourselves To Eggs  Etc.  We Had To Ask 3 Different Servers Before We Received It (We Had Asked For Brown Bread) And When The White Bread Finally Arrived  We'd Finished Eating Already.  It Was Over 15 Minutes Before It Arrived!
column77: Yes: We Were Told Twice By Different People At The Spa And Reception The Incorrect Closing Time.  Most Of The Reason We Decided To Come To Your Hotel Was For The Pool Facilities And Gym.  Based On The Wrong Information We'd Been Given  We Had Planned Our Evenings Around The 10Pm Closing Time We'd Been Assured.  Sadly We Were Evicted Twice At 9Pm  Having Just Arrived And Having Planned On Staying A Relaxing Hour In The Steam Room And Pool.  This Was Extremely Disappointing.  Though Some Of The People Working At The Hotel Were Very Friendly (Esp In The Bar) The Level Of Basic Knowledge And Intelligence Was Shockingly Low.
column83: I Asked For Two Duvets To Be Brought To The Room.  One Arrived  30 Minutes Later.  We Were Misled About 1) The Opening/Closing Hours Of The Pool  And 2) The Opening Hours Of The Dining Room
column89: Later Hours For The Pool On Saturday And Sunday-This Would Have Totally Changed Our Experience Of Sopwell

Fortunately  I Had A Credit Card With Me But This Could Have Been A Bit Inconvenient. I Think She Was Fairly New So Simply Hadn't Been Trained Sufficiently. Having Said That  She Was Utterly Charming And Made Us Feel Very Welcome When We Checked In.

column83: Our Toilet Did Not Work And It Took Too Long To Fix

column39: On Arrival There Was Glass On The Floor Of Our Room.  I Pointed This Out To The Bell Boy Who Informed Housekeeping Straight Away.  They Dealt With This Immediately  Vacuuming The Whole Room Thoroughly And Were Very Apologetic.   Our Room (216) Had A Number Of What Looked Like Red Wine Marks On The Wall Both In The Main Room And Bathroom Which Was Disappointing  The Corner Of My Duvet Cover Looked Like It Had Been Chewed Up In The Washing Machine  So Looked A Bit Tatty!  Other Than That The Room Was Very Clean And Well Maintained
column53: The Breakfast And The Brasserie Experience Are The Only Area Of Sopwell House That Are Just Not Quite Up To Scratch.  The Staff  Particularly At Breakfast Seem Very Inexperienced And We Had To Ask Several Times For Tea  Coffee  Toast Etc.  The Buffet Style Breakfast Is Well Below The Standard Of The Rest Of The Food I Ate At Sopwell.  There Is Nothing More Off Putting That Curled Up Bacon And Solidified Eggs...
column64: The Brasserie Is A Little Disappointing Thought The Standard Of The Food Is Perfectly Acceptable.  The Atmosphere Is Not Very Relaxed  The Staff A Little Brusque And There Is A General Feeling Of Churning Tables To Get Diners Through The Experience As Quickly As Possible.  The Decor With All Its Hard Edges Makes It A Very Loud And Noisy Experience And Not A Place Conducive To A Relaxed Eating Experience.   Our Experience Of Both The Restaurant And The Cocktail Lounge Was However Faultless.  The Staff Were Attentive And Professional  The Food Was Outstanding And The Drinks Were Mixed To Perfection.
column77: My Only Comment Would Be That A Reminder To Book Spa Treatments At The Time Of Booking Would Have Been Good.  I Was Only Able To Get A Last Minute Cancellation.  I Would Certainly Have Booked More Treatments If There Had Been Slots Available.
column83: The Breakfast Staff In The Brasserie Were Really Not Up To Scratch
column84: Yes!  Higham  The Bar Manager Recognised Me From A Previous Visit And Said 'Hello Mrs Moon  Nice To See You Back With Us' - What A Nice Touch.  He Looked After Us So Well All Weekend.  His Professionalism And Dedication Was Strongly Evident.  Also Like To Mention Paulo Who Was Our Waiter In The Restaurant On The Saturday Night. It Was My Daughter's 12Th Birthday And He Went Out Of His Way To Make Her Feel Special.  It Was A Wonderful Evening With Excellent Food And Excellent Service.
column89: As Mentioned  The Brasserie Needs A Little Work
column90: Despite The Brasserie Experience We Had A Wonderful Weekend.  The Staff At Sopwell Are So Attentive And The Atmosphere Is Wonderfully Relaxing.  Looking Forward To Staying With You Again.

column53: As A Loner Traveller I Felt Completely Ignored At Breakfast ( And Also Eating Lucnh During My Spa Day ) I Had To Ask For Toast And A Hot Drink   My Plate Was Not Cleared Away  I Had No One Ask Me How My Food Was And Yet Witnessed Others Who Had More In Their Party Receive A Much Better Service. I Would Have Thought As A Lone Traveller The Service Should Have Been Much More Attentive And Not Less So. I Must Say I Was Really Disappointed By This  Because It Happened At Lunch As Well As The Breakfast. I Had No Offer Of Bread At Lunch  My Plate Was Not Cleared Away And I Received No Service At All.
column83: As Mentioned My Lunch On The Spa Day  I Was Really Ignored And Not Offered The Same Service That Couples Or Groups Were  - I Was Not Offered Any Bread  No One Showed Me How It Worked  What The Soup Was Etc Etc Etc - I Have Been Before ( With Others) And This Time Was Really Not Impressed.

column89: Even Though I Was Travelling Alone - I Felt As Thought I Was Treated Poorly - If Anything I Would Have Thought Peole Would Have Been More Attentive And Not Less. No Offer Of Bags When I Checked Out.
column90: I Have To Say For What I Spent ( Over Â£400) For One Day Spa And An Overnight Stay  I Felt Very Under Whelmed By The Service In The Brasserie - Would Really Have To Consider Whether I Ever Stayed Again And Possibly The Spa   Which Is A Real Shame As This Is My 5Th Visit And I Have Been On My Own Before And Not Felt So Unwelcome.

column89: On The Night Of Friday 11Th October  Drunken Guests From A Wedding Party Were Brawling In Corridor.  It Was Horrific In That It Went On From 2Am Until Nearly 4:30Am.  I Do Not Understand Why Didn't Bring The Police In And Get Resolved In A More Timely Way.  I Was Very Unhappy With The Lack Of Sleep And I Know Many Other Guests Were Intimidated.  You Either Need To Screen Your Drunken Guests Or Invest In Some Security.

column35: The Level Of Service From All Staff Throughout Our Stay Was Excellent.

column35: Arrived At 1 Room Ready At 3 As Advised  So Had Lunch While We Waited.
column39: Room 234 Window Open  Smelled Of Smoke And Cold No Heating On.  Tried To Set Temp Waited Half An Hour Then Found Chambermaid To Try  She Couldn't Do So Called Reception. Maintenance Arrived And Set  As Heating Came On Smell Of Smoke Worse  Also Carpet Damp To Walk On As Room Had Been Smoked In And Carpet Cleaned.  At First Reception Said No Other Room Then We Were Moved To Room 222.  This Was Ok But Only Double Bed  We Always Have Kingsize As Mr Whyman Large Build  Mattress Soft And Over Noisy Banqueting But That Was Not So Much A Problem.  We Dined In The Main Restaurant Which Was Fine  Although Water Never Did Arrive When Requested.  On Departure Mr Whyman Asked For Reduction For Inconvenience As This Was Meant To Be A Relaxing Weekend For Him Due To His Busy Work Schedule  Like Many Others  But Vince Said He Could Do Nothing But Offered An Upgrade Next Time We Stay! Our Afternoon Completely Wasted So He Left Not A Happy Man.  I Have Been A Member For 12 Years  Stayed Many Times Which Have Been Lovely With No Complaints  The Last Being 4 July 13.  I Really Think He Could Have Made A Reduction  Or Offered Lunch In Brasserie Or Something  An Upgrade Just Means You Have To Spend More Money.  We Have Stayed Twice At Luton Hoo And Been Upgraded To Suites At Â£799 For Nothing  So That's Is Where My Partner Will Chose Next Time.  This Was My Idea As A Member I Am Happy There  But When Membership Went Up It Was My Partner Who Persuaded Me To Stay  So I Felt Quite Bad Vince Didn't Give Any Compensation  Apart From Bottle Of Wine In Room.  All He Could Say Was How Great The Place Is Now With The Refurbishments  But I Know As A Member Had To Put Up With Them All.    Not A Relaxing Weekend As Planned  Which Is A Shame As We Were Going To Use It More Often As My Partner Not Local  Also Spa Busy No Treatments Available Which Is Understandable  Breakfast And Service Really Good Though.  I Should Have Asked To See You.
column53: It Was Really Good
column64: Champagne Was Lovely And Chilled Can Be Warm In Some Places  Both Had Steak  Mine Was More Well Done  But After Our Room Experience  Didn't Mention It As My Partner Was Upset Enough  Luckily His Was Ok!!  We Did Ask For More Water But It Never Arrived.  Doubt We Would Dine There Again In A Hurry  Did So For As Convenient For Our Stay

column83: We Had Had A Busy Day And Didn't Manage To Get To You Until About 7Pm So We Sat In The Bar For A Drink. Our Table Was Booked For 8Pm And It Was Apparent It Was Going To Be A Rush. We Asked The Bar Tender If It Was Possible For Him To Ask If The Restaurant Would Change Our Reservation To 8.30. Sadly  He Became Quickly Distracted By A Large Party Needing More Chairs  Forgetting About Us And Leaving Us Not Knowing What To Do.

column35: There Had Been A Change To Our Booking  On Our Part  Whereby The Spa Had Made The Booking With Reception For Us.  This Had Not Been Communicated To Reception And There Was No Note On Our Booking  Which Resulted In A Bit Of Confusion.
column39: Room 233 - Room Was Lovely  But There Were A Few Things Which Let It Down.  The Lamp On The Desk Did Not Work  The Sink Tap And Shower Took A Long Time To Run Smoothly And Spluttered For A Few Minutes Before We Could Use It.  The Shower Leaked On The Floor As We Could Not Adjust The Flow Of Water To Keep It In The Area Of The Shower Glass.   There Was Only Sufficient Milk And Tea Bags To Make One Cup Of Tea.
column53: The Breakfast In Terms Of Quality Was Outstanding.  Unfortunately We Arrived At 9.00 Which Is Clearly A Prime Time For Arrival And The Organisation In The Restaurant Was Chaotic.  The Staff Present Worked Hard But Could Not Manage To Get On Top Of Clearing Tables  Serving Tea And Coffee  Toast And Butter.  They Were Charming And Very Helpful  But Overwhelmed For About 20 Minutes.
column64: The Food Was Excellent.  The Waiter Did Not Know What The Lamb Main Course Was And Told Us It Was A Type Of Chop. It Was A Lamb Casserole  Which Was Delicious  If Unexpected.
column77: The Massage Was Outstanding For Both Of Us.  It Was My Partner's First Massage And He Is Now Hooked!

column35: Although The Staff Were Very Polite And Friendly There Was No Order Or Extra Care For New Arrivals. I Did Notice After We Had Checked In That A Number Of Staff Were Available To Assit New Clients - Maybe Just Our Timing Was Off.

I Asked The Chef Directly For A Mushroom Omelette Which He Very Kindly Cooked And Delivered To My Table Which I Thought Was Very Courteous And The Omelette Was Delicious.

column77: It Was So Busy That There Was No Loungers Or Chairs To Use And The Noise Level Was Awful.  More Like A Public Swimming Area Than A Hotel Spa! On The Second Day We Were There  We Were Informed By The Reception Spa Staff  That It Was Very Busy Round The Pool And Actually Ended Up Spending Most Of The Day In The Coffee Lounge In Our Robes  Which Wasnt Actually Ideal.

column39: Room 133 - I Have Visited And Stayed At Sopwell On A Number Of Occasions.  I Would Like To See A Mini Fridge In The Room  It Would Be Nice For Waters Especially In The Summer Months.
column90: I Dont Think You Survey Mentioned The Spa.  We Arrived Early For Our Treatments So That We Could Relax By The Pool Etc.  Unfortunately There Were No Sun Beds Or Chairs For Us To Sit  Many Beds Were Empty But With Towels On Them And Although The Staff Said They Regularly Checked The Beds And Cleared Towels We Didn't Have The Time To Wait So Had To Sit In The Bar!!

column35: None
column53: The Coffee Is Far Too Strong And Grainy. Need To Be Moderate With Its Flavour  Its Like An Expresso!
column64: The Menu Is Not Changed On A Regular Basis  Therefore Limited In Choice. No Specials Detailed. Therefore When Staying Regularly I Run Out Of Choices!
column89: On Checkout Any Additions Were Incorrectly Booked To My Room Therefore Had To Correct And Asked To Review Receipts. Not Easy To See.
column90: It's A Nice Hotel And The Staff Are Friendly And Attentive. Thank You.

column35: Details Given In Original Booking Telephone Conversation Were Incorrect....Ie Told Price Included Dinner When It Did Not. Prices Given Per Night Were Actually Bed And Breakfast Rates And Then Differed When Confirmed In Writing.
column39: Apartment 1. The Apartment Was Shabby With Many Cobwebs Around The Ceiling. The 'Kitchen' Area Was Lacking...Only Two Mugs For 4 Of Us. Very Limited Tea And Coffee Sachets Provided And Given We Were Paying Â£250 Per Night  Would Have Expected A Bowl Of Fruit  More Biscuits Etc. If You Did Try And Cook (Not That We Did) Would Have Expected More Utensils. The Bathroom Soaps Etc Were Not Replenished For The Second Night. Finally Sound Proofing V Poor As We Were Right By Reception And Therefore Heard All The Delivery Lorries Arriving In The Morning And All Guests Arriving And Departing Were Loud And Woken Up During The Night On Both Nights. We Could Also Hear The Television And Voices From The Family In The Room Below Us - The Overall Sound Proofing Was V Poor And Given The Room Rate  Would Have Expected Much Better.
column53: Very Busy And Noisy In The Dinning Room Used...Not A Relaxing Experience.
column77: Very Disappointed That It Is Adults Only After 5Pm. We Have Two Teenage Daughters And Having Arrived At 5Pm And Told That The Earliest Dinner Reservation Was 9Pm  We Had Four Hours To Wait. We Then Found That We Couldn't Use The Leisure Facilities Which Totally Defeated Our Plan To Have A Relaxing Few Days In A Nice Hotel With Facilities That We Could All Use. We Cancelled The Dinner Reservation And Went Out Instead. I Appreciate That You Might Want To Restrict Timings During The Week When You Have Business Travellers But To Restrict On A Friday Night And Over The Weekend Will Defeat Family Bookings.....Particularly Those Paying Nearly Â£500 For Two Nights. Have Stayed In Many Cheaper And Smarter Hotels With Leisure Facilities That Allow Older Children Access.
column89: Less Restrictive Leisure Timings. More Flexibility On Dinning Reservations As Only 9Pm Available When Booked On The Day.
column90: Based On The Comments Above  Overall We Were Disappointed With Our Stay. We Take A Lot Of Short Breaks In This Country With Our Children And The Standard Of Accommodation Is Usually A Lot Better And Cheaper Than We Found With You. The Room Needed Updating And The Restrictions On The Leisure Facilities Were Very Annoying.

column90: Very Enjoyable Value For Money Time

column39: Dirty Old Bathroom. Definitely Not 3 Star Or Even 2
column48: Asked For Biscuits With Tea But Didn't Get Any
column53: Eggs Which We Ordered Fried And Poached Were Cold. But Not As Cold As The Ones In The Restaurant On Sat
column64: Changed Components In Dessert. Would Not Have Ordered. Too Quick To Take Away Plates Before Others At Table Had Finished So They Were Eating Alone
column84: Receptionists Lovely
column89: We Have To Stay Here Due To Friends Family Needs. This Is Not A 4 Star Hotel. Needs Upgrading. Sofa Bed Creaky. Bathroom Shocking
column90: Lovely Lady On Phone Who Booked Us In Defiantly Needs Recognition

column35: I Found The Website At Time Of Booking Not Clear Re Choosing Dates  So Made A Mistake  Called To Rectify And Staff Were Very Efficient And Friendly
column39: Room 118. Prior To Coming Enquired About A Dvd Player Being Made Available. Was Told Sopwell Don't Have Dvd Players Which Was Disappointing. Uht Milk Is Horrible  Would Prefer Fresh Milk. Body Lotion In Bathroom And Light Above Suitcase Stand Or In Wardrobe Would Be A Nice Extra. It Was Very Dark Unpacking
column53: The Tea Was Dreadful - Weak And Cold. On The Saturday It Was A Relief To Have Self Service Tea Making Arrangements But Unfortunately Only Decaff Tea Bags Were Available Then.
column64: We Were Unable To Book A Table One Night As Brasserie Was Full. We Wound The Selection And Quality Of Food Better In The Conservatory

column35: None - It Was Excellent
column64: We Stayed For 3 Nights And Had The Same Choice Of 4 Dishes For Each Course On Every Night On The Set Menu. This Was Difficult If You Didn't Like Some Of The Options. My Wife Had The Same 'Soup Of The Day' For 4 Meals Running! Please Have A Different Set Menu Each Evening. The Service Was Variable - Sometimes Great With 2 Or 3 Waiters Coming Quickly To Our Table  And Sometimes Pretty Slow. The Behaviour Of Some Of The Other Diners Was At Times Very Loud  And Spoiled The Atmosphere For The Two Of Us. The Food Itself Was Ok  But Not Really Outstanding
column77: The Hotel Was Clearly Very Busy Over Half Term  Yet Casual Users Still Came To The Pool Area. This Meant That  On One Morning  It Was Overcrowded And Quite Frantic. There Should Be A Limit On The Number Of People Going Into The Pool. The Very Loud Aqua Aerobics Class Also Meant That It Was Very Difficult To Relax. However Coming Later The Following Afternoon Was A Completely Different And Very Pleasant And Calming Experience
column83: The Room Cleaning Was At Times Very Late In The Day  And Seemed To Take Several Stages
column84: All Of The Staff Were Very Polite And Professional
column89: Apart From The Minor Issues Already Mentioned We Had A Very Enjoyable Stay
column90: This Was Our 4Th Visit To Sopwell House And We Have Never Been Disappointed. This Was A Great Choice For Us To Spend Our Silver Wedding Anniversary

column35: Excellent Service
column39: Very Comfortable  Needed Better Hairdryer  When Requested It Arrived Within A Few Minutes
column90: Very Enjoyable Spa Break
Would Stay More If There Were More Offers Making The Stay More Affordable

column53: Fried Eggs Were Very Rubbery.  Scrambled Eggs Very Watery

column64: Set Dinner In Meeting Room

column39: Bathroom Could Have Been Cleaner Well Equipped Bedroom But Nothing Was Obvious I Discovered A Lot Of Things Only Only Checking My Belongings Prior To Check Out
column53: Buffet Service Is Quicker But Results In Rubbery Eggs And Soggy Bacon I Understand This Is Always A Conflict Fresh Toast And Lovely Fruit
column64: Good Food For Event Catering. The Service Was Excellent And Water Topped Up Frequently Which I Appreciated
column84: Head Of Banqueting Was Very Attentive. Small Spanish Girl On Reception Was Very Helpful Overall All The Staff Made A Point Of Saying Hello As You Passed Them In Corridors And Were Exceptionally Welcoming And Friendly Congratulations
column90: A Cleaner Bathroom And Better Housekeeping Generally Is Needed To Bring This Element Of The Hotel Up To The Standard Provided Elsewhere. Decroations Tasteful

column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column35: Pre Booking Went Smoothly  Received Phone Calls To Confirm Spa Treatments. But Sadly On Day Due To Shortage In Staffing Levels Planned Treatments Had To Change Desire Months If Pre Booking. Appreciate That This Was Unavoidable But Still Disappointing. Also Planned Treatments Wrongly Booked  So Didn't Quite Get What We Had Requested. Staff Tried There Best To Accommodate In The End.
column39: Room 261 The Bathroom Radiator Was Extremely Hot  So Much So That When I Slipped In The Bathroom I Burnt My Forearm On It. This Was My Fault In Slipping But The Burn Was Quite Sure And Left A Raised Red Welt. I Do Think That It Needs Addressing By Main Trance As A Small Child (This Was A Triple Room) Could Have Really Been Burnt Quite Badly. I'm An Old Bird  So Have Tougher Skin!
column53: Sausage Were Sublime!
column77: Sadly The Only Place To Get Drinking Water In A Cup Is By The Spa Waiting Room. It Would Be So Much Nicer To Have Some Facilities Around The Pool. I Think You Are Missing A Chance On Other Soft Drinks That Could Be Purchased. We Were On A Spa Weekend And Would Have Happy Purchased Drinks As We Lounged Around The Pool. It Got Quite Hot  Around The Pool Area And Trips To The Water Machine Saw Us Have To Traps Back And Forth To The Water Machine. A Bell Or Phone Requesting Drink Services Would Be Most Welcome!
column84: Staff In Brazier Were Very Professional When At Another Table One Couple Were Having A Very Heated Argument. This Was Very Loins And Went On For Most Of Our Meal. Staff Apologised And Tried To Be As Discrete As Possible In A Difficult Situation.
column90: Look  Forward To Seeing You Again Soon I Hope!

column39: 212 - Clogged Shower Drain Made The First Morning Of My Stay Rather Unpleasant
column83: Slow Service

column64: We Booked A Package With Included Breakfast And Evening Meal. Before We Order Our Meal  I Was Asked If We Would Like A Glass Of Champagne. Which We Had. The Meal Was Fantastic And The Champagne Was Wonderful. When I Said Yes To The Champagne  It Would Have Been Nice To Be Informed As To The Cost   Of The Drinks. I Had A Shock When Handed The Bill  At The End Of The Meal. Paying Nearly Â£30.00 For Two Drinks Took The Shine Off The Evening For Us. This Will Not Stop Me From Staying With You Again  However I Feel That I Was Taken To The Cleaners Regarding The Drinks. Needless To Say I Shall Not Be Ordering Champagne Again.
column84: Breakfast Staff  So Very Helpfull

column77: I Felt On The Friday There Were Too Many Peoplein The Spa

column35: We Were Shown To The Lifts But Not Told Where Our Rooms Were Or Given Any Directions
column39: Room 123  Only One Robe And Slippers Were Supplied We Had To Go And Get Another One  The Bathroom Cold Tap Was Not Working At All.
column53: The Cooked Breakfast Food Was Not Very Warm Although There Was A Lot Of Other Choices That Were Very Nice
column64: We Had The Set Menu As We Had A Spa Break And The Choices Were Very Limited. My Daughter Does Not Eat Curry And Two Of The Four Choices Were Curry Added To Which The Soup For Starter Was Curry. My Starter Had To Be Returned As It Had Not Been Heated At All And Was Stone Cold
column77: The Spa Was A Very Relaxed And Welcoming Experience

column39: Too Small Room  Internet Connection Week
column64: Uniform Food Was Served To All Participant Of Meeting And Was Paid By Invition Organization

column53: Had To Request Tea Twice
column83: Had To Ring To  Confirm  3Pm Sunday Check In(Which Was Advertised At Time Of Original Booking)Was Sent Email From Hotel Saying It Was For 4 Pm
column89: Was Told Our 2  Inclusive Spa Treatments Had To Be Taken Together - Would Have Preferred Them Separately

column39: Room No 236.   This Room Was Rather Small.  More Suited To Children.  I Booked The Retreat Weekend But Our Room Was So Small You Would Not Spend A Lot Of Time There.  Oonagh Krogh
column53: Lovely Breakfast
column64: The Meal And Restaurant Were Lovely. Service Was Good. Afterwards  However We (3 Couples) Found It A Different Story In The Drinks Bar.  The First Drinks We Ordered After Our Meal Took At Least 20Mins To Be Served And The Waitress Got Them Wrong.  The Second Round We Had To Cancel As We Had Waited Over 30 Mins And When We Enquired Were Told That They Hadn't Even Started On Our Table. We Gave Up In The End And Decided To Make Coffee In Our Rooms.  This Was Not How I Wanted The Evening To End And After A Lovley Afternoon And Evening I Felt This Was Very Disappointing.
column83: Only In The Bar.  Waitng Too Long For Drinks And Giving Up In The End
column89: Room Could Have Been Bigger And Bar Could Have Been Run With Efficiency
column90: It Is Not Often That I Get The Chance To Indulge In A Night Away And I Like Everything To Be As It Should Be.  Its A Pity That These Little Things Happened As I Had Made The Booking And Invited The Other Couples To Join Me For My 50Th There.  I Had Been Before And They Had Not So It Was Important For Everything To Be Ok.

column35: Excellent Front Desk Staff
column39: 116 And 256 Surprised Not To Have A Fridge/Mini Bar
column64: Sunday Evening The Buffet Main Course Was Very Lacklustre. Monday Lunchtime Excellent And What I Would Have Expected From Your Hotel
column77: Excellent And Happy Team Which Was Impressive And A Good Reflection On Management. They All Loved Working At Sopwell Which Is A Credit To All Of You. Excellent Massage And Wax Treatment But Very Mediocre Luxury Pedicure For The Cost.
column83: Excellent Team And Grounded  Sensible And Again A Credit To The Hotel. Excellent Head Housekeeper
column84: As Above. Head Housekeeper /All Front Desk/Brasserie Manager
column90: Very Enjoyable And Relaxing 2 Days

column39: Room 136: The Wash Basin In The Bathroom Had A Large Crack Right Across It. Not What We'd Expect From Such An Establishment  Also There Was No Toilet Brush  Therefore Making It Difficult To Leave The Toilet Basin In A Clean Condition.
column64: I Realise That You Are Very Busy  But I Felt The Atmosphere Was Too Hectic

column35: Several Problems Getting Hold Of Someone To Speak To During Booking/Problems
column84: All Staff We Came Into Contact With  Even Just Passing In The Corridors Were Exceptionally Friendly And  If Needed  Helpful.

column35: Two Calls From The Us - One To Confirm Our Reservation And Another To Request Early Check-In - Were Quite Pleasant.  We Were Affirmed That Sopwell House Would Do Everything Possible To Have Our Room Ready For Us Were We To Arrive Early  Or That We Would Have Access To All Facilities While Waiting.  The Bar Was Terrific  Your Staff Very Helpful And Friendly  The Facilities Comfortable And Restful. We Look Forward To Staying At Sopwell House Again On Our Next Trip To St. Albans To See My Brother And His Family!
column84: Our Bartender On Our First Night (May 10) Was Especially Friendly And Helpful  Making Us Our First Pimm's Cocktail - Quite A Treat. A Man At The Front Counter Helped Us Solve The Electrical Adapter Issue With Aplomb. The Maids Did A Terrific Job In Our Room.
column89: No. We Had A Lovely  Relaxing Stay.

column20: The Wedding Reception Was Held At Sopwell House
column39: Somewhat Difficult To Operate The Shower/Bath - Instructions Would Be Helpful.
column53: There Was No Black Pudding - Missing From The Tradition Breakfast
column84: They Were All Very Helpful And Polite.
column90: The Wedding Reception Was Wonderful  The Setting Was Lovely. We Really Enjoyed Ourselves.

column35: No
column39: Electrical Sockets Over The Desk Were Not Working; Similarly On The First Occasion There Was A Minor Electrical Problem.  Neither Issue Significantly Affected Me Personally But A R&M Programme Would Normally Pick These Things Up.
column48: I Was Told Room Service Didn't Start Until 7.00 Am So Was Not Able To Use It.
column53: Overall A Good Standard Except Eggs Cooked In Advance Will Inevitably Lose Their Appeal.   Still The Quality Was Above Average And I Enjoyed The Breakfast Overall
column70: I Was A Guest So Was Not Directly Involved With The Management Of The Event.
column84: Staff Overall Were Pleasant; Albeit One Senior Admittedly 'Harassed' Bar Manager Came Over A Bit Brusque And Left A Bad Taste.
column89: Spa Brasserie Seems To Suffer From Poor Ventilation As A Rsult Of Which The Staff Are Leaving The Double Dorrs Open To Reduce The Temperature.  In Mid Summer That Might Be Ok But In British Summer Rain And Cold It Makes For An Uncomfortable Environment.   On The Plus Side When Seeking A Reasonable Seating Arrangement  The Waitress Exceeded My Expectations In Trying To Address The Requirements Of My Guest Who Is Suffering From Cancer  Unwell Generally And Who Was Suffering From A Severe Headache.    The Waitress Concerned Could Not Have Been Aware Of My Friends More Severe Illness  But Genuinely Tried Very Hard To Please.
column90: No

column35: It Was Such A Pleasure To Be Greeted A Smiling And Polite Receptionist. Checking In Was Seamless And Quick
column39: Much Appreciated Sky Sports Channels
column64: We Were A Guest Of Mr Golding And We Were Dining After His Reception And Considering The Size Of The Dinner I Thought Your Staff Were Superb And Nothing Was Too Much Trouble. We Have Been In The Catering Business For 40 Years And There Is No Doubt Your Staff Made The Evening A Sucess
column84: It Be Unfair To Single One Out They Were All Excellent
column90: It Was A Pleasure To Stay In A Hotel Where You Made To Feel The Most Important Person There. It Is A Great Pity That More Hotels Do Not Have Your Attitude

column35: None  All Went Extremely Well.

column83: We Left A Pair Black Ladies Shoes At The Wedding Reception On 17Th May. We Have Phoned Five Times From Overseas Asking If They Had Been Located. Twice I Was Redirected To The Housekeeper And There Was No Response. Twice Reception Said They Would Investigate And Ring Back And After A Week Have Failed To Do So. The Third Occasion Was This Morning And A Further Promise To Ring Back Was Given Either For Today Or Tomorrow.
column90: The Access To The Room Was Poor Particularly From The Lift. The Lift Facility Is Totally Inadequate. Bedroom Corridors And Stairs Need Modernisation. The Main Corridor To The Lift Was On A Slope To Facilitate Wheelchair  But The Slope Was Too Steep Which Caused The Wheel Chair To Run Away From Handler. This Is  A High Risk Area Made Worse By The Narrow Corridor

Even The Trees Out Side At Night  Which Were Floodight  Were So Lovely That We Took A Photograph. There Is An Air Of Tranquility About The Hotel And Our Son And Daughter-In-Law Are Staying With You On Saturday Night. Sopwell House Is 'Simply The Best'

column64: The Food Was Excellent Both In The Bar And For The Wedding. The Service And Knowledge Of What Was In The Food (For Example The Veg Club Sandwich - Tomatoes And Peppers Plus What Was In The Ktichen  And Duirng The Wedding Sorry Do Not Speak English). The Food And Drinks Took A Very Long Time To Come  One Was Incorrect And We Had To Ask Several Times For Drinks.  The Staff Were Freindly - However They Were Not Very Efficient. A Couple Of Senior Staff Were Very Good - It Seemed That Other Staff Lacked Skills And Knowledge.

column53: Very Good Selection Of Food But Serving Of Coffee Not Frequent Enough
column77: Could Do With More Seats Around Pool
column83: Booked 3 Rooms At Wedding Discount Of Â£9 Per Room For 1 Night On 16Th June And Was Not Told This Would Mean Each Guest Would Need To Pay Â£15 To Use Leisure Facilitues Until Confirmation Email. When Phoned To Confirm This Was Told Correct Even Though Cheaper To Pay Full Price To Use Leisure Facilities. Checked Again With Evening Staff After Wedding Who Informed Me Any Guest At Any Price Were Able To Use Leisure Facilities. When Checked Again On Paying Sunday Morning Was Told Could Not Use Leisure Facilities As Paying Discounted Price. Expressed My Anger At Being Advised Differently Repeatedly So Two Of My Guests Did Use Them On Sunday Morning At No Extra Charge. My Complaint Is That The Extra Charge Seems Too High And Even Petty. Have Never Been To A Hotel That Does Not Allow Guests To Use Leisure Facilities Whatever Rate They Pay For The Room. But Also That I Was Advised Differently On Four Different Occasions By 4 Different Members Of Staff  So There Would Appear To Be A Staff Training Issue There.
column84: Porters Were Very Polite And Helpful
column89: Asked For Early Check In Of 1.30Pm As Hotel On Way To Church Then Reception At Hotel After. Was Told Probable  But Not Guaranteed. Did Not Get Confirmation Until Arrival At Hotel At 1Pm. Not Helpful On Such An Important Family Occasion And When Guests Coming A Long Way From Bristol And Nottingham. Would Have Thought As Guests At Wedding Reception At Hotel Some Priority Could Have Been Guaranteed.
column90: You Have A Lovely Hotel In A Beautiful Setting And It Would A Shame To Spoil The Experience By Not Offering The Best Customer Service Possible.

column39: 263 (?) For An Executive Suite Costing Over Â£200 The Bathroom Was Tired With Corroded/Old Taps Which Gurgled And Spluttered When You Turned Them On.
column64: We Had To Send Back One Starter. One Main Course Was Delivered With Purple Potatoes Which Were Hard Rather Than What Was On The Menu 'Sauteed New Potatoes'. The Waiterdid His Best To Rectify Matters But It Was My Wifes 65Th Birthday Dinner And Therefore Very Disappointing.
column83: I Ordered The Special Celebration Package For My Wifes 65Th Birthay  Champagne Flowers And Chocolates Which Were In The Room On Arrival. We Fancied Some Nibbles With The Champagne When We Opened It So With Nothing In The Room I Went Down To The Bar And Asked For Some Crisps Nuts And Olives That I Would Be Happy To Pay For. I Was Given A Very Small Bowl With About 10 Crisps Without Charge And Told There Were No Nuts Or Olives But They Would Look In The Kitchen For Some And Bring Them Up If They Had Any. Needless To Say Noone Came. I Thought This Was Very Poor Service. Additionally If You Pay Â£65 Extra It Would Not Be A Bad Idea To Include A Few Nibbles With The Champagne.
column89: The Check Out Took A Long Time Because Of Some System Problems And Eventually I Had To Pay In Two Amounts
column90: To Make Matters Worse While We Checked Out My Wife Put The Flowers Down Beside Reception And We Did Not Realise Until We Got Home. That One Is Entirely Down To Us!!!

column39: We Were First Allocated Room 223. When We Entered There Was A Strong Smell. We Called The Person In Charge. She Was Helpful But We Could Not Change As All The Rooms Were Full. We Changed Rooms The Next Day To 226. The Smell In 223 Came From The Waste Trap In The Bath

column84: The Reception Staff And The Restaurant Staff Were All First Class
column90: Just Want To Reiterate That We Found The Staff Absolutely Wonderful.  And Also The Staff At The Wedding  They Couldn't Do Enough And The Head Waiter Was Very Patient With Me Re The Air Conditioning.

column90: Will Await Your Response Regarding The Comments I Have Made

column35: Yes We Were The Parents Of The Bridgeroom At The Mason Newman Wedding When We Visited Previously To Finalise Details With Your Banqueting Manager We Were Assured Because Of All The Business We Were Bringing To The Hotel We Would Be Upgraded To An Superior Room On Arrival No One At Reception Had Any Knowledge Of This Arrngement. We Were Also Told That Only The 1St 12 Of Our Guests Could Use The Spa Again Not What Was Agreed. Further One Of Our Guests Was Disbaled There Was A Continuing Problem With The Lift Which Hampered Her Access To The Ground Floor I Understand From Your Staff This Problem Was Known For Some Time And Was Made Worse By The Heat My Guest's Daughter Became Increasingly Agitated And It Spoiled Her Weekend. Another Guest Had Booked A 3 Bed Room On Arrival It Was Dirty And The Toilet Did Not Function Properly You Were Unable To Provide An Acceptable Alternative.

I Am Amazed That At Least The Meal Was Not Credited And I & My Wife Were Not Treated In The Correct Way When We Told Reception What Had Occurrred !

column84: Tanya Lavin Was Helpful And Understanding Regarding Our Complaint About The Late Night Music Noise & Vibration We Experienced On Both Nights Of Our Stay Ie. 20Th & 21St July. We Felt That As Non Wedding Guests (On Both Nights!)  We Should Either Have Been Forewarned Or Else Given A Room Well Away From The Source Of The Music. She Resolved The Matter  Upon Checkout  By Giving Us A Complimentary Night/Breakfast Next Time We Were In St Albans.
column89: We Felt We Should Have Been Forewarned Of The Late Night Music On Both Nights Of Our Stay Or Given An Alternative Room. All We Were Really Wanting Was A Quiet Place To Rest Our Weary Heads After A Couple Of Very Busy Days With Family Just Along The Road In St Albans.
column90: Unfortunately  The Late Night Music Noise & Disturbance Took The Edge Off Our Enjoyment Of Our Actual Stay  Which I Think Otherwise Would Have Been Very Satisfactory. Thankfully Our Complaint Was Met With Understanding And Satisfactorily Resolved.

column35: 6/10 For Booking In. Arrived @ 3.20Pm Room Not Ready  We Went For A Coffee In The Lounge And Was Telephoned When Our Room Ready. After Checking  I Was Then Told That We Could Stay In That Room  It Was Then That I Pointed Out That We Had Paid For  Superior Room  We Were Then Moved. So  If Not For My Observation  Someone Else Could Have Had A Very Nice Room On Me!!  Eventually Shown To The Right Room @ 3.45Pm.  Although Apologetic  We Were Never Offered  Free Drink Whilst Waiting.  That Was The Only 'Blott On The Landscape' Of A Very Lovely Two Night Stay.  Would Have Liked To Use The Pool But Â£15 Per Person  Per Day Was Off Putting.

column83: See Above Comments About Room. And Why Were Housekeeping Knocking On The Door Just After 8.00Am On The Morning We Were Leaving To Clean The Room  Surely The Vast Majority Of People Checking Out Do Not Do So By That Time. Over 90% Of Hotels (And I Stay In Anything Between 50 And 100 Per Year) Don't Come To The Room On The Last Morning Until Around Or After Check Out Time  Unless Reception Tell Them The Room Has Been Vacated. (We Were Still In Bed.)
column84: The Maintenance Man Who Came Sunday Afternoon (The Only British Member Of Staff We Saw Incidentally) Who Tried To Be Helpful  But Couldn't Solve Anything Other Than The Light Bulb Situation In The Room.
column89: Other Than Fixing The Shortcomings Of The Room  Or Moving Us To Another Room  Which Was Never Suggested (Though I Appreciate The Hotel Might Have Been Full)  And Improving The Dining Experience  Nothing.
