column39: We Did Have A Problem With Not Having Any Water In The Room.  We Woke In The Night And Were Not Sure Whether The Tap Water Was Drinking Water Or Not  Therefore  Eventually Having Found The Kettle  We Boiled A Cup Of Tea.
column64: We Were Not Hungry Having Had A Wonderful Champagne Tea Party At Sopwell And Would Have Had Snacks At The Bar But Could Not See That They Were Available.

column35: Friendly And Helpful Staff When Booking By Phone
column77: Poolside Refreshment (Tea/Coffee/) Facility Would Have Been Appreciated
column90: The Lazy Sunday Package Was Good Value For Money And Most Enjoyable.

column35: Person In Reception Area (Not Behind Desk) Was Very Welcoming And Friendly During Our Stay
column64: Bit Disappointed With Restaurant  Thought It Was Overpriced But Booked It As We Preferred The Menu.
column83: Tv Did Not Work But The Young Man From Reception Area Came And Sorted It For Us
column84: The Young Man Who Was Doorman/Porter.  Excellent Welcome And Helpfulness At All Times.
column90: Would Be Pleased To Hear Of Any Promotional Offers.

column35: Initially Signed Card For Room 237 Then Told That Was Wrong And Given Key-Card For 211. Went To 211 And The Room Was Already Occupied By A Young Lady. Embarrassment All Round. Eventually It Was Decided It Should Be 237. Superior Room Was Booked And Paid For. If Superior I Would Call It Not That Superior - Have Stayed In Better Standard Rooms.
column39: 237.  The Room Was Clean  Fairly Comfortable And Adequately Equipped. I Dislike Having The Words 'Exceptionally  Extremely And Well' Included In The Question. That Is For The Responder To Decide And Not Be Made To Answer The Questions To Suit Yourselves.Treat My Response After Deleting Those Adjectives  Please.
column53: Very Good But We Dislike Tea And Coffee Being From A General Pot - And As A Consequence Often 'Stewed' And  Not Very Hot. Each Day We Had To Ask For It Be Replaced. This Was Done Willingly But Why Not  As In Most Good Hotels  Individual Pots Per Table. Generl Pot Is Reminiscent Of Only Very Average Boarding Houses Or 1 & 2 Star Hotels.
column64: When I Booked Hotels About 3 Months Ago It Was Confirmed To Me That Restaurant Was Open On A Monday Evening And When We Booked In I Asked If Was Alright For Guests To Be Invited By Us For Dinner On The Monday Evening On The Occasion Of My 80Th. Birthday. Told That Would Be Alright. On The Saturday Evening I Informed The Restaurant That We Would Be Bringing Guests With Us On The Monday Only To Be Told That Such Facility Was Not Available On Monday Evenings. This Put The Damper On The Celebrations And We Had To Go In To St. Albans For The Meal. Certainly Made The Occasion Unforgettable. That Is Why I Booked Your Hotel In The First Place As We Had Stayed Previously And All Was Satisfactory Apart From On Arrival Our Room Had Been Double-Booked. After Imparting Strong Words On That Occasion We Did Get Our Room As Booked - Seems That The Mix-Up Of Rooms Is The Norm At Sopwell House!!!
column83: See Above Re 'Communal' Coffee Jugs And Teapots At Breakfast In The Brasserie.
column84: A Tall Dark Young Man - Could Double For Ed Milliband - Who Was Always To Hand In The Entrance Foyer To Help With Doors  Luggage Etc.  Also  A Blonde Young Lady In The Brasserie At Breaklfast. Came From Near Krakow In Poland.
column89: Informed Me When I Booked The Hotel That Restaurant Not Open On A Monday Evening. That Has Left A Very Nasty Taste And Did Spol What Was An Important Celebration Ion My Family.
column90: Clould I Recommend The Hotel?  Not Without Informing The Person Asking Of Our Experience And Letting Them Decide For Themselves. Perhaps They May Be More Fortunate.

column35: Very Friendly Reception Staff  Especially The Young Man From Holland.
column39: Room 133 - Plenty Of Hangers Which We Liked  Appreciated The Sky Box Being Available  Liked The Fact That We Had A Biscuit To Go With The Tea Tray.  Generally  A Very Nice Room.
column53: First Morning  Our Tea Was Poured At The Table Into The Mugs; On The Second Morning  The Mugs Of Tea Were Brought To Us - We Preferred Having The Tea Poured At The Table.  Had To Request Toast  Rather Than Being Asked If It Was Wanted.  On The Second Morning  I Asked For Some Toast  Saying That I Wanted To Have A Poached Egg On Toast.  The Chef Made Me A Piece Of Toast But I Had To Take It Back To The Table To Butter It  To Take It Back To The Buffet To Get My Egg To Put On It!
column83: On Both Mornings  Staff Came Quite Early To Service Our Room  And We Asked Them To Come Back A Little Later.  By Mid Afternoon Of The First Day  Our Room Had Not Been Serviced And I Had To Go And Find Someone To Ask If They Intended Coming In As I Wanted To Get Ready.
column84: The Young Man On Reception Mentioned Earlier Whose Name I Do Not Recall  And The Staff In The Terrace Bar Who Were Very Efficient And Helpful.
column89: The Problem With The Check Out Was Minor  But Revolved Around The Fact That The Food And Drinks Were Separated Out On The Final Bill Meaning That We Didn't Recognise One Of The Items Charged For.  Reception Were Quickly And Easily Able To Identify For Us What The Item Was  And Then There Was No Problem In Our Meeting The Cost.
column90: Lovely Hotel  Lovely Atmosphere.

column53: It Was Adequate  But Lacked The Special Quality Of The Rest Of The Experience Staff Friendly  Helpful. No Specific Complaints  Just Could Have Been Less Choice More Quality.
column84: Receptionists Were Helpful And Friendly
column89: More Info Re History And Area Would Be Good On A Handout
column90: It Seemed Strange To Have Guests Wandering Around In Bath Robes When We Arrived! Not A Complaint  Just Odd In Mid-Afternoon To Early Evening.     We Appreciate There Is A Spa But Not Bathrobes In The Foyer And Bar Perhaps?  New To Us In Our Extensive Experience Of Hotel Stays - Perhaps The Coming Thing?

column77: My Wife Booked Treatments Over The Phone In Advance Of Our Arrival. On The Phone She Was Told Our Treatments Would Be At 12 O'clock. Turned Out Our Treatments Were At 11:00Am Instead. Both My Wife And I  Are Honest People  And We Could Not Believe It When The Receptionist Advised Us That We Were Late For Our Treatments And Nothing Could Be Done. I Felt Robbed. Instead We Had To Make Do With Half An Hour Treatments Each. I Guess At The End Of The Day Its Our Word Against Yours But I Think In The Future You Should Email All Customers That Make Bookings Over The Phone With An Email To Confirm So There Are No Misunderstandings :(
column83: As A Customer I Was Serviced As Though I Was Not Telling The Truth About Our Treatment Times.
column84: To Be Fair  Both My Wife And I Enjoyed Our 30 Minute Treatments. The Staff Who Delivered These Treatments Were Friendly And Very Polite.

column84: There Was A Young Man At Reception I Think His Name Was Callum  He Saw We Were Waiting To Be Helped By Reception Staff Who Were Busy Then Helped Us Unlock The Inter Connecting Doors In Our Rooms By Coming Up With Us However He Did Not Have The Right Key And Had To Go Back Down To Get The Right Key From Maintenance. He Had A Smile At All Times And Could Not Do Enough To Help Us  Thank You.

column48: We Asked For An Early Meal For Our 7 Year Old As It Does Not Suit Him To Eat Later Than 5.P.M. And We Needed To Get Him To Bed Early. The Meal Was Half An Hour Late So We Were Getting Anxious And Our Boy Was Getting Fractious. We Had To Phome To Remind Them. However  When The Meal Did Arrive It Was Lovely - Generous Portions  Well Presented  So All Was Forgiven!
column53: Breakfasts Were Great -Plenty Of Choice And Well Cooked And Presented.
column64: This Was Our Fault - We Had A 7 Year Old With Us Who Is No Good At Late Fancy Dining. I Thought We Were Going Into The Brasserie But We Were Turned Away From There As We Were Not On A 'Package'. The Restaurant Seemed The Only Alternative (Although I Since Realised We Could Have Gone Into The Bar). The Experience For Us Was Not Good Although It Was Not The Restaurant's Fault. Service Was A Bit Slow And We Left Before We Got Our Dessert (Although We Had Ordered It) And It Was Brought To Us In Our Room. They Said It Would Not Be Charged For But I Think It Was. The Restaurant Manager Apologised At The Time And They Did Have A Large Birthday Party Going On. It Was All Just A Bit Unfortunate Although The Fault Was Probably Ours For Choosing The Wrong Place To Eat  But I Thought There Was No Alternative. Perhaps The Brasserie Manager Could Have Pointed Us To The Bar For Easier Food With A Small Child.

column39: The Mattress Although Comfortable Was Very Soft And I Have A Minor Back Problem Which Made It Difficult To Sleep Properly

column35: We Found A Parking Space But The Car Park Was Busy Because Of A Funeral Gathering. 'There Were Plenty Of Parking Spaces...' Is How This Part Of Your Survey Should Read!
column39: Hot Water To The Basin Was Ages Coming Through.

column35: The Porter Did  Not Offer To Take Our Bags To The Room

I Was In A Party Of 4 People And Each Received A Spacious  Modern Double Bedroom For Their Stay  After Seeing Their Room And Then Mine I Was Very Disappointed That Mine Was A Small  Not At All Modern Single Room. I Asked To Switch Rooms As I Was Paying The Same And The Hotel Was Unable To. They Claimed They Were Just 'Lucky' I Was Very Upset By This And It Dampened My Stay.

They Woke Both Me And My Partner And Continued To Be Disruptive That Morning.

column77: Very Pleasant Staff In The Spa And The Beauty Girls Seem Very Hard Working.

column35: As I Booked With Lastminute.Com Through Wahanda When We Got To The Hotel  I Was Told Out Room Wasn't Paid For However I Had My Statement Which Showed The Money For The Room Had Been Taken  It Was Rectified After And Then Everything Was Fine.

column39: Our Bedroom Was On Top Of A Wedding And Therefore We Were Kept Awake Until Midnight. We Had Booked The Hotel To Get A Quiet Break Away From Our Young Kids And Desperately Needed The Sleep. We Should Never Have Been Given A Room So Near A Wedding When You Keep The Music On Till Midnight
column83: Wake Up Call Woke Us!! After Getting To Sleep Much Later Than We Wanted Due To The Wedding We Were Woken In The Morning By The Telephone Wake Up All. We Left The Hotel Shattered And Upset

column64: We Had Dinner In The Brasserie Resturant As Part Of Our Package.  We Were A Bit Disapointed With The Set Menu As There Was Not Much Choice.  I Must Add That This Was The Only Comment I Had.  I Thoroughly Enjoyed My Stay And Really Enjoyed All Of My Other Meals ( Breakfast And Lunch)

column8: Much Needed Break From Looking After My Husband Who Suffered A Stroke
column53: Eggs Swimming In Grease
column90: Very Disappointed With The Spa.  I Phoned To Book My Appointments And Asked If I Could Have A Pedicure And Facial Instead Of A Back Massage. I Was Told This Would Cost An Extra Â£15 To Which I Agreed. The Facial Which I Went Into With Eye Make Up On Still Had The Bottom Line On When I Went Back To My Room.  As For The Pedicure  I Felt It Fell Well Below ' Deluxe' As I Was Told I Was Having.  When It Came To Checkout There Was An Extra Â£47 On My Bill. I Queried This And Was Told I Had Booked A 'Deluxe Pedicure' I Said I Had Not I Had Called And Asked If I Could Change A Back Massage For A Pedicure And Was Told It Would Be An Extra Â£15.  Whilst Waiting For The Manager  I Was Sitting In Reception And Noticed That My Pedicure Was 'Two Tone' As The Second Coat Of Nail Varnish Did Not Cover The First  This Could Be Because The Spa Room Was So Dim That The Therapist Could Not See Properly.  I Explained All This To The Manager  Who Said That I Had Booked A 1Hour Facial And A Deluxe Pedicure And That The Package Was 2- 25Minute Treatments And It Was In My Letter . I Explained That I Had Not Booked This  It Was A Gift  And Not In My Letter Which I Showed Him  And That When I Phoned To Book These Treatments  All I Was Told Was That It Would Cost An Extra Â£25. He Then Deducted The Extra Cost From The Bill.  My Husband Has Suffered A Stroke And The Past Few Months Have Been Very Stressful. I Therefore Did Not Need This Aggravation Added.

column35: All The Staff Were Very Helpful
column39: It Was Fantastic
column48: I Asked Them If They Could Bring A Candle In A Cake As We Were There Celebrating A Birthday And They Turned Up At The Door With Breakfast And A Candle And Singing Happy Birthday. It Was Wonderful

column39: Some Bottled Sparkling And Still Water Would Have Been A Nice Touch In The Hot Weather.

column53: All The Food Looked Delicious But The Flavors Did Not Measure Up. The 'Chef' Made Me A Requested Omelet Which Was Very Good

column35: We Were Very Disappointed By Our Initial Welcome And Check In Process.  Firstly  The Receptionist Asked Us What We Wanted To Do With Our Room And Was Fairly Surprised When We Wanted To Check In. We Then Had To Repeat Our Personal Details A Number Of Times As She Incorrectly Entered Them Into The System. She Then Presented Us With Paperwork With Someone Else's Address On And Appeared Exasperated When We Said It Was The Wrong Address And The Process Began Again. She Then Asked For Payment And Was Very Very Unclear Asking For Â£50 And We Kept Asking What This Was For - It Wasn't A Problem For Us To Pay We Just Were Not Clear What It Was For. The Whole Check In Process Was Confusing And Lacked Clarity.  She Clearly Did Not Listen To Us And Even When We Said We Had Stayed Before - Told Us Directions To The Pool As So On  Again Not A Problem If She Hadn't Just Asked Us If We Had Stayed Before And Then Ignored The Answer.  It Demonstrated A Lack Of Customer Care And We Felt A Bit Like Generic Cattle Rather Than A Couple Embarking On A Romantic Retreat!  It Really Took The Gloss Of Our Arrival.
column53: It Matched Our Experience Of Poor Customer Care  For Example No Toast And Having To Ask A Number Of Times For Items.  Food Was Lovely.
column64: This Was The Best Service Of Our Stay  Excellent.
column83: We Had Lunch On The Outside Terrace Both On Saturday And Sunday And The Service Was Truly Terrible Despite It Being Fairly Quiet. On Both Days We Waited Over 20 Minutes For Anyone To Even Acknowledge Us And Take Our Order And This Was After Several Prompts From Us. It Was Really Disappointing And Embarrassing.  Then The Food Took A Very Long Time To Arrive And On Both Days The Orders Were Wrong  Just Little Things Like Olives In A Salad When I'd Asked For The Salad Without Olives And Chips With The Burger Instead Of Separately Plated As I Am A Vegetarian And My Husband Is Not And We Were Hoping To Share!  Both Lunch Experiences Left Us Really Disappointed And Would Make Us Unlikely For Us To Return.  We Just Expect Firstly  A Better Standard Of Service And Secondly  Attention To Detail.  I Really Feel The Staff Let The Hotel Down . Please Note We Were Delighted With The Dinner Service That Was Quick  Discreet And First Class. We Were On A Romantic Retreat Break Away From Our 3 Children (Which Is Rare!) And Really Wanted To Feel A Bit Spoilt By The Sopwell Experience But The Inconsistent Service And Totally Poor Service Really Took The Shine Off And We Ended Up Spending Sunday Lunch Talking About How Terrible The Service Was Rather Than Enjoying Ourself. It Was A Real Shame.
column90: A Mixed Stay  Lovely Room And Evening Meal But Tg The Inconsistent Service In Every Other Area Was Incredibly Disappointing.  We Have Stayed A Couple Of Times Before And Loved Our Stay  Hence Coming Back. This Time However  We Would Look For Other Alternatives. It Was Little Things But When They Add Up And Fall Well Below What You'd Expect From A Hotel Of Your Calibre   It Makes Us Not Want To Return.

column35: The Lady I Booked With Was Very Patient And Helpful As I Was Booking For 3 Of Us And Was Asking About Several Different Options. We Received A Very Warm Welcome On Arrival. Also My Friend Had Rung Up Without My Knowledge And Arranged An Upgrade As It Was My Birthday. Excellent Service!
column39: Room 8. The Only Thing That Would Have Been Nice Was A Fridge  However We Asked For Ice Buckets And They Were Provided. Lovely Air Conditioned Apartment With The Most Comfortable Beds  Even The Roll Out Bed!

column31: When We First Entered Our Room (159) We Were Quite Excited As It Looked Lovely. However  There Were Cobwebs On The Ceiling Above The Tv In The Bedroom  And When My Partner Went To Have A Bath It Felt Like It Hadn't Been Cleaned Properly After The Last Person Had Stayed?  We Went To Have Our Treatments Which We Did Enjoy Very Much And Later Had Dinner Which Too Was Very Nice  However  When We Went Back To Our Room Later In The Evening We Noticed A Loud Noise  A Kind Of Humming. We Watched The Tv For A While Hoping It Would Go Away  We Even Turned Off The Aircon As We Thought It Was That  But My Partner Discovered It Was Infact The Heated Towel Rail Making The Noise  And He Phoned Reception To Ask If Someone Could Turn It Off As Were Unable To. This Was Around Midnight  And Although Someone Did Come Up To The Room They Couldn't Turn It Off Either. We Were Upgraded To Another Room (210) Which Was Lovely  But It Did Rather Spoil Our Experience Having To Pack Up And Move At 12.30 In The Morning !
Well Received  Relaxing  Good Food  Excellent Staff  Beautiful And Well Laid Out Hotel.

column31: We Where Having A Good Break Until On Friday 22Nd Nov There Was A Fire In The Laundryroom About 6.45Am We Left The Room And About 1 Hour Later Was Aloud Back In The Hotel.Our Room No Was 264 We Got Up To The 2Nd Floor And There Was Thick Smoke In The Hallway Went To Reception And Told Them They Wasn't That Bothered And Said The Fire Brigade Said It Was Safe.When We Got To Our Room We Couldn T See Anything Just Thick Smoke All Our Belonging Smelt Of Smoke  We Opened The Windows In The Room To Clear It   We Just Packed Up And Left We Mentioned To Reception About Our Room Again They Where Not That Bothered.Sopwell House Was A Place To Stop On The Way Up North. After Checking Out We Had To Find A Laundette And Wash All Our Clothes Before Heading Up To The Second Part Of Our Trip.I Know It Was A Rare Incident .All We Wanted Was A Member Of Staff To Listen To Us  But Instead We Just Got The Brush Off .

I Came For An Over Night Stay With 9 Others For My 40Th Birthday. I Enquired About & Booked Our Stay Over 6 Months Ago & A Week Before Coming I Called To Confirm Our Booking & I Am Glad I Did! There Were Only 2 Rooms Booked Instead Of 5 & I Hadn't Received Any Conformation Of My Booking. My Initial Call Wasn't Dealt With Straight Away  I Called Back Twice & Left Voice-Mail Messages To Which I Didn't Get A Return Call  I Had To Then Call Again As I Wanted To Resolve This Issue & Make Sure There Were Rooms For Everyone That Was Coming With Me For The Weekend. Luckily I Spoke To Jenny Bevans Who Sorted Everything Out For Me & Booked The Extra Rooms I Required. It Seemed The Information On The Computer System Compared To The Paperwork Was Totally Different  Which I Was Very Surprised About. On Arrival Afew Of Us Checked In At Different Times  6 Guests Were Told They Weren't Booked Into A Room & The Receptionist Didn't Seem To Know What She Was Doing & Wasn't Very Welcoming  She Spent Most Of The Time Asking For Money! I Confirmed Beforehand I Would Pay On Arrival/Departure. There Was Also An Issue With Lack Of Communication From The Reception Staff  As We Were Having To Ask Alot Of Questions Rather Than Being Told Where To Go & What To Do  Times For Dinner  Where The Spa Was  How To Get To The Rooms Etc. We Also Had An Issue When It Came To The Lockers In The Changing Room  They Were Very Temperamental As They Wouldn't Always Open/Close. When Putting The Code In For My Locker  Another Locker Opened Instead! I Eventually Got Mine Open  But I Didn't Feel These Were 100% Safe! On A More Positive Note  Our Experience At Sopwell House Was Very Enjoyable & Relaxing  The Rooms Were Very Nice  The Food Was Excellent & The Facilities Were Brilliant. The Surroundings & Location Were Amazing & The Treatments Were Enjoyed By All. On The Down Side  We Felt Very Disappointed With The Lack Of Communication & Poor Customer Service We Received On Arrival & Also The Problems With The Initial Booking I Made & The Lack Of Communication Between Staff. For A Well Established Business I Feel This Is Unacceptable & Lets It Down Very Much.

column31: Myself And My Partner Booked In Late (Around 11Pm) At Night As A Stop Gap Between Our Very Long Drive. We Have Stayed Many Times And Our Stay Has Been Perfect But Unfortunately This Time It Was Not The Same Experience. We Went Straight To Our Room And Got Changed And Came Down To The Bar To Be Told It Was Shut. On Previous Visits The Bar Shut At 2Am So We Were A Bit Miffed But Nonetheless Went Back To The Room To Order Drinks And Room Service. Room Service Came Over An Hour After Ordering (A Few Sandwiches!) And To Say That Was Was Delivered Was Disgusting Us An Understatement. A Very Nice Gentleman That Even Dealt With Us And His Customer Service Was Second To None. He Explained That You Were Short Staffed And The Person Making The Food Would. Not Usually Be Making It. It Was Very Simple Things Like The Bread Was Hard  Probably Where It Had Been Sitting There For So Long And The 'Toasted' Salmon Bagel Was Not Toasted Etc Etc. I Was Fed Up And Ran Myself A Bath But The Hit Water Would Only Run Luke Warm! I Gave Up And Went To Bed. If You Look Up Our Previous Stay You Will See That We Usually Spend A Lot Of Money And We Feel Extremely Disappointed. Especially That We Had Upgraded To The Room That We Did. We Were Refunded For Our Food But For Us It Was Nothing To Do With Money. I Look Forward To Hearing From You Soon.

column39: An Apartment  Was Meant To Be Self Contained........ No Toaster And Only Two Hot Plates To Cook On. The Tv Was Opposite The Table And Chairs As The Lounge Was By The Kitchen  Very Strange

column31: Very Relaxing  Fun Break As It Intended To Be. Excellent Service  Lovely Food  And Myself And My Two Sisters Didn't Want To Leave!
It Was Good  However The Apartment We Stayed In Needed Some Smartening Up.
column35: When We Asked About What Duplex Apartments There Were Available The Lady On The Front Desk Seemed Very Suspicious As To Why We Were Asking! We Had Seen Reviews Online That Recommended The Split Level Apartments And Would Have Preferred One Of Those. The Lady Went Away For A Few Minutes And Was Adamant That We Would Like The Apartment We Had Been Allocated. We Left It At That As We Didn't Want To Cause Any Further Confusion To Her.
column39: Apartment 2 - The Bed Had A Hard Metal Piece Sticking Out At The Bottom Of The Bed Which I Caught My Leg On. The Shower Could Have Done With Some Bleach As There Was Evidence Of Mildew. The Air Con Went Extremely Hot During The Middle Of The Night.
column90: I Unfortunately Fell Over Outside The Hotel As There Was An Unmarked Speed Bump (No Yellow Markings On It). It Was Extremely Dark Outside And I Tripped Over It. This Is The Bump Just Before The Parking Area To The Right Of The Hotel. Please Do Something About This As Someone Older Than Me Would Have Probably Broken Some Bones!

column31: Room 105 Was Beautiful. The Only Issue Was The Air/ Com And Heating Unit Was A Little Difficult To Master! Food In The Brasseire Was Fair. Might Try The Fine Dine Next Time.
column39: 105 Air Con And Heating Unit Was Difficult To Get The Hang Of

column31: Very Good
column35: Reception Team Is Always Extremely Helpful And Welcoming  No Matter Who Is On Duty.  In My Opinion  They Are Uniformly Outstanding
column53: The Service Teams At Breakfast Are Always Anxious To Ensure That I Get What I Need And Am Well Looked-After.  Tony Is The Outstanding Member Of A Very Good Group Of People
column84: Tony - Always Outstanding All The Reception Team
column89: Re Answer To 21: I Have Got Used To Exceptional Treatment At Sopwell House After Being A Regular Guest For Over 4 Years.  My Experience This Time Was Fully Up To The High Level Of Service That I Have Come To Expect

column31: A Lovely Relaxing Stay
column35: There Was A Mix Up With Our Rooms And The Total Amount Which I Had To Pay. Luckily I Had My Letter Of Confirmation With Me. The Mix Up Wad There Were Two Party's With The  Same Surname. But It Was Very Stressful And Embarrassing At The Time.
column77: One Of The Party Had Upgraded Her Treatments But The Spa Had Not Cancelled The Original Treatment So Two Different Therapist Came To Collect Tracy .

column31: A Wonderful Relaxing Break We All Felt Truly Pampered. The Staff Were Very Friendly  Hospitable And Professional. We Can't Wait To Come Back Next Year!

The Staff Were Very Polite  Attentive And Well Trained. Very Disappointed With My 25 Minute Massage At The Spa Though   It Turned Out To Be 18 Minutes Hands On Massage  Witch Felt Like A Rip Off And Therefore I Would Not Ever Return To The Spa Nor Would I Recommend It To Friends.

My 25 Minute Massage At The Spa Was Disappointing And A Rip Off Since It Turned Out To Be Only 18 Minutes Hands On . Therefore I Would Not Return To The Spa Nor Would I Recommend It To Anyone. The Staff At The Hotel Were First Class  Very Attentive  Friendly And Well Trained. Our Room And Bed Were Clean And Comfortable And We Might Return To The Hotel But Not The Spa.
column77: The Spa Treatment Was A Rip Off  Please See My Previous Comment  Question 6
column89: To Price Your Spa Treatments More Fairly And Provide The Promised Treatment Minutes.

column31: Had An Amazing Time  Staff Very Friendly And Professional  Special Mention Reception And Reuben. Treatments We Had In Spa Were Fantastic And We Are Coming Back In March. I Must Say We Found The Food At Lunch Was Exceptional  Better Than Evening Meal!. Overall Great Stay.
Was Absolutely Amazing  The Service Was Great All The Staff Were Very Welcoming And Friendly Definitely Will Be Back.
column39: The Pillows Were Uncomfortable

column35: The Receptionist Was Pleasant But Unfortunately I Have To Say I Found It Painful Checking In.  There Was Also Confusion Over The Price Of Our Stay Which I Found Very Unprofessional.
column39: A Bottle Of Water Available Would Be My Only Comment
column53: Fantastic
column64: Very Good

column31: The Staff Are Very Friendly And Helpful  The Food Is Very Good And The Rooms Are Nice And Clean. Some Money Needs To Be Spent In Certain Areas  But Overall Its A Very Nice Place To Stay
column35: The Car Parks Were Full  So It Wasnt Easy To Park  But We Managed In The End
column39: My Bed Was Very Good And Clean  But With Regard To The Room Itsself  It Was Clean But Certainly Nor Exceptionally Clean
column53: The Tomatoes Could Have Been Cooked For Longer And The Bacon Was Far From Crispy. You Do Serve Green Tea  Which Was Nice And The Service Was Good
column64: It Was A Shame That On Our Last Visit The Restaurant Was Closed  But We All Enjoyed Our Meal
column89: Cook The Tomatoes For Longer And Make Sure That The Bacon Is Crispy As The Standard Of Breakfast Is Every Bit As Important As The Standard Of Dinner. Some Would Say That It Is The Most Important Meal Of The Day
column90: The Hotel Will Only Ever Be As Good As Its Staff And I Think That Everyone Tries Very Hard To Do A Good Job

column31: Very Well Looked After By Very Helpful Staff
I Had A Good Time And The Spa And Food Were Great. However A Mix Up With Rooms Was A Negative.
column83: On On The First Day Of Our Stay Me And My Partner Returned To Our Room To Find A Complete Stranger In Our Room. The Person Had Used Our Shower And Facilities Since She Was Sent To The Wrong Room By The Hotel Staff  And Was Given A Wrong Keycard. This Made Us Feel Quite Uncomfortable And The Staff Were Unable To Explain Why This Happened And Could Not Guarantee It Wouldn't Happen Again.

column31: Disappointed With The Booking Process And Poor House Keeping
column35: I Booked Over The Phone As Your Website Was Saying No Bookings At All. We Were You Had No Twin Or Double Rooms Left But We Were Able To Have The Room With The 4 Poster Bed For £1 More Each. My Female Friend And I Agreed To Take The Room And The Lady Who Took The Booking Made A Comment That The Room Was Too Be Shared By 2 Woman Incase Anyone Questioned It When We Arrived. Upon Arrival I Was Informed We Had Been Given A Free Upgrade ?? To An Apartment Room 10 And You Would Split The Bed Into Twins Although The Reception Lady Kept Saying We Definitely Requested A Double Bed Which Isaid Clearly 3 Times We Had Not !We Were Put Into A Tiny Loft With Sloping Roof Sides  A Bathroom Full Of Dust And Cobwebs Off The Tiles And Neither Lamp Bulbs Worked. We Contacted The Reception And They Sent Someone To Split The Beds ( Again Another Row Over We Specifically Wanted A Double Bed When We Said No Such Thing  Come On  2 Obviously Married Woman Why ?? )While We Used The Spa And On Our Return Before Dinner Found Nothing Had Changed. How Please Was This An Upgrade From A Room With A 4 Poster ?? Finally We Received An Apology And We Had To Pack Up And Move Our Things To Number 7 Which Was At Least Had Proper Beds And Lamps That Worked But Both The Shower And Toilet Had Dirt And Cobwebs Hanging Off The Tiles  Very Poor. It Took 40 Mins To Sort Out Moving And We Then Had To Go And Get New Keys From Reception Instead Of Them Being Handed To Us  We Should Not Have To Be Running Around As The Guests.
column39: Dirty Bathrooms In Both Apartments  Clean Your Tiled Walls Please !!! And Check Basics Like Lamps
column53: Great Choice But We Were Advised To Be In Before 9Oc Because 100 Children Were Coming In And We May Have Had Less Choice. We Then Had To Get Up Earlier For This  Didn't See 1 Child !! The Whole Point Of Going Away Over Night Is To Maybe Have A Lay In ? Again Very Poor Communications To People  Both Tables Beside Us Made The Same Comment Over The So Called "Kids"
column64: Staff Were Very Quick With Our Orders And Polite
column77: No
column83: See Previous Comments
column84: No  We Unfortunately Had So Many Coming And Going No Idea Who They Were
column89: Two Coach Loads Of Conference People Were All Checking Out At The Same Time  We Couldn't Move And Got Fed Up Waiting Around. In The End We Just Handed Over Our Key Passes To A Member Of Staff And Left. Trying To Get Out Of The Car Park Took Ages As People Were Boarding Coaches  Standing In The Road And Leaving Luggage In It. Surely Your Staff Should Have Helped Organise This Mass Leaving And Sorted Out The Coaches. We Had Lunch Booked At 2Oc But We Left And Didn't Bother To Return For It As We Were Disappointed With The Stay And Glad To Leave  Restful Was Not The Word  Ridiculous Maybe.
column90: I Am Glad To Receive This Survey As It Meant I Did Not Have To Waste More Of My Time Sending In A Complaint Which I Was Going To Do This Weekend  However You Managed To Ruin Last Weekend For Us  Poor.

column31: Disappointed By Being Lied To And Taken For Fools When They Said Were Being Upgraded When Actually We Were Relegated To A Poorly Appointed Loft Room In A Outdoor Mew. Our Room At Home Was Warmer And Better Furnished So We Decided To Go Home And Come Back For Breakfast.
column39: Mews 10. Was Presented To Us As An Upgrade And It Was Shockingly Poor. Burn Marks On Surfaces  Kettle Had To Be Pluged In On The Floor. Room Was Cold And Furniture Ikea Like.
column83: Being Presented A Lesser Room As An Upgrade. It Was A Lie And They Knew It Which Is Why They Apologised. But Why Lie In The First Place? It Was In The Hope That We Would Either Not Notice Or Complain. Thats Bad

column31: Unacceptable. Despite Booking Directly On The Sopwell Website  When Reserving A Table For Dinner At Check In I Was Informed That My Booking Did Not Include Dinner When It Certainly Had.It Took Ten Minutes Of Staring At The Screen Before A Receptionist Referred It: A Supervisor Then Confirmed That The Booking Did In Fact Include Dinner. It Was Disappointing To Note That The Booked Room Was Not Available At 3Pm  Despite The Website Confirming That Rooms Would Be Available From This Time. So In Summary The Check In Experience Was Unacceptably Poor. The Experience Continued Negatively At Dinner  When The Host Advised That Our Booking Again Did Not Include Dinner. When I Explained What Had Happened At Check In She Said She 'Would Need To Charge' And 'Would Tell Our Story' To Reception. Clearly This Language And Approach Is Totally Unacceptable And Left A Sour Taste In The Mouth During Dining  Spoiled The Stay In Fact.
column35: See Previous Comments On Unacceptable Arrival Process
column39: Room 257. Insufficient Quantities Of Milk  Sugar And Teabags Etc  Only Enough For One Cup Which Really Isn't Enough. The Flex On The Kettle Is Too Short For The Available Plug Sockets  Meaning That To Boil The Kettle It Needed To Be Precariously Balanced At An Angle On The Desk - Certainly A Health And Safety Hazard. The Toilet Would Not Flush Either  I Had To Remove The Top Of The Cistern And Free The Ball And Chain  Again Something You Just Dont Want To Be Doing When You Are Having A Leisure Break.
column53: We Breakfasted At C0930 And It Was Clear That The Kitchen And Cleaning Staff Were In A Rush To Clear The Food Away And Close The Room Down As Soon As Possible. I Would Have Liked Longer To Have Eaten The Breakfast And In Fact The Pastries Etc Had Been Removed Before The Tea Was Taken  Which Is Unacceptable
column64: See Earlier Comments About Being Told We Had Not Paid For The Dinner And That Our 'Story' Would Have To Be Told To The Front Desk  Despite Booking Directly With The Sopwell Website.
column77: Can Anything Be Done About The Number Of Beds? In The Morning Every Bed Was Decked With A Towel Though The Very Great Majority Remained Unattended For At Least Two Hours. There Was Nowhere To Sit Or Relax Yet Very Few People About. A Notice Could Be Put Up That Politely Requests That Guests Remove Towels When Not At The Poolside  Or Even Better Towels Would Be Removed To Free Up Beds After An Hour Of Being Unattended Etc
column83: See Earlier Comments
column84: The Gentleman Who Was Cleaning The Changing Rooms At C1600 On 1St December Took Time Out To Explain In A Courteous Manner How To Operate The Combination Lockers: This Was Helpful And Out Of His Way.
column89: Yes  Firstly  The Booking On Your System Must Reflect That Selected By Your Customers On The Website  This Was The Source Of Much Grief And Poor Customer Experience. Secondly The Rooms Must Be Ready As Advertised At 3Pm: If They Cant Be Ready  Dont Advertise That They Can. Thirdly  Better Communication Between Check In And Brasserie Staff So That The Customer Is Not Inconvenienced. Fourthly  Better Management Of Bed Availability In The Pool.
column90: I Would Like Someone To Contact Me By Email At Asmcgee@Mac.Com And Respond To My Experiences. At The Present Moment In Time I Will Be Advising Friends And Colleagues Not To Visit Sopwell House

column31: Beautiful Relaxing  Me Time
column39: 138 Was A Lovely Room  However Not Clearly Signed From Reception. But Lovely Team Showed Us The Way
column64: Loved It.....Food At Lunch And Dinner Fabulous Always Plenty Of Choice
column90: Cocktail Bar Very Nice  Love This
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column39: Mews 8  Would Also Have Expected A Fridge At The Price. Otherwise All Ok

column31: Very Enjoyable It Was My Wife's Birthday  The Apartment Was Excellent And The Food Superb  My Wife Had A Spa Treatment Which She Fully Enjoyed  The Staff Are Excellent In What They Do A Big Big Thank You.
column84: All Of Them There Are Pleasant And Always Had A Smile

column31: All The Rooms That I Saw Were Good Bedrooms And Function Rooms. I Did Try To Have Lunch But Was Told That The Lunch Restaurant Was Closing In 10 Minutes So Go To The Bar For Something. Felt That This Attitude Was Not Very Flexible This Was About 2 To 2.30. The Room Telephone Did Not Work At All  So Unable To Ring For Room Service Late Evening And Morning For Tea. The Bar Service For Drinks Was Good But Waited 25 Minutes For A Toasted Panini Which I Felt Was Far To Long And Decided To Leave When It Arrived. Surely It Does Not Take That Long To Prepare And Deliver. Apart From This I Did Like The Feel Of The Hotel. The Banquet Meal Was Good So I Would Rate This As 7 Out Of 10.
column39: Room 100   Both Telephones In The Room Were Dead  So Unable To Get Room Service Late Evening Or Early Morning.

column31: We Enjoyed Our Stay  The Executive Room Was Clean And Reasonably Well Equipped - Only Had 2 Normal Tea Bags So Needed To Ask For Others To Enable Us Both To Have A Cup Of Tea On Arrival And The Following Morning.  We Had A Drink In The Cocktail Lounge And Ate In The Restaurant - Both Were Good. Just One Comment Regarding The Glasses - For A 4 / 5 Star Hotel We Both Commented That The Quality Of Glasses Being Used In The Bar And The Restaurant Were Of Low Standard (Ie Thick Rimmed Cheap Glasses). Particualrly Having Purchased A Reasonable Expensive Bottle Of Champagne....To Have Such Poor Glassware Felt As Though It Let Things Down A Little.  Breakfast In The Morning Was Good - No Toast Machine  But Not A Major Issue. Again Felt Breakfast Mugs A Bit On The Cheap Side.  Minor Gripes  Overall Experience Was Good.
column39: Room 217  See Previous Comment Re Lack Of Sufficient Normal Teabags In Room.  Also Toiletries Normally Contain A Body Lotion.
column53: No Toaster.  Thick Rimmed Mugs Rather Than Tea Cups
column64: See Previous Comment Re Glasses.  We Were Sat At Teh End Of The Room In The Restaurant With A Large Space With No Tables And Chairs.....Lacked A Bit Of Atmosphere.
column89: See Previous Comments

column31: I Had A Very Relaxing Time And Spent Ages Looking At The Football Shirts En Route To The Brasserie. They Are Very Impressive!

The Event The St Columba's Winter Ball Was Excellent And We Took Advantge Of A Subsidized Room Rate. Room Unfortunately Was Small And A Little Tired  Bits Fell Off The Bath And Shower. Bed Was Very Small Light Didnt Work Etc
column39: 136  As Per Previous Commnets  Tired Cracked Wash Basin  Loose Fittings Etc
column83: Bit Slow At Breakfast Had To Ask A Few Time For Butter  Coffee Etc

column31: Very Good Apart From Tv Not Working In Our Room 137 & Despite Reporting It To Reception &A Visit From A Member Of Staff Who Told Me He Would Report To Maintenance Staff & Get The Tv Replaced If Necessary In Our Room .This Did Not Happen So I Reported It To The Front Of House Manager When We Checked Out Next Morning .She Apologised And Made A Note For Us To Receive An Upgrade When We Next Visit As Recompense .I Hope This Will Be Possible As We Require Twin Beds As We Are A Mother And Daughter?
column39: We Had Booked A Twin Bedded Room But Were Given A Double Bed .The Double Bed Had To Be Remade Into Two Singles By Your Staff For Us As We Are A Mother And Daughter. The Surfaces By The Tv Had A Layer Of Dust Covering Them But The Rest Of The Room And Bathroom Was Very Clean.
column83: See Previous Comment Re Tv
column89: Make Sure Room Tv Works Before Guests Arrive In Their Room& If Not Working Replace Tv For Guests To Enjoy During Their Stay
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column31: Excellent. Hotel Staff Very Helpful. Food Good. Spa Was Very Good And The Whole Spa Experience Left Me Feeling Completely Relaxed And Pampered. My Overnight Stay Was Excellent Value For Money And I Will Be Returning.
column35: Extremely Helpful Staff When Booking And Check In Was Very Smooth. Staff Welcoming And Friendly.
column39: Room 232. Lovely Room  Good View  Clean And Well Equipped
column64: The Starter Was Very Cold. The Main Course Was Disappointing As The Olive And Potato Crush Was Not A Good Combination With The Fish. The Dessert Was Poor.
column77: Excellent Facilities And Staff Really Pleasant. Treatments Excellent. Felt Really Relaxed Afterwards.
column89: Evening Meal Needed Improvement. However  The Lunch Buffet Was Excellent With A Lovely Selection Of Hot And Cold Food.

column27: Before We Left Earlier This Year Booked At Reception

column31: Great Location  Excellent Quality Food  Ideal For Short Breaks With Spa And Garden.
column35: It Was Easy To Reschedule Our Stay.
column39: No
column83: When We Checked Out On The Sunday Morning There Was Only One Person On Reception And I Was Fourth In The Queue With Others Behind Me. I Felt This Was Poor As The Staff Member Was Dealing With Quests  The Phone And Checking Lost Property With No Assistance.
column89: See Previous Comment About Checkout.
column90: Would Love To Come Back For A Short Break And Experience The Spa And The Grounds.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column31: Relaxing
column39: 812 Room Was Fantastic.  Bed So Comfortable. Just Could Have Done With Some More Coffee/Milk.
column83: The Heating In Our Room Wasn't Working  But After A Call To Front Desk Someone Came To Resolve The Problem.

column31: Good Facilities  Nice Staff A La Carte Dinner Menu Could Be Better Quality
column53: Breakfast Was Good
column84: Ruben Concierge Very Friendly
column89: Deluxe Room Very Shabby In Need Of A Refurb. Upgrade To Executive Room Was Satisfactory

column39: 210 The Temperature Gauge On The Rain Shower Went Hot When Moved To Cold And Cold When Moved To Hot.
column89: Improve Quality Of The Food.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column31: Amazing Totally Beyond Expectations- It Has Improved Massively Since I Visited 3 Years Ago.
column35: No
column39: No It Was Spotless
column48: Cranberry Sauce Should Have Arrived With The Turkey- I Didn't Want To Ask Them To Come Back Again All That Way For My Sauce!
column53: Loved The Buffet And Also The Hot Food Was In Small Bowls Which Looked Lovely Instead Of Industrial Sized Dishes- I Ate Less Too!
column64: Lunchtime Deserts Were So Cute! Very Good Idea  The Food Was Exceptional
column77: Needs A Relaxation Area With Low Lighting Loungers And Lemongrass Burning!
column84: All Were Amazingly Friendly- All Of Them
column89: The Wine Should Be Served In A Glass That Doesn't Look Like A Tesco Value One- If I Am Paying That Price For A Glass Of Wine I Expect To Get A Decent Glass To Justify Paying That Price?! The Girl In The Conservatory Needs To Speak Better English- If I Ask For The Wine List In A Bar I Don't Expect To Repeat It 3 Times Until Understood!!!!
column90: The Table Decorations In The Brasserie Look Like They Belong In A Greasy Spoon As Everything Else Looked Amazing This Really Stood Out For Me.
column108: special occasions e.g mother's day  valentine's day etc

column31: Bed Was So Comfortable  Staff Were So Obliging.
Very Relaxing  Genuinely Friendly Staff.  Fantastic Food!
column77: The Locker Room Is Quite 'Cramped'  Your Gym Members Were Complaining About The Lack Of Space Because Of Day Guests.

column31: Beautiful Place - Really Friendly Staff And Comfortable Rooms. Definitely A Positive Experience.
column53: Food Was Great. Portion Size For The Fish And Chips Was Huge! Could Have Fed 3 People... But Did Enjoy It.
column77: Very Much Enjoyed The Pool  Sauna And Jacuzzi. Didn't Have Any Treatments Or Use The Gym So Can't Comment.

column31: We Had A Lovely Stay And Enjoyed Every Moment  However My Only Complaint Was That Our Room Was Not Readty To Check Into At 3Pm  We Waited For About 20 Minute And It Was Still Not Ready So They Moved Us Into A Different Room.
column35: See Previous Comments On Checking In And Room Not Being Ready

column31: Excellent! Thank You!
Had A Really Good Stay And Would Return. Treatments Were Great!
column35: We Arrived A Little Early And So Our Room Was Not Ready  Which Was Fine. However  Even When The Room Was Ready  We Were Told No Information About Where Everything Was  What Happens With Dinner Etc. I Asked The Porter Whether We Had To Book Dinner And He Didn't Know. We Then Found Out That We Were Already Booked In When We Rang The Restaurant Ourselves. Having Previously Worked In A Spa On Reception  I Thought The Check In Was Poor.
column39: 258. Loved The Room  It Was Very Big As We Had A Triple. Lovely Bathroom.
column53: Fantastic Selection For Breakfast. The Lady Who Showed Us To The Table Was Really Nice Too.
column77: I Thought The Spa Facilitates Were Really Good  And The Treatment I Had Was Great. My Girl Who Did My Treatment  (I Think Her Name Was Kerry?)  Was Very Professional And Talked Through Everything Beforehand. Really Great! Nice Touch To Give Guests A Bottle Of Water After Treatment.   Locker System Was Very Clever In The Changing Rooms  Good To Not Carry A Key Around. The Only Thing I Would Say Is That It Was Very Hot In The Pool Area. But This Wasn't Really A Problem!
column83: Was Not Told Any Information Upon Check In. Some Details About Meal Times  Treatments  Where Everything Is  Would Have Been Good. I Don't Feel That We Should Have To Ask All Of This Or Find Out Ourselves.
column84: Kerry (Treatments) - Great Treatment  Lovely Girl.  Not Sure What Her Name Was  But She Was Working In The Brasserie And Had A Trainee Badge On - Wearing A Suit. Really Great Customer Service And Explained Everything Well.

column89: The Brassieres Food Was Very Disappointing  We Felt There Was No Quality To The Food  No Seasoning And No Care Or Passion In Putting A Meal Together .... It Wasn't Busy Either Thought I Doubt That Would Have Mattered As The Quality Is Not There. I Have Had Better Olives On A Market Stall  The One We Were Given Tasted Like Cheap Crespo Olives From A Jar. We Were Very Let Down As It Was Meant To Be A Special Birthday Meal !! The Hotel And Facilities Were Stunning We Would Visit Again However Next Time We Will Go Somewhere Else For Dinner .

column53: Disappointingly Poor Quality Of Ingredients.
column83: Had To Change Rooms At 11.45 P.M. As Noise From Function Room Was Impeding Sleep.   This Was Done In An Efficient And Courteous Way.
column84: Yes  The Man Who Moved Us To The Second Floor But Do Not Know His Name.

column31: They Accommodated For A Vegan And Veggie In The Restaurant Without Any Fuss At All.  That Made Such A Difference And Was Very Much Appreciated.    There Was A Problem With The Booking That Was Made Over The Phone And The Manager Kindly Sorted Out What Could Have Been A Big Problem (Big Enough For Us To Go Back Home Again)....That Was Dealt With Very Well And Help Make Our Stay A Pleasurable One.  A Big Thank You...I Think The Lady In The Restaurant Was Mia - She Was Particularly Outstanding...And She Is A Big Asset To The Venue.
column35: A Problem Occurred Over The Phone And The Booking Was Taken Incorrectly But The Manager Sorted This Out And Everything Was Fine After That.

column31: Perfection  Peace  Elegance.  Beautiful Surroundings. Impeccable Staff And Management.  Sterling Service All Round. Felt Like I Was Reliving A Scene From The Bridgette Jones Film When She Stayed In Her Parents House In The Snow.. Then To Even More Opulence Surroundings. Only Criticism Loose Tile In My Room In Bathroom ... Other Than That.. A Dream Come True. You Are All Fantastic People.. The Doormen Sterling Touch.  Never Forget My Stay. The Male Instructor Who Took Our Combat Classes.. Awesome.. To The Head Girl Taking Our Menus In The Evening.. Stunning And Kind To Us  Thank You From My Heart.
column35: The Original Booking Was Messed Up By The Female Booking Staff. However 30 Later Sorted Out  By Then Had A Migraine. Then The Dream Began. Thank Yoi
column64: Employ Me. I Didn't Want To Leave.
column77: Awesome
column83: Found The Ic3 Female.. Stand Offish Towards Me.
column84: Female With Blonde Hair And Make Up.. Head Waitress? In The Room Where They Held A Buffet. Can't Rem What It's Called. However She Was Extremely Patient Helping Us With Our Vegetarian And Vegan Choice. She Was Very Very Caring And So Kind. She Made Me Very Pleased To Be There And Welcomed.
column89: Free Coffee With Our Meal. And A Date With The French? Doorman
column90: Sopwell House Is Fantastic

column31: Relaxing  Energizing. Walking Towards The Entrance And Being Met By Doormen Opening The Door For Us Was Sterling Service. After A Mixup At Reception And Booking  The Rest Of The Stay Was Absolutley A Dream Come True. I Loved The Idea Of The Man In The Hall Playing Piano Was Amazing  I Also Play Piano So This Was A Welcome Sight For Me. Christmas Trees In All The Lounge Areas Was Truley Enchanting. Open Fires And Extubrant Sofas To Take The Weight Of Your Feet.  Everyone Of Your Customers Treated With Equal Amounts Of Respect And Dignity And Offered The Same Level Of Service Is Something Which I Noticed From The Offset. I Work For The Police And Have Stayed In Very High Level Accomodation In The Past  However The Level Of Service And Attention To Detail Super Succeeded That. All Round Care And Consideration For Your Public  So A Huge Thank You
column35: The Main Point Of Contact Over The Phone Messed Up Our Booking Which Led To A 30 Minute Of Phone Calls And Waiting  This Led To A Server Migraine And Slight Annoyance. However Sorted Out And Sterling Service Commenced.  Thank You.
column39: Room 246.1   Left Side Bathroom Tile Loose  Broke My Toenail On It As It Moves If Stood On. 2 Large Hornet Wasp In Bathroom.   3  Floors Need Sound Proofing As Other Guests Walking Up And Down Outside Door Sounds Like A Herd Of Elephants.
column48: Not Enough Coffee Sachets  Hence Room Service ..  Other Than That I Really Enjoyed My Stay  I Wished I Had Booked For Longer.
column64: The Head Of House Female With Blonde Hair   Don't Recall Her Name. She Was Absolutley Amazing. Arranged All Of Our Vegetarian And Vegan Menu. She Was Really Really Funny And Friendly And Came Across As Really Patient And Genuine. I Had Such A Blast. Only One Problem.. There Should Have Been Free Coffee And Tea Served.
column77: More Extended Treatments For Foot Care As I Walk About In Work Boots On Patrol All Day And I Would Have Loved More Treatment On Feet. Other Than That I Had The Best Massage Ever. The Female In Question Was Very Well Trained. Superb Service!!
column83: N/A
column84: Female Head Of Service In Buffet Area  Female Taking Orders For Evening Meal. Blonde Hair  With Make Up  Black Suit  Amazing Kind Hearted Female
column89: Free Coffee And Tea With Meals  As I Am A Coffee Addict. However Will Bring A Jar Of My Own Next Time. Apart From That  Sterling Service.
column90: I Have Had The Best Two Days In A Very Long Time.

column31: Entrance Is Beautiful. The Room Wasn't What I Booked  The Surprise Chocolates I Ordered Weren't In The Room Ready  The Card Was Addressed To Me When It Was Meant To Be For The Other Half. The Bed Was Uncomfortable. Bathroom Celant Was Missing  Mold On Shower Door  Toilet Seat Is Older Than Me And The Length Of Time You Have To Wait To Order A Drink In The Cocktail Lounge Is Ridiculous... We Gave Up After 1!!! I Am Not Impressed What So Ever  Actually Truly Dissapointed. I Am A Travel Agent  And The 5*/Deluxe Hotels I Visit Make Sopwell Look Like A 4*. Won't Return Which Is A Shame  As We Are Planning Our Wedding For A Couple Of Years Time And Wanted To Have A Look At Your Well Known Hotel  As Everyone Says It's Amazing Etc...
column35: On Arrival  Do To Read Out The Price We Paid  As This Was A Surprise Booking And I Rather The Other Guests Next To Me Not Hear How Much I've Spent! As I Also Said Before  The (Pricey) Chocolates I Ordered Weren't In The Room  Card Was Addressed To The Wrong Person. But  The Reception Girl Was Lovely  Very Polite
column39: 261 - Sort Out The Bathroom Celant And The Mattress!
column64: If A Couple Have Booked A Stay Including Dinner  Then Why Should This Food Be Half The Size Of The A La Carte Food?
column83: I've Already Stated My Issues A Few Times
column89: Improve On What I Have Already Commented On

column31: Truly Wonderful. Made For 40Th Birthday Very Special. Wish I Could Have Stayed For The Whole Weekend
column53: Excellent
column84: Bar Man On Our First Evening But I Don't Know His Name Sorry. He Was Extremely Helpful
column90: Overall Fantastic

column31: The Only Area That Needed Improvement Was The Spa.   On 5Th Dec  We Spend 3 Hours Relaxing And Only Saw One Lady Take A Water Sample.  There Were Many Towels And Robes Left On The Chairs.  Empty Water Cups On The Tables And An Apple Core On The Floor.  The Ladies Changing Rooms Were A Mess And When I Was Waiting For My Partner Next To The Reception Desk I Heard A Regular Guest Say To The Receptionist That "It Looked Like A Bomb Had Dropped In There"  She Immediately Went In And Cleared Up The Towels Ect... It's A Shame That Staff Need To Be Told By Guests To Clean Up.  Surely They Should Take A Walk Around The Spa And Changing Room Area Every Hour?    Everything Else Was Absolutely Perfect!

Another Waiter Told Us Where We Could Sit And Then It Was Fine. However  By The Time We Left None Had Actually Come To Sit At The Table We Were Told To Leave. It Wasn't A Huge Issue  But If We Were Meant To Book For Tea Someone Should Have Told Us. Or The People On Reception Could Have Sorted That Out For Us When We Asked Where Tea Was Served.

column31: I Booked Our Lazy Sunday Stay For 1St -2Nd December To Celebrate My Pregnant Wifes 30Th Birthday.  On Checking In We Were Told Our Spa Treatments Were Not On The System. When The Reception Staff Checked Further We Were Told They Had Been Entered On Your System For The 24Th November And Subsequently We Had Been Charged As A "No Show".  My Pregnant Wife Instantly Started To Worry That We Wouldn't Be Able To Have Our Treatments Which Had Been The Main Reason For Choosing To Stay At Sopwell House.   Fortunately I Had Received A Voice Message The Day Before Our Stay  From A Member Of Staff In Your Spa  Confirming Our Treatments For The 1St December  Which I Relayed To Your Reception Staff.   Whilst The Staff Did Ultimately Resolve The Issue  This Was Not The Relaxing Start To Our Break That I Had Hoped For.   Other Issues:-  > Noise From Other Rooms When Having Our Spa Treatments > View Of Tv In Bedroom Obscured By The Post On The Four Post Bed > Credit Facility Not Correctly Set Up By Reception When Checking In Meaning We Were Refused A Tab At The Bar And The Brasserie Staff Coming To Find Us In The Lounge To Obtain Payment For Our Meal Time Drinks.   When Paying In Excess Of £300 For Our Stay And Treatments This Is Not The Sort Of Issue I Expect To Be Faced With.

column31: First Class

The Warm Welcome In The Beautifully Decorated Reception Area Was A Wonderful Start To Our Stay  And The Service Throughout Was Excellent.  I Would Especially Like To Thank The Staff In The Spa  Who Fitted Me In For A Manicure At Short Notice (Natalie Did An Excellent Job!)  Which Made Our Anniversary Trip Even More Special.
column53: The Buffet Breakfast Was Excellent  And We Were Particularly Pleased To Discover Poached Eggs Were Available!
column64: The Brasserie Was Very Noisy (A Number Of Christmas Groups Were Dining At The Same Time)  So Conversation Was Difficult  But The Service Was Excellent.  The Italian Sharing Platter Was Superb  And Our Main Courses Were Delicious. Unfortunately  My Dessert Was Rather Disappointing.  I Had Ordered Panetonne With Espresso Ice Cream   But The Ice Cream Tasted Like Caramel Or Butterscotch.  I Was Told That It Was 'Definitely Espresso'  Though The Taste Of Caramel And Coffee Are Hard To Confuse!  My Dessert Was Replaced With A Fresh One  With Vanilla Ice Cream In Place Of The Disputed Espresso.
column77: A Special Thank You To The Receptionist And Natalie  For A Last-Minute Appointment!
column84: The Receptionist On Duty In The Spa  And Natalie For Providing A Wonderful Manicure - It Lasted Throughout Christmas  And Was Only Reluctantly Removed (Still Chip Free) Due To Nail Growth. The Best Jessica Nails Manicure I Have Had!

column31: Poor Service. Every Time Any Kind Of Request Was Made For Something For The Room  One Of The Items Was Forgotten. Basic Items Were Not Left In The Room After Servicing (E.G. Tea  Coffee  Water  Shampoo) And We Kept Having To Request Them. When We Asked Our Room To Be Cleaned And Went To The Spa  We Returned 90 Minutes Later To Find The Service Had Only Just Started And Had To Leave The Room Again.Reception: Unsmiling Welcome On Arrival  And On Departure We Were Not Asked About Our Stay At All. No Robes In The Spa. The Room Was Very Cold On Arrival And We Had To Ask For An Extra Heater. Breakfast Brasserie Service Was Slow - On More That One Occasion We Had To Chase Up Tea  Coffee  Etc. Room Service On New Years Eve Tried To Charge Us £50 Until We Pointed Out That We Had Not Been Given Any Notice Of This (To Their Credit  They Did Revert To The Original Menu Eventually). Increasing The Price Of A Cup Of Coffee From £3.55 To £5.25 (Approx) Overnight And Without Any Warning For Customers. And Of Course Charging Over £5 For A Coffee In The First Place. On Arrival We Were Told About The Black Tie Events On New Years Eve - If This Had Been Made Available To Us When We Booked We May Have Chosen To Come And Would Have Brought Appropriate Clothing For Such An Event. We Stayed In The Most Expensive Room In The Hotel Yet Did Not Receive Suitable Service For Such A Room At All. The Room On The Whole Was Fine  Though There Really Ought To Be A Fridge Included For The Best Room In Your Hotel And For The Prices We Paid. One Exception: Ruben Was Excellent. Overall  We Are Very Doubtful About Returning To The Hotel Or Recommending It To Others.

We Were Told That There Were Only Two Rooms Booked When In Fact I Had Booked Three Rooms For An Overnight Stay And There Had Been Many Telephone Calls Made And E-Mails Sent (Since Aptril 2013) And At One Point Was Going To Cancel My Booking.  This Did Not Bode Well With One Of Our Friends Who Was Staying The Night .........Also I Feel That A Welcome Drink For Guests On Arrival Would Have Been A Nice Gesture Especially For The Money We Paid.  Overall We Enjoyed Our Stay As On A Previous Occasion .
column35: I Refer To My Previous Comments (6) And Feel That The Booking System For A Stay And A Meal Coluld Be Dealt With More Efficiently. I Have To Say That Jenny In Reservations Was More Than Helpful In Sending Out Brochures Which I Had Previously Requested But They Did Not Arrive And Also In Securing Our Rooms.

column84: Amanda Who  Was The Maître D For The Wedding. She Really Went The Extra Mile And Worked Extremely Hard. She Was There At Midday Or Before And Still There At 1.00Am. Nothing Was Too Much Trouble. She Really Did Stand Out As A Member Of Staff Who Really Gave Excellent Service And Is A Good Ambassador For Your Hotel.
column89: I Just Don't Think You Are Visible Enough. The Staff Who Served Us Were Great But They Were Few And Far Between. Chasing Around For Your Breakfast Items And For Cutlery Etc. Was Not Great.

column31: It Was Our 2Nd Wedding Anniversary   We Really Enjoyed Our Stay..
column35: The Receptionist  New It Was Our Anniversary Nice Touch..

column8: A Relaxing Break With A Friend.
column31: We Were Very Excited About Coming . We Thought The Hotel Itself Was Great. However  We Found The Spa Facilities Very Very Busy. Not At All Relaxing. There Were No Loungers Or Chairs Available For Us Poolside On The Day We Arrived  There Was Also A Shortage Of Robes Availablen. I Am Overweight And The Towels Did Not Cover Me. My Friend Is Heavily Pregnant And Not Having A Robe To Cover Her  She Felt Self Conscious And With No Where To Sit Poolside  We Only Spent An Hour There For Our Whole Stay. The Treatments We Received Were Fantastic And Helped Us To Relax. We Enjoyed The Food In The Evening And The Quality Of The Room Was Great. We Were Told That The Restaurant Would Be Open At 6.30Am And Arrived At 7.30Am To Have To Wait An Extra Half Hour To 8Am! We Ended Up Laying On A Bed Relaxing After Breakfast As We Could See How Busy The Pool Area Was. For This Reason We Checked Out By 11 And Decided Not To Stay For Lunch Or To Use Spa Facilities. We Couldn't Fault The Staff Or Facilities(Apart From The Make It Yourself Nescafe Coffee At Breakfast - But That Is Being Very Picky!) But Didnt Particularly Enjoy What It Had To Offer Because Of How Busy It Was. We Dont Far Away And Im Unsure If We Would Visit Again Or Recommend It.
column35: No
column53: I Thought The Coffee Was Terrible And Ended Up Getting Coffee From A Coffee Shop In St.Albams After We Checked Out. I Expected Better From A Hotel Of This Standard. Some Of The Hot Food Was Cooked Well But Some Not.
column64: Not Much Of A Choice For Someone Pregnant. Pate/Shellfish/Soft Cheese - Lots Of Dishes Included These And It Limited My Friends Choice.
column77: Very Busy. Felt Someone Could Have Been On.Duty In.There. There Were Children Under 8 In The Jacazzi And Nowhere To Sit Or Relax As All The Seats And Loungers Were Taken. Many Of These 'Reserved' With A Towel. Although The Facilities Were Great  The Pool Was Cold And We Could Not Relax And Did Not Enjoy Thi Part Of The Stay. It Was The Main Reason We Picked Sopwell House Over Other Spas Too.
column89: Look After Obviously Heavily Pregnant Guests. Particularly In The Spa Area..... Ensure They Have A Robe And Someone To Sit And Relax.... My Friend Had The Choice Of Being In A Cold Pool Or Standing Up (Cold  Without A Robe) By The Pool.. She Was Unable To Go In.The Jacuzzi  Steam Room  Sauna Or Sit On The Hot Stones. I Didn't Use Them Because I Couldn't Relax Knowing She Wasnt Able To.

column31: Great Hospitality  Great Customer Service And Amazing Personable But Professional Staff. I Love The Boutique Style Accompanied With A Hotel Feel - It Makes You Feel At Home. The Fireplace In Reception Was An Amazing Welcome. It Would Have Been Nice To See The Fireplace In The Lounge On Also.
column39: 105 - Great Room However Very Cold. Beautiful Bathroom But As A Suite Fresh Flannels Would Have Been Appreciated. I Would Not Describe The Room As Well Equipped As A Suite - When You Book A Suite You Expect Extra Special Touches So It Is Disappointing When There Are No Extra Luxuries E.G. Bubble Bath  Mini Bar  Turn Down Service  Several Bottles Of Water And A Fruit Bowl/Snack Bowl.
column53: Not A Wide Range Of Food Especially Healthy Options. Fruit Came From Tins  Scrambled Egg Was Very Milky. There Was No Porridge On Offer. There Were No Smoothies Or Juices Made Fresh. The Breakfast Really Let The Hotel Experience Down.
column83: Noisy People In The Room Next Door
column84: Vince Castranova Is Fabulous! His Hopsitality  Attention To Detail And Talent At Putting People To Ease Is Rare And Brilliant. Thank You Once Again Vince For Making Our Stay So Great :) If It Was Not For Vince We Would Not Be Returning!

column31: The Stay Was Fine But Making A Booking Was Awful Could Only Book For The Wedding Rate Over The Phone And No One Ever Answered The Call And I Had To Call Repeatedly To Get Through. Booking Team And Reception Were Not Very Helpful. Booking At A Luxury Hotel Should Be Simple

We Didn't Find It Relaxing From That Point Of View.  If I Were To Stay At Sopwell House Again It Would Be In The Middle Of The Week And Not In A Holiday Period When I Feel That There Might Be Less People.

column31: I Must Have Stayed At Sopwell Nearly 50 Times In The Past Five Years And 20 Times In The Past 12 Months. Yet Each Time I Check In I Get Asked 'Have You Stayed Before'. A Little Annoying- Anychane Your Front Of House Team Can See Our Records When We Come To Check In. Also Be Good If You'd Consider Some Sort Of Loyalty Scheme......I Split My Business Trip Stays 50/50 Between Sopwell And A Hotel Near Hatfield Who Do Offer Points But I'd Probably Go There Less And Increase My Stay With You If You'd Offer A Loyalty Scheme

Tea/Coffee Waiter Was Surly And Disappeared When We Needed More Drinks.
column64: Waitress Was Very Good And Very Friendly  Service Was Prompt And Food Was Excellent.

column31: Overall We Had A Lovely Time  The Staff Were Friendly And Attentive While Not Being Too Over Attentive. We Stayed In An Executive Room Which Was Very Comfortable  Clean & Nicely Decorated.  Constructive Feedback Is That There Were Not Enough Lounge Beds In The Spa So We Had To Swim In The Pool & Use The Jacuzzi Etc To Wait For A Free Bed Which Was About 40 Minutes. There Could Be A Wider Choice Of Dishes On The Menu In The Brasserie As Part Of The 3 Course Set Menu  We Went For Something Off Of The A La Carte Menu As The Choices Were Limited On The Set Menu.  We Also Had Room Service Which When It Arrived Was Missing Some Of The Menu Choices (Ie Poached Egg  Milk For The Coffee).  Having Said That  We Had A Very Enjoyable Time  Very Relaxing And Easy & We Would Definitely Visit You Again. Regards Faye
column48: Our Breakfast Was Missing Some Of The Menu Choices We Had Made  Poached Egg And Milk For The Coffee But We Managed Without.  The Breakfast Was Also A Bit On The Small Side For For The Price  1 Sausage  1 Slice Of Bacon Etc - The Bacon However Was Very Tasty.
column77: There Were Very Few Loungers Around The Pool So We Had To Wait For About 40 Minutes Before 1 Became Free.
column84: The Porter Was Very Friendly & Helpful  He Took The Time To Show Us Around The Hotel Facilities Which Was Kind Of Him.
column89: Please See Previous Comments.

column31: Not The Best Visit I Have Had To Sopwell House. Little Things Such As No Slippers Available At Spa  Being Asked If We Would Take Our Dessert In The Lounge As The Restaurant Wanted Our Table  The Lounge Being Exceedingly Cold When I Was Expecting Cosy Real Fires Burning Rather Than Me Having To Ask Your Staff To Turn A Radiator On!
column35: We Checked In At 2.30Pm As We Had Treatments Booked At 3Pm. Our Room Was Not Ready  Which Was Fine As We Then Took Our Swimwear Out Of Our Luggage And Would Go Straight To The Spa. The Porter Said He Would Take Our Luggage To Our Room When Ready And Drop Our Room Key Off At The Spa Reception  Which Was Great In Theory But When We Left The Spa There Were No Room Keys For Collection And The Spa Staff Had To Go To Reception And Collect For Us!
column39: Room 237 Was A Superior Room And I Had To Ring Reception On Arrival  To Confirm This As I Have Been To Sopwell Several Times And This Room Looked No Different From The Standard Rooms I Have Previously Stayed In. On Checking Out I Asked Reception What Made This Room A Superior Room And Was Told It Was Because 'It Had A Black Granite Bathroom'!
column53: A Good Selection Of Items Served At Breakfast Which Was Most Enjoyable
column64: We Were Asked If We Would Take Our Dessert In The Lounge As The Brasserie Needed Our Table. I Had Taken My Sister To Sopwell As A Christmas Present And Also As A Thank You For Supporting Me Through The Previous 7 Months Of Illness.  This Was A Special Occasion For Us And Although I Appreciate The Brasserie Was Busy  I Did Not See Staff Asking Male/Female Couples Dining If They Would Move To The Lounge. I Did Take Exception To This And Did Not Move To The Lounge.
column77: We Were Told There Were No Slippers For The Spa And As We Have Been Before And Have Always Had Slippers Available To Us  We Did Not Bring Flip Flops  Only The Boots We Had Worn To Sopwell! When We Were Waiting For Our Room Keys (As Mentioned Earlier) We Were Surprised To See The Reception Staff Giving A Gentleman A Robe  Towel And Slippers! We Then Asked Again And Was Told To Keep It Quiet As They Only Had A Few Pairs Left  Which Seemed Strange As On Arrival To The Spa We Were Told Quite Categorically That There Were No Slippers Available.

column31: I Found Trying To Book Online Confusing And Slightly Misleading  For Example Selecting To Book A Double Room But Still Being Shown The From Price As A Single Occupancy.  Enjoyed The Overall Experience And Hope To Come Back. New Years Eve Was A Lot Of Fun And Overall The Staff Were Helpful And Friendly.
column35: Jenny Was Extremely Helpful When I Booked Over The Phone And Gave Me Assurances That I Was Making The Right Decision Booking. She Was Able To Answer All Of My Questions And Was Very Friendly And Warm In Her Communication Style.
column39: Room 224. Disappointed That There Were No Drinking Glasses In The Room Other Than The Small Bathroom Ones. Room Cleaning Whilst There Was Sub-Standard  Some Bits Done (Coffee/Tea Restocked) But Bed Not Really Made And We Had To Look Around To Remind Ourselves Whether Anyone Had Been In. It Wasn't Obvious That It Had Been Cleaned/Tidied.
column48: Good To Have The Option Of Breakfast Delivered And Felt It Was A Reasonable Cost.
column64: Dined In The St Albans Suite For Nye Gala Dinner. Food Was Good. Service Friendly. Loved The Multiple Desserts!!
column77: One Of The Jacuzzis Was Out Of Service Although Wasn't Made Aware Of This And No Signs Suggesting So (Just No Bubbles!!) But Enjoyed The Swimming Pool  Lots Of Light And Warmth.
column83: I Was Informed Over The Phone That We Would Receive Half A Bottle Of Wine Per Person Incl In The Cost  It Turns Out This Was The Wrong Information. I Brought This Up With One Of The Waiters And Saw Him Speak To The Lady Manager At The St Albans Suite  However She Did Nothing And I Had No Response.  Half An Hour Later I Brought This Up Directly With Her  She Seemed A Little Frosty And Although Her Attitude Came Across As Unwilling To Do Anything About This Misunderstanding  I Was Pleased That She Much Later (Around Dessert) Brought Over The Wine We Had Expected. I Felt This Was The Right Gesture.
column84: Jenny For Being So Nice When I Booked.  Reuben's For Being Very Smiley  Helpful And Polite And Providing First Class Service. All The Staff Were Very Friendly With Service As A Focus And Helped Make The Stay Very Enjoyable.
column89: We Loved Staying There And Hope We Come Back Soon. All Of My Comments Are Just Small Points And Didn't Affect Our Stay Overall. We Would Have Liked The Ability To Play Our Ipods (Ipod Docking Station Would Have Been Nice). Would Also Have Liked More Bathroom Products  But This Is Just A Wish List And Taking The Best Of Other Hotels I've Been Fortunate Enough To Stay In.
column90: Look Forward To Seeing Some Tempting Offers So We Can Come Back!

column39: 128 - I Think!  Great Room But No Explanation How To Use The Heating Control. Turning The Temperature Up Made No Difference - Only Cold Air Blew Out. Even When We Turned The Heating Off At Night It Kept On Coming On And Was Quite Noisy - I Had To Get Up 4 Times In The Night To Turn It Off.  The Bathroom Was Cosy Though As The Heated Rail Worked!
column77: Too Busy On Our Second Day. Nowhere To Even Put Our Towels Down Whilst We Were In The Water And Too Many Reserved Beds That We're Not Monitored Despite Being Told The Policy Was To Roll Up The Towels. We Only Saw This Happen On Our First Day When It Was Not Busy.
column90: Other Than Not Bring As Cosy As We'd Like To Be - Really Great Venue.

column31: As Always I Very Much Enjoyed My Stay. All Staff I Came In Contacted With Were Friendly And Very Helpful.  It Was Also My Experience That Staff Would Go "The Extra Mile" To Assist Me.  Very Impressive.

column31: The New Year Celebration Is Very Good And Really Enjoyable. This Year Was Exceptionally With The Food  The Group Were Fantastic And The Singers Exceptional  The Room Decorations Looked Great And The Excellent Waiter Who Looked After Table 24. We Have Celebrated 4 Previous New Years With You But This One Was The Best. The Bedroom This Year In The Courtyard Differed From Our Normal Room. It Was A Lovely Room (11) But Unfortunately We Could Not Get The Heating To Work. We Did Notify Reception When We Checked Out So Hope They Have Fixed It For This Coming New Year
column39: Room 11 In The Courtyard. The Rooms Heating Wasn't Working Which Only Effected Us When We Were Getting Ready In The Evening And Morning. This Was Reported To Reception.
column64: The Dining Experience Was In The Ballroom. We Also Had Afternoon Tea Too Which Was Very Good. Would Before More Sandwiches And Less Cakes

column35: As A Disabled Driver I Couldn't Immediately See Any Disabled Parking Spaces And Had To Drop Off My Elderly Mother At Reception To Find Out Where They Were And Then Discovered There Was Only Two For The Whole Hotel. Upon Returning To The Hotel That Night The Area That Included Those Spaces Was Roped Off With No Thought Or Signage To Where A Disabled Person Could Park As The Main Parking Area Is Too Far Away To Walk.
column39: No.117 Disabled Access Room. The Controls For The Shower Are Exceptionally Difficult To Operate Being Stiff And Small Though Overall Size Of The Bathroom Was Good. The Bed Was Lovely And High Although On The Second Day The Beds Were Together Instead Of Being Twin! Second Day There Was No Hot Chocolate Sachets Or Room Service Menu Upon Our Return To The Room.
column48: I Ordered Boiled Egg With Soldiers And When It Arrived There Was No Egg Cup  No 'Soldiers' And No Side Plates To Cut Up The Partially Toasted Bread And The Egg Wasn't Cooked Enough. There Was Only One Saucer But Two Cups. I Would Suggest A Toast Rack And Cover So That The Toast Could Be Warmer When Delivered And It Needs To Be Toasted More Fully.  Also It Would Be Helpful To Be Able To Mark On The Menu How You Would Like Your Bacon Done (Crispy  Light Etc).
column53: No Egg Cup For Boiled Egg  Partially Toasted Bread Instead Of Properly Toasted  No Side Plates  Two Cups But Only One Saucer. Toast Could Do With Being In A Toast Rack With A Cover So That It Arrives Warmer.
column89: Better Disabled Parking And Signage Of Spaces And More Thought If Needing To Close Off The Disabled Parking Instead Of Roping Off Or Placing Cones That Stop A Disabled Person From Parking Or Exiting The Car Park. Little More Attention To Detail For The Room Service And Room Amenities.
column90: It Might Be Worth Mentioning When Someone Books Room 117 Or Other Rooms That Are Far Away From The Lifts That It Is A Long Walk That Includes Several Inclines!

column31: The Hotel Was Lovely  Service Good. But My Bath Was Not Cleaned To A High Standard  The Toilet Was Dirty  And No Soap Or Bath Gel Was Provided I Had To Call For That  That Attention To Detail Was Poor Considering The Cost Of The Room  It Was Not A Primer Inn .
column39: Bath Dirty  Toilet Dirty  And No Toiletries Provided. I Had To Call Reception For The Above.

column31: Tranquil  Relaxing  Our Only Fault Was Having To Wait 30 Mins For Our Table That We Had Pre-Booked For 830  We Couldn't Be Seated Till 9Pm Making It Quite Late And We Was Not Offered A Complementary Drink Which Would Have Been Nice Considering The Length Of Time We Had To Wait.Just Told To Wait In The Bar Area.  Otherwise An Enjoyable Stay. Loved The Spa Treatments But They Had Run Out Of Slippers So We Had To Walk About Barefoot Between Services. Its The Little Touches That Do Always Make A Difference. Would Have Been Nice To Have Been Able To Make A Drink In Our Room Too.

column31: We Had An Executive Room And It Was Great. Had An Issue With Housekeeping But It Was Cleared Up. The Only Downside Is The Food. The Restaurant Food Is Simply Not Good Enough For What You Are Charging. I Get Better Food At My Local Gastro Pub In London. Steak Was Under Seasoned  Chips Were Powdery And Tasteless  Broccoli Dissolved In My Mouth  I Could Go On.   I Would Definitely Come Back But Would Choose To Eat Only In The Brasserie  I Had Better Service  Better Food  Etc. Also I Thought The Choice Of Wine By The Glass Was Poor. Small Selection Of Mostly Average To Bad Wines.   Don't Get Me Wrong  There Is Lots Good At Sopwell House And I Would Definitely Return But A Real Shame As It Could Be So Much Better.
Great Experience!  Lovely Accommodations!  Wish I Had Had More Time To Enjoy Everything Your Facility Has To Offer.
Good Location & Facilities. Very Good Quality Food And Drink. Spa And Pool Are Excellent. Staff Were All Exceptional And Added To The Pleasure Of The Stay.

Wonderful Hotel  Brilliant Staff And Food. However  Misunderstanding On A Disability Accessible Room Meant That We Stayed One Night Only
column39: I Stayed In The Mews Room 9 The Hotel Disabled Rooms Had Been Booked And Was Offered The Above Room As A Room That A Disabled Person Could Use. The Shower Had A Hughe Step Not A Small Step  And The Wc Is Tucked Behing The Door  And The Doorway Too Small For Wheelchair Access. Therefore Agree The Room Is Big Enough But The Toilet Would Be Impossible To Use For Paraplegic Wheelchair Guests
