column90: I Was Disappointed With My Stay Not With The Hotel Or Staff  But That My Room Did Not Match My Needs. I Am Suprised That I Paid The Bill  Happy To Have Paid For The Food And Beverages  But I Was In Such Pain That All I Wanted To Do Was To Get Home. Duty Manager Tried To Make Things Right But The Fact Is The Hotel Got It Totally Wrong.

column31: Very Nice But Not Exceptional. Extremely Disappointing Room This Time.
column35: Very Busy At Check-In  Had To Wait Ages (Massive Queue Going All Round Reception)
column39: 141 - A Pull-Down Double Bed For 2 People At Full Price? Very Uncomfortable Because My Husband Is 6'4" Tall - Double Beds Are Hopeless For Him. I Didn't Complain At The Time Because I Could See The Hotel Was Fully Booked But My Single Friend Was Given A Room With A Kingsize Bed - Don't You Check The Number Of Occupants When Assigning Rooms? Also  The Rooms Was Very Cold  It Had Obviously Not Been Occupied For Some Time.
column53: It Would Be Nice To Have Porridge
column64: The Service Started Off Being Very Slow (No Drinks Offered On Arrival) But Improved As The Evening Went On. Drinks Were Very Expensive.
column84: Fabiola Perez Took Ownership When I Checked Out Regarding My Issues With The Room We Stayed In. She Emailed Me To Follow Up And Has Offered A Complimentary Upgrade. It's A Nice Offer But I Don't Think It Really Recompenses My Husband And I For A Very Poor Night's Sleep. However  Very Happy With Fabiola's Service And Attitude - She's A Credit To You.
column89: Just The Points Mentioned Earlier
column90: I Emailed Fabiola Perez Back To Ask About Availability Of Lazy Sunday Deals On March 23Rd - I Am Considering Having My Birthday Celebration With You (With Probably About 20 Guests). Haven't Heard Back Yet.

column31: Appalling - Horrifying
column35: This Was A Disaster - Reservations Were Extraordinarily Unhelpful - No One Except Nicolette Knew Anything About The Christmas Package And She Was Never There - I Was Very Worried Before I Arrived - The Room Was Badly Prepared In A Much Lower Standard Than A Normal B And B And Crucially The Welcome Scroll Explaining The Christmas Activities Was Never Given To Me Until After Everything Went Wrong  And Rather Than Helping Me  Or Trying To Find Constructive Solutions This Was Accompanied By Endless Sterile And Unprofessional Arguments That Somehow The Hotel Had Not Made A Mistake In A Preoccupation With Your Profits Rather Than Value Or The Well-Being Of Guests. Also The Reception Desk Staff Knew Nothing Either About The Christmas Package - It Was Incredible
column39: This Was Mews 10. The Room Was So Shabby And In Need Of Refurbishment That It Would Be Difficult To Keep Clean. The Heating Was Completely Inadequate And Old And At One Point Broke Down Briefly. It Was Badly Secured To The Wall With Loose Screws Which Looked Dangerous. I Had To Ask For Two Radiators And Many Extra Blankets. There Were No Towel Rails Or Hooks In The Bathroom Which Also Had No Heated Towel Rail  Making It Very Cold. It Took Ages To Heat The Bathroom With The Inadequate Manual Heater. There Was A Problem With The Bath Taps Which Were Old And Broken So It Was Difficult To Turn On The Water. The Bed Was Not Finished And I Had To Finish Putting A Pillow In A Pillow Case. There Were No Brochures Laid Out - I Found The Main One For The Hotel In An Obscure Drawer Two Days Later - The Christmas Scroll Was Crucially Missing - And The Smaller Brochures Were Old And Dog-Eared And Not Laid Out. It Poured With Rain For Most Of The Stay And There Were Big Leaks Over The Door So Spouts Of Water Poured Down As You Stood By The Door Trying To Open It  So That You Got Soaked And This Could Have Made An Older Person Ill. Incredibly The Wi Fi Gradually Ran Out Like An Old-Fashioned Meter - This Was The Thing My Friends Found So Unbelievable. When I Raised Some Of These Points With Vince He Said (Clearly With The Greatest Sincerity  As If Scarily He Had Been Brain-Washed Into Nonsensical Beliefs) That I Should Have Called Hotel Maintenance To Have Hooks Put On The Doors - He Didn't Seem To Realise That It Is The Hotel's Responsibility To Provide An Adequately Equipped Room  Not A Guest's Responsibility
column48: Although Some Deliveries Were Ok In General This Was Also Appalling - Even When Vince Stepped In To Try And Improve It - What Was Worse Was That Even His Requests Were Flouted And Ignored. Meals Were Delivered Absolutely Stone Cold Or Badly And Resentfully  Or In Direct Contravention To Precise Instructions. It Was A Nightmare And Very Scary And Was The Key Reason I Never Risked Going Back To The Hotel. I Actually Felt Frightened About Being Alone As A Woman  As The Room Service Was Always Delivered By Men  Never Women  And It Was Not Always Clear That They Were Not Drunk.
column64: This Was An Absolute Nightmare - Once The Scroll Had Not Been Delivered And Incredibly I Had Not Been Told That A Dinner Dance On Christmas Eve Was Compulsory For A Single Guest (I Had Assumed The Dinner Would Take Place In A Different Room From The Dance Floor)  With No Option Of Not Attending It (Although If I Had Realised Beforehand  There Would Have Been A Chance Of Finding A Sensible Solution) And I Had Lost Any Opportunity Of Meeting Guests Before Christmas Day (As None Of The Guests In The Spa Were On The Christmas Package) Raising The Real Risk Of Not Being Able To Participate In The Christmas Package At All As A Single Person  Which Was What Eventually Happened. There Was Never At Any Point The Slightest Attempt To Make Sure I Received The Expensive Meals I Had Paid For. The Only Attempt Was On Christmas Eve Where I Had A Miserable Late Meal In The Brasserie  Served Cold And Unappetising  With Peter Unnecessarily Giving What He Later Described As 'Butler Service' Which I Did Not Want And Did Not Request  When There Was A Perfectly Good Maitre D' Standing Doing Nothing
column77: All The Spa Treatments Were Booked Up Prior To The Christmas Package - Another Sign Of The Complete Lack Of Any Help From The Reservations Department
column83: The Service Was Staggeringly - Unbelievably  Scarily - Incompetent. It Seemed That Not A Single Person In The Whole Hotel Had Read The Christmas Brochure. Most Incredibly  On Several Occasions (Including Even From Reservations) I Was Asked As A Guest By Staff For Basic Information About The Hotel As If I Would Be More Informed Than They  And As If This Was Normal. The Reception Desk Staff Knew Nothing About Midnight Mass At The Cathedral  And Nothing About The Carol Concert (Which I Assumed From The Description In The Christmas Brochure Would Be An Operatic Selection). The Time On The Brochure Was Completely Wrong For The Mass As By The Time I Arrived There (With A Guest Not On The Christmas Package) There Was Standing Room Only And There Was No Option Of Exploring The Cathedral Which Would Have Been Possible If We Had Been Advised To Arrive Much Earlier. We Were Also Cheated By The Taxi Driver. It Was As If The Hotel Had Never Had A Christmas Package Before And Had Never Had A Single Guest At Christmas Before. The Sensible Solution Would Have Been For Peter The Manager To Look At The Guest List And Introduce Me To Other Single Guests (Such As A Mother And Daughter Who Reservations Had Told Me About  Although They Sensibly Might Have Cancelled) - This Was Never Suggested Or Tried.
column84: Once The Situation Was Completely Out Of Control And Beyond Recall On Boxing Day  When I Had Lost The Whole Of The Christmas Package And All The Hotel Did Was Argue That It Had Never Made Any Mistakes (Clearly Only Concerned About Not Losing Money) Vince Did His Utmost To Turn The Situation Around With Extraordinary Sincerity And Kindness - But Since His Values Were Completely At Variance With The Ruthless Values Of Peter And The Hotel - It Was Worrying Dealing With Vince As He Had Been So Naively Brainwashed By The Hotel  Like So Many Trusting Well-Intentioned People Who Are Unable To Comprehend The Ruthless Callousness Of Commercialism. He Presented A Nonsensical Position That The Hotel Was So Eager To Please Guests That I Could Have Requested Maintenance To Put A Hook On The Bathroom Door - I Was So Shocked By His Ingenuousness That I Didn't Bother To Contest This  As I Have Seen People Made Ill When They Discover Their Values Are So At Variance With The Grim Realities Of Real Life
column89: At Every Stage Sensible Steps Could Have Been Taken To Turn This Situation Around  As I Am A Realistic Tolerant Person. However As The Sole Preoccupation Was With Justifying The Hotel's Position So As Not To Lose Money  There Was Never Any Possibility Of This
column90: The Check Out Was As Callous And Insensitive As The Rest Of The Stay - Gita  The Manager  Pretended Nothing Had Happened And Even Charged Me Even Though I Had Had No Value For The Stay - I Was So Exhausted And Upset And So Convinced By The Ruthlessness Of The Hotel That It Didn't Occur To Me That I Could Have Refused To Sign The Bill For The Relatively Low Amount Outstanding  Otherwise I Would Have Refused. Although I Had Told Her Twice What Time I Was Leaving Which Was Half An Hour After She Came To Do The Check-Out  She Appeared To Have Forgotten This  And Offered Me Help Then And There With A Hotel Member Of Staff She Had Brought With Her. By Then I Had Lost All Confidence In The Hotel's Ability To Organise Anything So I Was Given No Help Half An Hour Later When My Taxi Arrived

column31: Fantastic. Felt Like Royalty.
column35: Again Fantastic. All Staff Were Warm  Welcoming And Efficient. Particularly The Lady That Managed Our Check In. The Gentleman Called Vince Or Vincent (I Believe) Was Fantastic. Nothing Too Difficult.
column53: Fantastic. Nothing More To Be Said. Contiue Doing What You Are Doing.

column84: Usa In The Brasserie  She Was Extremely Lovely  Made The Whole Family Feel Welcome And Included. And Gave A Very Professional  Service.
column89: I'd Booked Sopwell House As A Surprise For A Family Members Birthday. On Booking I'd Requested If We Could Have Access To Their Room Early To Dress It (Balloons  Photos  Banners  Birthday Cake  Champagne  Us Waiting To Surprise Them  You Get The Idea) We Were Told It Should Be Fine.  A Few Days Before We Arrived I Called And Checked Again  They Said It Would Be Fine.  We Arrived Bright And Early On The Saturday Morning  Well Aware Of The Official Check In Time At 3Pm  But With The Knowledge We'd Been Told They Would Ensure The Room Would Be Ready Earlier. Very Kindly Our Own Room Was Offered To Us But We Did Clarify It Was Their Room We Really Needed Access Too And We Were Told It Was Put On Priority For Cleaning.  Time Passed And Each Time I Checked With Reception We Had To Re Explain 3 Times As The Team Behind The Counter Kept Changing. Alas We Only Just About Managed To Get Into The Room 15 Mins Before They Arrived And Had To Rush Like Crazy To Get Everything Into Place.  I Understand It's A Huge Hotel  And Takes Time To Prepare The Rooms But I Do Feel Enough Notification Was Given  It In Fact Proved Quite Stressful To Get In To Prep The Room Just Before The Guests Arrived.
column90: The Brasserie Was  Booked For Dinner Over The Telephone. I Called To Double Check The Booking A Few Days Before We Arrived. Yet On Arrival For Dinner We Were Told The Booking Was In The Restaurant. We Had Definitely Requested The Brasserie. We Were Switched To The Brasserie Easily  It's A Small Thing But It's Things Like This That Make It Seem Less Efficient.

column31: Very Good Everything Was Great Apart From Not Being Informed Prior To Our Visit That The Bar Area Was Going To Be Closed.

column39: 117  Is A Charming Room   With Comfortable Armchairs And An Impressive Bed  A Little Too High For My Height And Muscle Strength....But I Slept Well. All My Room Service Meals Were Delicious....And That Was My Real Need During My Stay.
column64: I Used The Brasserie For Breakfast...But That Was Disappointing.I Drink Real Fresh Coffee At Home And Make In A Cafetiere....You Don't Provide Real Coffee. I Don't Enjoy Buffet Food  And Am Used To Ordering Freshly Cooked Breakfast...That Aspect Puts Me Off A Return Visit.

column64: The Food Was To A Good Standard   However We Had To Wait At Least 15 Minutes To Be Offered A Drink.  At This Point We Had Already Chosen Our Meal Choice.  Once We Had Finished Our Main Course The Manager Cleared Our Plates Approximately 10 Minutes After We Had Finished.  We Then Waited 30 Minutes To Be Offered Another Drink And The Choice Of Desserts  At This Point We Decided To Leave And Get A Drink And A Dessert Elsewhere.  We Felt Completely Unattended And Stated This To The Manager.  I Would Like To Note That Although Rose Was Doing A Fantastic Job The Manager Came And Undermined Her Which I Found Very Unfair And Inappropriate In Front Of Guests.

column31: We Came To The Hotel As We Were Attending My Cousins Daughters Christening On The 28Th December (Tony & Caroline)  We Checked In And Were Shown To Our Room But Had To Head Straight Down To The Ceremony So Didn’T Go Back To The Room Until Late In The Evening.  We Woke Up And Went For Breakfast And Went To Reception At 11Am To Check Out. We Then Headed To The Spa To Be Told We Were Not Allowed In As We Had A 2 Year Old And Swimming Had Finished!  At No Point Were We Told There Were Time Restrictions On The Swimming (At Check In  Or At Breakfast)  So We Had Not Showered Due To The Fact We Were Planning On Using The Spa Facilities.  I Asked At Reception And The Same Lady Was There Who Checked Us In Apologised As She Said She Should Have Told Us About The Restrictions.  The Front Of House Duty Manager Then Told Us We Could Go Into The Pool But We May Be Asked To Leave If Our Daughter Was To Loud And Disruptive As We Would Probably Get Complaints From The Other Guests!!  We Declined This  As We Were Not Prepared To Go In Only Be Told To Leave Again! Our Daughter Had Her Swimming Costume On So We Had To Deal With Her Being Extremely Upset As We Had Told Her We Were Going Swimming. We Then Went Into The Spa To Get Her Changed And Went Straight Home To Shower Which Is Not What You Expect When You Have Stayed In A Nice Hotel – You Want To Use The Facilities.  For A ‘Spa’ Hotel This Is Completely Unacceptable As We Had Planned To Use The Facilities And If We Had Been Told There Was A Time Restriction We Would Have Gone Swimming Straight After Breakfast! We Paid A Lot Of Money For A Room That Small And Dark And Could Not Use Your Facilities. My Cousin Paid A Lot Of Money For The Christening And I’M Very Disappointed Your Hotel Acted In This Way.

column90: Thank You  I Can't Wait To Come Back

column31: It Was Good For A "Normal" Hotel But Was Missing Many Of The Touches Which Would Elevate It To A "Top" Hotel.  For Example: Turndown Service  Selection Of Toiletries In Bathroom  Choice Of Teas In Room And At Breakfast  Fridge/Minibar In Room  Pool/Spa Was Small For Number Of Residents  Little Information On Local Area And Activities.  It Wasn't Worth The Price Of The Stay.
column35: Too Many Staff In Reception Apologising For Delay  And Not Enough Staff Actually Operating Check-In.  Reception Staff Didn't Volunteer Basic Information (E.G. Location And Timing Of Breakfast) And Had To Be Asked.
column39: 102.  Expect Body Lotion As Part Of Toiletries Provided.  Door Didn't Close Easily - Required Double-Checking That Self-Closer Had Actually Worked.
column53: Found It Rather Informal That Bathrobes Were Condoned At Breakfast And Undermined The Attempted Refinement Of The Hotel.  Few Vegetarian Options  And No Alternative To Cow's Milk.
column77: Way Too Small For The Number Of Rooms.  Impossible To Swim Lengths Due To Number Of People And Children In Pool.  No Available Seats / Loungers And Had To Wait To Use Spa Pool And Steam Room.  Several Young Children Were Using Spa Pool Despite Sign Specifically Saying Age Limit Of 12.
column90: Should Either Aim To Be Top Spa Hotel And Charge Accordingly  Or Reduce Prices To Comparable To Regular Out Of Town Hotel.  Currently Prices And Ambition Don't Match Reality For A Luxury Hotel.

column1: - Comfort: Wife Very Happy; I'm Not Keen On Squashy Pillows But Didn't Have The Energy To Go Hunting For Any Firmer Ones.

Also Expected To Be Invited/Taken Through To The Restaurant At 7 Rather Than Find Our Own Way There (Which We Decided To Do ~7.20 Once Nothing Had Happened).

- Restaurant Food And Atmosphere Was Great. Slight Confusion With The Wine Though - The Menu Said "Wine With Each Course Chosen By The Sommelier" But We Were Asked To Choose Our Own Each Time And Weren't Sure What Was Included In The Price And What Wasn't.
- Coffee Back In The Cocktail Lounge Was Great And Everyone Knew What Was Going On By Then :)
- A Very Enjoyable And Tasty Evening  But Not Quite The Overall Package That We Thought We Had Paid For.

column39: The Double Room Which I Booked Came With Twin Beds With A Gap Between Them. There Were Marks On The Table And Stains In The Bath And Toilet. I Went On Valentines Day  Spent Nearly £400 In Total (For The Room And Restaurant) And Both My Partner And I Were Not Impressed With The Facilities.
column64: We Pre-Ordered Our Meals Before Arrival But Did Not Get What We Ordered (Deserts Were Both Wrong). The Food Was Ok But Not What We Expected. We Could Only Get A Table For 9.30  But Were Still Promised A Romantic Evening (£185 Per Couple) But There Was No 'Harp' Or 'Live Music' Only Some Very Loud And Annoying Jazz Music. I Felt That All The Staff Wanted To Get Home By This Time And That Everything Was Very Rushed. Tables Were Being Set Up For Breakfast Around Us While We Were Still Eating Our Mains. I Wasn't Allowed To Charge The Drinks To My Room So Had To Go Back To The Room And Return With Cash. I Recently Visited Wybosten Lakes Spa With Friends And Have To Say That I Would Favour The Spa There Over Sopwell House  As The Wybosten Lakes Spa Had A Wonderful Quiet  Relaxed Atmosphere Which Unfortunately Sopwell House Did Not. I Had To Ask For Our Complimentary Champagne & Canapes And Then Were Served 5 Minutes Prior To Going In For Our Meal.  Despite Checking The Menu Prior To Making The Reservation That We Be Served A Meal With No Prawns As My Husband Is Allergic The Canapés Had Prawns On.
column77: I Understand That You Had Some Building Works Going On At The Time   So We Were Shown To A Different Waiting Area  Fully Clothed  We Were Then Presented With Dressing Gowns And Slippers But Nowhere To Change It To Them As We Explained To The Lady We Had Already Checked Out Of Our Room.  My Actual Massage Which Was Done By A Girl Called "Symonne" Was Great However The Fact That I Could Hear The Drilling And Works Going On Over The Tranquil Music Playing Did Not Make For A Very Relaxing Experience.
column83: I Just Feel That Overall Especially The Service In The Bar Was Really Poor.  We Decided To Have Another Drink After Our Meal  Which We Ended Up Getting Up From The Table  As The Bill Never Came Even Though We Asked For It Twice And When We Did Go Up To The Hostess Stand It Had Items On There That We Didn't Order  Sat Down At A Table Was Going To Receive Waitress Service But Decided To Sit At The Bar And Again Waited Far Too Long To Be Served Then Far Too Long For Our Drinks To Be Made.  I Appreciate That A Good Cocktail Will Take Longer To Make Than To Pour A Glass Of Wine  However!

column31: I Understand That The Spa Weekends Is Great Business For You Over Weekends.  I Really Get That.

column1: However  When Your Hotel Is Packed Full Of Spa Weekend Guests The Atmosphere Is Not What I Would Expect At All From A Calibre Of Hotel Such As Sopwell Park.
The Number Of Guests Shuffling Around In White Bathrobes And Slippers  Especially In The Brasserie On Sunday Morning Gave The Hotel An Air Of "One Flew Over The Cuckoos Nest'.

Saturday Night In The Same Brasserie Was Interesting.  We Couldnt Help But Notice That The Customer Base Was Massively Dominated By Women  And The Noise Level That Accompanied That Was Substantial.  But Then I Understand That There Were Two 'Hen Parties' In The Brasserie That Night  Including One That Had The Prospective Bride Dressed Up In The Customary Barbie Pink Sash And Tiara.  While The Silver Mini Skirts And Skin Tight Dresses Favoured By Her Guests Made Us Question Whether We Had Taken A Wrong Turn And Were In A Romford Nightclub.
We Didnt Eat In The Restaurant Because We Felt That We Were Underdressed As We Were Wearing Jeans - Smart Jeans - But Jeans None The Less.  I Obviously Made A Misjudgement There.

The Staff Were Great.  I Would Say That Your Staff Are What I Would Expect From A 5 Star Hotel.  Its Your Guests That Are The Problem And My Background In Luxury Hotel Sales Tells Me That Its Your Spa Weekend Breaks That Are Attracting Them.

All In All I Spent Just Over £500 On A One Night Stay On Saturday Night.  A Not Unsubstantial Amount Of Money.  And I Spent My Evening Experiencing An Atmosphere That I Could Have Had For £40 In The Brighton Branch Pizza Express.  The Suite We Stayed In Was Lovely.  I Just Wished We Had Stayed In It And Ordered Room Service.

column1: Check-In Was Not Smooth. I Was Told That I Could Either Pay Immediately On My Debit Card Or Use My Credit Card To Guarantee The Booking. Never Before Have I Had To Make That Choice In A Hotel  Especially As I Made The Booking Online With My Debit Card. Then I Was Asked Whether I Would Like To Credit £100 To My Room. I Was Then Told I Could Alternatively Choose To Charge To My Room As I Go  So I Couldn't Understand Why People Would Do That. When I Did Eventually Use Room Service It Was Insisted I Could Not Charge To My Room And Had To Pay Cash. This Happened Twice Until I Had To Check With Reception  And Then When I Next Used Room Service I Had To Insist I Could Charge To My Room Before I Could Order.

column48: We Ordered Room Service And Although We Ordered 2 Sandwiches Just One Came With Both Orders Of Chips. Fine  We Asked For Another And It Was Delivered Not Long After. However  The Really Nice (Smiley) Waiter Said That The Meal Was On Them Because Of The Mix Up And To Have A Happy Birthday. My Friend (Who Was Going To Treat Me To That Meal) Said 'The Whole Thing?' And The Bloke Said Yes And Smiled. We Were Gobsmacked; We Certainly Never Expected That. I Was Charged At Check Out For That Meal In The End Though Which I Wasn't Happy About. A Manager Was Called Out And After Explaining The Situation I Only Ended Up Paying For Some Of The Meal Which Was Very Nice. I Was Apparently Suppose To Receive A Birthday Platter Of Some Sort But Never Did. That Was Fine Because I Didn't Know About It Anyways. We Were Also Charged For Drinks From The Bar When We Didn't Drink In There (We Did However Go In For 2 Cokes And 2 Diet Cokes To Take Away And Paid By Cash). That Was Handled As Well But I'm Not Sure How We Were Billed To Begin With. Someone Else Charged Their Drinks To My Room? I Don't Know But It Was All A Bit Embarrassing.

column90: My Company Regularly Books Rooms At Sopwell House And Has Done So For Over 10 Years.  My Colleague Booked A Room On A £15 Reduced Rate Which It Transpired Was Non-Transferable/Refundable.  However I Was Detained On The Date Of My Arrival And A Request Was Made To Change The Booking To The Next Night So I Didn't Have To Travel Late Into The Night.  This Request Was Denied  And Moreover  I Was Informed That If I Did Change  There Would Be A Charge Of £50.00 To Change The Booking.  My Colleague Had Explained That We Were Regular Users But To No Avail.  It Is Disappointing That  As Long Term Customers  There Was No Room To Accommodate Our Very Reasonable Request.  So Much So That We Did Consider Finding Another Hotel To Use For Our Travellers.  In The End I Had To Travel Over 200 Miles And Arrive At Nearly Midnight Very Tired  When I Could  With A Little Extra Help From The Hotel  Have Travelled The Next Morning And Had A Much More Relaxing Stay.

column53: Breakfast Overall Was Good  Choice Was Plentiful  Availability Of Items Was Good And Staff Were Very Polite. However Service Was Difficult To Get  Offers Of Coffee And Toast Were Not Given As Soon As We Were Seated Or Even Soon After. We Had To Chase Staff Down For This. They Were Very Polite Once We Got Hold Of Them Though. Service Did Seem Relatively Hectic And There Was No Routine To Clearing Tables Etc. I Thought The Food Offering Could Have Been Improved If There Was Some More Local Produce. Quality Was Ok But It Didn't Seem Outstanding. On The Sunday The Room Was Very Busy And We Did Have To Wait For A While To Be Seated. The Room Did Feel Too Small To Accommodate Everyone.
column64: The Main Issue With The Restaurant Is The Prices. With The Level Of Pricing I.E. 2 Star Michelin Level  You Set Expectations Very High For Service And Food. Unfortunately The Experience Didn't Come Near This Level And That Left Me With A Feeling Of Being Being Duped. The Service Was Polite And Relatively Quick But It Was Not Personal  We Had Different Staff At Every Visit To The Table. When We Did Complain There Was No Real Effort To Understand Why Or Go Out Of Their Way To Understand What The Problem Was. Overall It Felt Like The Staff Were Inexperienced. The Food Arrived Worryingly Quickly After We Ordered It  Which Made Us Feel Like We Were Being Rushed. Our Starters Were Luke Warm As If They Had Been Pre-Prepared. One Was So Cold We Sent It Back. The Replacement Was Warmer But The Meat Element Had Suffered From Over Cooking. They Looked Stunning And At Over £12 They Should Do. Unfortunately They Did Not Deliver On Flavour. They Lacked Seasoning And A Depth Of Flavour That I Expect For Something Priced At This Level. Our Main Courses Were Better In Flavour Terms  But Not Stunning Which They Should Be For £30 Each. Again We Felt Rushed And When A Large Party Arrived At 9Pm It Became Clear Why We Were Being Hurried. I Could Accept All Of These Faults At Half The Price  But At This Level It Felt Way Over Priced.
column77: Facilities Were Very Good  Even Though They Were Busy.
column83: I Wouldn't Call It An Issue But The Impersonal Service In The Restaurant Was A Let Down For This Level Of Hotel And Price.
column90: The Hotel Fell Below Expectations Mainly Because Of The Price. I Don't Mind Paying These Prices If It Is Worth It. But The Food Element Fell Well Below The Expectation  The Hotel Was Dated In Parts (Although It Was Clearly Being Updated) And The Executive Room Didn't Really Feel Like It Was Worth Paying The Extra Amount For It.

Sopwell House Is Beautiful! This Was Our First Visit  My Friend Kerry Stayed With You And Told Me How Lovely It Was So My Sister In Law Tania And I Decided To Stay With You And Treat Ourselves To A Relaxing 2 Night Break! Overall We Really Enjoyed Our Stay  Few Things We Were A Bit Dissapointed With  Firstly Because We Stayed Two Nights With The Package Our Meals Were Included  But The Menu For Dinner Was The Same For The Both Nights  Unfortunatly We Only Liked One Thing On The Menu So We Had The Same Dinner Both Evenings  Also We Had To Keep Asking For Drinks As We Were Just Shown To Our Table Then Left!! The Spa Was Really Lovely  Treatments Too  Really Nice Pool Area And Afternoon Tea In The Cocktail Lounge Was Devine!! But Also When I Booked On Line I Upgraded Our Room And Called To Ask For Two Separate Beds And Was Told That Would Be Fine But On Check In We Found A Double Bed Made Up So We Had To Wait For The Maid To Come In And Change It Into Two Separate Beds  This Could Have Been Avoided :0( All In All We Really Enjoyed Our Stay And Are Thinking Of Rebooking Soon

column6: As We Had Booked Our Spa Break In Advance It Would Have Been Extremely Helpful If We Had Robes & Slippers In Our Room  So We Could Relax And Make Our Way To The Spa Ready For Our Treatments. column2: Re Above : What Actually Happened For Us Was That We Left Our Room Laden With Bits And Pieces As We Did Not Know What To Expect. We Went Though A Door That We Believed To Be The Spa Treatment Area (Seeing Other Ladies Going To & Fro In Their Robes) Up Some Stairs To Be Greeted By Spa Staff  And Led Into A Room With Other Guests Waiting. They Were All Wearing Robes  So We Were The Odd Two Out. We Were Quickly Called To Our First Treatments. I Asked Corrine Why We Were Not Supplied With Robes Etc  She Fiirst Said Maybe Because We Were Not Having A Spa Day  I Said We Were Having That And Staying Overnight Too! She Went Out Of Her Way At End Of Treatment To Kindly Supply Us With Robes Etc. Apparently We Should Have Gone To Spa Reception Which We Did Not Even Know Existed. This Was To Be A Relaxing Spa Treat For My Mum  So It Was A Little Uncomfortable For Her (And Me) Carrying Around Clothes And Things Until We Found The Lockers. (Hence Robes Etc In Room).

column1: I 'M Sure I Read That The Spa Rooms Would Have Been Finished For Our Stay On 20Th March. Our Treatments And The Made Up Guest Rooms Were Very Good But I Had To Ask For The 2X £5 Discount On Final Payment.

column31: Very Poor. From The Tiny Room With A Very Very Small Bathroom (Without A Bath - Even Though Your Website Advises All Rooms Have A Bath?) The Treatments Were Good But The Heat In The Pool Area Was Unbearable And The Service In The Brasserie Was Laughable All The Way From The General Waiting Staff To The Manager.
column35: We Had A Voucher For The Friday Night Break And I Have Emailed The Code Though On Booking But Had Lef Thte Voucher At Home. The Girl Who Booked Us In Advised She Would Need To Check With Her Supervisor About This And Come Back To Us. We Heard Nothing  But Then On Check Out The Same Girl Presented Us The Bill Including The Full Spa Break. On Mentioning This She Said She Would Have To Check With A Supervisor (!?) And We Were Told We Would Be Charged The Full Amount And On Presenting The Voucher We Would Be Refunded. I Turned Up A Few Days Late And Was Left Waiting For Quite A While At The Desk While The Girl Went To Check.........
column39: Very Dusty Room. I Have A Picture Of The Glass Table In Our Room That Would Appear Not To Have Been Cleaned For Days. As Said Before - Very Small Room And The Bathroom Was Far Too Small. My Wife Couldn't Find The Flush Button For The Toilet - It Is Under The Sink - Crazy.
column53: Breakfast Very Good.
column64: We Were Shown To Our Table And Asked What Water We Required. The Menus Were Given To Us And Immediately We Were Asked What We Wanted!? We Asked For A Few Minutes To View The Menu  Also Expecting To Be Asked For A Drinks Order. The Waiter Reappeared And We Had To Ask For A Bottle Of Wine And He Took Our Order. Within 90 Seconds Our Starter Appeared.......! On Finishing This We Asked For A 10 Minute Break And Our Main Course Arrived Within 5 Minutes. I Have Never Felt So Rushed In A Restaurant.  We Found Ourselves Not Wanting To Put Down Our Cutlery In Case The Plates Were Taken! We Had Finished The Bottle Of Wine And Were Contemplating Another To Take Through To The Lounge When A Waiter Appeared And Whisked Our Ice Bucket Away And Deposited It At Another Table! Not A Word Said About Ordering Anything Else! We Mentined This To Another Waiter Who Eventually Sent The Manager Over Who Enquired If We Were Staying Another Night? We Advised No And Asked Why He Had Asked This And He Said If We Were We Should Consider Eating At The Fine Dining Restaurant..!?? We  Obviously Incorrectly Thought That A Brasserie At A Four Star Restuarant Would Be A More Relaxing Expereince Then A Fast Food Restaurant - But To Be Honest I Have Had Far More Relaxing Meals With My Children At Mcdonalds.
column77: Hot Hot Hot. Unberably So. Everyone Was Mentioning It - Lasted 15 Minutes Then Had To Escape. Relaxing? Far From It. Plus Not Enough Loungers / Chairs For The Amount Of People Crammed In. I Guess Would Be Fine In The Summer If The Patios Are Available But In March  Not An Option.
column83: See Check In  Dining Comments.
column90: I Feel That You Let Yoursleves Down In Areas That Should Be The Most Basic To Offer A First Class Customer Experience - A Relaxing Dinner Is Not Difficult To Provide  A Smoth Check In  Even Without The Voucher Shouldn't Have Been So Difficult To Control (I Douby I Am The First To Forget The Voucher.) Rooms Should Have A Bath Or If Not This Should Be Mentioned. The Heat In The Pool Area Again Shoyuld Be Easy To Rectify And Finally I Begrudge Being Asked To Leave A Gratuity For Drinks When A Non-Disclosed 10% Fee Is Added! But I Guess This Is The Norm These Days. I Am Prepared To Discuss All Of My Comments With You Should You Wish - Chirs@Fncgeneral.Com Or 07507605745

column31: Very Disappointing. The Hotel Is Held Out As Being A Premium Hotel But The Level Of Service Fell Far Below What I Would Have Expected. On The Saturday I Wanted To Have A Drink In The Cocktail Bar  The Conservatory Bar Or Outside. I Could Not Find A Spare Seat Anywhere Due To The Amount Of People There For Afternoon Tea. For A Resident To Not Be Able To Find A Seat Anywhere In The Hotel Is Not Acceptable. After 30 Minutes Of Waiting I Eventually Found A Two Chairs For Myself And My Partner. It Then Took A Further 45 Minutes To Be Served And Have A Coffee Brought To Me.

column1: At Dinner That Evening In The Brasserie The Service Was Similarly Poor. The Staff Were Inattentive And I Had To Get Up To Find Someone To Ask For Drinks To Be Brought. Also  My Food Arrived And Was Not What I Had Ordered. It Was Not Taken Away And Took A Further 10 Minutes For My Correct Order To Arrive  All The While My Partner's Food Was Left On The Table Getting Cold.

All In All  The Service Was Very Poor And If Sopwell House Wants To Market Itself As More Of A Destination For Afternoon  With No Regard For Making Allowance For Residents To Be Able To Even Find Somewhere To Sit  Then This Should Be Made Much Clearer.
column5: I Was Assisted By A Trainee Receptionist Who  While Very Pleasant  Was Slow And Not Able To Answer Simple Questions. For Some Reason She Seemed To Have Very Little Oversight. I Came Back To The Reception A Couple Of Hours Later To Obtain The Information I Was Wanting.

column31: We Found All The Staff Very Helpful. Ellyn Hubble Was Always Very Understanding  Informative  Helpful And Professional In Her Dealings With Our Requirements For My Mother And Aunties Surprise Birthday Party. The Two Members Of Staff That Served Drinks And Food At The Party On Sunday Where Extremely Helpful  Polite  Kind  Understanding And Made The Whole Day Perfect. The Food Was Wonderful And Presented Well. Our Whole Stay Was Wonderful And My Mother And Aunt Have Not Stopped Talking About It For The Past Two Weeks.
column53: On Monday Morning There Was A Hairdressing Conference And They Where Rather Loud At Breakfast Time Which Made It Difficult To Have A Relaxing Breakfast Or Even Having A Conversation. Some Of The Waiters Appeared Rushed And Therefor Sounded Rude At Times.
column64: The Lighting Was Not Good As It Was Too Dark And We Could Not See The Menu Very Well
column83: Breakfast Staff Where Very Short And Rude At Times. The Waiter That Served Us Tea When We Arrived Did Not Use The Handles On The Jug But Put His Hands Around The Spout ( Hygiene)
column84: As Previously Mentioned Ellyn Hubble And The Two Staff Who Served Us On Sunday. All Brilliant

column31: Perfect  Thoroughly Enjoyable Experience  Room Was Beautiful  Dinner Was Lovely  I Would Recommend Sopwell House To All My Family And Friends. Made Anniversary Very Special.
column35: Very Friendly Welcome When We Arrived  We Were Also Given A Drink At Reception And Then Shown Around Before Being Shown To Our Room. Exceptional Service.
column39: Room 100 Was Beautiful And Made Our Stay So Memorable.
column53: Did Not Realise It Would Be Self Service Breakfast  We Were Near A Corner And Felt The Tables Very Close To Each Other.
column64: Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Dining Experience And Service Was Superb.

column89: No Had A Fabulous Overnight Stay.
column90: Will Be Back!

Fantastic Hotel And Fantastic Service.

column48: We Ordered Breakfast To Our Room At The Additional Cost Of £4 (Which Seems Like A Neither Here Or There Cost - Not Enough To Put People Off  But Enough To Make A Profit). It Arrived 45 Mins After Out Designated Time And Was Luke Warm. The Poached Eggs Were Solid!
column53: See Comment Before. The Bread Served With The Breakfast Was Supermarket-Value Service.
column64: The Staff Were Really Busy And Stressed And Got Our Order Wrong - We Ordered Two Cream Teas  And Ended Up With Two Pots Of Green Tea. We Waited About 40 Mins For Our Cream Teas.

column89: I Think Over-All The Service Could Be Improved.

column1: Although The Food Was Satisfactory  It Doesn't Quite Meet The Cost Acquainted With It.

column8: Other: Spa Weekend With A Friend
column31: My Friend And I Have Been Visiting Sopwell Every Year For Over 10 Years Now And Because Of Illness And The Fact That At Such Short Notice I Couldn't Change Our Booking (Because Of Unbendable Hotel Policy) My Husband Had To Come With Me Instead!  The Actual Visit Was Good But The Distress Caused By Being Unable To Rebook Wasn't!
column39: Could Do With More Breakfast Tea Sachets In Each Room
column90: Our Stay Was Great And Always Is But As A Long Standing Guest Of Many Years  I Was Extremely Disappointed That When My Friend That  Usually Comes With Me  Fell Ill The Night Before (With Gastroenteritis) You Were Unable To Do Anything For Us Except Quote Hotel Policy And Charge Us 50%! At One Point During The Phone Call I Was Told That My Friend Would Need To Go And Get A Doctor's Certificate!! I Know You Have To Have These Policies But Surely There Must Be Something Different For These Circumstances?  This Was The First Time In Over Ten Years Of Coming To Sopwell And We Felt Totally Let Down!

column31: We Booked A Deluxe Room And Other Than The Size Of The Bed There Didn't Seem To Be Anything Else Extra Than The Normal Rooms.
column39: 237 - The Bath Had Chips Along The Outside Which Had Gone Rusty And The Inside Of The Bath Had Brown Marks On It.  There Was An Extremely Small Shampoo And Conditioner But No Shower Gel.  I Asked At Reception And Was Given A Small Tube  However There Were Two Of Us In The Room So Not Really Enough.  When Paying For A Deluxe Room You Expect These Things To Be There And Enough For Everyone Staying.

column8: Other: A Treat For My Sister's Birthday
column31: An Absolute Haven - So Relaxing And A Very Special Place. The Staff Were Incredibly Welcoming And Helpful. They Made Us Feel Very Special. We Loved The Whole Stay From Start To Finish And We'll Definitely Be Back.

column53: No Comment

column31: The Staff  Food And Room Were All Excellent. The Bed Was Extremely Comfortable And We Slept Very Well. The Bar  Fine-Dining Room And Bistro Are Lovely And Nicely Decorated. However  The Hotel Has A Slightly Forgotten Air About It And Seems To Be Riding On A Tide Of Reputation From The Early And Mid 90'S. It's Time To Get Rid Of The Football Memorabilia  Develop A New Identity  Spend Some Money On The Grounds And Update The Garden. The Corridors Are All A Bit Oppressive. Low Ceilinged And Narrow. When It's Time For An Overhaul  Give This Some Attention If Possible.
column35: No
column39: No
column53: My Husband Requested French Toast. Unfortunately The Chef Didn't Know What It Was - He Got Pre-Sliced White Bread Toasted On One Side - He Had To Ask Three Times For It And The Syrup Was Definitely Not Maple Syrup. It Would Have Been Better If He'd Been Told From The Outset That It Wasn't On The Menu. Otherwise  The Breakfast Was Very Good.
column64: No
column77: Again The Corridor To The Complex Is Narrow And A Bit Like A Rabbit Warren - Something To Think About When The Building Is Next Overhauled.
column83: As Before  The French Toast At Breakfast Time
column84: Our Waiter For Our Evening Meal - He Was Excellent
column89: As Before - It's Building Itself And The Grounds That Didn't Meet With My Expectations.
column90: All The Ingredients Are There For A Truly Wonderful Hotel - Please Spend Some Cash And Update It!

column35: This Was Our Fourth Spa Weekend At Sopwell House On This Occasion We Didn't Recognise Any Of The Check In Assistants Service Was A Bit Slow We Normally Get Given A Free Room Upgrade I Asked If This Was Possible But Was Told That We Would Be Charged £150  So We Declined This Was A Shame As We Always Were Given One Even If It Was Just For One Of The Rooms.
column39: We Asked For Some More Body Lotion But Was Told There Wasn't Any.I Asked For Some More Hot Chocolate Sugar Coffee And Some Milk Sachets After About 20 Minutes Someone Came Up With Two Hot Chocolates And Two Coffees Already Made In Some Mugs I Explained That I Only Requested Sachets But He Said To Me That The Bill Was Only Just Over £9.00 But I Told Him That I Wasn't Prepared To Pay For It As I Didn't Order It So He Went Away.

column53: The Food Was All Excellent .
column64: On Arrival One If My Friend Ordered The Pate When This Arrived She Had What Looked Like A Whole Slab Of Pate But Only One Slice Of Toast This Wasn't Well Purpotioned We Thought So She Had To Ask For Some More Toast.

column1: Unfortunately There Was A Wedding Party In Room 210/211 Across From Us? So Very Noisy And Disturbed Night Of Sleep With Additional Noise From The Car Park Where People Were Also Smoking.  There Was An Old Lady Who Objected Us Being In The Swimming Pool Which She Said Was For Serious Swimmers And Members Only?  I Found This Bazaar Since We Were Guests.  I Brought It To The Attention Of A Lady (Jamaican/African Origin?) At Reception On The Day We Were Checking Out.
column5: There Was A Wedding Party So Understandably There Were Very Limited Parking Spaces But Eventually We Managed To Find One.

column90: Love Your Hotel And Cannot Wait To Return

column31: Our Experience This Time Was Nowhere As Good As It Was When We Visited 12 Years Ago.  We Had To Wait An Hour In Reception After Trying To Check In At 3:15 As Our Room Wasn't Ready.  Our Room (12) Was Reasonable But For Some Reason The Sofa Bed Was Made Up As A Third Bed  Even Though There Was Only Two Of Us So We Had To Remove The Bedding To Put It Back To A Sofa Again  In Order To Create More Space.  In Addition  There Was Spilt Tomato Ketchup On The Small  Table Which We Had To Wipe Away.  Later In The Evening  We Placed Our Breakfast Card Outside Of Our Room  But When We Checked In The Morning  It Was Still There.  We Called For Someone To Come And Collect It  But No-One Did.  We Called Again 20 Min Later  Someone Came And We Received Our Breakfast 45 Min Later  And Then Discovered We Had No Butter Or Marmalade.  We Appreciate The Hotel May Have Been Very Busy That Morning  However  The Service Was Not Good.  It Has Made Us Question Whether We Will Return  Which Is A Shame As Our Previous Experience Of The Hotel Was A Good One.  We Hope These Comments Will Be Of Use To You.
column35: Long Queue At Reception And Issues Re: Checking In  As Previously Mentioned.
column39: Pls See Previous Comments
column83: Please See Previous Comments.  I Feel The Staff Were As Helpful As They Could Have Been And Were Not Rude In Any Way  However  We Did Expect Better Service Overall.

column53: Female

column31: This Is The Second Time My Husband And I Have Stayed At Sopwell House And I Have To Say We Enjoyed Our First Visit More. It Was Very Busy On Saturday Night/Sunday Morning. The Spa Was Particularly Busy Late Sunday Morning; People Were Continuously Coming Into The Pool Area And There Was Nowhere For Them To Sit Or Really Even Leave Their Towels And Robes. One Group Of Ladies Spent An Hour In The Jacuzzi Totally Oblivious To Others Wanting To Get In. A Gentleman Fell Down The Wet Steps And Hurt His Back While We Were There. The Lady Cleaning At The Time Just Carried On Without Asking Him If He Was Ok! I Ended Up Leaving The Spa Earlier Than Intended Because It Had Become So Busy. We Extended Our Room So That I Could Get Ready For A Wedding I Was Attending In The Afternoon. On Three Separate Occasions The Cleaners And Concierge Knocked To See If Our Room Was Available. Each Time We Told Them We Had Extended Our Room But They Still Continued To Knock. We Would Stay At Sopwell Again But Would Definitely Book In A Quieter Period.
column64: The Staff Were Rushed Off Their Feet On Saturday Night. When Our Bill Arrived  We Explained That We Wanted It Added To Our Room. The Waitress Never Came Back! In The End We Gave Up Waiting And Sorted It Out With The Staff At The Restaurant Desk.
column77: Please See My Earlier Comments. The Spa Area Was Far Too Busy For Anyone To Really Enjoy. Many Beds Had Been Taken By Guests Who Were Not Even Using The Pool Area.
column89: Our Room Was On The Mezzanine Level And As There Was An Event In One Of The Room Downstairs On Sunday  We Did Not Have Access To Walking Down The Stairs. Instead We Had To Go Around The Houses To Get Back To Reception.

column31: Very Relaxing  I Visited During A Busy Weekend So It Was Very Difficult To Get A Lounger Which Was A Little Disappointing.
column35: Very Long Queues To Check In But The Service I Received At The Desk Was Excellent.
column48: A Larger Menu Would Be Good.
column53: Room Service Menu For Breakfast Is Limited Compared To Other Hotels.
column83: No Robe In Room But It Was Promptly Delivered With A Smile.

column31: Good Engagement With Staff But 2 Issues:

column1: 1) Guttering Above The Entrance To Room 10 In The Mews Was Completely Blocked Leading To A Waterfall In Front Of The Door When Gaining Entrance In The Rain On Monday 7Th April. This Did Not Seem To Be A Recent Blockage And Should Have Been Noticed And Rectified.

2) On-Line Booking System. I Use The System To Book With A Corporate Code As Advised By Yourselves. Every Time I Make A Booking I Have To Add My Address And Contact Details. Then  Every Time I Arrive At The Hotel I Have To Give All Of My Contact Details Again  Wasting Both My Time And Your Staff's. When Queried It Is Apparently Just The Way The Booking System Works. Given You Are Trying To Sell Yourselves As A High-End Location I Find It Somewhat Lazy And Unprofessional To Simply State That's The Way Your Own It System Works. Not Good Enough.
column64: Daniel

column31: When We Arrived I Thought Checking In Was Very Poor  We Were Not Shown Round  The Way Was Just Pointed Out  There Are Also No Signs Showing Where Anything Was  It Took Us A While To Find Where We Could Actually Sit And Have A Drink  However The Food Was Really Good And Spa Was Exceptional

column31: We Were Extremely Disappointed With The Experience.  Online We Stated Our Check In Would Be 6.30Pm. We Unfortunately Experienced Bad Traffic And Arrived At 8.15Pm But Our Room Was Still Not Ready.  We Were Eventually Given A Different Room. We Asked If We Could Have Breakfast In Our Room As We Had To Leave Early The Next Morning.  We Filled In The Card And Left It On Our Door Asking For Breakfast At 7Am. The Card Was Gone In The Morning But No Breakfast Arrived And We Checked Out At 7.30Am. Also Our Experience Of The Staff On Duty During The Wedding Reception We Attended Were Slapdash  And Badly Trained.

column31: We Came To Celebrate Our 20Th Wedding Anniversary On The Day  So The Choice Of The One Night Spa Break Seemed To Be The Perfect Fit.

column1: Our Room Was Nice  Apart From Several Large Dried 'Personal' Hairs In The Bath Tub! We Did Not Use The Bath! (I Have Photographs As I Was Quite Disgusted)
Our Treatments Were Very Nice  We Both Enjoyed Them Despite The Fire Alarm Going Off For About A Minute Half Way Through The Massage.
My Husband Used The Gym And Was Impressed With The Staff And Equipment.
Around 6.30Pm The Fire Alarm Went Off Once Again For A Minute Or So  I Was Just Out Of The Shower And The Panic Wondering What I Needed To Do  Although Comical Now  Was Rather Annoying.
I Was Thoroughly Disappointed With Our Evening Meal. The Food Was Nice  Our Choice Of Wine Was Pleasing But The Service Was Such A Complete Let Down.

I Felt Like I Was Being Served In A Motorway Service Station! The Waiter Rushed About  Hardly Looking Where He Was Going  He Whipped My Dinner Plate From Under Me When I Had Only Just Put The Last Mouthful Of My Meal In. We Felt Completely Rushed! The Table Next To Us With Four Ladies On However Seemed To Get More Attention Than Anyone  Several Members Of Staff Were Most Attentive To That Table  Most Noticable.
Breakfast The Next Morning Was The Same  Shoved In  Rushed Out. This Time It Was My Husbands Plate That Was Whisked Away As He Finished And While I Was Still Eating.
So  Despite Paying For Lunch We Left............

A Disappointing Experience For A Day That Was Very Special For Us. We Felt Like We Were Being Treated Differently As We Were On A 'Spa Break'  Like The Poor Relative. Maybe The Staff Should Be Reminded That £300 For One Night Is Alot Of Money!
I'm Sad To Say That I Would Not Want To Come Back And Go Through That Again.
column23: Rushed  Felt Like I Was At A Little Chef  Not A Hotel!
column31: Very Poor
column53: Restaurant Staff Were Unfriendly And Rushed.

column2: Lounge Bar Staff Were Helpful And Knowledgeable About The Available Drinks
column7: We Didn't Use The Spa Area Or Stay For Lunch As We Were So Disappointed With Our Evening Meal And Breakfast.
column8: A Disappointing Stay For A Special Personal Occasion.

column31: We Liked The Location And The Room. The Personal Service By The Staff Was Good. However  I Didn't Feel That The Room Service Was Very Propt. After A Long Drive After Finishing Work My Partner Went Downstairs To Order Food And A Glass Of Wine. Instead Of Giving My Partner The Wine To Bring Up We Waited 45 Minutes  By Then It Was Gone 11Pm And I Just Wanted To Go To Sleep  Therefore A Waste Of £11. This Happened A Few Times With Room Service Taking A Long Time. Which Did Spoil The Experience Of Being In Such A Lovely Hotel And Location.

column31: Had A Lovely Time... Could Have Been Slightly Better
column35: When Being Checked In  The Receptionist Made A Comment That I Felt Was Uncalled For And Rather Rude. She Explained That The Room I Had Booked Was The Classic Suit And Was "Our Most Basic" Room. Infront Of My Partner I Felt This Was Very Embarrassing. Especially As I Paid £134 For A Room For A Night. That's A Lot Lf Money To Me And My Partner And For Her To Make That Comment Was Very Unprofessional.
column77: I Was A Bit Dissapointed At The Level Of Young Children In The Pool. I Didn't Realise It Would Be So Busy And Not Very Relaxing At All. Boys Messing About And Play Fighting Is Not A Very Relaxing Time For A Spa. Other Than That  It Was Good
column83: Just The Receptionist Which I Explained About In A Different Box
column89: More Friendly Reception Staff And Not To Embarrass Me Infront Of My Partner Saying My Room Was "The Most Basic Suite"

column31: Lovely Stay  Staff All Very Friendly And Helpful. Food Lovely. Only Downside Were Rooms Were Quite Noisy (Sounds Of Air Conditioning / Heating Units?) And Rooms Felt Stuffy At Night.
column35: Check In Was Quite Slow
column39: Bed Head Was Very Strange And My Sister Banged Her Back On It. Room Was Stuffy / Noisy

column31: Nice Clean Room  Poor Breakfast. Lots Of Food Over Done Or Not Cooked Properly. Great Service Generally But Food And Price Of Drinks Let The Hotel Down.

column39: Upon Check-In  We Paid To Be Up-Graded To One Of The Executive Double Rooms (Which Appeared To Have Recently Been Refurbished).  As We Were Two Friends Visiting Sopwell For A Spa Break  The Room Was Broken Down Into A Twin Room For Us.  It Would Have Been Helpful If Additional Shampoo  Shower Gel Etc Had Been Provided.   Also  It Would Be Beneficial To Have A Small Selection Of Cotton Wool / Cotton Buds - The Little Extras Can Make A Difference.
column53: Execellent Selection Available For Every Type Of Dietary Requirement.   Professional But Friendly Service And Ample Staff To Ensure All Guests Were Greeted And Seated Quickly On Their Arrival
column64: Due To My Dietary Requirements  The Chef Very Kindly Adapted The Set Menu And Made A Bespoke Pudding.   The Service Was Attentative And Much Care And Concern Was Taken To Ensure That I Had A Meal That I Was Able To Enjoy.   Very Professional  Very Friendly And Just The Right Level Of Service.  We Were Both Able To Relax Whilst Not Feeling That We Were Being Interupted Every Few Minutes.
column77: Far Better Than Anticipated.   Having Visiting Both The Grove  Champneys At Tring And Henlow I Was Very Impressed By Your Recent Refurb.  However  It Was "Frustrating" That Guests Were "Keeping" Sun Beds On The Terrace By Leaving Towels  Robes And Books On Them Even Though They Were Not Using Them ........ Three Beds Were "Blocked" With Items But Not Used For An Hour At One Point.
column84: The Female Restaurant Manager Who Was In Charge Of Breakfast Service On Monday 14 April 2014.  Unfortunately I Dropped My Iphone Down The Loo ......... Don't Even Ask!!!  I Went Down To The Brasserie At Approximately 10.30 Am Begging For Rice And She Couldn't Have Been More Helpful!   She Came To My Rescue Getting Me Some Rice From The Chef And Was Friendly.   And ........ Two Days Later  The Phone Actually Came Back To Life!!!!
column90: Thank You To All The Staff Who Work So Hard Behind The Scenes To Make Sure That Your Guests Can Escape From Their Every Day "Stresses And Strains" From Time To Time .......... My Friend And I Had A Wonderful Spa Break Which Was Much Needed After A Very  Very Stressful Six Months For Us Both.   We Both Felt Refreshed After Just 24 Hours In The "Sopwell Bubble" And Can't Wait To Return!!

column31: The Service Is Good And Friendly...

column1: Things Not So Good Where:
1. The Food We Ordered Was Undercooked;
2. The Time It Took To Get Served In The Bar Area Was Rather Longer Than Desired - We Often Had To Go Out Of Our Way To Get Someone's Attention.
3. Our Room (139) Had A Pull Out Bed... The Bed Wasn't Quite A Double Bed So Quite Small  It Was Very Uncomfortable With Regards To The Wooden Headboard.
4. There Were Regular Noises Coming From What Seemed To Be A Generator - These Would Last For Around 20 Minutes At A Time.

She Took Me Straight To The Kithen Counter And Asked Them To Provide Me With A Bowl Of Rice.   She Certainly Saved The Day As Within 48 Hours ....... It Was Working Again!!!!

Directions To The Room Were Shocking..It Tooks Us About 20 Mins To Find Our Room And Had To Ask 2 More People Where It Was..Further To This We Got Lost Finding The Room On Several Occasions During Our Stay! And Upon Asking Numerous Members Of Staff We Were Met With Not The Best Help From Any! The Room Was Lovely And The Dinner Was Great Also. However We Felt Annoyed For The Amount We Paid That The Service At Reception And The Room Situation Wasn't Worth It. Can Not Fault Service In The Restaurant. But We Will Not Be Returning To Stay Again.

column31: Was A Bit Annoyed That I Was Told A Bottle Of Complimentary Preseco And Glasses Would Be Put In The Room For My Son Jensen And New Wife But Unfortunately It Was Not Done

column83: Your Bar Staff Let You Down This Visit. The First Night We Asked For A Bottle Of Veuve Clicquot Champagne Which Was On Your Wine List. The Barman Said You Didn't Have Any And Said All He Had Was In The Bar Fridge. We Had To Insist That It Was On Your List And Told Him To Go And Ask Someone Who Knew About It.....And Lo And Behold You Had It!! The Second Night The Barman Was Obviously Not Properly Trained In How To Pour Wine. We Ordered A Bottle Of White And He Filled Up The Entire Glass Instead Of Just A Small Amount And We Had To Explain To Him That You Only Pour A Small Amount To Ensure That The Wine Remains Cool Otherwise One Is Drinking It Warm By The Time The Bottom Of The Glass Is Reached.

column1: The Last Issue Was At Reception When My Friend Went To Pay Our Bill And She Was Given The Wrong One!!
We Just Felt This Visit That Perhaps Staff Had Changed And Not Been As Well Trained As Previously.

column53: Understandably It Was Busy As A Bank Holiday Weekend However The Main Restaurant Was Shut For Breakfast. The Brasserrie Restaurant Was An Absolute Nightmare  People Stealing People's Tables  One Of The People Seating Guests Was Particularly Rude Asking For Our Room Number When I Tried To Explain We Had Already Given It To Another Member Of Staff Who Was Already Clearing A Dirty Table For Us. Tea And Coffee We Didn't Get Offered Until The End Of Our Breakfast. Scrambled Eggs Were Cold But Other Food Was Of Good Quality. We Were Asked If We Wanted Toast Which We Said Yes But Never Got Any. People Bumping Into Each Other  So Noisy And Not Relaxing!
column83: As Mentioned In Previous Answers

column90: Particularly Frustrating When You Can Only Use A Credit Card Against Your Room. Myself Or My Husband Didn't Have One But Could Have Used A Debit Card However We Only Had The Choice Of Then Paying By Cash Or By Card Over The Phone Which Was Irritating Each Time We Ordered A Drink Or Food. On A Plus Side We Visited The Hotel Before It Had Been Refurbished Years Ago And Believe It Is Much Nicer And Glamorous Than Before

column31: While Our Stay At Sopwell House Was Mostly Enjoyable And Pleasant  There Were A Couple Of Issues That Spoilt Our Experience: The First Was The Fact That On Arrival The Receptionist Couldn't Locate Our Reservations  In Spite Of The Fact That I Gave Her My Phone With The Reservation Number On It  Due To The Fact It Had Been Made Under A Different Name. This Is Something That Could Of Course Happen To Anyone. However  We Found The Receptionist's Attitude Ungracious  If Not Downright Rude  Which Is Not Something We Would Expect From A 5 Stars Hotel.

column1: The Other Problem Was That The Spa Was Full Of Kids That Were Very Loud And Pretty Much Invaded Every Single Facility Available  Including The Jacuzzi Which Is Not For Kids Under 12. They Also Dived And Jumped In The Pool Splashing Everyone And Disturbing The General Peace  Both On Saturday Afternoon And Sunday Morning. As This Is Is Supposed To Be A Spa  I Believe Rules Should Be Strongly Enforced By The Staff  And Kids Should Not Be Allowed To Run Amok.
column5: As Mentioned Before  There Was One Particular Receptionist That Was Quite Rude And Even Questioned The Fact We Had Indeed A Reservation; The Whole Process Took 20 Minutes And She Never Once Apologised.
column31: Good
column47: As Mentioned Before  Rules About Kids Should Be Enforced In The Swimming Pool As They Can Spoil The Whole Experience; The Point Of A Spa Is To Be Able To Relax And Kids Running Amok Do Not Generally Help.
column53: The Arrival At The Reception Was Unpleasant; I Would Expect A Better Level Of Training.

column31: I Was Very Disappointed That The Room Was Not Cleaned On The Day Of The Wedding Sunday We Came Back To The Bedroom (Room 147) At 1.00Pm Still To See That The Room Was Not Cleaned We Had To Use The Towels From The Previous Night  I Would Have Thought The Calibre Of The Hotel Would Have Made An Effort To Make Sure That Rooms Were All Cleaned After 11. 00Am For The Wedding Party - I Did Report This To Reception Only To Be Told That The Rooms Are Cleaned In The Afternoon - This Is Not Acceptable.
column39: I Was Very Disappointed That The Room Was Not Cleaned On The Day Of The Wedding Sunday We Came Back To The Bedroom (Room 147) At 1.00Pm Still To See That The Room Was Not Cleaned We Had To Use The Towels From The Previous Night  I Would Have Thought The Calibre Of The Hotel Would Have Made An Effort To Make Sure That Rooms Were All Cleaned After 11. 00Am For The Wedding Party - I Did Report This To Reception Only To Be Told That The Rooms Are Cleaned In The Afternoon - This Is Not Acceptable.

column35: When We Checked In We Were Asked If We Wanted To Upgrade Our Room At A Cost Of £30.00 Per Night. We Declined The Offer. We Were Then Told That We Were Being Given A Complimentary Upgrade! This Seemed Very Strange!
column39: We Were Given A Complimentary Upgrade Of Our Room. However  In Order To Get To Our Room We Had To Walk Down A Long Corridor  Get The Lift To The First Floor  Walk Along Another Corridor  And Down Stairs To The Mezzanine Level. We Were At The Hotel For A Wedding (I Was The Best Man) And It Was Very Tiring Walking To And From Our Room Over The Weekend!

column1: We Had Room 108 Which Had A Lovely View  However Out Of Our Window We Could Also See The Function Room Below And Down To The Left. We Thought Nothing Of This Until We Went To Bed On Our First Night Only To Find A Function In Full Flow And The Noise From The Disco Reverberating Into Our Room - The Bass From The Disco Was Very Loud And We Could Not Get To Sleep Until The Function Had Finished. It Was Too Late And We Were To Tired To Ask To Move Rooms. We Were Therefore Very Tired The Next Day For Our Friend's Wedding. Apart From These Things The Room And The Hotel Were Lovely.
column46: The Bar Staff (Male With Red Hair) That Served At The Fielding Wedding Function On The Evening Of Sun 20Th April Was Particularly Polite And Helpful.
column52: Hope To Stay Again But In A Quieter Room A Little Closer To Reception!
column53: Male

column31: From The Moment Of Arrival We Were Made To Feel Very Welcome By Gisella  Cirmi With  In Reception Whom Was Very Attentive To All Our Needs And Ensuring That The Room And All Our Requirements  Were  To Our Satisfaction. We Were Running Late To Attend Our Treatments Due To Traffic And Giselle Changed The Arrangements For Us So That We Did Not Have To Rush. We Enjoyed The Spa Experience And Treatments With The Overnight Stay And Dinner And Breakfast And Lunch Were Of A Great Standard And We Left Feeling Relaxed. All The Staff We Met In Hallways And The Hotel Cleaners All Had A Smile And Looked Happy As We Walked Around The Hotel And We Felt At Ease At All Times.  We Wanted To Thank The Manager Alessandro Convertini Whom Sat Down With Us For A Chat And It Was Evident To See How Passionate He Is About His Job And Ensuring Excellent Customer Service Is Delivered! We Will Return Again For Another Weekend Soon! Please Pass On Our Thanks To Gisella And Alessandro!
column35: We Were Made To Feel Welcome From The Moment We Arrived And Met Gisella At Reception  We Were Then Escorted To Our Room By The Spanish Male Twins Whom Again Were Very Attentive To All Our Needs And Always Delivered Service With A Smile!
column53: Breakfast At Sopwell House Was Varied With A Good Selection Of Drinks  Cerals  Hot Food And Fruit To Meet All Of The Customers Needs.  Lovely Views To Enjoy Whilst Eating And Staff Were Very Attentive To Our Needs And Clearing Tables
column64: We Very Much Enjoyed The Dining Experience As We Were Made To Feel Welcome Fromt The Moment We Were Taken To Our Table And The Environement  Was Very Relaxing ! The Menu Was Varied And We All Enjoyed The Quality Of The Food.  The Only Comment I Would Make Is That Staff Appeared To Many Times At Our Tables Whom Were To Eager To Take Plates Away Whilst Still Eating.
column84: Gisella Cirmi In Reception For Her Friendly And  Excellent Customer Service Thoroughout Our Stay And Helpful Advice. Alessandro Convertino Whom We Met For A Chat And Made Us Feel Like Valued Customers Ensuring We Were Very Happy With Every Aspect Of Our Stay!! We Will Be Coming Back

column31: The Food In The Evening In The Brassiere Was Very Disappointing. My Burger Meat Was Very Dry And Crumbly  I Had To Smother It With Ketchup To Make It Palatable And My Partner's Steak Was Very Fatty With Hardly Any Meat. This Was Very Bad Quality For Sopwell House In My Opinion.  The Breakfast Next Morning Was Good. And My Room Was Very Nice. I Was Very Upset When At Around 10Am I Was Sitting On The Toilet With The Bathroom Door Open And One Of Your Staff Walked Straight Into My Room. I Had The Do Not Disturb Sign On The Door. Could She Not Read ?? I Was So Embarrassed And This Has Put Me Off In Wanting To Stay Again. The Stay Was Meant To Be A Pleasant And Stress Free Experience. We Paid A Lot Of Money For Our Stay  Evening Meal And My Spa Treatment. But Those Two Things Let Me Down Greatly. You Must Tell Staff Not To Enter Bedrooms Until After 11Am And The Food Needs A Bit More Tlc !
column35: The Signage To The Hotel Is Very Hard To Spot  Its Easy For Someone Not To Spot It And Drive Past Your Hotel. The Soft White Sign With The Very Light Coloured And Delicate Typeface Is Not Clear And Does Not Stand Out For Those Who Have Never Been To Your Hotel Before. My Partner Said He Nearly Missed The Turning.
column39: My Room Was Beautiful  That And The Spa Were The Best Parts Of My Stay. Although Having That Silly Member Of Staff Come Into My Room While I Was On The Toilet Was Not Something I'd Like To Remember. Extremely Unsettling!! :-(
column53: Only Two Complaints...The Food In The Evening At The Brasserie Was Not Good And Having A Member Of Staff Coming Into Your Room Is Not Good Either!
column64: The Burger Meat Was Very Dry  Crumbly And Hard To Swallow. My Partner's Steak Was Fatty With Hardly Any Meat. The Chips Were Not Great Either.
column77: My Treatment Was Meant To Be For An Hour. She Was Late And Finished Early. Lost About 15 Minutes Overall. Not Great Value Felt A Bit Rushed.
column83: As I Have Quoted Before The Member Of Staff Walking Into My Room Is A No No!!
column89: Better Food  Less Rushed Spa Treatment And Staff Not Entering Rooms Till After 11Am Unless The Customer Has Already Properly Checked Out.

column31: It Was A Lovely One Night Spa Break. The Treatments Were Lovely  As Was All The Food. The Disappointing Elements Of The Trip Was That There Were No Tea Or Coffee Facilities In The Room Or A Mini Fridge. The Worst Part Of The Stay Was That We Were Provided With No Complementary Drinking Water. We Had Driven To Sopwell House And On Arrival Were Quite Thirsty But There Was No Drinking Water Provided In The Rooms  We Also Had To Pay For Water With Dinner Even Though Our Stay Was Full Board. In Less Than 24 Hours We Spent £8.40 On Still Water And I Think It Is A Shame That Such A Nice Hotel Lacks The Initiative To Provide The Most Basic Of Complementary Services  Clean Water.
column35: The Receptionist Seem Very Confused At Both Check In And Out.
column39: Room 142. No Tea Of Coffee Facilities Or Mini Fridge. Worst Of All No Drinking Water Provided.
column53: Lovely Sausages But The Bacon Didn't Match The Quality Of The Rest Of The Food. Would Have Been Nice To Have Granary Toast As An Option. Poached Eggs Were A Little Cold And Although I Like A Runny Yoke Some Of The White Was Still Gloopy.
column64: Really Tasty. I Didn't Mind Paying For The Wine But When We Asked For Water We Were Brought Still Which We Had To Pay For And Had No Option Of Tap Water Provided  Which Was A Bit Cheeky.
column77: One Of The Lights Has Come Off The Wall In The Swimming Pool  There Was A Sign Which Said Maintenance Had Been Informed. Although It Must Have Been Safe For The Pool To Remain Open This Was Quite Disconcerting As I Am Aware Of The Result Of Water And Electricity Mixing.
column83: On Check Out The Receptionist Who Was A Trainee Got Very Confused About Whether Or Not We Had Already Paid Even Though It Was Her Who Had Taken The Card Payment From Us Just The Day Before.

column31: The Hotel  Setting And Room Were Lovely.

column1: The Power And Heat Of The Shower Were Excellent.
The Staff Were Polite.
The Sash Window That Actually Opened Was A Delight.

However  I Slept Poorly. This Was Due To The Presence Of A Smoke Alarm(?)Or Sprinkler(?) On The Ceiling Which Intermittently Emitted A Momentary Flash Of Bright Light. I Found It Very Disturbing  And Arrived At My Job Interview The Next Day Absolutely Exhausted. I Also Missed Breakfast Because I Had Slept So Badly I Found It Hard To Get Myself Up And Going In The Morning.

So Despite The Fact That Sopwell House Is Clearly A Beautiful Hotel  I'm Not Sure I'd Want To Stay Again. If You Can't Sleep At Night It Doesn't Matter Whether You're In Buckingham Palace Or The Travelodge On The M1.
One Further Thing... The Receptionist Who Greeted Me Was Delightful ~ Very Polite And Helpful.

However  She Didn't Smile Much And Looked At Her Computer Screen During The Check-In Process More Than She Looked At Me. I Think Eye Contact Is A Really Important Element Of Good Manners  And Would Have Preferred Her To Pay More Attention To Me Than To Her Screen.
column64: Elizabeth

column77: As A Spa Hotel One Would Expect To Be Able To Get A Lounger  Use The Jakuzzi And Just Relax By The Pool. We Were Unable To Use The Jakuzzi As 3 Kids Under 6 Were Using It And I Was Under The Impression As Stated On The Jakuzzi Rules That Children Under 12 Were Not Supposed To Be In The Jakuzzi. We Hand To Stand Around And Wait For Loungers  Whichbwas Such A Let Down As It Was Supposed To Be A Birthday Break And Also A Breakmaway From Our Young Children And Also To Chill Out As We Have Had Quite A Stressful Year And Really Needed To Unwind Which Was Very Difficult To Be Honest. You Could See Every Persons Disappointment As They Walked Into The Spa And Find You Have No Where To Go Really  Which Is Quite Intimidating When You Are Standing Around Semi Dressed And Feeling Very Awkward To Be Fair. The Spa Facilities Are Not Adequate Enough  I Would Describe Sopwell House As More Of A Hotel With Limited Spa Facilites  I Wouldnt Clasifiy It As A Spa Which I Was Under The Impression Of.
column83: All Was Pretty Good Until We Checked Out And We Were Charged For A Spa Treatment That My Brother Had Pre Booked As A Surprise For My Birthday. The Lady Was Adament That No Payment Had Been Made  So I Had To Call My Brother Who Was Abroad At The Time And Explain The Situation  Which Was Very Embaressing For All Of Us As It Was Suggested I Pay For The Treatment And Then Get The Money From Him  Which Was Very Unprofessional And Quite Rude To Be Fair. After The Manager Calling The Spa (Although When I Said My Brother Had Paid Directly Via The Spa She Said That Wasnt Possible As All Payments Come Via Reception) Was She Implying We Were Lying  I Hope Not  As We Are Not That Type  And Would Embaress Ourselves Over £45!!!!!!!!!

column1: The Spa Or The Manager  Not Sure As She Wasnt Very Helpful Then Said My Brothers Card Had Been Declined Over The Phone And Thats Why Payment Had Not Been Paid. I Can Assure You I Would Find It Very Unlikely My Brothers Card Would Ever Decline. And We Also Pointed Out To The Manager That If That Was The Case  Why Would The Spa Person Finish The Phone Call If It Had Declined  Surely She Would Have Waited For Card To Accept Payment Before Placing The Phone Down  And She Had His Contact Number  Why Not Call Him Back?!?!? Given They Knew It Was A Surprise Birthday Gift  You Dont Just Charge To The Persons Room. Very Unprofessional And Unacceptable.

column2: All Staff Were Helpful And Friendly Apart From That Very Last Check Out Issue.
column8: Aside From All I Have Commented On  It Was Generally A Good Stay For The Money We Paid  Although The Issues With Checking Out Was Unacceptable Regardless Of How Much Money Is Paid. We Probably Wouldn't Come Back Again Which Is A Shame As Its A Lovely Hotel But If You Want To Come For A Spa Break To Chill Out Then Your Better Off Going Else Where. I Was Going To Be Visiting With 9 Girlfriends Of Mine For A Spa Break/ Get Together As We Do Each Year ( Visitors From Usa  France  Italy And Switzerland) But We Are Now Looking At Booking Elsewhere As Its Obvious You Would Not Be Able To Cater For Our Spa Needs.

column1: The Brasserie's Food Was Very Good - We Were Impressed With The Service As Well Both For Dinner And Breakfast. The Menu Catered For Families With Young Children And We Appreciated This. We Also Liked The Cocktail Lounge.

However  We Were Not Notified When We Booked The Stay That The Lifts Were Out Of Order And On The Day Due To Refurbishments  We Had To Climb Two Flights Of Stairs With Two Young Children And Our Luggage  With Two Members Of The Family Moved To The Mews Apartment  Away From The Main Building. This Diminished The Whole Experience.

We Also Wanted To Have Some Flexibility In Terms Of The Times And Lengths Of Treatments But The Spa Was Unable To Accommodate Longer Treatments. We All Booked To Have Treatments - Facials And Massages But Felt They Were All Rushed Through  Which Again Diminished The Experience.

column31: Overall Very Good.  Staff Are Friendly And Helpful  Rooms And Facilites Are Clean And Very Comfortable  Food Is Lovel.
column35: When I Booked I Told Them This Was Going To Be Our Honeymoon  This Was Commented On And We Were Congratulated When We Checked In Which Nice. Staff Were Friendly And Helpful.
column39: We Have Stayed At Sopwell Twice Before This Trip. We Have Always Booked A Standard Room And Been Very Impressed With The Size And Quality Etc. Having Checked In This Time  After Confirming This Was Our Honeymoon  We Arrived At A Much Smaller Room - Still Lovely But We Were Quite Disappointed.  Long Story Short  It Seems We Were Double Upgraded To Executive Suites On Both Our Previous Visits But Never Told So. This Was Great On Those Visits As We Didn't Pay For An Upgrade For Which We Are Grateful. But As We Didn't Know We Had Been Upgraded  We Came To Expect This Room As A Standard Room So Were Quite Dissapointed When We Received A Real Standard Room This Time.  Aside From The Size  This Particular Room Was Next To A Cupboard And A Busy Stair Well So Within 10 Minutes We Had Already Had Enough Of The Banging And Crashing Going On Around Us.  We Went Back To Reception And Were Helped Very Kindly (By Lucy I Believe) Who Explained That We Could Upgrade To A Superior Room Complimentary Or An Executive Room For Half The Normal Rate.  This Was Much Appreiciated And This Is When It Became Apparent That We Had Stayed In Executive Rooms Before.  Overall  We Were Happy To Pay A Little Extra For Some More Space And The Peace And Quiet Of This Other Room For Our Honeymoon.  This Experience Did Taint Our Visit A Little. Its Hard To Understand How You Could Have Upgraded Us Twice For Free Previously Without Even Mentioning It But On This Visit  Which The Hotel Knew To Be A Special Occasion  We Had To Pay For It.
column64: On Our First Night I Ordered The Smoked Trout Salad For Starter. When It Arrived There Seemed To Be A Lack Of Trout  However We Assumed It Was Cut Up Small And Mixed In With The Dressing Etc. On The Second Night  My Husband Ordered The Same Dish And It Was Apparent There Had Been No Trout With My Meal The Night Before.  His Dish Had Large Pieces Of Trout On Top Of The Salad And Lots Of Parmesan Shavings Mixed In. This Lead Us To Believe They Had Perhaps Run Out Of Trout And Parmesan The Night Before But Never Told Us.  If They Had  I Might Have Ordered Something Else.  Again  Overall The Dish Was Still Nice And This In No Way Ruined Our Experience But It Is Not Really The Kind Of Behaviour We Expected In Such A Nice Hotel.
column77: I Was A Little Dissapointed To Find There Was Hardly Any Treatments Below Approx £70. On A Previous Visit I Enjoyed I Believe A Half Body Massage Or Shorter Timed Back Massage For Around £40. I Would Have Liked To Have This Again But It Is No Longer Available It Would Seem.  I Appreciate This Is A Luxury High End Facility But It Would Be Nice To See Treatments To Fit All Budgets On Offer.
column84: I Believe The Lady Who Rectified Our Booking Was Lucy.  Also The Consierge On Duty Was Very Helpful (Helped Us More Our Luggage To New Room)

column83: The Only Problem I Had  And To Be Fair It Was Instigated By Me  Is That I Left My Wash-Bag Behind. But  It Took An Email And Three Phone Calls Before I Could Actually Speak To Someone About It  Including Leaving Two Voicemail Messages. I Stayed On The Thursday Night But Only Managed To Get To Speak To Someone On The Saturday  When I Was Told That It Could Be Posted To Me Until The Tuesday. Whilst Its My Fault I Left It Behind  There Was A Missed Oportunity To Post It To Me On The Friday. I Got My Bag Back  But Only After Driving Back To You Get It (3.5 Hours Round Trip).

column31: We Only Stayed One Night But Were Impressed By The Hotel  The Decor  Surroundings And Food. The Only Thing I Would Mention As Feedback Is It Would Have Been Nice To Have A Bathrobe In The Room And Some Body Lotion Especially As You Are A Spa Hotel And These Items Are On Hand. As A Woman It Is Nice To Be Able To Put On The Robe After You Have Showered As You Get Ready Before Dressing And Nowadays Even The More Basic Of Hotels Have A Full Compliment Of Bathroom Toiletries So That For Just One Nigh I Don' Bother To Pack Things Like Body Lotion. A Little Touch But Appreciated.
column35: Again I Did Mention When I Called To Book A Table Of Dinner In The Brasserie That The 'Reserve A Table' Option On Your Website Does Not Appear To Be Working. column90: Probably Not Possible But It Would Be Good To Move The Smokers Taking A Break From The Spa In Their Gowns From Gathering By The Open Door Back Into The Hotel Reception So That Their Smoke Wafts In. column31: Hi Alessandro  I Have Been Staying At Sopwell House For Around 20 Years And Remember When I Played Snooker With The Arsenal Players There. We Now Live In Surrey But Have Still Decided To Have Our Wedding At Your Venue On 18/7/14 Because Of The Friendly / Excellent Service... Joe Carter Is Now Looking After Our Wedding. We First Met Him On Friday 16/5 And Found Him To Be Highly Professional. We Were Reassured By His Professionalism / Attentiveness And Believe He Will Make Our Special Day A Fantastic Experience. I Would Also Like To Mention Jenny In Reservations Who Provides An Excellent Booking Experience As She Has Done For Many Years. If I Was To Make Any Criticism The Queuing At Check-In / Check-Out Has Always Been Tedious And Time Consuming. This Is Something I Feel Could Be Improved By Having Extra Staff On At The Prime Check-In Time Of 15:00 And Check Out Time Of 11:00 . I Hope You Find This Feedback Helpful And Constructive. John Egan 07973 625356

column31: Front Of House Were Not Overly Helpful. Restaurant Service Was The Slowest I've Experienced In A Long While ( Waited 20 Mins For A Menu  30Mins For A Waiter To Take Our Order  And 20 Mins For A Bottle Of Champagne And A Lot Longer For Afternoon Tea! - No Exaggeration). It Was Obvious That The Restaurant Was Understaffed But There's Simple Ways Of Dealing With That Rather Than Ignore And Frustrate Guests. Many Others Where Equally Complaining And Very Frustrated Not Just Us Including An Elderly Couple Who Really Needed The Water They Ordered. I Didn't Check The Bill That Was Charged To Our Room And If Service Was Added  Please Refund. Positives: Comfortable Bed  And Decent Breakfast.

The Only Negative Comments   Which Are Minor  Was That Outside Our Room Was A Loud Air Con Unit ( Room 240 ) And We Would Have Liked A Fridge/Mini Bar In The Room. As Mentioned These Are Minor Points Which Did Not Detract From Our Enjoyment. We Will Definitely Recommend Sopwell House To Others And Hope To Visit Again Soon.
