column84: The Restaurant Staff

column31: Generally We Had A Good Stay  Was Surprised There Was No Wifi Available In The Rooms. Was Generally A Bit Disappointed By The Size Of The Room For The Price And The Tiny Corridors Leading To Them. On Entering The Spa We Had A Very Confusing Conversation Regarding Bath Robes With The Lady Behind The Counter. She Seemed Annoyed We Opted For Robes When The Only Alternative Seemed To Be To Roam About In Our Underwear  Both Massages However Were Amazing Once The Issues With The Robes Was Sorted. I Would Advise Avoiding The Bar As It Is An Incredibly Drawn Out Performance To Firstly Get A Drink And Secondly Attempting To Pay. I Would Have Thought Charging £4.50 For A Small Beer And A £10 Tip Would Result In Great Service Or At Least A Chance Of Buying A Second Round Of Drinks. The Evening Meal In The Brasserie Was Faultless As Was The Breakfast.
The Rooms Were Lovely And Beds Very Comfortable. The Service Both At Reception And In The Brasserie.  We're Very Good And We Enjoyed All Our Meals. We Used The Pool And We Had A Lovely Stay With You.
column90: Woulld Be Nice To Have More Milk Cartons With The Tea And Coffee. Just An Observation And Not A Complaint!

column31: Excellent  Great Breakfast And Dinner In The Restaurant  And Excellent Waiters  Although They Were Over Worked And Didn't Really Have Enough Time To Get Round Everybody Efficiently Enough  Afternoon Tea Was Delicious. We Did Order Room Service Though Of A Beef Sandwich  Potato Wedges And A Bottle Of White Wine Which Was Hugely Overpriced For The Standard Of The Food We Received - The Sandwich Was Tiny For £12.50  And The Wine Unfortunately I Found Barely Drinkable And A Poor Choice For A £22 Bottle! Overall Though Great Stay - Thank You!

column31: We Enjoyed The Reception Areas And The Food Was Wonderful  From The Afternoon Tea To Our Meal In The Brasserie. However  I Felt That The Accommodation In The Mews Apartment (No. 2) Was Very Poor For The Price. The Place Needs Updating  It Was A Mess Of Styles  The Bathroom Light Flickered Badly And Wasn't Repaired  And Unfortunately For Us There Was A Very Young Family That Got Up At 6Am Both Mornings And The Noise Upstairs Was Not Fun For Us Underneath. The Thin Wooden Floors Above Are Very Noisy For Those Below. I Know Soundproofing Would Have Been So Much Better In The Main Hotel And Was Sorry That We Could Not Have Accommodation There. Also Although The Food And Drink Were Of Excellent Quality And Afternoon Tea Was Lovely  The Service Was Actually Quite Poor. On The Sunday Evening We Didn't Receive Two Lots Of Bar Drinks Before Asking Twice And Actually Saw Them Sat On The Bar For 20 Mins Before We Went And Got Them Ourselves  And Secondly We Did Not Get Served To Be Seated For Our Afternoon Tea In The Bar At All. I Had To Go To Reception And Tell Them That We Were Not Being Served After 20 Mins Of Standing At The Bar And Waiting. The Bar Was Very Busy. I Watched A Couple Leave And A Group Of Women Huffing As They Could Not Get Served. There Were A Few Staff About But None Of Them Acknowledged Our Being There Or Suggest How Long We Might Wait. This Was Very Disappointing And I Left The Area Where We Were To Eat Which We Had Booked For Our Daughters Birthday.

column31: We Went For "A Fine Dining Experience" Saturday Night In The Restaurant. The Only Enjoyable Aspect Was The Starter Of Scallops  Chicken Was Cold And Not A Nice Dish It Was A Texture Of Mushed Up Baby Food  Also Dessert Was Not Nice. It Was Not The Fine Dining Experience We Had Expected. Despite This We Decided To Book In For A Second Night  Despite Just Booking Out And Re-Booking Through Website (Despite Receptionist Saying It Was Fully Booked) We Had To Wait To Check In At The Very Late Time Of 3.00Pm When We Went To Check In We Were Told We Would Have To Wait At Least Another Hour So We Decided We Would Go For A Walk And Went To Nearby St.Albans. Receptionist Told Us They Would Phone Us When The Room Was Ready. Never Received The Phonecall  On Return To Hotel We Got A Mere Apology Which Was Not Sincere. Disappointing Stay

Receptionist At Front Desk Was Not Helpful And Basically Said Keep Trying The Different Extension Numbers She Gave Me. When I Finally Got Through Just Before They Close  Therapist Said They Were Fully Booked. Although I Do Understand It Was Short Notice If The Phone Had Been Answered On Any Of My Many Calls  I May Have Been Able To Get A Last Minute Booking.

Also The Bottle Of Water Wasn't Replaced And The Selection Of Apples Wasnt Replaced Either.  Other Than These Minor Things The Stay Was Perfect.

column31: We Had A Lovely Relaxing Time In The Spa And The Brasserie Food Was Excellent.

column1: On One Negative Note; It Was Surprising That The Afternoon Tea Did Not Include Refills Of The Sandwiches Or Cakes. Other Afternoon Teas  At Other High End Establishments  Always Include Replenishment Of The Sandwiches.
Also  The Mews Room Was Lovely  But For Our Third Adult  A Camp-Bed Is Not Really A Suitable Substitute For Your Comfortable Beds.
column5: We Were Not Able To Use A Debit Card To Secure Our Check-In (None Of Us Have A Credit Card) And  Therefore We Had To Pay For Everything Up Front  And Then Did Not Have A Card We Could Use To Charge Drinks Etc Back To The Room.
column9: As Previously Mentioned; I Think A Camp Bed For The Third Guest  In A Mews Room  Is Not Suitable. Especially When They Pay The Same Amount.
column31: Excellent
column64: Kirstie

column31: I Thought That The House  Rooms  Food And Spa Was All Beautiful And We Did Have A Good Time. Unfortunately Though We Were Not Impressed By The Late Sitting For Dinner. We Booked The Day Before A Sitting For 20.30 In The Brasserie And When We Arrived We Were Told Our Table Was Not Ready. At 21.10 We Were Still Sitting Waiting And No-One Informed Us When We Would Get To Sit For Dinner. Only After Complaiing We Were Finally Offered A Complimentary Drink. It Was Not Until 21.40 That Our Table Was Eventually Ready. I Do Not Believe This Is Acceptable For A Hotel That Prides Itself On Its Service And Quality.

column1: I Realise It Was A Saturday And You Were Busy But I Was Very Dissappointed With The Dirty Floor In The Spa Around The Sauna  Steam And Seats In That Area. It Was Honestly Filthy!

column64: Catherine

column31: Our Wedding Was Magical Small And Simple. But The Special Touches Were Missing - I Stayed The Night Before And Was Placed Straight Over The Previous Wedding So Loud Music Kept Me Awake Most Of The Night. My Parents Arrived And When They Checked In They Were Given Details On Entertainment And The Reception Had No Idea They Were Booked For Their Daughters Wedding! We Had Left Money At Reception For The Speakers Man To Collect Before The Event- He Couldn't Locate It So On The Night Of The Wedding I Went To Reception To Ask About It- I Was Made Wait So Long I Had To Remind The Reception That I Was Missing My Wedding And Could They Perhaps Look And Then Bring Down The Envelope.  So Small Details Were Missed That Are In Fact Big Details. Nones The Less The Staff Catering He Wedding Were Exceptional And The Food Was Really Excellent - We Would Have Enjoyed Ourselves In A Field That Day!! But Feedback Wise I Did Think What A Pity.

column1: This Year On Our Return It Was Completely Different- Despite A Very Long Check In Queue The Reception Was Warm And Friendly And Professional. The Room Was Stunning With A Card As A Nice Touch. The Meal Was Great And The Service Excellent. The Spa Was Busy But Really Relaxing. We Felt Spoilt  Valued And There Was A Genuine Warmth. Really Lovely And We Will Come Back Again Even Though We Only Live 10 Minutes Away!!!
column5: I Did Request That For This Visits That We Not Be Given A Room Directly Above A Wedding! I Never Got A Response About This. When I Mentioned To The Check In Receptionist She Did Not Seem To Understand My Questions Regarding G Whether Our Room Was Located Above The Wedding Area And Tried Numerous Times To Sell Us An Upgrade. It Turned Out That The Room Was Not Above The Venue Area And It Was A Beautiful Room
column9: I Loved The Toiletries Smell - It Was Pristine
column23: Excellent Delicious Fresh Good Quality Food- I Would Go Back For Breakfast !

column1: It Was So Good And Quiet Large- I Would've That For Lin H Or Tapas In The Bar Area With Friends I M Not Sure If It Is Offered There- I Thought It Was Excellent
The Area Was Definitely Clean.
When U Entered The Spa Area All Seating Was Marked With Towels Or Robes But Clearly People Had Been And Left.

One Area I Thought Could Improve Was That Someone Be Aware Of Who Is Where And Clear Chairs As Be One Available- As Lots Of People Arrived Into The Area With No Where To Place Their Belongings Despite In Fact Many Of The Seating Areas Being A A Available.
This Makes The Difference Between And Efficient Tranquil And Neat Spa Area V's A Messy Old Towels And Robes Everywhere- Massively Different First Impression .
column7: On This Recent Visit Everything Was Really Exceptional
column8: On Arrival A Very Warm Italian Lady Called Gracia I Think Greeted Us And Others As There Was A Queue. She Was Brilliant - Beautifully Warm And Professional And You Immediately Felt You Were On A Relaxing Break. Instant Effect!!! That's Good!!

column31: Really Lovely Hotel And Great Value For Money  Will Be Staying Again.

The Venue And Setting Were Lovely.  Our Room Was Great And I Had The Best Night Sleep In A Long Time.  The Spa Pool  Steam And Sauna Was Clean And Tidy  But The Treatments Were Slightly To Expensive.  We Did Have One Issue When Ordering A Cream Tea.  We Were Told To Take A Seat  And We Informed The Gentleman We Would Sit Outside.  After Waiting 15-20 Minutes I Returned To The Bar To Find That Staff Had Changed Shifts And Our Order Had Been Forgotten.  We Did Speak To The Manager To Make Him Aware.
column35: We Did Arrive Early.  A Room Was Not Available But Our Mobile Was Taken And We Were To Be Called When A Room Was Free.  After Lunch We Approached The Arrivals Desk At About 2Pm To See If Our Room Was Ready And We Were Given Our Room Keys  Although We Had Not Been Called To Let Us Know The Room Was Ready.

column31: I Have Been Staying Here Every Week For 6 Months. The Facilities And Staff / Service Is Very Good From All At The Hotel. The Breakfast Is Good But I Have Long Since Exhausted The Dinner Menu - A Change Of Menu Would Be Welcome.

column1: I Have Stayed In Quite A Few Different Rooms Now And Definitely Prefer The Newly Refurbished Ones. The New Showers And Decor Are Excellent. There Is Sometimes An Issue With Noisy Fans. The Rooms Over Looking The Kitchen Are Noisy At Ground Level Due To This. Since My First Visit In Dec 2013 I Have Been Located On The Other Side On The 2Nd Floor - E.G Room 232. On This Occasion A Fan Constantly Started Up And Stopped And Appears To Be Catching On Some Ducting. This Fan Was Not The Heater / Cooler Unit In My Room But Possibly In The Corridor Or The Wc Extract System.
In Conclusion I Will Recommend This Hotel To Others.

We Ran Out Of Toilet Paper In Our Room And Couldn't Find A Spare  Our Bill Was On Account But We Had To Prove This Every Time We Signed For Anything  The Restaurant Manager Even Knocked On Our Door At Night Following A Meal And I Had To Produce My Copy Of The Authorisation Form. That Became Quite Embarrassing.

column53: When You Ordered Tea Coffee Or Toast It Took A Long Time To Arrive And Sometimes We Gave Up Waiting . But Other Than That The Food Was Good
column64: Only Had Breakfast In The Brasserie.And Food At The Wedding Reception Was Good

column31: Check In Was Terrible 25 Minutes  Although Your Staff Did Apologise For The Busy Period.  I Was Offered An Upgrade Which Was Very Nice  But The Room Then Had Twin Beds ! This Was Sorted.  My Issue Was Really The Evening Meal Which Was Tired And Over Cooked  But Then To Have A Member Of Staff Knocking On My Door For Payment At 11.30Pm Was Completely Unacceptable.  I Was Using A Debit Card And When I Checked In Simply Stated That I Do Not Have A Credit Card  As I Am Sure There Must Be Others.  I Know The Waiter Was Only Doing His Job  But There Should Have Been A Duty Manager On Hand To Make A Simple Decision.  To Wake Guests Up With A Credit Card Machine Was Simply Woeful. Breakfast  Complete With Poor Quality Tissue Napkins  Was Wonderfully Disappointing.  A Little Tlc From The Duty Chef Would Ensure That Sausages Were Simply Not Scraped Off The Grill (Stuck Together In 3'S And 4'S) Before Being Dumped In The Chaffing Dishes.  But Then Again I Am Not A Fan Of Buffet Breakfast  Which Is Why I Usually Stay At A Hotel Where I Would Not Expect It To Be Served.

column1: Jm

column5: Perhaps I Was A Little Unlucky  But As I Mentioned Your Meet And Greet Lady Was Excellent In Making Sure That She Remained Attentive At All Times
column9: I Would Have Expected Some Bottled Water  Of Which There Was None  And If Your Are Going To Upgrade A Guest Then Their Sleeping Requests Should Be Taken Into Account.  I Don't Expect To Have To Zip The Twin Beds Together  At Which Point I Went Back To Reception At Two Single Duvets Would Not Replace A Double
column23: More Care And Attention Needs To Be Shown As To What Is In The Chaffing Dishes  Less And More Frequently Replenished Is Better Than Overflowing And Cold.  If You Must Use Paper Napkins They Should At Least Be Good Quality

My Wife Has Visited Sopwell House With Her Girlfriends Before And Enjoyed The Experience So Much She Couldn't Wait To Go Back A Second Time So I Treated Her As Part Of Her Of Xmas Present In The Form Of A Gift Voucher. She Asked Me To Go  With Her And I Must Say That I Had Never Been To A Spa Before But Was Pleasantly Surprised  Whilst My Wife Had A Treatment I Used The Spa Facilities And Couldn't Fault It.We Had A Meal In The Brasserie That Evening And Breakfast The Following Morning And The Food Was Excellent .

Overall A Lovely Stay. Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Night Away From The Baby. Many Thanks.

column31: My Visit With My Daughter Was A Surprise Treat For Her Having Finished Her Exams. She Is Hopefully Going To University In September And I Wanted Some Mother Daughter Time And A Treat For Both Of Us. We Had The Most Wonderful Experience At Sopwell House. The Staff Were Excellent  The Facilities Perfect  Cocktail Bar A Favourite And The Food Was Superb. I Rarely Have My Expectations Exceeded But Sopwell House Certainly Did It. Thank You So Much And We Are Saving Already For Another Visit  We Thought His Should Be An Annual Treat For Us!
column35: Very Helpful Lady Whom I Spoke To Originally Who Talked Me Through The Various Offers That Were Available On Spa Breaks
column39: We Did Have An Issue The First Night Insomuch As We Could Hear A Lot Of Noise From Above Our Room. After A While I Reported It To Reception  Within Minutes The Manager Rang Me Back To Assure Me He Had Checked It Out But Was Unable To Pinpoint The Source. However He Went To Great Lengths To Reassure Me That If It Continued I Was To Call Back And He Would Arrange For Us To Be Moved. The Noise Stopped So That Was Not Necessary But I Was Very Impressed With The Proposed Resolution And Felt That It Would Have Been No Trouble To The Hotel If We Had Taken Up The Offer.
column53: Fantastic
column64: Dinner Was Wonderful And The Sopwell Cheesecake Is Probably The Best I Have Ever Had.
column77: Excellent Staff  Particularly Holly And I Think Lorna ( She Wore A Brace On Her Arm)
column84: Holly Excellent Pedicure And Looked After My Daughter With A Manicure And Body Massage Brilliantly. Lorna ( I Think) Who Made A Last Minute Booking Possible In The Spa. The Head Waiter On The Wednesday Night In The Brasserie Who Was Very Kind And Went The Extra Mile Offering Us The Opportunity To Eat From The A La Carte Menu On The Second Night Of Our Spa Break As We Had Had The Same Menu Two Nights Running. We Declined But I Was Very Impressed With The Offer.
column90: We Would Love To Come Back To Sopwell House And I Have Already Recommended It To My Friends And Told People Just How Wonderful It Was.

column83: On Our Second Day The Room Hadn't Been Serviced After Several 'Absences'. We Asked The Maid As We Left To Service The Room And Put The Appropriate Hanger On The Door. When We Returned Later That Night There Were Clean Towels But No Cleaning/Bedmaking Had Been Done And The Refreshments  Were Not Replaced. We Rnag Down For Some Tea Bags
column84: Reception-Very Friendly

column5: Had Difficulty Ringing Through To Reservations. Took At Least 4 Call Backs Before I Finally Got Through To Someone...And This Was On A Week Day. If I Had Been Floating Customer......I May Well Have Gone & Chosen An Alternative Hotel

column31: Generally The Staff And Service Was Very Good But Some Things Let The Hotel Down  Such As An Overbooked Spa Area  Noisy Restaurants And Lack Of Table Service In The Bar Area.
column35: I Arrived Early As I Had Treatment Bookings In The Morning.  Not Unreasonably  My Room Wasn't Ready But As The Bar And Terrace Were Closed For Private Events  And The Brasserie Was Closed And The Pool Area Was So Full (Of Very Noisy Children) There Was Nowhere Other Than The Reception Area For Me To Sit.  It Is Shame That When The Hotel Books Venues For Private Parties  It Doesn't Ensure There Is At Least One Area Open For Guests Of The Hotel.
column39: The Tea & Coffee Tray Was Not Refreshed While I Was There Suggesting The Hotel Is Seeking To Cut Costs Where It Can.
column48: The Menu Is A Little Limited But What I Ordered Was Nice And Arrived Promptly.  Room Service Staff Were Excellent.
column53: Staff Were Excellent In Delivering Food Within The Chosen Time Slot.
column64: The Brasserie Is Very Noisy And So Not A Pleasant Dining Experience.  I Waited Over Half An Hour For My Order While People Who Had Arrived After Me Were Served Sooner.  The Manager Disagreed That I Had Waited So Long And Did Not Apologise.  Other Staff Were Very Friendly.
column77: Spa Staff Are Truly Exceptional And Treatments Very Good.  However  It Was Almost Impossible To Book A Treatment (Perhaps Because It Was Half-Term).  I Suspect If It Had Been Better Weather There Would Have Been Sufficient Room In The Pool Area For All Guests (As Some Could Sit Outside) But It Was Unfortunately Very Cramped And Over Heated.
column83: Very Slow Service In The Bar Area And Non-Existent Table Service All Evenings.  Locals Appear To Know That You Need To Order At The Bar.  Not Quite The Standard You Would Expect From A Hotel Of Sopwell House's Standard.  Most Staff Were Very Courteous And Eager To Help.
column84: The Front Of House Manager I Spoke To On The Morning Of My Departure Was Very Professional And Dealt With My Issue Very Well.  I Did Not Think So Highly Of The Manager Who Disciplined Bar Staff Right In Front Of Me When I Was Sitting In The Bar Area On The Monday.  He Was Rude And Didn't Listen To The Staff's Reasonable Explanation For Why A Problem Had Arisen (Which They Had In Fact Already Dealt With).
column89: Generally The Experience Was Good But I Do Not Feel The Hotel Met My Expectations Of A 4 Star Hotel.  The Facilities Are Lovely But I Felt That Guests Lose Out In The Hotel's Drive To Maximise Profit From Every Corner Of The Hotel  Through Weddings And Private Functions.  I Sometimes Felt I Was Getting In The Way Of Other Money Making Opportunities.

column31: Sorry To Say But Sopwell Went From Being My Favourite Hotel To Being On The Not So Good List.....

column1: My Last Visit I Could Have Been At The Thistle For The Quality If Food And Room But Paid Well Over The Thistle Price.....We Have A Corporate Rate Of £55 At The Thistle But I Push To Stay At Sopwelll For The Great Service  Great Rooms And Cleanliness.....

On My Last Visit I Booked A Superior Room At £119 Per Night.....Was Told I Was Given A Upgrade To Amews Room....Which On The Website Is The Same Price So Nit Sure How It Was A Upgrade....The Room Smelt Bad  The Kitchen Area Is Old And Worn  The Boiler Door Was Wide Open  The Desk Was Stained And Not Nice To Work From  The Lounge Area Was Not Clean Or Comfortable.....Granted This Has Not Been Upgraded But To Say This Was A Upgrade Was Wrong....The Bath Room Is Not Any Where As Nice At The Main Rooms.
That Evening I Ate In The Restaurant And Was So Disappointed.

I Order A Caesar Salad With No Anchovies.....It Came Piled High With Anchovies  The Chicken Was Black From The Grill And It Had Barely Any Dressing......I've Worked In The Catering Industry For 30 Years And This Was Not Value For Money At £9.95

I Also Order A Rare Steak With New Potatoes And Rocket Salad.....It Came With Chips  The Rocket Was Limp And Hot After Having The Steak Dumped On Top  This Was Returned To The Kitchen Were I Watched The Chef Complain To The Waiter And Slap The Steak Onto Another Plate  Take The Same Limp Rocket And Soak In Balsamic Syrup And Add Some Pre Cooked Sautéed New Potatoes Which Where Greasy And Over Cooked......Worst To Come The Steak Was Well Done....
The Waiter Clearly Wasn't Interested So I Left....

The Next Day I Decided To Eat Locally But Have A Drink In The Room With A Colleague  When I Went Into The Kitchen Cupboard To Get A Glass I Could Not Believe The State Of The Glasses I Was Expected To Use.....I Reported This To Your Foh Manager Who Was Very Embarrassed......
Will I Be Back Honestly I Don't Know.....As I State The Thistle For Half The Price Could Be A Safer Bet....
My Last Revue For Sopwell Was How Good Your Service And Rooms Were  What A Contrast My Latest Visit Was.....
Best Regards
Dean

column31: I Was There With Two Friends On A Spa Experience  Which Was Excellent Value For Money. We Stayed Overnight And The Room  Breakfast And Lunch Were All Excellent.  However  I Dinner Experience Was Exceedingly Disappointing.  We Had A Table Booked For 7.30 P.M  The Head Waiter Invited Us To Order Pre-Dinner Drinks At The Table And We Ordered Cocktails.  He Then Returned And Took Our Order For Food And Wine..  The Cocktails Arrived At The Same Time As Our Starter  And The Waiter Then Proceeded To Pour The Wine.  So We Had  At One Time  Cocktail  Wine And Water  Full On The Table!!!  I Would Add That The Restaurant Was Far From Full On Our Arrival  But We Did Not Leave The Restaurant Until Gone 10.00 P.M.  People Who Had Arrived Long After Us Completed All Courses And Left Before We Got Our Dessert.  We Did Complain And Did Get An Apology  And When Asked  I Did Tell The On Duty Manager As We Were Leaving The Next Day.  There Appeared To Be A Total Lack Of Co-Ordination With Table Service.

column31: High Expectation After The Refurbishment And Booked The Exec Suite But Very Disappointed With The Location Of The Room And The Service And Breakfast Was Terrible.
column35: We Arrived At 1Pm As We'd Managed To Get Away Sooner. Check In Was 3Pm So The Team Was Well Aware We Were There And They Promised They Would Try And Get Us In The Room Early And Call Us When It Was Ready. I Had To Call Twice To Check As No One Called And We Were Checked In After 330Pm.

column5: The First Suite Room 115 Was Looking Over The Parking Lot. We Were Moved To 110 Which Was Also Overlooking The Car Park And I Cannot Believe You Have Put Your Best Rooms Facing The Car Park With Shaded Balconies Which Proved Worthless In Getting Any Sunshine.
column19: Despite Being Told Our Breakfast Would Arrive Within 30Mins  After 3-4 Phone Calls Assuring Us It Was On The Way  It Took 1Hour And 30Min To Arrive. It Was All Cold And Tasteless And The Coffee Was Watery And Cold. Very Disappointing As This Is Normally The Highlight Of Our Nights Away And We Were So Stressed And Disappointed.
column30: The Team Were Very Nice And Even Brought Us A Dessert As It Was My Wife's Birthday. The Restaurant Was However Very Nosiy
column39: N/A
column43: You Need More Outdoor Beds As The Day Was Very Hot And There Was A Shortage So We Had To Sit On Chairs

column1: Room Service On Breakfast
The Check Out Manager Was Quite Rude And Abrupt With Me
column2: Grazia Was Amazing And Went The Extra Mile Y Helping Us To Get A New Room  Sent Us Champagne At Dinner And Helped Us Get Breakfast Removed. Nothing Was Too Difficult For Her And She Managed Us Very Well. She Saved Our Stay

column31: Extremely Pleasurable Stay. The Treatments In The Spa Were Excellent  The 3 Meals We Had In The Brasserie Were All Delicious. I Will Definitely Come Again And Recommend Sopwell House To My Friends.
column39: The Only Comment I Would Have Is That The Shower In The Room's Bathroom Was The American Style  From Above  Only. Personally I Don't Like Those And Think That Adjustable Are Handier.
column64: I Have To Say That My Dish (Chicken In Red Thai Curry Sauce With Chips) Was Extremely Salty And It Was Difficult To Eat It.
column77: We Bought An Overnight Spa Package Deal. The  Two 25 Min Treatments Were Excellent  Thanks To Highly Qualified Staff (Eg Ola). However  There Is A Limited Choice Of Treatments When You Book A Package Deal. I Think More Treatments Off Your Full List Could Be Available  Just In Shortened 25 Min Versions (Eg Other Types Of Massages  Not Just The Head  Shoulders  Back Massage).
column84: Ola Who Was My Therapist In The Spa Was Excellent. The Massage And Facial I Received Were Amazing.
column89: No  It Was A Great Stay  Thank You.

column31: I Have Stayed With You A Number Of Times  And Only Recently With A Friend Overnight On Friday 6 June.  However  During My Visit I Was Extremely Disappointed Because We Were Unable To Sit In The Gardens Nor The Conservatory As The Area Had Been Booked For A Company Event.  This Was Particularly Disappointing As I Had Booked A Surprise For My Friend's 50Th And The Weather Was Extremely Warm.  However  I Am Returning Again On Sunday 29 June With 3 Other Friends For An Overnight Stay  So Hopefully My Recent Experience Will Be Forgotten About!  Your Customer Service Manager Was Aware Of My Thoughts At The Time   Perhaps An Email Or Call So That We Were Aware Beforehand Would Have Somewhat Eased The Disappointment.
column35: No  Just Generally Keep Up The Good Work And Keep Guests Informed Should You Have Another Event Whereby Certain Areas Of The Hotel Are "Out Of Bounds".  As Previously Stated  I Am Returning On Sunday 29 June And I Have Requested 2 Interconnecting Rooms.  Also  Perhaps Free Accommodation Upgrades For Our Forthcoming Visit On Sunday To Compensate For My Recent Disappointing Visit Would Be Extremely Appreciated.
column77: One Comment Regarding The Swimming Pool Area - It Was Extremely And Uncomfortably Hot.  We Could Not Sit On The Loungers And Relax.  Perhaps A Slightly Larger "Relaxation" Area Outside Of The Pool Area With A Selection Of Magazines Would Be Beneficial.
column84: Your Customer Service Manager (Cannot Remember Her Name) But She Was On The Concierge Desk(?) When We Arrived On Friday 6 June.  She Is An Asset To Your Organisation!
column90: I Will Be Back!

column31: Clean  Comfortable Room  Polite  Friendly  Helpful Staff. Beautiful Grounds.

Poor Service And Disregard Of Quiet Room Asked For When Booking Was Placed. Arrived At 2.45Pm To Check In And Was Told Room 139 Was Being Prepared  But Would Ring Mobile Phone As Soon As Room Was Ready. No Call By 3.30 Pm  So Went Back To Reception And Was Given Key Cards To Room 242. Neither Key Worked  So Had To Return To Reception For New Cards. Unable To Unpack And Change Until 3.45Pm  Missing 4.00Pm Appointment In St Albans. Allocated Room Was Right Next To A Stair Door Which Banged Shut Every Time Someone Went Through It: Was Woken Up Frequently As A Result. Will Not Be Returning.
column39: Cramped.
column53: Would Have Been More Enjoyable Without Sleep Deprivation.
column83: Already Referred To. Late Admission To Room By Reception  Malfunctioning Key Cards  Disregard Of Need For Quiet Room.

column31: We Had The Most Amazing Time It Was My Sons Wedding All The Staff Were Outstanding In Every Way. The Hotel Is Of A Very High Standard
column53: Great Breakfast Plenty To Choose From
column84: Every Member Of Staff Was Exceptional From The Banqueting Restaurant Bar Etc

column31: This Was Our Second Stay - It Was A Lovely Experience Only Let Down By Poor Facilities In The Room This Time. There Was No Remote For The Tv  No Menu For Room Service And No Robes.

column31: A Lovely Warm Welcome For Birthday Celebration. Relaxed And Comfortable Surroundings.
column39: It Was Nice That Our Party Were In Adjoining Rooms
column83: Items On Final Bill That Were Queried But Then Removed
column84: Jodie From The Spa For Fantastic Massage And F Facial Treatment  One Of Best Ever!

column31: My Two Friends And I Visit Sopwell Every Year For A Spa Break And We Always Have A Wonderful Time. We Booked The Friday Spa Package Which Gives You Lunch On The Day You Leave. I Would Like To Suggest The You Make That The Day You Arrive As Your Breakfast Is So Good  We Can't Manage Lunch On The Same Day As Well. We Did Change It On This Occasion And Your Staff Were  As Always  Extremely Helpful. Keep Up The Good Work Guys And We Are Already Looking Forward To Next Years Visit (If Not Before!!)
column35: Excellent As Always.
column84: I Didn't Get His Name Unfortunately But The Young Man Who Helped Us With Our Bags. He Made Us Feel Really Special And It Got Our Break Off To A Great Start.
column90: The Only Reason I Disagreed With The Final Account Comment Is That A Bottle Of Wine Which Was Not Ours Was Put On Our Bill. We Had A Bottle Of Rose For £20 But Were Charged For A £40 Bottle Of Chardonnay (Which I Don't Drink). The Lady At Reception Sorted It Out Without Any Problem.

column31: The Managent Were Superb The Beds Most Comfy. The Food Good. The Reception Welcome Pleasant And Welcoming  Thanks So Much.
column89: Writing Paper And Envelopes In Bedroom

column31: Very Nice  Although A Few Niggles.  Noisy Housekeeping With No Regard To Resting Guests And A Manager Who Shrugged Her Shoulders When Our Bedroom Window Wouldn't Open And No Other Rooms Were Available.
column83: As Mentioned Before  Housekeeping Were Very Noisy With No Regard To Resting Guests And A Manager Was Unprofessional In Her Attitude Towards Us.
column84: The Manager Who Spoke To My Wife  But Didn't Acknowledge Her Name

column31: The Spa And Treatments Were Fantastic.

column1: The Food In The Brasserie Was Not Of A Good Standard For The Amount We Paid.
The Room Décor Was Nothing Special.
column5: The Receptionist Tried To Sell Us An Upgrade And First She Quoted £40 And Then When We Declined She Quoted Us £30  I Thought This Was Poor Service And Standards And Not What I Expected From Sopwell.
column31: Fair
column34: The Wine Glasses Looked Like They Belonged In A Pub! The Presentation Of Our Steak Was Poor. The Cheese Board Could Have Been Made In 2 Minutes In Someone's Home - Not Something You Want To Pay £7 For!
column47: The Swimming Pool Had A Plaster And Dirt In It By The Stairs As You Enter The Pool.
column60: We Arrived At 2Pm And Wanted To Use The Spa As Our Treatments Were At 4 And We Had To Leave Early The Next Day. One Spa Receptionist Said That We Could Not Use The Spa Till 3 Even Though It Was Not Busy  Thankfully Another Therapist And Allowed Us To Use The Spa Facilities. We Paid A Lot Of Money And This Was A Treat For Us  We Wanted To Make The Most Of It And So We Really Appreciated That The Therapist Understood And Obliged Our Request
column64: Nikki

column31: Great. Very Friendly And Accomdating Staff. Lovely Food.
Lovely Hotel   Nice Staff . Comfy Beds
column48: Long Time To Get Anyone To Answer The Phone. When It Came It Was For One Not Two People. Ended Up Walking To The Bar To Re Order

column31: Stayed For A Wedding  The Service We Received Throughout The Whole Event Was Exemplary. The Staff Were Excellent  The Care And Friendliness Whilst Being Very Professional Was Outstanding. I Would Recommend Sopwell House Without Hesitation. The Only Negative Comment Is The Layout Of The Building Which Is Very Confusing At Times  Maybe Better Signage To Varying Public Rooms Would Help.
column39: I Feel That A Mini Fridge In The Room Would Be An Advantage  Especially In Hot Weather.
column48: We Ordered Room Service With Breakfast At 9Am  This Was Delivered Exactly On Time  Amazing Service

column31: Room Was Good And Restaurant Acceptable. Reception Below Expected
column35: Only One Person On Duty With A Queue To Check In

column1: A Gentleman Came Out To Help And Took My Details But Then Disappeared Into The Office And Never Came Back Out  I Consider This Very Discourteous.
column19: My Table Was Given To Someone Else At Breakfast In Between Me Being Seated And Going To Get My Breakfast
column39: N/A
column49: As Mentioned Previously  The Gentleman Checking Me In Went Into The Office And Did Not Come Back Out. Eventually Someone Else Came Out And I Did Mention What Had Happened But They Appeared Disinterested
column53: Disagree
column64: 19 June 2019

column31: A Lovely Experience
column89: No

column2: Thank You For A Lovely Stay

column31: On Arrival We Were Greeted Well By Reception Staff.At The Time We Were Asked If We Wanted To Have A Bill For Extra's At The End  But Declined Saying That We Would Pay As We Went.We Deceided To Have Afternoon Tea And Ordered On Terrace.After Ordering My Husband Thought It Would Be Best To Have A Running Bill So Went Bact To Reception To Ask Only To Be Told It Was Not Possible Now (This Was By A Different Member Of Staff )

column1: We Waited For An Hour For The Afternoon Tea As They Had Forgotten Our Order Manager Was Very Good And Chased It Up For Us.
We Had Friends Meeting Us At 5.30 For Drinks As This Was A Treat For My Husbands 65Th Birthday.

They Arrived In Terrace Area Before And Ordered Drinks.When We Arrived We Also Ordered More Drinks The Bar Staff That Served Us Was Badly Trained And Did Not Know How To Make A Lime & Soda There Was A Fuss Over The Wine Order And A Cider Was Also Ordered When Asked If He Had Ever Worked In A Bar Before Was Told It Was His First Week.My Husband Asked If He Could Take Off The Bottle Top And The Said Staff Member Replyed I Can't Find Opener  What Do You Want Me To Do Open It With My Teeth.As You Can Imagin My Husband Was Shocked By This Reply.At This Point Another Member Of Staff Came To Take Over Situation.
This Is The 6Th Time I Have Stayed At Hotel Over The Years My Daughter Stayed For Her Hen Weekend  There Were 10 Of Us At That Time.
As You Can Imagin This Has Made Us Think About Staying Here Again.
We Had Stayed At Limewood In New Forrest The Previous Weekend And Our Expieriance Could Not Have Been More Different.
We Are Business Owers Ourself's And Understand The Importance Of Customer Service Especially In The Hospitality Industry.
As We Live In Bournemouth And Travelled Some Distance For This Weekend We Were Disappointed.
P Macwilliam
column5: As Commented Staff On Arrival Were Friendly
column9: There Was No Mini Bar Not Even A Bottle Of Water As It Was Very Warm.

column35: You Have A Fantastic Lady That Welcomed Us When We Arrived And Showed Us To The Check-In Desk;I Feel Very Embarrassed That I Have Forgotten Her Name  But She Was Excellent!

column31: The Hotel Is Lovely But The Service In The Terrace Bar And The Resaturant Was Appalling. People Were Waiting 45 Minutes For Their Drinks  Let Alone Food  At The Terrace Bar. We Had Pre Ordered Our Meal As Requested In The Restaurant But We Waited An Hour To Get Our First Course. We Were Seated Next To A Hen Party Which Was Not Good For Either Us Or The Hen Part. If You Take A Hen Party Booking Then Arrange For A Separate Area For Them To Eat; It Is Unfair To Inflict Them On Others And Unfair For Them Not To Be Able To Enjoy Themselves. We Left The Restaurant Early Because Of The Noise And Very Poor Service.
column64: As Already Stated  It Was Appalling And Disappointing.
column83: As Already Explained The Service In Both The Brasserie Was Appalling; Disorganised  Slow  Staff Were Too Busy And Untrained.
column89: Have Well Trained And Efficient Staff Serving. Pre Planning - If You Have A Busy Night In The Restaurant Then Take That Into Account And Staff Accordingly And Lay Tables Out Accordingly. Don't Squash Everyone Together Just To Get More Money.. Don't Overcrowd And Take Bookings You Can't Cater For. It Was A Very Unpleasant And Disappointing Experience.
column90: I Left My Phone Charger In Room 102. I Stayed 13/14 June. I Phoned Up On Monday 15 June And Paid For It To Be Sent Back To Me. I Have Still Not Received It.

column31: Friendly Reception  Good Comfortable Rooms  Quiet At Night.
column90: Having Stayed At Sopwell Many Times  I Expect Excellent Service!

column31: Sopwell House Has Great Facilities  Very Clean And Well Kept  The Food Was Fantastic! As This Was The First Time At Sopwell On A 'Over Night Spa Day' I Thought A Member Of Staff Would Show Us Around And Explain The Procedure. We Found Ourselves Confused And Searching For Help From Staff And Customers. When We Asked Questions Staff Were Polite But Vague. We Ask If The Lockers Took £1 Coins A Member Of Staff Said 'Yes' But The Lockers Were Not. It Would Of Been Nice If A Member Of Staff Had Explained How To Use Your Lockers Instead We Had To Ask A Customer. Checking Out Our Luggage Before Having Our Treatments Cause A Few Problems Too  As We Had To Recall Our Luggage From Reception  Drag Them Up Stairs And Through To A Very Busy Changing Room. I Would Consider Coming Back But Not On A Overnight Spa  Its Too Much Hassle. I Hope My Comments Help With The Future Of Your Company.
column64: At 3 O'clock We Sat In The Conservatory To Order A Light Snack  We Were Told They Were Only Serving Drinks And Cakes. I'm Not Sure If This Was Correct Because 5 Minutes Later A Lady Was Served Chips.
column83: Yes  Mentioned In Other Areas Of The Questionnaire.

column31: We Enjoyed Our Stay  Although The Outside Part Of An Air Conditioning Unit Was Quite Noisy. Possibly On The Roof?
column53: We Only Stayed For The Weekend. This Meant Having To Leave The Room At 11Am My Wife Was Unable To Enjoy The Spa Facilities As There Was No Where To Change Etc.

column31: The Pool And Surroundings Are Very Peaceful And Luxurious. We Really Enjoyed Our Day There.
column64: It Was Very Nice And The Food Was Good But It Was An Expensive Lunch For Us.

column31: Have Been To Sopwell House Many Time Over The Years And We Had Our Third Stay This Year And Have Say With Great Disappointment The Experience Overall Was Not A Good One Compared To Previous Visits.

column1: We Upgraded Our Room Which In Itself Was Fine However Many Lights Were Not Working  The Radiator In The Bathroom Was Not Working And The Room Was Cold Overall.  Room Service Was Incorrect Whereby Only One Meal Was Sent So We Needed Up Eating At Different Times.

The Room Was Situated Over The Conference Venue And There Happen To A Wedding On Whilst We Were Staying Which Itself I Have No Problem With   However The Music Could Be Heard In Our Room Until 1Am! To Top It Off We Were Then Disturbed My Room Keeping At 8Am Walking Into Our Room And Wake Us  Again A Error On There Behalf   I Feel Very Strongly That We Should Have Been Advised Of The Risk Of This Union Check In And Been Offered Another Room.

Also In The Spa The Sauna Was Not Working And There Was Free Loungers As Many Had Towels/Robes Placed On Them However No Guests To Be Seen?! When We Did Many To Secure Loungers We Found On Two Occasions That Staff Had Removed Our Towels Whilst We Were Swimming Therefore A) Left Us Without Towels Or Robes And B) Again With No Loungers!

I Felt Though The Staff Did Apologises Once We Mentioned Some Of The Issues Nothing Was Really Done To Ease The Issues.  On A Plus The Restaurant Manager Was Very Good Once We Advised In The Morning Of The Room Service Error And Removed The Food Of The Bill.
column5: There Was Limited Parking On Arrival And We Not Offered Our Luggage To Take To Our Room Nor Was There A Someone To Assist With The Doors.
column18: Please See My Previous Comment Around The Room Service Incident.
column31: Fair
column47: On All Visits The Spa Does Seem To Have Guest Than Can Be Catered In Way Of Loungers/Seating Area.
column53: Room Service - Took A Few Calls To Place A Order As The Line Would Just Ring With No Answer

column1: Spa
-Please See Main Comments

column8: As We Have Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stays Over Years And Particularly The First Two Stays This Year So Have So Many Hiccups On This Stay Was Very Disappointing.  Understand That A Many Issues May Have Been Down To The Size Of The Wedding Party Being Catered For However Sure Issues Could Have Been Resolved And Dealt With In Much Better Way.

column31: Lovely To Be Back At Sopwell House Again.  We Originally Had Our Honeymoon There 18 Years Ago And Have Stayed With You A Few Times Since.  Enjoyed The Gym  Spa  Eating In Brassiere And Orangery.  However There Were A Couple Of Disappointments: When I Booked On The Website I Asked Someone To Call Me Regarding Booking Some Spa Treatments And Nobody Did.  Also When Booking The Brassiere At The Reception  My Booking Was A Surprise To The Brassiere And They Nearly Could Not Accommodate.
column35: When I Booked On The Website I Asked Someone To Call Me Regarding Booking Some Spa Treatments And Nobody Did!

Please Have A Pot Of Butter As Well As Salt & Pepper Per Table  General Trend Was Sharing!
column64: Food And Staff Lovely. As Mentioned Before  Our Booking Made At The Reception For The Brassiere Was Not Communicated And Was Nearly An Unnecessary Crisis.

column1: Please Have A Pot Of Butter As Well As Salt & Pepper Per Table  General Trend Was Sharing!

column1: Bathrobes And Slippers Great Although I Had Heard That You Ran Out Sometime On The Saturday.  Pool Really Well Kept.

column8: Italian Lady At Reception Was Absolutely Lovely And Attentive A Real Star.  Young Asian Porter (?David) Was Very Friendly And Helpful.

column53: Superb Choice  Superb Service  Superb Room
column64: Cant Fault A Thing  The Food Was Exceptional  The Staff Were Above And Beyond Exceptional  Truly Fantastic
column84: Tansin In The Conservatory Bar Was A Lovely Man  So Friendly And Helpful
column89: The Only Disappointing Thing Was The 3 Rooms I Had Booked Did Not All Have The Same Facilities. 2 Rooms Had Gowns And Water And Fruit Whilst The 3Rd Room Had No Gowns And Water And Fruit .. My Mum Rang Down And Asked For Some Water And Was Told It Would Be £6 So Didn't Bother Getting Any. Also We Were Booked Into Rooms Directly Over A Wedding Party  It Was Very Noisy. Even After The Music Finished There Was Loud Noise From Party Revellers Who Then Made Their Way Noisily Down The Corridor.It Was Around 3Am When Everything Calmed Down And It Really Did Spoil The One Night We Had Booked ... Had We Been  Staying A Second Night It Wouldn't Have Been So Disappointing.
column90: I Really Think When A Wedding Is Being Held  Guests Staying In Rooms Near By Should Be Made Aware And Even Offered A Little Compensation Such As A Bottle Of Wine In The Room If No Other Rooms Were Available. This Was The Only Thing That Let Our Stay Down ... Quieter Rooms Would Have Been So Much Better. But I Must Say The Hotel And Service Was Absolutely Brilliant ... The Staff Need To Be Made Aware Of Just How Good They All Are And The Chef .... What Can I Say ... Blooming Brilliant. Thank You For Helping Me Make By 50Th Birthday So Special.

column31: Very Good Deal. Disappointed With Treatments Booked For One Of Our Party With Their 2 25 Minute.

Pedicure Was Shocking And Had To Take It Off When I Got Home. Very Obvious She Was Less Experienced. After Care Very Poor. Wasn't Shown Any Relaxation Area And Didn't Say Goodbye Or Ask How My A Treatment Was.
column83: See Previous Comment. Overall Experience Was Excellent Apart From The Beauty Therapist I Experienced
column84: Reception Team And Concierge In Terms If Their Welcome And Housekeeping In Terms Of Room Standard
column89: Just Need To Ensure All Therapist Are At The Right Level Before Allowing Them To Do Treatment. This One Therapist Did Dampen My Own Experience  Otherwise Would Have Exceeded My Expectations

column31: Excellent! We Celebrated Our Daughter  Vishna's 30Th Birthday.  There Were 8 Of Us.  My Daughter Has Multiple Medical Problems Together With Learning Disabilities.  Jenny Meticulously Organised All Our Requirements.  She Communicated This To All Other Managers Who Were So Kind.  Everyone Went The Extra Mile To Make This Stay A Very Special One.  The Made My Daughter Feel Very Special And Greeted Her With Warmth And Compassion.  Thank You.
column35: We Arrived In A Hummer And All The Staff Came Out To Greet Us With Drinks.  This Was A Surprise And Made Us Feel Very Welcome And Special.  Thank You.
column39: We Were Happy With All Our Rooms.  Thank You.
column53: The Staff Were All Kind.  I Cannot Remember The Manager's Name (White  Tall Male) Who Was Asking Us All The Time If We Were Ok And Need Anything.  It Made Us Feel Very Special And Looked After.  We Have A Vegetarian Diet And The Chef Also Made Vegetarian Sausages For Breakfast And Dal Makhani (Lentils) For Lunch.  Special Thank You To The Manager And Chef.
column64: The Same Manager Accommodated Our Lunch On The First Day In The Reception Area Since The Other Places Were Full.  He Was Very Attentative.  He Went The Extra Mile To Make Sure We Were Comfortable.  Thank You.
column77: We Enjoyed All The Facilities.  Thank You.
column84: Jenny  The Overall Manager Who Came To Greet Us   The Brasserie Manager  Geeta (Asian Lady Who Greeted Us In The Reception And Another Lady (White  Middle Aged) Who Had Only Started Work At Sopwell House Just Before Our Arrival.  Thank You All Staff.  Your Kindness And Support Was Very Much Appreciated.
column89: Thank You To Jenny For Your Kindness  Support And Co-Ordination Of A Very Well Organised Weekend.
column90: Thank You To All Staff.  Your Generosity In Looking After Our Needs Did Not Go Unnoticed.  God Bless.  Sorry I Am Replying A Little Late.  My Husband Has Multiple Fractures In Both Arms And Had To Have Major Surgery To Put Metal Plates Etc.

The Food Was A Bit Bland And The Drinks Were Very Overpriced  We Were Given The Wrong Drinks By The Bar And Told To Keep Them Under The Impression That They Were Free  But When We Looked At The Bill The Following Day We Were Actually Charged. The Staff Were Very Pleasant And Helpful  We Just Found The Hotel To Be A Little Bit Of A Conveyor Belt At Times And Maybe Not As Relaxed As It Could Have Been.
column35: Arrival Was A Little Bit Manic And Not Very Organised.
column39: Although Well Equipped It Was Very Poorly Laid Out And We Were Next To The Generator And At The Top Of The Back Stairs  Which Meant That We Could Not Open The Curtains Or Sleep As Well As We Expected To.
column53: Breakfast Was Very Very Disorganised And Frustrating  We Were Not Given Any Guidance Or Help And Just Had To Sort It Out For Ourselves  Although The Breakfast Itself Was Very Nice.

column84: The Bar Staff Were Pleasant Until They Decided That They Were Going To Shut The Bar And As A Consequence Slammed The Doors Shut On Us   Which Made Us Feel Very Unwelcome  And Being Giver The Wrong Drinks And Being Charged For Them Is Very Wrong.
column89: There' Was A Very Rushed Feeling About The Hotel  Which Made It Quite Difficult To Relax And Enjoy Being There. It Did Spoil Our Experience .
column90: I Think The Hotel Needs To Make There Guests Feel More Relaxed And Stop Trying To Pack In To Many Different Events. We Tried To Pop Into The Lounge Area For A Coffee Only To Be Told Unless We Had Booked And Afternoon Tea We Couldn't Enter  It Just Felt Unfair As Unlike Someone Who's Come For The Day  We Were Actually Staying At The Hotel. This Is Just A Little Example Of How We Felt When We Were There.

column39: 259 - A Really Wonderful Room  Comfortable Materials  Decor And  Really Importantly  Temperature. Very Quiet  Even Though I Know You Had A Full House The Night I Stayed.
column53: The Team Was Working Very Hard And Took A Little Longer Than I Might Have Expected To Offer Tea Or Coffee. A Really Minor Issue  But I'm Sure You Aspire To Offering The Very Best Service. Offering Diners Tea When They Are Seated Could Reduce The Number Of Transactions  Whilst Boosting Perceived Efficiency. I Rarely Need Cooked Breakfast  And Certainly Didn't Given The Generous Dinner I Enjoyed At Sopwell The Night Before  So The Cost Of Breakfast Seemed A Little High.
column64: I Thoroughly Enjoyed The Food. High Quality Ingredients  Well Cooked And Served In Very Generous Portions.

column1: The Only Slight Issue Was That I Ordered A Side Salad As A Starter And My Main Was Brought Well Before I Had Finished My Starter. It Was Taken Back And Brought Again  Without Issue. The Light Level Was A Little Low. Lone Business Diners Often Like To Read Whilst Waiting  And The Lack Of Light Makes That More Difficult.
column26: More Staff To Speed Checkout In The Morning. One Additional Member Of Staff Did Come To Assist And Got Everything Moving But It Could Have Been Better Resourced And More Efficient.

column35: I Had Booked A Mews Room But When We Checked In  The Receptionist Just Said "I Know That You Had Booked A Mews Room But We Have Booked You Into A Room In The Hotel Overlooking The Gardens".  When I Queried Why  She Was Unsure And I Explained That I Had Booked The Room For My Husband's Birthday And Wanted The Mews Room.  She Didn't Say To Me "We Know You Booked... But Sorry We Have Had To Book You Into The Hotel  She Just Told Us That Was That". She Then Spoke To The Manager Who Came Out And Again Said The Same.  I Reiterated It Was For A Birthday Surprise And The Manager Then Said That It Was Because Of Maintenance Issues.

column1: She Did Offer An Executive Room Which We Accepted Because We Could Definitely Not Get The Mews Room We Requested.  The Manager Didn't Apologise The Receptionist Did.  However  When We Went To The Room  The View Was Overlooking The Side Car Park - Not The Picturesque Views We Had Wanted!  We Did Try To Change The Room Because Of This  But Nothing Was Available.

Whilst We Were Happy With Our Room And Could Not Fault It I Was Very Disappointed To Be Told We Couldn't Have The Room That I Had Booked And Only On Speaking To The Manager Were We Told It Was Maintenance Issues.  The Receptionist Was Just Happy To Book Us In The Hotel.  It Was Only That I Knew The Mews Room Was Not Part Of The Hotel Building Itself That I Picked Up On The Change.

We Did Have An Enjoyable Stay With You But As It Was My Husband's Birthday Surprise It Was Disappointing Not To Get What We Had Booked.  I Appreciate That Things Do Happen But I Think The Situation Could Of Been Handled Differently.
Many Thanks

column31: Initially Confused Experience - Day Originally Requested Was Not Available Therefore Opted For The Day Before Our Preferred Date Yet When We Arrived The Receptionist Said We Were Not Expected Until The Following Day  Which Was The Day Originally Requested And Declined?!   Sincerely Glad We Could Be Accommodated On Day We Did Arrive And Had Booking Confirmation For Otherwise Would Have Been Far Less Than Impressed.   Unfortunately Mix Up Continued When Presented For Dinner As Although We Had Been Allocated 7.30Pm Reservation The Restaurant Didn't Have Us On The List For That Day!  Otherwise And Despite An Agonising Back Pain I Arrived With  Our Stay Was Very Relaxing. Surroundings Are Comfortable  Facilities Good Though Did Wonder How Comfortable An Experience It Would Have Been Had We Visited At The Weekend - Envisage Spa And Changing Area Would Not Accommodate Larger Visitor Numbers So Well And Would Lose The Serenity Experienced On An Early Week Day.  Food Was Lovely And Staff Likewise.  Special Thanks To The Two Natalie's In The Spa For Their Patience During My Treatments Given I Had Mobility Issues Due To An Agonising Back Complaint.  They Left Me Feeling V Relaxed And I Found Them To Be Warm And Friendly.   In Summary  Stay  Staff  Facilities And The Weather Made For An Enjoyable And Relaxing Stay.  Would Like To Have Stayed Longer .
column35: Sorry Inadvertently Provided Answer To This In The Previous Section.
column39: Lovely And Spacious Room And Bathroom.  With A Crippling Back It Was However A Shock Having To Take Steep Stairs To Our 2Nd Floor Room.  If There Is A Lift We Were Not Made Aware Of The Fact.   I Didn't Mention My Back Problem As I Am Not One To Make A Fuss But I Was In Pain And The Spa Visit I Hoped Would Bring Relief. On Reflection And Considering There Were Guests More Senior In Years I Do Wonder How They Would Manage The Stairs.  Perhaps I Looked Healthy Enough To Take The Stairs?  My Mention Of This Really Is With A View To Staff Taking More Notice Of The Customer Which In My Experience Helps To Anticipate Needs Enabling Opportunity To Ensure First Class Customer Service  Not That The Level Of Service Was In Any Way Poor But There Is Room For Improvement.  A Bottle Of Water And Drinking Glasses On The Service Tray Would Have Been Welcome - I Found Just 2 Sachets Of Coffee On The Tray A Mean Offering  Ditto One Small Bottle Of Body Wash For 2 People.  Perhaps As Ours Was A Gift Voucher Booking (In Celebration Of A Milestone Anniversary) The Norm Is To Provide The Most Limited Of Room Compliments.  I Would Expect That Had We Requested More These Will Have Been Provided But The Point Is One Should Not Find The Need To.
column53: At Busy Times A Toasting Machine May Prove Beneficial And Enable Guests To Take Toast With Their Breakfast Than Encounter Delay Awaiting An Order For Same From The Kitchen.

column1: All Dishes Were Delicious And Staff Appropriately Attentive.
column14: Facilities All Very Nice But A Pity The Spa Does Not Occupy More Space.  Were Guest Numbers To Increase As We Were Told Is The Case When Really Good Deals Are Offered And At The Weekend  It Was Apparent From The Tranquility We Enjoyed That This Enjoyable Sense Would Be Threatened When There Is A Greater Numbers Of Guests Using The Spa  Pool  Jacuzzi  Steam Room And Sauna.  Some Spa Members Confirmed Our Thoughts As They Spoke Themselves Of The Negative Impact On The Ambience At Busier Times.   Just To Add That I Would Have Loved For There To Have Been A Blow Dry Bar In The Spa.   The Spa Decor Up To The Treatment Rooms Is Very Nice.
column20: None Really Other Than The Booking Confusion That Resulted In Us Not Being Able To Visit On Our Preferred Date And Not Being Expected On The Day The Hotel Booked Us In For.
column21: I Arrived With Agonising Back/ Hip Pain And The Two Natalie's In The Spa Were So Patient And Understanding - Due To The Pain I Was In It Took A While For Me To Be Able To Get To An Upright Position From Sitting Or Lying Down And Both These Young Ladies Were Very Patient With Me.  For A Middle Aged Lady Movement Was Particularly Painful When I Visited But I Enjoyed My Treatments And Found The Two Natalie's So Considerate  Friendly And Welcoming.   All Staff In The Spa Were Helpful  Informative  Down To Earth And Wholly Competent In Delivering A High Level Of Customer Service.  Their Approach And Service Delivery Are A Credit To The Hotel And Left Me Wishing I Could Have Stayed For Longer.
column26: In The Main Expectations Were Met But For Reasons Outlined Within This Feedback There Is Room For Improvement If All Guests Are To Feel Genuinely Valued Customers.
column27: The House And Grounds Are Beautiful And We Had A Lovely Stay And Fabulous Weather.. Comments Made Are Not To Criticise As There Is Much That Is Very Good At Sopwell And Are Intended To Be Viewed As An Honest And Helpful Point Of View.

column1: It Would Be Nice To Find Information On The History Of Sopwell And It's House Within Guest Rooms. The Location Of The Secured Booklet On Display In Reception Is Not Well Thought Out. It Is Right By The Point At Which Guests Engage With Reception Staff And Limits Privacy Of Conversation If Someone Is Stood Reading The Book Alongside.  I Managed A Quick Read Of Some Pages Before Someone Approached The Desk Before Feeling Compelled To Give Space For Privacy In Their Conversation With Reception.  It Looks An Interesting Read But To Have It Fixed And No Apparent Alternative Format Of Interesting Content From It Around The Hotel I Think Is A Pity.
Travelling Outside Of Rush Hour The Hotel Is Just 40 Mins Drive For Us Door To Door And We Hope To Have The Good Fortune To Revisit Again In The Future (Minus The Back Complaint).

column31: Normally  As In Previous Years  I Would Say Brilliant  But Unfortunately This Year My Guests And I Were Not As Happy.  This Was Due To A Small Piece Of Glass Found In The Beef Stroganoff On The Day Of Our Departure Where My Guest Uncomfortably Removed It From Her Mouth.  Fortunately It Did Not Cut Her  But As You Can Imagine It Put Us All Off Our Food.  The Manager At The Time Was Very Apologetic And Did Not Charge Us For The Soft Drinks We Had  But I Feel My Guests May Try And Persuade Us To Go Elsewhere Next Year  Which Will Be A Shame.  I Appreciate These Things Happen And Will Still Push To Come To Sopwell House Next Year (Already Booked)  As In The Past We Have All Had Such Fun And The Treatments We Have In The Spa Are Wonderful.  Once Again I Must Praise Holly For Her Professionalism.  I Would Also Like To Say Although We Were Asked Not To Go To The Pool Until 2 Pm. As It Would Be Too Busy  It Was Actually Empty At That Time And I Feel That If We Were Allowed To Used The Facilities Sooner  We Would Not Have Felt The Need To Leave Sopwell House Soon After Arriving At Approximately 11.30 To Go To The Nearby Park For A Stroll.  This Was Also Due To A Wedding On Your Grounds Which Restricted Us Using Them.  However   If We Could Have Used The Facilities  As We Have Done So In The Past  We Would Have Happily Stayed At Sopwell And Had Lunch There.  I Feel It Is Necessary To Let You Know Of Our Disappointments At Sopwell House This Year.  With Kind Regards  Francesca Steadman

We Had A Fantastic Stay. The Room Was Superb  And Very Clean  The Pool And Spa Facilities Really Excellent  And Our Meal In The Bistro Was Delicious. Overall  We Really  Really Enjoyed Our Stay.

column1: However  There Were Two Problems I Experienced. The First Is That On The 'Comments' Section When Booking I Mentioned That It Was My Girlfriend's Birthday And That If There Was The Possibility Of An Upgrade Or Anything To Make It Special That I Would Appreciate It. The Person Who Checked Us In Essentially Read This Request Out In Front Of My Girlfriend. It Was Highly Embarrassing For Me. This Information Should Have Been Treated Discreetly. Secondly  I Had Booked Afternoon Tea And Again  In Advance  Asked If There Was Anything That Could Be Done To Make That A Little More Special As It Was On My Girlfriend's Actual Birthday. I Got Told That "We Can Offer A Nicely Decorated Birthday Plate To Celebrate Your Girlfriend's Birthday On Sunday 6Th July At 14:00." This Didn't Happen. I Followed Up By Email With Lucila Ito And She Said She Would Look Into It And Would I Give A Few Days For Her To Respond. This Was On The 7Th July And To Date I Have Had No Reply.

Whilst I Appreciate That The Offer Was Made As A Kind Gesture  Not As A Standard  It Was A Shame That It Didn't Happen. I'm A Little Disappointed That It Couldn't Have Been Made A Little Bit More Special With A Splash Of Customer Service!
I Would Love To Come Back And Stay Again  But I Have To Admit To Being A Little Nervous That Should Any Real Customer Issues Arrive They Would Not Be Dealt With Based On This Experience.
column23: It Was Very  Very Busy In The Breakfast Room And It Wasn't Immediately Clear How We Got Hot Drinks Or Toast  Although A Waiter Did Come And Ask What We Wanted Soon After We'd Sat Down. The Toast Wasn't Very 'Toasted' Either!

column1: There Were Two Problems I Experienced. The First Is That On The 'Comments' Section When Booking I Mentioned That It Was My Girlfriend's Birthday And That If There Was The Possibility Of An Upgrade Or Anything To Make It Special That I Would Appreciate It. The Person Who Checked Us In Essentially Read This Request Out In Front Of My Girlfriend. It Was Highly Embarrassing For Me. This Information Should Have Been Treated Discreetly. Secondly  I Had Booked Afternoon Tea And Again  In Advance  Asked If There Was Anything That Could Be Done To Make That A Little More Special As It Was On My Girlfriend's Actual Birthday. I Got Told That "We Can Offer A Nicely Decorated Birthday Plate To Celebrate Your Girlfriend's Birthday On Sunday 6Th July At 14:00." This Didn't Happen. I Followed Up By Email With Lucila Ito And She Said She Would Look Into It And Would I Give A Few Days For Her To Respond. This Was On The 7Th July And To Date I Have Had No Reply.

Whilst I Appreciate That The Offer Was Made As A Kind Gesture  Not As A Standard  It Was A Shame That It Didn't Happen. I'm A Little Disappointed That It Couldn't Have Been Made A Little Bit More Special With A Splash Of Customer Service!
I Would Love To Come Back And Stay Again  But I Have To Admit To Being A Little Nervous That Should Any Real Customer Issues Arrive They Would Not Be Dealt With Based On This Experience.

I Had Previously Stayed At Sopwell House In May And Had A Thoroughly Enjoyable Experience.  The Service Was Incredible  Hence I Decided To Arrange A Joint Birthday Weekend For My Parents To Enjoy The Same Experience I Had Had.  Unfortunately This Turned Out Not To Be The Case.  They Were Forgotten About When They Had Asked For A Cup Of Tea At The Bar  And Had Waited For 20 Mins Whilst They Watched The Bar Tender Serve Drinks For Others.  Then They Were Not Told That The Package I Had Bought Included Lunch.  When I Had Stayed Previously We Were All Told At Check-In That Lunch Will Be Served At 1Pm The Following Day.  So Unbeknown To My Parents They Checked Out At 11Am And Were Still Not Told Of The Lunch. I Was Most Disanointed That Their Overall Opinion Was Nowhere Near The Standard That I Had Experienced Earlier In May.  I Understand A Wedding Was Also Taking Place But This Does Not Excuse The Lack Of Service.
column35: The Lunch Which Was Included In The Package I Had Bought Was Not Stated At Reception To My Parents.  The Details Of The Package Which I Had Printed Out Was Handed Over To Reception Was Not Returned So They Were Unaware The Lunch Was Included The Next Day.

column31: We Loved This Hotel.  One Or Two Quirks  Mainly To Do With Information On-Site E.G. Very Few Signs And No Plans  Little Info In The Bedroom  Had To Ask Where The Spa Was And Where Breakfast Room Was Located.

column1: Breakfast: Hot Water Ran Out And Took Too Long To Replace After I Had Had To Ask  Which Shouldn't Be Necessry.  It Was A Busy Morning  But Only 2 Flasks Of Hot Water.  The Toaster Should Be In A Museum!  Otherwise  Good Food And Selection.  We Were Part Of A Family Wedding Group  But Only Afterwards Did We Learn There Was A 2Nd Breakfast Room And That Some Of Our Family Were In Another Room.  We Were Really Disappointed About This  And Heard Other Guests (Not Our Party) Making The Same Comments.  Some Family Members Who We Don't See Often Had Travelled A Long Way And We Missed Spending Time With Them Because Of The 2 Breakfast Rooms.  The Hotel Could Learn From Cheaper Hotel Chains About Breakfast Service.

Spa Was Lovely - When We Found It!  Again  No Signs.  Once Past The Spa Reception  We Had To Ask Other Guests Where The Changing Rooms Were And Both Of Us (Female & Male) Missed Seeing The Baskets For Used Towels In The Changing Rooms.

Check-Out Took Far Too Long.  The Hotel Must Have Known How Many People Were Staying For One Night On Account Of The 2 Wedding Parties.  We Were Not There At The Last-Minute  But There Was No Facility For Quick Check-Out For Those Who'd Pre-Paid  So In Front Of Us There Were Guests Who Were Paying  Booking Taxis Etc. Which Delayed Us Unnecessarily.  Surely There Could Be A Quick Drop-Off  Followed By E-Mail Receipt?  We Weren't In A Particular Rush  But It Was Irritating That A Member Of Staff Was Being Used To Chat To Waiting Guests ('Have You Enjoyed Your Stay?' Etc.) Instead Of Used To Reduce The Queue!  Overall  We Found Staff To Be Friendly And Helpful.

We Really Liked The Hotel And Hope To Find A Reason To Visit Again.  I Was About To E-Mail With These Comments  Before Receiving This Form.  My Criticisms Are Small In The Context Of A Pleasant Stay  And Could Be Addressed Very Easily With Organisation And Very Little Financial Input Needed.

column60: As Guests At O'brien Wedding (25.07.14) We Enjoyed The Whole Experience Of A Traditional  Formal Wedding.  The M/C (Howard) Was Exceptional.  Sopwell House Clearly Runs To A Well-Tested Programme  But As Guests It Felt That Everyone Was Made To Feel Special.  It Was A Shame That The Wedding Meal Was Held In A Slightly Gloomy Room With Curtains Drawn In Day-Time  But Realise The Hosts Might Have Requested That For Privacy.

column1: Although I Have Stayed In A Few Hotel / Spa Resorts  This Was My First Stay At Sopwell And I Can Honestly Say That On A Personal Note I Have Never Been So Impressed With Every Aspect Of A Hotel / Spa.

Starting On Arrival  The Staff Were Extremely Professional And Polite. The Rooms Were Immaculate  Spacious And Exceeded My Expectations. Every Member Of Your Team Were Beyond Helpful No Matter What The Request And Carried Out Their Duties With A Smile. The Spa Facilities  Restaurants And Bars Were Welcoming  Comfortable And To An Extremely High Standard. The Grounds Were Perfect And The Food Was Amazing From Breakfast To Dinner.

As For The Wedding Itself  I Must Say That The Whole Day Went Like A Dream And I Know The Bride And Groom Were Amazed At How Professional And Accommodating All Of The Staff Were  With A Special Mention To Joe (The Wedding Coordinator) The Only Issue I Believe Was With Brides Breakfast (Which Was Organised To Be For Her And The Bridesmaids In The Brides Suite) I Understand Was Rectified Asap.
All In All I Would Have To Rate This As One Of The Most Relaxing And Comfortable Weekends Away And I Am Sure I Will Be Returning In The Near Future.

On A Separate Note  As I Mentioned Earlier I Have Stayed In A Fair Few Hotel / Spa Resorts  Which Has Been Down To My Occupation. I Currently Employed As A Senior Member For One Of The Largest Interior Fit Out Companies In The Uk And Regularly Work In Partnership With Exclusive Hotels Throughout The Uk And Europe.

I Must Say That The Mattress In My Room (106) Is The Most Comfortable I Have Ever Experienced And Would Like Experience That On A Nightly Basis. I Would Be Very Appreciative If You Able To Speak To Your Procurement / Purchasing Manager And Provide Me With The Suppliers Details.  I Am Sure That Purchasing Will Have O&M Manuals For All Of The Items In The Rooms.
Once Again Thank You To All Of The Staff For Making This Such A Great Weekend.
I Look Forward To Hearing From You And Returning Soon
Kind Regards
Carl (Best Man)

column31: Every Time I Visit I Am Disappointed By The Customer Service And Lack Of Attention To Detail.  Breakfast Was A Horrendous Experience That Wasn't Even Worthy Of A 1 Star Establishment  Let Alone A "Prestigious" Venue Such As Sopwell House.
column35: My Booking Was Correct.  However  I Had Telephoned And Emailed A Day Earlier To Finalise An Additional Booking And Despite Having An Email From Sopwell House Confirming The Information  Front Of House Did Not Have This Information And It Took A While To Find The Booking.  Not A Good Way To Start My Stay At Sopwell House.  I Made Things Easy For You And Yet It Was Still Messed Up.  This Is Indicative Of The Poor Administration And Miscommunication I Frequently Experience With Sopwell House!
column39: One Small Shower Gel And One Small Shampoo Isn't Really Enough For Two Guests Sharing A Room.
column53: It Took An Age To Be Seated  Despite Several Free Tables Available.  We Were Ignored By Staff And In The End I Had To Go Up To Someone And Tell Them I Was Sitting Myself Down.  Staff Were Too Busy Clearing Tables And Getting Ready For Lunch Service - It Was Only 10Am!  There Was No Crockery (Plates  Cups Or Mugs) So I Had Nothing To Put My Buffet On!  There Was No Coffee And No Hot Water.  I Had To Hunt Down A Member Of Staff And Request All Of These Things.  And I Had To Do This Several Times Before Anything Was Replenished.  They Made Me Feel Like I Was A Nuisance And Everything Was Too Much Hassle For Them.  A Very Unimpressive Experience.  What Little Food Was There Was Very Average As It Was Cold And Had Been Sat Out For Ages.
column64: Sadly The Main Courses Were Incorrect And One Dish Had To Be Sent Back.  It Meant One Diner Had No Food While The Rest Of Us Ate And His Meal Arrived After We Had Finished. column64: On Both My And My Wife's Starters Elements Of The Meal Were Not There As Advertised On The Menu. Our Original Choice Of Wine Was Not Available. Very Poor For A 'Fine Dining' Restaurant - Remove The Option From The Wine List Or Ensure That The Staff Tell The Guests When Presenting The Wine List. However When The Waiter Offered Us An Alternative And Said 'Look - Its A Chateau Which Means Its The Same Grape' We Knew We Were In Trouble. If You Really Want To Be Taken Seriously As A Fine Dining Restaurant Why Not Send A Couple Of Your Staff On A Sommelier Course So That There Is Someone On Hand Who Has Some Knowledge About The Wine List.

column30: The Brasserie Meal Was The Least Impressive Part Of Our Stay. We Booked The Table When We Made Our Reservation For Accommodation. We Received An E-Mail About Eight Weeks Before Our Stay Supplying Us With A Menu And Asking Us To Choose Our Meal. We Found This A Very Unusual Situation. We Were Only A Party Of Eight And Do Not See Why We Should Be Expected To Chose Our Meals In Advance  We Therefore Refused To Accept This And Said That We Would Chose When We Arrived In The Normal Manner. When We Arrived We Found That The Menu Was Different From That With Which We Had Been Supplied So We Don't Know How It Would Have Worked If We Had Chosen Our Meals When We Were First Asked To. The Menu Gives A Useful And Accurate Guide To How A Steak Should Be Cooked Depending On The Taste Of The Person Ordering  It's A Shame That The Chef Hasn't Read It !! A Rib Eye Steak That Was Ordered Rare Was Served Well More Than Medium. It Was Sent Back And The Replacement Was Correctly Cooked But It Does Not Reflect Well On The Kitchen. The Steak I Ordered Was Also Significantly Overcooked Although I Chose Not To Add To The Issue By Sending That Back Also. The Staff Were Obliging And In The End We Had An O.K. Meal But It Was Hard Work And Not Up To The Standard Of The Rest Of The Hotel.

We Used The Spa The Following Day  Which Was A Little Crowded In The Morning (As Expected) But People Soon Filtered Out And We Could Get Seated. The Facilities Were Great And The Massage Topped The Whole Experience Off! The Hotel And Staff Could Not Be Any Better! Thank You For Making It Perfect.

column31: We'll We Had Afternoon Tea In The Cocktail Lounge. Our Food Took Over 35 Minutes To Arrive. But We Also Had No Drinks While We Ate Our Tea. We Then Had To Remind The Waiting Staff Again And We Had Almost Finished Eating By The Time Our Drinks Gad Arrived. That's Pretty Bad Service For A. Four Star Hotel And Then We Were Charged The Service Charge On Top. The Following Day We Came Back To Our Room At Nearly 5 Pm And Our Room Was Still Being Cleaned. We Also Find At Your Hotel That Children Don't Seem To Be Liked At All And Merely Tolerated At Your Hotel By The Clientele  Which Makes The Experience Unpleasant. We  Realise There's Not Much That Can Be Done About That But It's Not Nice. The Room And Facilities Are Very Nice Which Is What Draws Us Back. However As Explained The Above Things Let It Down A Lot.
column39: We'll Again On The Service Side There Was Only Two Bath Towels And There Were 4 Of Us And Not Enough Toiletries To Accommodate 4.

column84: Well We Kept Speaking To

column1: Grazia About The Various Issues And She Was Helpful To A Certain Point. We Were Offered A Free Drink For The Afternoon Tea Fiasco But To Be Honest It's Not Really Enough To Make Up For The Bad Service Received. Especially Since We've Stayed With You A Few Times Already.

column31: A Pleasant And Relaxing Spa Break
column64: The Staff And Food On The Wednesday Evening Were Both Excellent And The Gentleman Serving Us Could Not Have Been More Helpful And Attentive. Quite A Bit Of The Salad Seemed Curled Up And Dry And It Would Have Been Nice To Be Offered Ham  As Well As The Pate.  As We Had An Early Lunch (12.15Pm) We Could Not Understand Why The Salad Seemed So "Weary".
column84: A Young Gentleman Who Served Us At Dinner Time In The Brasserie On Wednesday 6Th August (Unfortunately We Cannot Remember His Name)  Was Courteous  Fun And Helpful And We Appreciated His Efficient Service.

column31: It Was Very Pleasant  However We Weren't Taken Around The Spa When We First Arrived (Us And Other Guests Didn't Know Where We Were Going Or What We Were Doing); There Weren't Robes Available And 2 Towels Were Given As If We Were Having A Bath At Home (We Were Not Impressed And Neither Were Other Guests) So We Had To Nag For More; There Weren't Enough Places To Sit Or Lie Down; When The Showers Only Dripped And The Water Was Either Too Hot Or Cold And The Dial Was Falling Out Of The Wall Mid-Shower; No Conditioner In The Showers For Long Hair So Our Hair Was Matted; The Plastic Cups Constantly Ran Out For Water And Some Leaked Badly.  There Was A Pool Of Water As Soon As You Entered The Spa Area Next To The Swimming Pool Which We Saw Was Constantly Sorted By A Member Of Staff  But We Couldn't Wear Our Slippers Because They Became Soaked!
column35: We Weren't Shown Around The Spa Which Other Spa's Do Very Well.  There Needed To Be Sign Posts Around The Hotel Showing Which Way The Spa Was/ The Restaurant  Etc.  We Weren't The Only Ones To Look Lost.
column39: The Kettle Was Hidden So We Had To Search For It; The Hairdryer Was Hidden So We Had To Search For That Too.  Maybe A Card Telling You Where Things Are Would Be A Good Idea?

column35: Agree
column39: Sort Out The Pool Of Water Next To The Swimming Pool.  Our Slippers That You Gave Us Were Soaked Through From That Water So We Had To Walk Bare Foot. The Number Of People There Was Too Many So We Felt That You Had Too Many Guests There On Spa Breaks.

Was Also A Little Disappointed To Be Told That On Sunday We Could Not Sit Outside And Eat Our Food  Then Shortly After 3 People Were Merrily Sat Outside Eating When We Were Told We Were Not Allowed Seemed A Little Unfair  Very Poor Communication  Our Friends Also Had To Wait 1 Hour For A Salad As The Machine Had Broken?
column77: As The Former Spa Manager At Sopwell House  I Felt That It Could Be Run More Effectively My Treatment Was Running 10 Minutes Late  I Was Told I Was To Have A More Experiences Member Of Staff Due To An Injury And Ended Up With A New Girl Who Had Been At The Club For 2 Months In Fariness She Was Good  But I Did Check Several Times. There Was No Slippers In The Room. Changing Rooms Were Untidy  And Sad To See The Same Old Reception Area Which Is Looking Tired. I Think What Was Certainly Evident Is The Massive Increase In Treatment Prices I Would Of Liked To Have Had More But The Prices Put Me Off.

column77: We Had Booked A Spa Package With A Few Extra Treatments. The Pedicure And Manicure Was Defiantly Not Worth The Money! The Choice Of Nail Varnish Was Very Limited And Extremely Over Priced. I Ended Up With A French Manicure As None Of The Colours Were Suitable But Within 2Days  The Varnish Had Chipped. The Pedicure Was A Complete Waste Of Time As I Feel The Girls Did Not Do A Proper Job. It Was Very Quick And Rushed. We Had Cuticle Cream Applied Then Our Feet Put In An Electric Foot Warmer Followed By A Varnish ( Which Was The Worst Varnish I Have Ever Had !!!) The Package Treatments Were Excellent With No Faults At All  It's Just A Shame The Extra Treatments Left Us Feeling Disappointed.

column31: Everything We Agreed At The Time Of Booking Was Not Followed Through By The Hotel. We Had To Complain About Everything To Get It To The Standard We Had Expected.
column35: The Was To Be A Birthday Treat For My Wife But Everything I Had Agreed Over The Phone And On An Email Was Disputed By The Reception Staff. I Had Emailed To Say That We Had A Very Bad Year To Date And It Would Be Very Nice If We Could Be Considered For A Complimentary Upgrade  The Email Reply Said That This Should Not Be An Issue As Long As The Hotel Was Not Full. I Showed The Email To The Receptionist Only To Be Told Over And Over That There Would Be A Charge.   It Took 2 Attempt To Get The Room We Wanted And A Total Disregard For The Requests Made Prior To Our Arrival
column39: The First Room We Were Allocated Was Dirty  There Was Dust On Surfaces  The Curtains Were Stained And The Bathroom Floor Was Filthy Along With The Bath Itself. We Also Had A View Of A Car Park And A Flat Roof!
column53: I Have Allergies To Certain Foods Which Seemed Very Unimportant To Staff.
column64: When We Arrived We Had A Rocky Table  So I Tried To Catch The Eye Of Staff To Be Moved Or The Table To Be Altered With No Success. I Then Had To Crawl On The Floor And Sort Out The Rocking Myself. I Told The Waitress That I Was Allergic To Onions So She Went To The Chef Who Said He Could Only Do Me A Pasta Dish With Tomato Sauce. I Had Paid For 2 Night Stay With Db&B To Be Told All I Could Have Was Pasta!! I Asked To See The Manager To Be Told He Was Busy. Mean Time My Wife Had Ordered Wine  Hers Arrived All Ok But My Wine Arrived And The Waitress Was About To Open It When I Noticed It Was The Wrong Wine. I Pointed This Out Only To Be Told That The Wine I Requested Was Out Of Stoke So They Thought This Was A Good Replacement. Ask Me First!!! We Did Speak To The Manager And My Food And Wine Situation Was Rectified But Too Late To Enjoy The Experience! We Very Nearly Left The Table Packed And Went Home!!!

column31: The Hotel & Grounds Are Wonderful However I Think A Short Tour & Explanation Of Where All The Facilities Are & How To Access Everything Could Have Been Offered. There Was No Breakfast Option Menu In Our Room & The Inclusive 3 Course Meal I Thought Was Rushed & We Would Have Preferred A Bit Of Time Between Each Course  This Led Me To Leaving Nearly All My Dessert. We Weren't Really Sure How To Access The Pool & So We Didn't Use It. I Also Overheard Someone Asking About Pool Times For Children & When Staying For One Night On A Saturday It Is Virtually Impossible To Be Able To Take Children Into The Pool (A Facility That's Not Really An Option In Which Case). I Loved The Place But Didn't Feel Very Special & I Wanted It To Feel Special. Might Look At Other Options When Booking A Break Next Time.

A Warmly Welcoming Atmosphere Backed With Many Touches Of Luxury Make This An Exceptionally Good Hotel.

column90: Overall  I Think Sopwell House Is Run Exceptionally Well. We Were Surprised At The Refurbishment  Having Been There Only Two Years Earlier When There Was No Sign Of Anything Even Beginning To Look Faded Or Worn Or Out Of Date  So The Continued Investment In High Standards Is To Be Applauded. The Staff Are A Credit To The Establishment  Working Hard Yet Always Smiling And Welcoming.

column31: Relaxing Even Though This Was A Business Trip And Very Courteous And Professional Staff  A Very Enjoyable Stay.

column35: No Record Of Us Arriving.
column39: No Tea And Coffee Facilities And The Shower Had No Hot Water In The Morning. Not What I Would Expect For That Price.
