column83: They Claimed We Were Not Entitled To The Package I Had Paid For. We Paid Around £160 For Spa  Dinner And A Nights Stay  Only To Be Told That Was Just For The Room. Then £75 On Top For Dinner. The Only Compensation Was Late Check Out (Presumably Because The Room Wasn't Booked For The Next Day) And Which We Both Couldn't Take Because We Had To Get Up Early For Work. But With The £160 + £75 And Cocktails Costing More Than A Lot Of The Packages I Feel More Could Have Been Offered.

column31: First Class All The Staff Are Usually Very Friendly And Helpful
column35: No Always Very Good  But For A Regular Customer I Should Be Trusted And It Shouldn't Be Necessary To Pre Pay Or Have An Amount Pre Arranged Before I Check Out. Further Sometimes I Like To Check In Before 2Pm And The Staff Are Usually Very Flexible And Helpful
column39: I Can't Remember My Room Number  So Can't Leave My Comments

column84: Reception Is Always Very Warm And Welcoming  Eric The Greeter In The Lobby Area Always Friendly And Comes Over To Ask Me How I Am. Vince And Laura Always Very Attentive To My Requests. All To A Good Standard
column89: The Bill Always Has Service Charges Added And It Is Just Assumed I Will Accept And Pay Okay  But It Is Never Mentioned Unless I Point Out I Was Not In Total Agreement For Whatever Reason.
column90: I Like Visiting Sopwell House And The Service I Receive Is On A Par With The Grove Where I Used To Stay.

column31: A Lovely 2 Nights. I Had An Initial Problem With One Of The 2 Rooms I Had Booked - This Was Dealt With Efficiently And A Room Change Was Made.
column39: I Had Booked 2 Rooms For 2 Couples At The Same Price. A Standard Double And A Classic Double. I Was In The Standard Double And Disappointed To Find Only One Bedside Table. This Would Mean Having To Put Water  Book  Glasses Etc On The Floor At My Side Of The Bed. I Appreciate The Room Was In The Old Part Of The Hotel. However  A Bedside Wall Light Was There And It Was A Bit Odd There Not Being A Table. I Was Able To Change To A Classic Double Later After Speaking To Helpful Staff At Reception.
column64: On Our First Night (We Realised After) That A 10% Service Charge Was Already Added To The Bill - My Boyfriend Did Not Realise This And He Then Also Left A 10% Tip In Cash (This Is Our Preferred Way Of Giving A Tip). I Then Noticed This On The Bar Bill For 2 Drinks So Did Not Feel Inclined To Leave A Further Cash Tip. The Second Night Was Different - 10% Had Not Been Already Added And So I Was Happy To Leave An Equivalent Cash Tip. It Stated On The Bottom Of The Menu That A Service Charge Would Be Added For Parties Of 6 Or 8 Or More I Think. I Therefore Think It Was Strange That The Service Charge Was Added On The First Night For The 4 Of Us.
column83: I Have Mentioned The Problem With The First Room And 10% Being Added To The Bill In The Brasserie.
column84: I Don't Remember Her Name But The Lady On The Reception Desk Who Organised The Change Of My Room Was Excellent. I Did Thank Her As I Really Appreciated The Change To The Second Room - We Had A Super Room  Lovely View And I Had A Bedside Table!
column90: We Really Enjoyed Our Stay - Thank You.

column31: Exquisite. We Had The One Night Spa Break And It Is A Truly Excellent Package. The Hotel Is Beautiful  The Staff Were Superb  The Spa Team Excellent  The Food Was Delicious And Our Room Was Lovely.
column35: Perhaps Better Signs For The Overflow Car Parks Would Be An Improvement. Check-In Was Absolutely Efficient And Smooth. The Receptionist Kindly Showed Us To Our Room.
column39: The Room Was Lovely  Couldn't Fault It. Sky Sports Package Was A Superb Touch. Perhaps Body Lotion Could Be Included With The Toiletries As I Was Expecting That (And Didn't Bring Any Of My Own).
column48: We Just Ordered Drinks So Cannot Comment On Room Service Food.
column64: Our Wine Waitress Was Fabulous. She Was Very Knowledgeable And Offered Us Other Wines To Try. It Was A Really Interesting Experience. Dinner Was Delicious And The Quality Of The Sunday Buffet Lunch Was Superb.
column77: Both Mine And My Husband's Treatments Were Excellent. The Spa Was Very Relaxing And Well Equipped. I Personally Prefer A Warmer Pool When Using A Spa But That May Be My Own Personal Preference And Not How Others Feel...

column1: I Also Think The Spa Changing Rooms Would Benefit From Body Lotion.
column8: Hmm  Our Wine Waitress In The Brasserie On The Saturday Night Was Fab. Unfortunately I Cannot Remember Her Name. I Have Also Forgotten The Name Of The Lady Who Did My Treatments. They Were Both Excellent. I Made A Mental Note At The Time But Have Forgotten Now. Sorry.
column14: We Absolutely Loved It. I Would Consider Coming Again Next Time I'm Booking A Hotel/Spa Treat. Many Thanks To The Team.

column31: We Had A Lovely Weekend. The Spa Being The Highlight With Fantastic Treatments. The Hotel Was Also Lovely And We Were Happy With Our Room But The Standard Of Service Within The Hotel And Restaurants / Lounge Area Could Be Improved To Make The Stay Better. Customer Service Is Everything!
column35: When Booking I Called Up To Get Some Guidance On Rooms And Spa Deals And The Ladies I Spoke To In Reservations And In The Spa Were So Helpful And Polite. Check In Was Good. Our Room Was Not Ready But We Were Called Just Before 3Pm To Say Our Room Was Now Ready Which Was Great And Our Bags Were Automatically Taken Up To The Room. It Would Be Lovely To Be Offered Something On Arrival Like A Glass Of Fizz  Hot Drink Etc When We Cannot Get Access To Our Room Straight Away.
column39: Our Room Was Not Cleaned The Day After Our First Night Stay And By 4Pm We Had To Call Reception To Ask That It Get Seen To While We Were In The Spa!
column48: We Asked For An Ice Bucket For Our Wine Left Over From Our Meal The Night Before. We Were Not Told When Ordering This On The Phone That There Was A Room Delivery Charge. I Think For An Ice Bucket This Is A Little Off. Kindly  The Gentleman Who Came To The Room Made Us Aware Of It And Said He Would Speak To His Manager As He Didn't Think It Was Fair.
column53: Food And Selection Of Foods Was Great. Service However Was Not So Great. Snappy Waitress When I Asked Where I Could Find Tea And Coffee.
column64: The Food Was Lovely But We Just Feel The Whole Experience Could Have Been Better Had The Service Been A Little Better. The Brasserie Dinner Was Lovely  Great Food But Don't Feel Like We Were Looked After And We Had To Ask Someone To Take Our Order Because No One Came To Us. The Wine We Ordered Came Warm And We Had To Ask For Another Bottle As The Ice Bucket Could Not Cool It In Time Before We Opened The Bottle.

column1: The Conservatory Was Lovely And We Ate Lunch Outside On Arrival. We Had A Nice Waitress But All The Tables Outside Are Rocky On The Slate Floor Which Was A Pain And We Noticed There Were Plates And Glasses That Had Not Been Cleared From The Day Before On Our Second Day Stay.

The Service In The Cocktail Lounge Was Pretty Shocking To Be Honest. I Sat Myself Down At An Empty Table And There Was One Gentleman Running Around Like A Maniac Very Flustered Trying To Set 1 Table Up For Guests. He Continued To Ignore Me For About 10 Minutes Before I Managed To Ask Him For A Menu. He Took One Of The Chairs Away From My Table For Another Table Without Asking And I Had Friends Joining Me. The Food Was Great  It Came In Good Time But Just Felt Like Again The Service Could Improve.

We Then Had Drinks In The Cocktail Lounge After Arriving Back From Dinner Elsewhere. We Waited And Waited And Waited To Be Served And Then Waited Even Longer For The Drinks To Arrive. We Went To The Bar To Ask If We Should Expect The Drinks And She Started Making Them There And Then Having Clearly Forgotten. We Then Waited Even Longer And Were About To Get Up And Leave And They Arrived. We Were Practically Falling Asleep In Our Seats Waiting For The Drinks!
column14: We Were So Pleased With The Spa And Leisure Facilities. The Ladies On The Front Desk Of Spa Were Great. The Therapists Were Great. The Treatments Were Fantastic And The Whole Spa Facilities Were Probably The Best We Have Experienced. Could Not Fault It And The Reason We Would Return Would Be For The Spa.
column20: The Service Level Could Be Better As A Whole In Your Restaurants / Lounge Areas. I Think You Will Be Missing A Lot Of Return Business And Word Of Mouth Recommendations Purely Because The Service Levels Are Poor
column31: Daisy

We Had A Wonderful Day For Our Daughter's Wedding. We Have Had Many Letters From The Guests Saying How Much They Appreciated The Delicious Meal  Efficient Staff And Beautiful Grounds. The Only Disappointment Was Some Of The Bride And Groom's Presents For Bridesmaids And Others Were Missing.

column31: The Staff Were Extremely Helpful  The Rooms Were Nice As Was The Food  The Only Problem Was The Lack In Disabled Facilities  Ie Adequate Facilites For Bathing  Really Needed A Bath Hoist.

column31: We Stayed On The One Night Leisure Break Which Included Breakfast  Lunch And Dinner And A Spa Treatment And Full Use Of The Swimming Pool And Spa Facilities  And I Must Say We Had An Amazing And Relaxing Time. We Found All The Member Of Staff Extremely Friendly And Helpful. The Bedroom Was An Excellent Size And Quality. The Location Is Only A 5 Minute Drive From St Albans Which Is A Really Beautiful Town With A Wide Choice Of Shops And Restaurants. I Would Be Happy To Recommend Sopwell House To Anyone.
Our Experience The Second Time Round Was A Complete Deal Winner.  The Whole Experience Was Flawless And Made Us Feel We Had Paid For More Then We Had.

column1: I Was Surprised That The Breakfast Was Not Really Hot  The Fried Eggs And Hash Browns Looked Like They Had Been There Awhile  We Went To Breakfast At 9:45 A.M.  On The Whole It Was Okay  The Continental Looked Interesting With The Cheeses And Meats Maybe I Will Try Them Next Time.
column12: Kyler Served Us For Most Of The Evening  He Was Very Entertaining And Made The Meal All The More Enjoyable.  Nothing Was Too Much Trouble For The Staff Service Us.

column32: As Stated Earlier Kyler  Was Very Friendly And Interacted Well With Us.  All Staff That We Came Into Contact With Were All Very Helpful  What I Particularly Liked Was Just As I Had A Thought - Someone Appeared: For Example  When I Decided It Was Time For A Drink In The Conservatory A Waitress Appeared And Asked If We Would Like To Order Drinks  When We Wanted To Find A Particular Room Again Someone Appeared And Asked If They Could Help.  When Booking Out  The Welcome Hostess (Can't Remember Her Name But Had Blonde Hair) Asked If We Wanted To Leave Our Bags In Storage Again Excellent As We Thought We Would Have To Leave Our Things In The Boot Of The Car  As We Were Not Actually Leaving Until After Lunch.  I Really Loved My Weekend.

The Wifi Was Un-Useably Slow And There Were No Coffee Making Facilities.  Also  The Check-Out Queue Was Too Long To Consider Staying And Discussing Our Concerns.  That Said  The Staff Were Friendly And Helpful And The Children Enjoyed The Spa.

When We Come Again I Hope To See An Improvement In The Issues That I Have Just Mentioned . column1: Did 2 Classes  (Tue Yoga & Zumba)  Both Were Excellent Instructors  Very Welcoming & Inclusive And Super Classes.
column7: The Fire Alarm Went Off Soon After We Arrived.  It Stopped  Started & Stopped Again.  We Left Our Room And Went To Reception But Nobody Else Seemed To Have Evacuated.  It Was As Though Nothing Had Happened  No Staff Were Advising Guests What To Do  Everyone Was Ignoring It.  We Asked The Concierge Whether We Should Evacuate  He Was Icily Polite.  Said He Had Yet To Investigate.  Didn't Advise Us What To Do In The Meantime.  We Hung Around For A While But Were Ignored  So Eventually We Went Back To Our Room.

column1: Also  On Our Final Morning  The Phone Rang At 0730  Waking Me Up.  By The Time I Answered  There Was Nobody There.  Mistaken Wake-Up Call?  Wrong Number?  Wasn't A Great Finish To A Leisure Break.
column7: - There Was A Service Charge That We Didn't Understand On The Bill (C£8?).  Meant To Question It Before We Left But Forgot.

column1: - We Paid A Lot For This Special Break  But It Didn't Feel As Special As I'd Have Liked.  There Was Lots Of Calling Us 'Sir' And 'Madam' But It Didn't Feel As Though There Was Much Genuine Courtesy Behind It.  There Was A Wonderful Barman Who Brought Our Wine Through To The Brasserie (Wish I Remembered His Name) Who Made Us Feel Thoroughly Spoilt - I'd Have Like To Have Felt That Way Throughout.

column31: A Relaxing And Convenient Y Situated Hotel  Near To Heathrow For Our Onward Holiday Journey. Check In Press Was Very  Very Slow. No Introduction From Staff To The Facilities Available Or Their Location  I.E. Spa  Pool Etc. We Stayed Two Nights And Were Disappointed That Fresh Water Was Not Automatically Provided On Day 2  Especially As We Were In A Deluxe Room. Positives Were The Cocktail Bar As The Bar Manager Made Me A Brandy Alexander Even Though It Was Not Listed In Your Menu. Restaurant Meal In The Fining Dining Restaurant Was Excellent. Waiter Was Also First Class.
column35: Disabled Car Parking Limited To Just Two Spaces  Both Of Which Were Far Too Narrow And It Was Difficult To Access And Leave When The Delivery Lorries Were Parked. Reception Check In Was Far Too Slow And Laboured.
column39: No Mini Bar. No Access To Cold Drinking Water  I.E Drinking Fountains  Ice Machines Etc. column53: Hard To Get Tea And Coffee Served And When It Was  It Was Often Tepid. No One Asked Us If Our Breakfast Was Good Or Not.

One Of My Guests Had To Complain  Whereupon Some 20 Minutes Later  Separate Bowls Of Risotto Were Brought Out.  Also  The Belly Of Pork With Crackling  Turned Out To Be A Pork Chop. It Reflected Badly On Me That The Menu I Was Supplied By The Hotel And Passed To Guests  Was Not The Exact Same Menu On The Night.

column31: Nice Room  Lovely Building  Friendly Staff. One Big Disappointment - Room Service Dinner And The Response To My Feedback. I Have A Number Of Dietary Restrictions And So Ordered Soup Without Bread And A Large Mixed Salad With Grilled Chicken And A Sparkling Water. I Got A Bowl Of Not Very Warm Soup  A Massive Basket Of Bread  And A Piece Of Chicken On A Plate Of Lettuce. So  Soup  Chicken And Lettuce For 30 Pounds. When I Expressed My Concern Upon Checking Out  I Was Assured That Someone Would Call Me That Day And I Gave The Receptionist My Mobile Number. No-One Rang. The Following Day I Received An Email Requesting My Contact Details To Which I Duly Replied. Still Nothing. Very Disappointing. I Travel A Lot For Work And Frequently Order Room Service And  In Terms Of Value For Money  This Was One Of The Worst. I Did Order Room Service Breakfast And That Was Delicious. I Do Know That Sopwell House Is The Hotel Of Choice For The Company I Work. This Would Not Put Me Off Returning But I Would Certainly Expect Better.

column31: On The Whole We Enjoyed Our Stay At Your Hotel  Which Is Known To Be Very Expensive.  The Bedroom Was First-Class  With Lots Of Space And Comfort  Good Furniture And In Particular Excellent Storage Space (And A Safe Which  Amazingly  Was Easy To Operate!).  In General  The Staff Were Friendly  Helpful  Courteous And Efficient  But There  Were Occasions When Service Was Lacking In The Brasserie And Frankly The Junior Waiting Staff Were More Efficient Than The Senior Waiters!  The Expensive Food Served In The Restaurant Was Very Good And Better Than That Served In The Brasserie.  We Were Very Disappointed That  Having Requested A Room On The Ground Floor (If Possible) Or Otherwise Near A Lift  We Were In Fact Allocated A Room On The Second Floor And About As Far As Is Possible From The Lift (Which Involved 6 Small Steps Without A Banister)!
column83: Please See Earlier Comments Re. Brasserie.  Also  When 'Phoning Reception For Help In The Room (Once To Replace Light Bulbs And Once To Collect Suitcases)  We Waited For Some Twenty Minutes To Half An Hour And In Both Cases Had To 'Phone A Second Time In Order For Someone To Come To The Room.

column84: I Should Have Asked For The Lady's Name But Had Totally Forgot And Hope This Lady Know She Is. I Believed She Was In Charge In The Spa  There Was Confusion Regards Our Treatment From Our Agent (Not Sopwell) However  This Lady Was Fantastic  Understood Our Booking And Made Sure We All Had Treatments. Half Of Our Party Was Late For The Treatments And We Was Still Made Welcome (Did Not Get Told Off)  She Was Very Polite And Resolved The Problem. If You Find This Lady At Spa Whom Was Behind The Desk Organising Us All  Please Thank Her For Us. She Will Know Who We Are As Our Booking Wasn't Straight Forward. Also 2 Ladies At Reservation  1 Lady Is Anastasia And The Other Lady Whom Again Had Not Taken Her Name. They Double Checked My Booking As We Had Booked 3 Rooms For 8 Of Us. The Lady (Don't Know Her Name) Had Realised The Confusion Of Booking From The Spabreak And Contacted Me Personally To Double Check And Sort Out The Issues. They Both Have Been Fantastic And Assured Me To Have A Good Time And Relax.

column1: On Arrival  We Were Instantly Warmly Greeted By Staff And Handed A Refreshment. Vincenzo Engaged In Conversation With Us And Made Us Feel Instantly At Ease And Welcome. When We Told Him It Was Our Mini-Honeymoon Weekend  He Also Very Kindly Offered Us A Complimentary Glass Of Prosecco. He Needn't Have Done This  But It Was A Lovely Gesture And It Was Followed Through. Essentially  This Was The Best Experience We Have Ever Had On Arrival At A Hotel - And It Set The Scene For The Rest Of Our Stay. As My Husband Is Spanish  Vincenzo Kindly Introduced Us To Marco (? - Apologies If I Have Not Remembered The Correct Name!) Who Is Also Spanish And Helped Us With Our Baggage To The Room. My Husband Was Particularly Overwhelmed On Seeing The Football Gallery And Finding The Flag And Photos Of His Favourite Team (Barcelona!). We Enjoyed The Spa  Whilst Slightly Busy Being The Weekend  The Facilities Were Very Well Kept And Clean. We Enjoyed Dinner In The Brasserie  Food Very Well Prepared And Pleasantly Presented With Quick Service. The Cocktail Bar - Some Of The Best Cocktails We Have Ever Tried! We Would Come Back Even If Not Staying For An Evening Just To Experience The Cocktails With Friends. Breakfast Equally Surpassed Expectations With A Range Of Selection To Choose From.
Thank You Sopwell House For Making Our Mini-Moon Such A Memorable One - Your Staff (Especially Vincenzo & Marco) Do You Proud. We Look Forward To Returning Again Soon.
With Best Regards
Sarah & Vicente
column5: As Mentioned Previously - Warm Staff  Lovely Touch With The Refreshment - Set The Scene For The Whole Weekend.

column84: We Are Organising A Function On 5Th December And We Are Really Impressed With Joe Carter.  He Is Very Efficient And For Us The Best Thing Is That He Is So Easy To Get Hold Of.  E Mails Get Answered Straight Away  Phone Messages Returned  He Picks Up His Phone.  We Have Saved A Lot Of Time This Year In Having A Manager That Is Very Efficient And Very Easily Contactable. We Have A Greater Feeling Of Confidence Before The Event This Year.  Last Year We Wasted A Lot Of Time Leaving Phone Messages At Banqueting That Often Didn't Get Returned Or Waited A Few Days For A Response.  This Year Has Been So Much Easier.

The Massage Therapist Afterwards Said I Should Have Told Her And She Would Have Changed It But I Didn't Want To Make A Fuss And Interrupt The Experience! But I Would Suggest You Get Rid Of That Music As It Really Is Not At All Relaxing. But Otherwise We Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay.

column89: We Booked Through Spabreaks And Agreed A Certain Price However They Then Called Us Back To Say We Had To Pay Extra To Upgrade The Room As The Ordinary Room Was Not Available. This Was Fine But We Then Had A Call From Sopwell After We Had Booked To Say That There Was No Room For Us For Dinner On The Saturday In The Brasserie (Part Of Our Package) Unless We Ate Very Early Or Very Late. As We Were Newly Weds They Kindly Upgraded Us For Free To The Restaurant But I Think You Need To Be Clear With Companies Like Spabreaks About Availability Or Otherwise People Book At One Price But Then Have To Keep Upgrading For Various Things Which Is Annoying.

column53: I Am On A Very Restrictive Diet - Fodmap Diet As Prescribed By A Doctor. A Nightmare Of A Diet But We Did Phone And Let You Know. It Is Gluten And Dairy Free And There Is Quite A Lot Of Fruit  Vegetables And Additives That I Cannot Tolerate In My Diet. Breakfast Was A Good Selection So I Did Manage To Find Something I Could Eat. However Again We Had To Ask Twice For Gluten Free Toast But It Arrived.
column64: I Am On A Very Restrictive Diet - Fodmap Diet As Prescribed By A Doctor. A Nightmare Of A Diet But We Did Phone And Let You Know. It Is Gluten And Dairy Free And There Is Quite A Lot Of Fruit  Vegetables And Additives That I Cannot Tolerate In My Diet. We Were Assured On The Phone That It Would Not Be A Problem. I Have Only Recently Had To Go On This Diet For Health Reasons So I Did Have My Doubt About Keeping Our Booking. But My Husband Phoned You To Explain As He Was Really Keen For Us To Be Able To Have This Break As He Knew It Would Do Me Good.

column1: Went Down For Dinner. My Dietary Needs Had Been Noted Which Was A Relief. Explained About My Diet Whereby The Server Pointed Out One Dish That Was Suitable - Well That Is Hardly A Menu? For People With Dietary Needs. That Is One Option - Take It Or Leave It. So We Asked If I Could Have Something Different That Was Not On The Set Menu. I Asked For Plain Steak And Chips With No Sauce Or Anything Added To It. Was Told Yes That Was Fine But We Would Have To Pay The Difference Which Was Acceptable I Suppose (Didn't Really Have Any Other Choice). We Were Asked If We Wanted Water On The Table Which We Said Yes. The Upshot Of This Was When Our Bill Arrived It Would Not What We Were Expecting At All  Considering The Set Menu Was Part Of Our Stay. I Was Charged For A Side Salad - I Literally Had Steak Chips And A Couple Of Bits Of Lettuce. When We Queried It  I Was Told I Had A Side Salad. No I Had It In Place Of The Vegetables Offered As I Could Not Have Them And We Did Explain This At The Time. Ridiculous. The Price You Charge For Bottled Water Is Very High - We Did Not Realise We Were Paying For Water. We Were Charged For Other Substitutes. I Appreciate If You Go Away From The Set Menu There Would Be Charges But We Were Charged For Every Little Thing. Not Impressive When We Were Assured When We Originally Phoned Up  We Were Told Yes No Problem We Cater For All Dietary Requirements. Yes At A Cost You Do. No Reflexibility At All. However We Did Ask To Speak To The Manager Who Was Understanding Of The Situation And Sorted It Out For Us.
column14: Lovely Spa Facilities But Unfortunately The Weekend We Stayed It Was Extremely Busy And Noisy. Lots Of People Everywhere. No Beds As All In Use And Even No Chairs Available To Sit On At One Point. Jacuzzi Always Full Of People Unless You Were Happy To Sit On Someone's Lap. Very Embarrassing Walking Into The Steam Room  For Obviously Reasons Hard To Make Out Where To Sit Only For The Mist To Clear And To Find Out Its Full Of People And No Where To Sit. Had To Just Turn Round And Walk Out. Very Embarrassing. Lovely Facilities Just A Shame We Could Not Enjoy Them. My Husband Got Fed Up In The End And Wanted To Leave So We Did.
column20: All Previously Detailed. It Was Such A Shame Because I Have Had Health Problems Recently So My Husband And I Were Looking Forward To A Night Away Together Without Our Children Just To Rest And Relax. Use The Facilities And Enjoy Dinner Knowing That You Could Cater My Dietary Needs. Unfortunately This Was Not As Straight Forward As We Were Expecting And It Was Not The Break We Had Hoped For. You Had Come Highly Recommended To Us By Family Who Have Previously Stayed So We Had High Expectations  But You Simply Did Not Live Up To That Expectation.

It Is Just As Well I Keep A Close Eye On My Account And Didn't Have Other Payments Relying On The Money.

It Was Our Anniversary And They Gave Us A Surprise Dessert Too
column39: Think The Tv Could Be Bigger.
column64: The Cocktail Bar's Cocktail Is Not Very Professional My Husband Ordered His Usual Cocktail But Was Presented With Something Completely Different Instead Of An Orange Scented Clear Drink There's Cloudy Orange Juice. I Ordered A Non Alcoholic Mocktail But Was Charged At The Same Price As An Alcoholic Version Which I Was Surprised. I Had To Speak To The Barman In Order To Get Him To Change The Price.

column31: We Chose To Visit On A Special Offer - Lazy Sunday Package. The Meet & Greet On Arrival Was Very Welcoming With A Lovely Fire To Warm Us On A Winters Day!

column1: We Were Allocated A Twin-Bedded Room (Room 151) Which Was Very Nicely Furnished And Decorated With A Beautiful View Over The Countryside. Regretfully The Date We Chose To Stay Was Extremely Busy In Both The Hotel And Spa/Treatment Areas. The Reception Meet/Greet For The Spa Was Very Unfriendly And Was Not Particularly Helpful. We Had To Explore The Facilities On Our Own And Felt That This Really Let Down The Overall Pampering Experience. We Felt Very Much A Number Rather Than A Guest. The Swimming Pool And Sauna Was Extremely Overcrowded With No Available Loungers.
In The Evening We Had Pre-Dinner Drinks In The Bar And Again The Service Was Poor And It Was Not The Atmosphere That You Felt You Wanted To Stay To Relax And Enjoy A Few Drinks.
The Evening Restaurant And Staff Were Extremely Good And The Set Menu Offered A Nice Variety Of Choices. Breakfast Was Also Very Good.

Overall The Hotel Was In A Superb Location And The Grounds Very Well Kept. I Would Like To Re-Visit At A Time When The Hotel Was Not So Busy Just To Enjoy The Excellent Facilities On Offer  But In A Quieter Period So As To Enjoy The Ambience And Relaxation.

Apart From That I Would Still Highly Recommend Sopwell House To All My Friends And Family And Would Love To Return Again Sometime Soon.  Thank You

column90: The Manager Of The Spa Sandra Is Very Beautiful And A Model Figure...As I Am A Professional Artist She Allowed Me To Do Sketches In The Spa And That Si Helpful To Me As I'm Working On A New Book Of Drawings To Be Published In 2015....People And Places On My Travels. Thank You All Vw

column31: Not The 4 Star Experience We Was Expecting

column5: Disappointed We Were Not Informed We Needed To Book Spa Activities In Advance  When Tried To Book A Week And A Half In Advance Was Told Fully Booked. The Spa Manager Did Manage To Arrange Some Treatments But We Had To Fit In With Times As Opposed To Our Planned Scheduled.  I Must Be Honest I Was Quite Prepared To Cancel The Booking And Go Elsewhere  It Was Only The Fact It Was My Daughters 21St Birthday And We Had Told Her Where We Were Staying And What Had Been Arranged  Although These Arrangements We Changed To Fit With Spa Treatments.
column9: When The Room Was Cleaned On The First Day All Toiletries Were Removed  These Being Half Full And Would Have Been Sufficient For Use The Next Day. We Then Had To Go To Reception To Ask For More.

column1: No Bottled Water In The Room.
column15: No Menu Offered  Choice From Buffet Only. Only Offered Tea Coffee  Although Would Have Liked Latte.Breakfast Was Not A Good Experience  Waiting For Tea And Coffee Having To Wait For Eggs To Be Cooked Seemed Very Unorganized  Chefs And Serving Staff. Having Stayed In A 3 Star Hotel In Oxford Some 3 Weeks Before The Breakfast Selection Was Far Superior And Better Cooked And Included A Fish Option.

column25: Although There Was A Large Selection Of Spa Treatments Available On The Website  As We Were Not Informed We Had To Book So Far In Advance  We Were Very Limited As To What We Could Have. Preference Seems To Be With Visitors Booking Spa Day's Not Residents Who Are Spending A Lot More  With The Hotel.
column31: On Pre Booking Asked For Taxi To Be Booked To Take Us Into St Albans  On Confirming This In The Afternoon It Had Not Been Booked  Keys Stopped Working On 3 Occasions And We Had To Go Back To Reception. Plus Toiletries As Previously Stated.
column32: We Would Like To Acknowledge The Spa Manager  Who Went Out Of Her Way To Try To Book Us Spa Treatments.  We Feel The Fault Lay With The Hotel Not Informing Us That Treatments Needed To Be Booked So Far In Advance.
column35: Disagree
column37: Due To The Spa Treatments Booked And Timings  We Changed Our Afternoon Tea From One Day To The Other.

column2: Lovely Building  Just Feel  That For A 4 Star Hotel  Service Was Not Of A 4 Star Quality In Most Areas.

It Was So Lovely! And The Breakfast Buffet... Amazing!! Such Excellent Food! Thank You For Making Our Wedding Night Truly Wonderful. :)

column64: We Had Dinner Included In Our Spa Package. We Struggled To Find A Starter Or A Main Course We Liked From The Fixed Menu.  We Were Not Offered The A La Carte Menu-Which Resulted In Lost Revenue For You I'm Afraid. I Am Disabled  And The Chairs Were Not Particularly Comfortable  So The Staff Very Kindly Allowed Us To Enjoy Our Lovely Desserts In The Adjoining Room On The Sofas-Thank You Very Much.
column77: The Spa Receptionist Was Lacklustre In Her Greeting And  Indeed  In All Our Subsequent Dealings With Her. Other Guests Also Asked Us On Several Occasions How The Lockers Worked-Perhaps Some Signage/Instructions At Eye Level Might Be Helpful? None Of Our Party Received Their Travel Pack-Spa Receptionist

column1: Sent Us To Main Reception And Main Reception Sent Us Back To The Spa. Eventually The (I Believe) Spa Manager Took Charge And Arranged For These To Be Waiting For Us At Spa Reception After Our Treatments.
column7: Spa Receptionist -Mumbling  Having To Ask Her Where We Should Wait To Be Called For Treatments  Where We Got Our Travel Packs From Etc Etc. Getting My Name Wrong Each Time I Spoke To Her.

column1: Bar Staff Arguing Amongst Themselves Leaving Us Waiting To Order Drinks At The Bar. Slow Drinks Service. Cocktails Were  However  Very Good When They Finally Arrived.
column2: The Lady Greeter On Our Arrival-Lovely. She Also Recognised Us On Our Departure And Made A Point Of Checking With Us How We Had Enjoyed Our Stay Etc.
column7: Whilst The Building Promises So Much  The Lack Of Attention To Detail And The Disinterest Of Some Of The Staff Disappoints.
column8: I Had A "Luxury" Pedicure At An Additional Cost. I Do Not Feel The Treatment Warranted The Extra Cost Incurred...It Felt More Like An Ordinary Pedicure.

column31: We Really Enjoyed Our Stay Which Was  As Hoped Relaxing. Sopwell House Staff Were Welcoming And Very Polite. We Arrived At 3.30Pm Hungry And Tired After A Busy Working Week. Though There Were Many Bookings For Tea The Restaurant Staff Managed To Find Room For Us To Sit Down And Eat. On Both Days The Food Was Delicious.

column1: Our Only Reservations Were Over Breakfast  Taken In Our Room When The Grapefruit Juice Was Forgotten  And There Was Only A Small Amount Of Milk For The Muesli. These Omissions Were Soon Rectified.
Thank You For A Relaxing And Enjoyable Time.

column53: We Have Got To Know Some Staff And Would Like To Commend The Restaurant Manager Shiju Raju For His Warm Welcome Back. The Waiting Staff  Ritchie And Christine Greet Us With A Smile And A Warm Welcome.  They Work Very Hard.  It Was Also A Pleasure To See Kim Who Served Us Frequently As Premier Guests At Champneys  Tring.  I Do Not Believe That Her Experience Was Utilised Well At Champneys And Am Sure That She Will Compliment The Workforce Well At Sopwell House.

column84: Firstly Jenny (Reservations Manager) Without Her Kindness  Support And Detail To Guest Service/Satisfaction We Would Not Be Encouraged To Come Back To Sopwell House As Regular Guests - Special Thanks.   Thank You Andreas.  We Have Also Got To Know Some Other Staff And Would Like To Commend The Restaurant Manager Shiju Raju For His Warm Welcome Back.  He Is Also Very Gracious  Attentive And Will Offer Us An Alternative As A Result Of Our Vegetarian Diet.  I Do Not Know The Chefs' Names But They Are Most Accommodating As Well.  The Waiting Staff  Ritchie And Christine Greet Us With A Smile And A Warm Welcome.  They Work Very Hard.  It Was Also A Pleasure To See Kim Who Served Us Frequently As Premier Guests At Champneys  Tring.  I Do Not Believe That Her Experience Was Utilised Well At Champneys However Am Confident That She Will Compliment The Workforce Well At Sopwell House.  Many Thanks To Anita For Her Warm Welcome And Attentiveness In Supporting Our Needs.  Our Thanks Are Extended To The Two Young Ladies Who Administered Our Treatments (Pedicures).  They Made Us Feel At Ease And Relaxed.  Many Thanks To Reception Staff  Lucy  Gita And Another Lady Who Sits At The Front By The Doors (Sorry I Have Forgotten Her Name).  Many Thanks To The Porter Who Helped Us With Our Bags And Greeted Us With A Smile Every Time He Saw Us During The Day.
column89: If I Think Of Anything  Will Let You Know.
column90: You May Remember That We Celebrated My Daughter's 30Th Birthday In May At Sopwell House.  We Were Treated Like Royalty And That Special Treatment Has Continued.  I Would Add That We Have Stayed At Many 5 Star Hotels In The World And Also Uk Including Various Spas  However In Our Experience I Believe That Management And Staff Are Exceptional At Sopwell House With Their Guest Satisfaction Ethos.  Always Courteous  Kind  Caring  Polite And Attentive.  Thank You.

column31: We Found The Sopwell Experience To Be No Less Than A Corporate Cattle Market. With One Vision To Make As Much Money As Possible Regardless Of Resultant Client Dissatisfaction. We Suggest You Refer To Grazia Obertelli  If You Have A Sincere Interest In Following Up On This Reply To Your Survey  As It Was Grazia Who Handled Our Weekend Arrangements. Needless To Say The Latter Was A Huge Let Down & Insult To Our Intelligence. We Found The Whole Weekend A Waste Of Time And Money  Therefore  Would Never Stay Again Nor Recommend. There Is A Lot Of Work To Be Done If Your Establishment Is To Compete Successfully In Today's Hospitality & Recreation Market. Sopwell House Is Lacking In Sincerity  Professionalism  Quality  Particularly Health And Hygiene Standards.
column35: Despite Phoning Ahead On The Day Of Arrival And Confirming Our Room Was Available (Weekend Stay) And Reserving Our Rooms In August  After Driving 170 Miles  We Were Told By Grazia Obertelli There Wasn't A Room Available For Us And We Had To Stay At The Inferior Disgusting Noke Hotel. Suggest You Refer To Her For The Full Story. The Resultant Insult To Our Intelligence Is Unforgivable.
column39: The "Superior Room" Allocated Was Dirty. The Toilet Had Faeces On The Pan  The Mirror Was Full Of Hand Prints  The Bathroom Was Generally Unclean. The Carpet Was Dirty/Muddy. The Bedside Cabinets Were Dusty And A Used Tissue Was Found By The Wardrobe. We Were Exhausted By Grazia Obertellis Continuous Harping  And Bearing In Mind What We Had Been Through To Actually Get Inside A Room  Did Not Have Any Energy Left To Complain. Therefore I Used My Own Incentive To Correct The Imperfections With My Own Sanitation Methods  Namely Disinfectant Wipes. How Appalling That I Was Led To This In Addition To The Earlier Let Down Of Our Room Being Apparently "Unavailable" .
column53: No.
column77: Spa Staff Are Rude  Dismissive And Lack Professional Approach On Greeting Potential Clients. Over Booked And Overworked Staff. Air Quality Within The Pool Area Is Poor - Acrid Chemical And Stuffy Environment. Sauna And Steam Room Required Cleaning. The Size Of The Spa Is Unable To Cope With The Huge Number Of Clients Passing Through Resulting In A Frenzy Of Cattle Market Like Experience.
column83: Refer To Our Previous Notes In This Survey Response Regarding Our Stay.
column89: For Our Room To Have Been Of The Standard It Should Have Been And Clean  But Mainly To Have Been Ready And Available As Booked In August.
column90: We Have Said All That Is Needed  We Hope Sopwell House Management Are Courteous Enough And Professional Enough To Digest Our   Comments And Have The Professionalism To Learn By It.

column39: The Same As All Hotels  No Plugs Near A Mirror - Yes There Was A Hairdryer In The Drawer That Was Already Plugged In  Most Women Have Hair Straighteners Or Some Other Device Which They Need To Plug In Near A Mirror. We Had To Actually Pull The Heavy Desk Out In Order To Access Some Plugs That Were Hidden Behind.
column53: Breakfast Was Actually The Low Point For Us - We Ate In The Main Restaurant And After Being Given A Table And A Plate Of Toast It Sort Of Went Downhill - Will Waited About 10 Minutes To Get Coffee And Once We Finally Got It No Milk Was On The Table. We Asked For It 4 Times Before My Friend Actually Complained To The Manager On Duty. Finally We Were Given Milk That Had Been Left On Another Table Since The Guest Had Departed  Not Ideal  But Was Okay. The Manager Apologised And Was Very Helpful Following That. When We Went To The Buffet There Was Hardly Anything Available Despite Being Only 9.30  We Had To Wait About 10 Minutes More For Fresh Food To Be Brought Out. It Was All Really Nice Though  We Did Enjoy The Food And It Was Good Quality.
column64: Overall Enjoyed The Food  The Lunch We Had Both Days Was Fantastic  Once In The Brasserie And The Other Time In The Conservatory. The Food At Dinner In The Brasserie Felt A Little Rushed And The Main Course (Confit Duck) Lacked Flavour And The Dessert (Lime Cheesecake) Was A Little Rubberyand Jelly Like. But The Starter Were Good  Also The Wine And The Cocktails We Had In The Lounge Later On.
column77: The Receptionist At The Spa Was Rather Gormless And Just Pointed Us To The Changing Room Rather Than Taking Us (It Was Quite And There Were A Lot Of Staff So Wouldn't Have Been Too Much Trouble And It's What You Get At Other Good Spas)

column1: The Massage I Had - From A Lady Called Holly Was Literally The Best I Have Ever Had  She Was So Professional And Seemed To Really Care About Doing A Good Job Literally Cannot Praise Her Any More Highly  She Was Fantastic  In Her Technique But Also Her Manner. Also My Friend Left Her Iphone In The Robe Pocket By Accident And The Staff Located It Within 5 Minutes And Brought It Into The Restaurant To Us  Which Was Really Nice. The Facilities Are Really Good  Just One Thing I Would Say Which Seemed To Be Causing Tension  Bed Hogging With Towels - Yes I Happens Everywhere  But At Other Spa's I Have Been To They Have Signs Telling People Not To Do It  And Staff Should Come And Clear Towels From Unattended Beds If They Have Been There For A Long Time. 80% Remained Empty But Full Of Towels For Most Of The Day On Sunday  And There Were People Too Afraid To Move The Towels  Even Though The Beds Were Clearly Not Being Used. Just A Sign In The Area Asking People Not To Do It Would Give Others The Confidence To Feel They Are Able To Go And Sit There. I Think That Would Improve The Overall Experience!
column8: Holly From The Spa Definitely! She Was So Lovely And Professionally Excellent!
column13: Just Clearing The Beds More Regularly In The Spa And Having A Member Of Staff Show You To The Changing Room And Explain How The Locker System Works  Even Just Briefly As It's Not A Standard System And Another Guest Had To Show As  We Were Really Confused At First! It Would Also Be Really Nice To Be Able To Take Drinks Into The Spa  Understandably They'd Have To Be Served In Plastic But That Is What Takes It To The Next Level Spa. Rip The Sanctuary Covent Garden!!

column31: Everything Was Fabulous  Excellent Service In Reception  Spa  Treatments Lunch And Breakfast  The Rooms Were Lovely And Our First Night Celebrating My Dads 70Th Birthday Was Great. However  Our Second Night For Dinner Was A Disaster We Were The First People There And Over Three Hours Later Others Had Arrived Later Ate And Left Before Us. The Main Problem I Feel Was No Staff Allocated To Our Table Of Ten. The Young Adults On Our Table Did Not Like The Set Menu And I Asked For Bigger Children S Meals. We Were Offered The Brasserie Menu But Told A Value A Totally Unrealistic Amount Of £20.00 Each !!!! Was Not Happy At That Amount At All  Soup Is £7.50. The Older Kids (Paid Adult Price) Still Wanted Kids Meal And I Asked Could They Just Have More Chips  Their Meals Finally Came Wrong  And Had To Be Returned  A Young Fella Was Sent Over To Explain The Pudding Was A Set Size  I Said Ok Suggesting Two Scoops Of Ice Cream Not One ( It Didn't Happen). Every Part Of The Meal We Had To Ask What Was Happening. My Parents Were Uncomfortable Sitting At Table After Two Hours And We Spent Lots On Extra Drinks. When We Finally Got The Bill I Was Shocked At The Service Charge And Challenged The Lady At Desk Did She Think We Had Received Any Real Service And She Agreed It Had Not Gone Well. After Over Three Hours I Was Unhappy And Asked That The Service Charge Be Removed  I Was Disgusted That I Had To Ask As She Knew We Were The First In That Night And The Waiting Around. It Was A Shame That All The Other Service Was Overcast With This Incident And They Were Unable To Provide The Same Level Of Service As All Other Parts Of Hotel.
column35: Girl On Reception Was Very  Very Kind And Helpful Checking And Allowing Us To Check In A Little Bit Early
column39: My Parents Were Upgraded And Delighted With Their Mews Cottage  My Children Loved Their Mini House !!!

column64: Please See First Page Comments I Jumped The Gun !!! Both Nights Like Night And Day So Difference First Night Excellent Service. Second Night Terrible  Younger Members Not Keen On Same Menu And I Was Shocked At £20 Meal Value. Over Three Hours !!!!! And Mostly Waiting I Actually Think We Were Forgotten. Asking For Kids Meal With Extra Chips Not Really Gonna Overwork The Chef!!   But Please Read First Comments. Real Let Down On Breakfast And Lunch Staff Who Gave Fab Service.
column77: When I Booked Hotel Sadly There Were No Treatments Available But The Spa Contacted Me On The Day Before With All 10 Treatments !!!!! And Amended One To Suit 11 Year Old. Teenagers Received Advice On Skin And Were Totally Delighted. All Staff From Lady At Desks To Spa Super Helpful And Gave 5 Star Service. My Parents Loved It !! And It All Made The Price Of Trip Great Value For Money

column31: Frustration In Attempting To Book Rooms For My Friends Celebration. Lack Of Response To Several Requests And Rooms Not Available For Dates Initially Requested. Incorrect Menu Sent For Meal Selection. My Friend Had To Negotiate For A La Carte Menu. Hot Water In My Room Tepid. Hotel Offered To Move Me At 7Pm During Dinner But I Requested That Unless I Confirmed That I Wanted To Move I Would Stay. On Returning To My Room Close To 1Am I Find All My Possessions Removed From The Room. Reception Did Not Have My New Room Number But Fortunately The Supervisor Ann Had Not Left And Gave Me My New Room Number. She Was Amazed That No One Had Informed Me Of The Move. Congratulations To The Person/S Who Transferred Our Possessions As Everything Was In Exactly The Same Position As The Previous Room. The Rooms Were Very Good  Clean  Nice View  Spacious And Comfy Beds. The Dining Experience Was Superb  Fantastic Meals And My Praise Goes To Cosmin Who Provided An Excellent Service. A Very Enjoyable Stay Apart From The Few Glitches Mentioned

column1: My Main Concern However Was That I Was Givent He Wrong Key To A Room That Was Occupied By Another Person That Was Attending The Conference. When I Went Up To What I Believed To Be My Own Room I Walked In On A Male Taking A Shower. To Be Honest At The Time I Was In Shock. I Returned To The Reception Area To Let Them Know What Happened. While They Did Apologise And Offered A Late Checkout If Require Free Of Charge And Apologised Again When I Was Leaving I Felt That It Was Too Little Offered.

I Was Originally Concerned For My Colleague Who I Walked In On As He Was Extremely Embarrassed. However  I Feel That Insufficient Concern Was Shown To Me. I Am Only Glad That It Was Not The Other Way Around And He Did Not Walk In On Me.
So As You Can See My View On The Stay In Your Hotel Is Coloured By The Events Of The First Evening.
While I Accept That It Was A Mistake You May Need To Review How Keys Are Issued To Custoemrs Attending Corporate Events Going Forward.
Regards.
Jackie Fawcett

column31: We Had A Lovely Time At Sopwell House.  The Purpose Of Our Visit (9 Guests) Was To Get Together As A Group Of Friends To Play Bridge.  I Had Visited The Hotel Prior To Our Stay To Ensure That It Would Be Alright For Us To Play Bridge In A 'Lounge Area'.  We Kept Our Stay Short In Order Not To Become A Problem.  We Arrived At 4.15 On Saturday Afternoon And Left At 2Pm The Following Day.  We Played Bridge From 5Pm To 8Pm In The Conservatory On Saturday - When It Was Empty - And On Sunday Morning From 9Am - 1Pm - Again It Only Started To Become Busier At 12Pm.   We Were Made To Feel Slightly Unwelcome Regarding Our Playing (2 Tables Of 4 People Each).  We Had Dinner  Bought Drinks And Teas/Coffees And Snacks.  We Did Not Use Or Take Up Any Other Facilities.  Whilst Our Stay Was Lovely And The Hotel Superb.  We Were Made To Feel As Though We Were Slightly In The Way  With Several Comments About The Fact That The Hotel Is Not A Bridge Club.  Our Playing Bridge Was A Means Of Getting A Bunch Of Friends Together.  Equally The Weekend We Chose Was Not A Busy One E.G Run Up To Xmas  Festival Or Event.
